When checking in the front desk staff were useless and had next to no information but at least the lobby was clean and Snoopy was there to greet us.  99.9 % of the staff seemed annoyed and put out if we tried to engage them with exception of Destiny at the front desk who was cheerful (not sure if that's because we were leaving or not) but was all smiles and hello's.  If you need assistance as to the location of things, I would suggest asking other guest.  I over heard another guest saying they called DL Hotel and the staff from there told them what was near by and gave directions.    The elevators were not to clean which almost distracted one

Snoopy visits the hotel 3 times a day for photograph and hug sessions with kids.  We did not try out the pool as there was a strong wind. Summary: We visited here as part of our visit to the USA. As we'd been to New York and Las Vegas first we were in need of a wind down! A lovely hotel with all the Disney parks close by. Would stay here again to visit Disneyland.

Summary: Great location! Walking distance to Knotts Theme Park (and if you stay with Knotts you get discounted tickets to the theme park) also very close walking distance to Medieval Times. Free Shuttle to Disneyland. Easy walk to Buena Park shopping complex and there is a 7-eleven only a 5min walk away. Rooms are spacious and clean. This is the third time I have chosen to stay at Knotts as it never disappoints.

Summary: We stayed at Knott's Berry Farm hotel for 9 nights over the Easter break, visiting from England. Some things that may be helpful for parents of young children:  Snoopy is around a lot! There's rarely a wait to see him and he will wander round breakfast tables at certain times, happy to pose for photos.  The pool area is great. It has a swimming pool, splash area for kids with sprays and buckets squirting and tipping water, plus a beautifully warm Jacuzzi. The pool is open from morning to late and night and plenty of pool towels are made available.  You may get a children eat free voucher when you check in. It is valid for lunch and dinner only.  The breakfast buffet is great! Coffee, the best orange juice, sausage, bacon, eggs, Denver eggs, hash brown, cereals, fruit, muffins,

Summary: We stayed here for two weeks and hotel itself was lovely and couldn't fault it at all. Rooms were clean. The shuttle service was great. Pool was nice although cold but this was made better with their hot jacuzzi pool. There were plenty of very nice shops to look around as well as the theme park although we didn't do the theme park itself.  The location itself was ok. There were plenty of fast food restaurants They had a McDonald's. Dominos. IHOP etc but lacked any decent buffet restaurants. Also because of the exchange rate most things were a lot more expensive.  We ended up hiring a car and can highly recommend travelling to the Golden Corral restaurants. There was one about 15min drive from the hotel. Plenty of choice. Clean and lovely food.  The hotel offered pricey

Summary Heading: Nice One Night Stay - Knotts Berry Farm Hotel, Buena Park
Summary: We returned for a one night stay.  We booked a nice King Size Room.  There is a flat screen TV, nice sitting chair, and desk area. There are tourist brochures for the area. One gets a discount price when staying at the hotel.  Rooms are clean. Internet reception is OK.  Service is good.    Parking is also good.  Its walking distance to the park and also the shops and restaurants.

We only stay at the regular room, and it's good.  We will try the Snoopy room next time we visit. Summary: We stayed here April 2017 for 6 nights, The room was clean and tidy with comfy beds, our view was a bit rubbish as it over looked a roof and AC units but we were so busy all day we were not too fussed. The pool was warm and clean and the hot tub was a nice end to an afternoon in the pool. This hotel also has a splash zone right next to the pool which was great as my 5 year old loved that where as my 8 year old was more for the pool but i could watch both with ease, it is also very secure as it is walled all the way round and you have to have a room key to get in to the pool area. This hotel has a good location for getting around. They do charge for parking which I think is naughty as being a guest it should be free.  It has a self service laundry room which is great for families

Summary Heading: The closest you can get to Knott's without sleeping in the Ghost Town.
Summary: The Knott's Berry Farm is an older style hotel with rooms that have not been updated in well over a decade.  However, the rooms are quite spacious and offer all the amenities one would expect from a modern accommodation.  The free in-room WiFi is fast and easy to use, bathrooms have a full tub and shower, and the staff is very friendly.  It's possible to have Snoopy visit your room in the evening to help get the kids to bed.  The onsite restaurant "Amber Waves" serves a breakfast buffet that has quite a few options.  I have never eaten lunch or dinner there, but I have heard from others that it is pretty good.  Of course, the biggest positive of this hotel is its proximity to Knott's Berry Farm.  It's less than a 5-minute walk from hotel door to park entrance.  You cannot find a

Summary Heading: Tiny Room But Otherwise Enjoyable Stay
Summary: This hotel met my expectations. It's definitely on the older side. We had a single queen room on the 8th floor. I'm not sure if all single queens are like this, but ours was all the way at the end of the hall in a recessed area by the emergency exit. You'd be forgiven for not realizing there's even a room there. Because of the recessed entryway, our room was one of the smallest I've ever experienced. With no fridge or microwave, the room is indeed basic but ultimately adequate.  The obvious reason for staying here is for Knott's Berry Farm. In that regard, it's absolutely perfect. You have a back entrance that leads you right to the pathway along Grand Ave. Within minutes, you are walking under Ghostrider (still a great ride). Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary on Halloween. Of course we did the Knott's Scary Farm, but before that we had a good dinner buffet. They always decorate the dining area great! Summary: Well where to start, reception staff useless ask them to get a repair done go out for the day come back still not done bar in in mind we'd been out since half seven come back at 17:00 to only just have the room service maid only just getting to our room, then the maid from room service accidently removed one of my wife's shoes when we tried to get it back no help what so ever when I asked the staff in the morning on check out he had no idea what I was asking about!!  Room horribly dated needs more then a lick of paint the rooms lighting was inadequate the only thing I can say positive is that the money has obviously been spent on other areas besides the rooms

We stayed at the hotel since it was so close to the amusement park. The room was nice and perfect for our one night stay.   My young sisters really enjoyed the splash pad and pool    I would recommend the hotel have a small shuttle or something to allow quick access to the amusement park- it can be a lil long of a lock for young ones walking back after going through the park all day.

We stayed here on our first ever trip to LA and was pleasantly surprised. The location was ideal for us, we didn't want to stay too close to Downtown LA as we're not the most sociable people in the world, nor do we like too busy places. Buena Park was perfect for us. We hired a car, so it was easy enough for us to get around (beware of the traffic in LA, especially at peak times!)   The rooms are very basic, but they were clean and had everything we needed. I suppose when you go away you only really use your room to sleep and shower, so we were fine with this. We ate and drank in the restaurant a couple of nights, the food was lovely and the staff are all very friendly. One particular barman was happy to advise us on places to visit during our stay in Vegas, which we drove to

The only reason this review got a 3 was because the location.  I would have normally only given it a 1 or 2.   The rooms itself are dated and in need of updating.  The walls are paper thin, the carpets are worn, the bathroom needs work.  The pool area is ok, but very minimal.   The location is great, right at the park.  Very convenient.

Summary: Only stayed 1 night, during the worst storm to hit LA in forever but had a really comfortable night here and never heard any outside noise. Staff in the restaurant are attentive and helpful with tips on things to do locally. There is a theme park right outside but due to the weather we did not venture in but for kids I imagine this would be excellent

We spent 2 nights  at this hotel  it's big and a nice clean hotel next to its own theme park which we didn't use     the checking was quick and a pleasant young lady  was a big help  the room was big and clean maybe the bathroom was a little dated but clean  we had breakfast  which was nice  service good  reasonable price  also we had a dinner at night and to be honest this wasn't so good  I had half of roast chicken my wife had a chicken salad  of sorts  both the chicken was dry  the portions were big and it came out super quick   not the best  position of  hotel  is a distance from down town la  they do offer a free shuttle bus to Disney  all in all not bad a hotel

We were there over the big storm over Presidents Day weekend and the weather could have been better!! We could hear the roller coasters from the park from our room but this didn't bother us at all. The weekends were very busy at the hotel as they hosted large social events, I think there were a couple of weddings but the reception areas were busy but didn't detract from our stay.  Would like to thank the lovely gentlemen on the concierge who went out of their way to give you excellent service. Thank you Knottsberry Farm Hotel for a lovely stay.

Really nice hotel for families!  Excellent service!  When you stay hotel parking is literally right next door to Knotts so you don't have to pay for parking for the park.  Great restaurant inside the hotel and they offer a great pizza for $20.00.  I have five kids so the pizza fed all seven of us.  We played badminton on their tennis court and had a wonderful time.  Great Stay!

Summary Heading: Lots of fun for the entire family
Summary: This hotel is clean and nice and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. I liked the heated pool and the workout room, and my kids liked the pool and getting to see Snoopy in the Amber Waves restaurant. It's super close the Knotts Berry Farm. The only downside is the rooms do not have a microwave or refrigerator, and there is no complimentary breakfast offered like in so many of the other hotels in the area. But we did have a good time, and the price wasn't too bad 😃 We will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Extremely old and very noisy from the pool as well as the rooms next door.
Summary: Obviously paper thin walls. We could literally hear the entire converstation of the people staying next door. thank goodness I wear ear plugs. We also had issues with the noise from the pool. DO NOT stay in a room that faces that if you want some quiet time. the rooms are so old and in need of renos. We took pics of black mold in the bathroom and showed the manager who didn't really seem too concerned but did take our taxes off. We have stayed there previously however we stayed in the snoopy tuck in rooms which we now know are much newer and alot more comfy. We would not ever stay here again because it wasn't a deal of any sort.

Summary Heading: You get a hug from Snoopy
Summary: The nice part is at night when we returned we got a hug from Snoopy. The bad is the walls are super thin and you can hear everything next door or outside. It is not dirty, but the hotel is tired and in desperate need of being updated.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward towards your next visit.  We will be in the process of updating our hotel and should have a new product soon.

Summary: Stayed here for one night because we got free park tickets with out stay. The staff were great. The hotel was very nice and our room was clean and comfortable. Check in and checkout were easy    We had breakfast delivered to our room and it was great. Food was very good.  In the morning we met snoopy before we left and he kids were thrilled  Definitely a great place to stay and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Took my son for second time to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: Staff at hotel is friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and clean. Amber waves food was ok but you can eat out with better options. I booked room with large queen beds and room was large and comfy. I upgraded to Snoopy room which was much smaller, but you do get a Snoopy doll for each child. Went in February and park was not crowded.

Great theme park with almost no queues whatsoever & the price of admission is much more affordable ($41) than its larger cousins in the area – it was a welcome change after the long queues experienced at Disneyland. We enjoyed the Wild West show, the rides (especially the Boomerang, Silver Bullet & the Ghost Rider) and the shops. We even bought some delicious Knott’s Berry jam. Enjoyable day had by all of us.

We travelled as a family of 3.  The room was plenty big enough for the 3 of us.  It's dated, but we didn't plan on being inside much but anyway, the staff were friendly and knowledgable so that gave the hotel a very warm atmosphere.  The location was spot on too with a free shuttle to the Disney parks only taking us around 10-15 mins to get there.  Thanks, we really enjoyed our stay.

Recently stayed at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel. Their customer service was terrific. Anything we needed or had questions about their staff could answer. Also recommend buying tickets to Knotts Berry Farm Amusement Park through them if you stay there. Saved us about $30 on each ticket!!! Room was comfortable but the air control on the wall didn't seem to work with the actual unit. It needed to be turned on and off at the unit. We were bummed there was no small fridge in the room as thus would've been helpful to store water, food, etc in rather than overpaying at the park. Walking distance to several restaurants and a quick drive the the beach!

Every time I visit Knotts, I always stay at this hotel. The best value is to get a package. I always get the bed and breakfast (since I have a season pass) which consists of: hotel parking, overnight stay, 20% off dinner coupon at the hotel restaurant, and breakfast buffet the next day for around $140. The rooms are always clean and stocked, friendly staff and a good restaurant.

Summary Heading: Great location, great hotel & every member of staff were happy and friendly
Summary: What a lovely surprise this hotel was. The location was fantastic, just by the Knotts Berry theme park and 10 mins from Disney. The staff were so so friendly. Everyone was bubbly, even the maintenance guy wished us a great day, it felt like everyone was genuinely happy to be there, which gave the hotel a fantastic feeling of positivity. We The room was spacious, clean, had a coffee maker, a decent tv and bathroom. Hairdryer was rubbish, and hotel could definitely do with buying a couple to give out. The bar has a great vibe, perfect place to watch the superbowl and had a fantastic atmosphere, with delicious Margharitas. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

My family and I stayed in a Camp Snoopy room for one night for my daughters 5th birthday. It was the most wonderful experience we've had in a long time. The hotel is absolutely beautiful downstairs. Every single staff member was exceptionally nice. Our room was adorable, and there were Snoopy stuffed animals waiting on our bed for my daughter. We ate at the restaurant downstairs that evening. The food was great, the prices were not all that bad for a hotel restaurant, and we received a bunch of coupons and free birthday dessert and kids meal. So we saved about $25 at dinner. Snoopy came through and spent time with my daughter at the restaurant, and then Snoopy came up to our room in his pajamas and tucked her into bed that night. They made her feel so special on her birthday by

The best thing about this hotel is it's location. We bought the one day admission package from the hotel it does bring the cost of admission down a little. We arrived later in the day and checkout was quick as we were the only ones in the lobby. The lobby gives you the deceptive look of a more modern room than what you will find when you get to the room. The first thing we noticed when entering our king bed room was the smell. It wasn't a smell of something bad more like a musty old smell. The room appeared clean so it wasn't that. Maybe it was just the smell of a room that hadn't been used that much in the month of January. I thought it would go away after we were there for awhile but it was the first thing I noticed walking back in after a day at the park. It is a quick walk

We only spent 2 nights at Knotts berry farm hotel but wish we could have stayed longer. The room was huge and had a large comfy king size bed. We ate both nights in the amber waves restaurant which was excellent and bar staff were great.

Summary Heading: Nice place especially for the price
Summary: This place is pretty nice, especially when you consider the price.  It's a full featured hotel priced just above bargain motels. Clean and comfortable.  Walking distance from Knotts Berry Farm and Independence Hall. Plus they offer a shuttle to Disneyland. Enjoyed it very much. Would definitely stay here again.

Could just be the style of room and location but better room than a couple years ago for the price. Not huge, average size, but a nice quiet corner location on a higher floor facing the front entrance parking lot..which was nice.. could see your car parked out in the lot lol.  Comfortable bed and pretty clean... convenience of walking over to the Merry Farm can't be beat really, can even take a break during the day if you desire.  Can often get a decent deal as well, in this case keep an eye on the discount sites like Living Social etc..

Summary Heading: Celebrating birthdays for little ones a breeze
Summary: Hotel staff was professional and friendly, very close to Knotts Berry Farm, and affordable! There is nothing like waking up and eating a wonderful breakfast with Snoopy. Parking is also included and as pass holders the perks just keep coming. Fifteen minutes from Huntington Beach Pier and so much more to explore nearby. This is our only choice when we travel to Buena Park with a toddler.

The room was large although the bathroom could have been a bit bigger. The room had a safe and coffee making facilities. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. They could do with having more power sockets in the room but we were happy enough. We ate in the hotel restaurant Amber Waves, the food was good but the service was not well organised. The staff were all friendly however and helpful. There is a mall close by where we  went to have a nose at. Nice area. Good hotel.

Summary Heading: So outdated... but still a nice stay
Summary: Knott's Berry Farm and its hotel appear to be "stuck in time".  The good news is that we had booked a Camp Snoopy room and this part of the hotel looked like it received some much needed upgrades, a coat of fresh paint and decent carpeting not that long ago...  What I liked:  Very friendly staff that try to go above and beyond to fulfill even the simplest requests.  Camp Snoopy room and wing in relatively good shape.  Room size was adequate. The upcharge for Camp Snoopy is well worth it as you get two Snoopy plush toys and a bedtime visit from Snoopy.  Of course, location is convenient to the park. Onsite dining options, including the nearby "original" restaurant are decent and reasonably priced. Decent recreation area (pool) on site. Complimentary wifi working just fine  What

The staff are fantastic! We were greeted with welcoming smiles and friendly conversations. The receptionist explained everything we needed to know. The hotel itself is great, especially for kids, as it offers a vide variety of activities. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Reasonable hotel if visiting Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at Knotts Berry Farm Hotel for a few days so we could visit the amusement park next door.   Overall we had a nice stay.  The staff were friendly and the location is good if visiting Knotts Berry Farm.  The room itself was OK.  It was clean and tidy and perfect if not in the room for very long.  It was a little small though and has only one chair with a small desk....which makes it difficult if the kids want to eat a snack in the room.  My main issue was the bed.  It was rock hard and I found it hard to sleep on.  Particularly after a day on the roller coasters next door a softer bed would have been great. In terms of facilities the pool is a good size and the spa was warm.  There is also a water activity park which I am sure kids would love when

Only good thing about this hotel was the location and staff.  Room was too small. Bathroom as well w no fan, no fridge or even a small microwave (which for the price u pay and given that it's a theme park for kids hotel you would think they would have). Kids had no place to eat when we ordered pizza besides the bed.. on check out day as I was picking up my kids stuff I found gum, hairband, sunflower seeds and hair clip left behind from previous family. Very disappointed, would of saved myself $$ and rented the cheap motel room across the street from it.

Had an amazing time with my kids. The lines were very long but other then that no complaints. Very hard to find parking because so many people. I forgot her name but she drew a picture of my kids and it looks so real I love it. I would definitely recommend her to capture the memories of your vacation.

We had a fantastic time at this hotel, the staff were always friendly and helpful.  We stayed in a twin room, which had 2 comfortable double beds and the room was spacious and clean.  My friend and I will definitely be back to visit.

From beginning of stay to the end, we found the staff welcoming and accommodating and the hotel attractive, clean, quiet, and convenient.  Loved the nicely decorated restaurant Amber Waves easily accessible with great food and friendly staff!  Room was clean and pleasant, and bed was very comfortable!  Free parking and attractive appearance exterior as well.  Rates reasonable!  Would definitely come back again!

Spent 10 very comfortable days here over Christmas. Check in was fast and easy and good information given by the very pleasant staff.rooms comfortable and clean queen beds nice and soft  pillows. There is a heater/air con unit in room which is easy to operate. Large tv with plenty of channels to choose from .a free safe and plenty of cupboard/ wardrobe space for three adults.bathroom could do with a little makeover  (ie) lick  of paint repair to sink plug hole (staff were informed but not fixed)and maybe a New shower curtain but otherwise everything else fine.cleaners came everyday including Christmas day and boxing day and we can not fault them. Had breakfast everyday in the restaurant Amber Waves and food was always hot and tasty ie pancakes  or all american breakfast  staff

There was a NAMM conference in Orange County/ hard to find a hotel.  I remembered Knott's Berry Farm Hotel was discounted with a Knott's annual pass. Very comfortable beds & great big screen tv. The restaurant on the premises is GREAT!! We used a breakfast package with full Buffet breakfast.

Stayed here for a couple of days. The hotel is very old and the room/bathroom are very small. The quality is more like a motel. Everything is quite expensive. There is nothing special. I would recommend looking for a standard hotel, instead of this place. Two stars are simply for the location (next to Knott's Berry Farm).
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,  Sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the hotel stay.  We strive to ensure your stay is pleasant.. Please feel free to call me if you get a chance to talk more about it and make a more enjoyable experience in the future. Thank you  Don

Summary: First of all the employees at the front desk were very nice, especially Rachel. They were always helpful, polite and friendly. The hotel was clean and comfortable. I've read in other reviews that it's noisy but maybe because we were in the 8th floor and it was rainy that we didn't have trouble with that. The shuttle bus to Disneyland is very convenient but it doesn't wait for you very long at Disneyland so you'd better be super punctual. You get a good discount to get into the park if you are staying at the hotel. They have self laundry service for the guests which is nice and helpful. The room was cozy but neither the extractor in the bathroom or the AC were working correctly. The cleaning of the rooms was kinda confusing because some days we arrived to find everything in

We chose this hotel due to the proximity to the park. Once checked in you can walk to the park. Quick and easy check in. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Coffee maker in the room. No refrigerator The beds and pillows were very comfortable! Enjoyed our stay and will return again.

Summary Heading: Always a fun stay; dated but good value
Summary: We always stay here when we come down to the area. The four stars is for the overall experience. The staff is always very friendly and being walking distance from the park without worrying about parking is great.  However the hotel is dated and our room had carpeting coming off the wall and the AC wasn't working great (when we switched to a snoopy room there was a window lock broken and clogged tub).   We stayed in two queen room and then switched one night to a snoopy room. The rooms comes with an average size flat screen tv  and ironing board and safe. There is no fridge (but if you order an expanded room it comes with a bar area and fridge). We had a view of the courtyard/park where you can hear the roller coaster (which was cool) but otherwise quiet. Be careful if you have a

If you don't like mass amounts of people , don't go here ! I was crowded when I went , got there right when it opened , and stayed to late afternoon . What made the day bearable was the purchase of line hopper tickets , which cost about $50 more , but it puts you at the front of every line you encounter !  The rides are all fun , they keep the park nice and clean and family friendly . But it will cost you , everything in the park is NOT cheap ...so bring lots of money .

We had a great time. We were with other family members who stayed on the Snoopy floor. It was such fun to watch Snoopy come in and tuck our JJ in at night! My older son enjoyed himself on the basketball court and fitness center after an afternoon at the park. The hotel was welcoming and great value!

We stayed at Knott's hotel for 6 night in late August 2016. Our room was on the second floor, which was nice. Our family of 5 had 2 rooms with adjoining doors. We made our reservations separately, but asked if our rooms could be near and it turned out that we were next door. We liked the hotel a lot. The room was comfortable, nice and the price was good. (The only complaint about the room is that it had a funny smell when we first arrived, but then it went away. The room next door smelled normal.) However the price of room does not include breakfas. The breakfast is expensive and the buffet is ok, but nothing special. If you want to order from the menu, it is a better option. Otherwise the restaurant had very good food. The dinners are huge. One meal will feed 2 people if you

We stayed here for 4 nights while we did Knotts and some other area attractions. It was a great location for setting up our base. We had an 8th floor room facing the coaster and while it wasn't really noisy you could hear it. It didn't get in the way of sleep or anything for us, although for light sleepers it might.   The room was typical, 2 queen beds, which were comfortable. The shower pressure wasn't the greatest but it did the job. We needed a few things, extra towels, a remote that worked, etc. and the staff was super quick at bringing them up. Very friendly.   The hotel was having a lot of Christmas parties going as we noticed alot of people for that and the downstairs bar was pretty loud anytime you came through the main lobby. The pool and jacuzzi were nice and clean!

Oldish hotel in old American style wannabe  luxury resort. Need to be refreshed  Good gym.   Heating didn't work.  Close to shopping center Good breakfast  Windy reception hall Big parking Too expensive for value Very far from LAX airport.  Not for people with early morning flight at check out Room and WC size ok

Summary Heading: Great Staff & Convenient for going to the park
Summary: Wonderful friendly & helpful staff. The hotel is nice, clean & convenient for a park visit.  Our package included overnight stay, park tickets & a nice breakfast.  Snoopy even visited us in the hotel lobby

We really enjoyed our stay here.  All the staff went above and beyond to make the stay wonderful.  We found the hotel was always clean and the rooms were a bit dated, but clean and comfy so that is all we required.  The best perk was the free shuttle to disneyland.  You had to pre-book it, but we never had issues getting a ride. One night our son was getting tired and wanted to come early and we called to cancel our shuttle to take a cab and they offered to send someone to get us...that was great!  We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good if you're going to the amusement park
Summary: 3.5 stars. Our family spent a couple of days in the Knotts Berry Farm amusement park, and we stayed the night prior to our trip, and of course during.  The hotel appeared clean and presentable, but nothing out of the ordinary for a large hotel such as this.    They did not have any porters to handle bags, so I had to corral a luggage cart and do it myself.  The room had two queen beds, a dresser (with TV), with a desk and chair.  There was a open sink area across from a closet, and a door enclosing a toilet and shower.  The room, although clean, showed some age and was just average. There was a small safe in the closet, but we were disappointed that it did not contain a refrigerator (as we wanted to keep the leftovers of Ms. Knott's famous and delicious fried chicken, but could

Nice, clean convenient stay while visiting Knotts Berry Farm! Desiree at the front desk was amazing!! Affordable for the continence and great way to spend time with family. I would determinately recommended it and I will do it again!

Summary Heading: Everyone here wants to make your stay the best ever!
Summary: Even when there are issues, all you have to do is ask, and things are resolved. We have stayed here twice and would not hesitate to do it again. Everyone is truly good at what they do and proud to do a good job.

Summary Heading: Knotts berry farm hotel convenience and excellence
Summary: Everything ran smooth with our stay. Adjacent restaurant, amber waves, great for breakfast, and after knotts wind down at their bar. Craft beer menu a plus. Easy short walk to knotts berry farm was accomplished two consecutive days. Would return.

Super nice hotel! Amazing staff. Walking distance right to park. Huge pool with kiddie play area we had a lots of fun. Theirs a restaurant. Also on the little Main Street walking to park another restaurant TGIF's and lots of adorable amazing stores! Another restaurant the chicken house with amazing food. Great time

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and location to stay in LA
Summary: The hotel staff were really helpful and friendly. Printed tickets when we needed them.   Its a perfect location to stay in LA. Offers a free shuttle bus to Disney so your avoiding transport costs.   Has it's own theme park next door, Knotts berry farm which is a really quaint and has a real American feel to it. The rides are really good too, loads of big roller coasters and rides for kids. Offers excellent shows too. This was my favourite park out of Disney/universal/knotts berry. The wait times aren't that bad either. THE GHOST RIDER IS A MUST! The New Years fireworks were amazing! They also had a band on.   Rooms are big,clean and basic, no fridge or microwave. Has a bath and free safe for valuables. The tv has loads of American channels and the sports channels offer premier

I had a groupon for the hotel at a terrific price.  All employees were friendly and professional.  The room was quiet, spacious, clean, and comfortable.  I wish that it would have had a mini refrigerator in it.  There's a fitness room, heated pool and jacuzzi, and gift shop.  You can leave your car parked and walk to the amusement park and gift shops.  Snoopy was in the lobby every evening.

We had an amazing time here. The packages are a steal and we enjoyed every single minute of our three days and two nights there. Where can I start? Oh how about Camp Snoopy!  Camp Snoopy is a special program they have for a discounted fee (while booking) where Snoopy comes into your room around 8-8:30pm to tuck you in. Can we get any better than this?! Snoopy is incredibly soft, cuddly and dressed in his pajamas too! Whoever was doing the acting inside Snoopy was awesome as well, Snoopy gave our daughter a "kiss" and we just loved how the actor/actress handled the whole thing!  Camp Snoopy was located on the second floor in its own wing. The Peanuts gang adorns the walls in the hallway and the decor matches the primary colored doors and bright green carpet. Inside the room the

Summary Heading: Great spot to stay for stay for Disney/Universal vacation
Summary: All the staff were great from check in to check out, the restaurant, housekeeping, etc.  Hotel was decorated really pretty for the holidays too. The hotel is slightly older if you look in the corners like in the bathroom but it's clean and well maintained.  so location is good. an hr to Universal, 30 mins to Disney, about 30 to Long Beach.  Around the Buena Park, there are other attractions and plenty of restaurants. The theme park is just a stroll away and you get a really good discount on the entrance fee staying at the hotel. There is a Walgreens in case you need anything. Ihop, Denny's and the standard america fare around too. The hotel restaurant is good too. Also have room service in case you don't want to head down.  You do have to pay for parking $4/night which I was bit

I choose this hotel based on its close proximity to the theme park. It's basically on the theme park property about a 5min walk to the gate. I mean for the price we paid I wasn't expecting the Four Seasons but it was a lot dingier than I expected. We booked the classic package which included the hotel room, buffet breakfast for 4 and theme park tickets for 4 and we upgraded to the snoopy room it was roughly $400 which isn't bad considering a ticket at the gate is $75 a piece. You can stay parked at the hotel so no need to pay for additional parking at the them park. We booked the snoopy room because of the bedtime tuck in service from snoopy himself! He was very friendly and arrived on time at 8pm. We requested to be first because my kids sleep early. My kids really enjoyed this

Amazing staff fantastic hotel and a great base.  We had a fantastic time no problems staff were always around and able to answer questions Close to shopping and lots of places to eat. We hired a car and drove to LA and Huntington Beach  A truely amazing holiday  would definitely return.

This hotel is a high-end property, as one might expect at a famous attraction like Knott's Berry Farm.  The rooms are nicely appointed, comfortable, and quiet.  Internet service is free and drop-dead easy to connect to any wireless device.  Hotel staff is attentive and the service is excellent.  A nice restaurant is located in the hotel, but Mrs. Knott's famous Chicken Dinner Restaurant is only a short walk away.  This is a pricey place to stay, but worth it for a special occasion, or a memorable vacation treat.

We have no complaints. The room was nice, clean.  The breakfast buffet was good. We were going to visit Knott's Berry Farm amusement park and loved being able to wake up and make a quick walk to the entrance!

Summary Heading: Southern CA amusement park hotel prices, lacking the amenities
Summary: First I'll start with what we loved about the hotel-- the visits from Snoopy and customer service. That's it. The hotel is very old and none of the rooms actually face the theme park, so don't ask. The bathroom is very small with updated counter tops and light fixtures. The closet door was broken and maintenance had to come repair it as soon as we got there. Also, the air conditioning unit let off a funny smell that reminded me of Raid. Rooms are pretty small themselves with no microwave and no mini-fridge. The coffee maker couldn't even be plugged in because there was no accessible outlet. All in all, wont spend the extra money to stay here again.

We have stayed at this hotel, many times over the last 20 years (probably over 20 times), We spent 12 nights here back in January and have booked again for January 17, for 11 nights. The last few trips it has been my son and I, My wife also stays here when she comes with her mother. Rooms are great, walking distance to resturantes. Nice and central to freeways, great parking.

We stayed here recently for 2 nights while travelling around America, we were greeted with a warm welcome only to find there had been a mix up on our booking by a third party and the dates were wrong for our stay, luckily there were rooms still available and the staff on front desk were amazing in helping us to resolve the issue and get us checked in eventually, it was well worth the wait as the room was amazing with 2 queen beds and very spacious, all the usual mod cons and a large flat sreen tv, aswell as an excellent view looking across at an old fashioned classic wooden roller coaster. A great place to stay regardless of either passing through or a luxury overnight stop over after a busy day on the rides. Would highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again.

Our large family of 6 traveled to Knott's Berry Farm over Thanksgiving and had THE BEST ever experience from the time we walked into the hotel until the time we checked out.  We got to the property at 9:30am and check in wasn't until 3:00pm.  They said they would text me when my room was ready.  They texted me at 11:30am!  I was pleasantly surprised!  We got settled into our rooms.  The front desk clerk remembered my name!  5 star customer service!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Park visit
Summary: Very nice people, very convenience to walk to park. Nice room, nice facility, very clean. Staff accommodating.   Good breakfast and restaurant. Pleasant staff.  Bar closes early and no other place handy for any kind of night life. Good family oriented place.

Very friendly front desk staff greet you on arrival, helpful with local information (I was looking for good Mexican food), offering to print off eTickets etc, offering courtesy shuttles to the theme parks and I'm sure I could have found more.  The room was nice and clean, comfortable bed, good TV, good air conditioning unit plenty of space and a free to use safe.  Location wise, it is obviously made for the resorts; of course Knott's Berry Farm in the back yard but the free shuttle to Disneyland means that you don't really need to consider how far you are from there. We didn't have a car so getting to restaurants that weren't the hotel restaurant wasn't the easiest option. You can get a cab or Uber but there isn't really much within a walkable distance. It's probably fair to

Summary Heading: Room is outdated, but rest of hotel is very nice
Summary: The lobby is beautiful, the Amber Waves restaurant is delicious, and all the employees are cheerful and great!  The location in proximity to Knott's Berry Farm theme park is great!  The price per night vs. limited amenities and overall dirty room are what make me question if I will stay there again or not.  No dorm size fridge (although I have been told a person can have one for an additional fee in their room). No microwave in room. Overall, the room is just dirty and old. I've attached a few pictures to this review. In 2016, with laptops, phones, chargers, and other devices, there are hardly any plug ins. I was fortunate to find one filthy power bar under one of the bed so I was able to charge my electronics. The friendly staff at least made the visit a pleasant one. I may

Had  great time at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. Located on the property the rooms were spotless. They have pool and spa which was very convenient. It's a easy walk to the park located about two blocks north of the hotel. There are restaurants in the hotel and across from the park entrance. The staff was great and Snoopy is frequently in the hotel lobby.

We stayed for 3 nights in early November.  The staff was very friendly upon check-in and throughout our stay.  Since we had kids they gave us a schedule of when Snoopy would be in the lobby which was really cute.  The restaurant had decent food.  The pool was fun for the kids.  The best part was the location to Knott's Berry Farm.  It was so nice to be able to walk back to the room for a short break during the day.  We also went to Disneyland one day and there was a free shuttle.  If you let the staff know a day in advance, they will guarantee you a seat.  Overall, it was a good place to stay at a reasonable price and great location.  We would definitely stay there again.

The staff was friendly and helpful. My check-in took longer than anticipated as the reservation seemed to be lost but the manager on duty made sure that it was worked out. This was my 2nd stay at the hotel and I found it clean, comfortable and adequate as before. I guess I'm spoiled; there was no cooler (refrig.) or microwave and I don't like paying extra for parking. The big plus for my stay was the short walk to the Knott's Berry Farm main entrance.

I went out to California for a mini vacation to meet up with friends. The Knotts Berry Farm came recommended from a friend, so I booked my stay for a Halloween week in California.  Upon arrival we were welcomed at the gate by a very chipper and well dressed woman who gave us clear instructions on where to park and check in. The grounds were clean and well maintained. The lobby was spacious, clean, and showed no wear and tear. The staff inside was chipper and friendly. I didn't feel rushed or a bother, they answered my various questions and offered advice and suggestions. They even offered a coupon for 20% off at their Amber Waves restaurant in the hotel as well as discount tickets (nearly half off) to the amusement park itself. Of note, they do charge a $4 per day parking fee

We stayed at this hotel with son, daughter in law and grandkids. It is a great location - directly next door to the Knotts Park, the marketplace and restaurants. The pool is nice and was enjoyed by the grandkids. The onsite restaurant was passable. There is also complimentary coffee in the bar area every morning. The rooms are a bit tired but fine for our purpose. The common areas were pleasant and the staff helpful and welcoming.They also offer a complimentary shuttle bus/van to Disneyland. You sign up ahead so you were guaranteed a seat. They were on time and efficient. The grounds were clean and had beautiful flowers. There was a $7 per night fee for self park.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, especially for a visit to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: Check in was quick and friendly.   Car park fees are $7 per night, but you can leave your car if you go to the theme park.  The room we had was very spacious and clean with some prints if a couples of the coasters from the park. There was coffee making facilities and 'Knott's' toiletries.  The hotel has a nice outside area including a pool.  Breakfast is from the menu or buffet, we opted for the buffet but didn't think there was much choice for the money.  The evening meal however was tasty and good value. It's just a short walk into the park from the hotel. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Old fashioned, but clean and comfortable
Summary: Our room was clean, tidy and very comfortable. The shower is amazing, after awful water pressure in New York the shower was heaven. All I could ask is for English tea in the room and milk. Not every one likes black coffee

We had a room on the first floor, not much of a view but the hotel was unusually quiet considering it was so close to a family amusement park.  Everything was clean and in working order.  The front desk was very helpful.

I've been staying at the Knott's resort for years when I go to Knott's Scary Farm. Everything from making reservations, adding to the reservation, checking in and out, food, etc. is made easy by the staff.

Fun two day family trip to California Knott's Berry Farm. Hotel parking was near     our room. Lots of store to shop at and places to eat all with in walking distance. Family got to meet Snoopy! We had a good time.

We've just returned from a 5 night stay at Knotts berry farm resort hotel, having enjoyed our stay back in February. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor this time. The rooms are quite spacious and the beds are very comfy. Plenty of hanging space, big tv, decent bathroom with shower over the tub. We liked the location of the resort as you can walk to the theme park next door. We used the pool which is quite nice. Only slight negative was the coffee maker. Not sure if it was the coffee or the water, but didn't like the coffee. There is a 7-11 about a 5 minute walk away, so we tended to get our drinks there. We tried the breakfast buffet one morning, it was ok, not great for the money. Other than that no complaints. The staff were all pleasant and friendly. I would stay here again.

Such a great experience for the kids. The value is great and the fact that Snoopy comes to tuck the kids in is such a special treat for the kids. This is our third year staying at the hotel and I have never been disappointed and have always had such a great time.

I really enjoyed the hotel. Clean and great feel. Walking distance from shops, restaurants and park. I was there for Knotts Scary Farm. Staff friendly and dressed to theme. I did not eat at the hotel so I can not say much about the food. Parking rates better at hotel than parking structures around park. I would stay again.

The hotel is walking distance to knott's berry farm and has parking so it made it very convenient for my husband and I that wanted to visit during knott's scary farm time. The staff was nice and very helpful with any questions we had. However, the rooms seem outdated. The shower made a terrible noise as if the pipes were about to burst, the walls of the tub were dirty, the shower curtain was gray as if it had not been washed or changed in a while, the towels were rough and had make up stains, the toilet paper felt like newspaper. I would expect this from a lower level hotel but this is the theme park's hotel and I was expecting better and cleaner facilities.

Took the kiddos to Knotts Berry Farm for the Annual Knotts Scary Farm event (1st timers), We stayed overnight at the Knotts Hotel. As always the accommodations were excellent. The package I purchased was for 2 queen bed room with one ticket. I should've purchased the Gruesome package that included breakfast, dinner buffet, and  the tickets. I stayed behind (didn't enter the park with the kids), and walked the promenade. The pool was open so just me and a few friends took a dip during the day. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back next year.

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: I have not been to Knott's Berry Farm since I was a kid, so this was an exciting trip 2 days with my husband and son.  We had a blast, and were so happy we picked this hotel for our 2 nights.  Front Desk staff are super helpful and friendly, the place is old but it has a great safe, family feel about it. Easy safe walk to the park.  Room was again older, but kept very clean. Did not use the pool, but had a view of it from our room, it was always super busy.  Love this place, coming back next summer!!!

We visited the hotel for three nights during Knotts Scary Farm.  We enjoyed the Halloween festivities and the costumed characters came into the hotel lobby.  We were able to interact with them and take some photos.  I wish we could have experienced the buffet dinner that you could have with the characters but we were otherwise occupied.  The hotel was nice, the front desk staff were pleasant and accommodating.  The restaurant onsite, Amber Waves, was nice and had some very good food.

Summary Heading: Convenient, Close, Could be Cleaner ... A lot Cleaner
Summary: The hotel was close and convenient to Knotts with a 5 min walk in a safe area, but the room was far from clean. There must have been a sewage issue as well because the entire hall smelled of sewage. For a single night it was doable, but not the best.

I have to say that I have never stayed at a hotel where I felt so welcome.  The staff is young and very friendly both in the hotel and the restaurant.  The hotel is located in a great place if you are going to Knotts Berry Farm, especially since we went to the Knotts Scary Farm event which ended very late.  The hotel is old and very plain but comfortable.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at a reasonable price.
Summary: We have been staying at Knott's Hotel for some time now and enjoy every minute. This place is a gem and is family friendly. We recommend to get a package deal that includes breakfast at Amber Ways restaurant.  Would highly recommend it to anyone.

Summary Heading: Very 70s hotel which needs a bit of a revamp.
Summary: Hotel is very large and the lobby has a railway terminal feel about it. Staff at the desk were friendly and did resolve a booking problem very efficiently. Room was large with two double beds and although it was next to the elevator there was no noise from it. All you would expect from a US hotel including a wall safe. Didn't use the hotel restaurant which was a bit pricey. Only there for one night which was fine but don't think I would like to take a 'holiday'. Theme park close by so I suppose would suit a family on a budget.

Hotel is decent. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Overall good deal for the price. Nice pool area and hot tub. Only drawback is that they stated breakfast included.  That was not the case,you receive a 20% discount on your breakfast.  Also almost forgot,you have to pay for parking.  Really?  It's not enough that we're paying for overnight stay?

Summary Heading: Good value and close to KBF
Summary: This is the best trip ever to KBF I can remember! It started at the front desk with Ernie who allowed us to drop off our bags in the morning and get our tickets early so we could go to the park. We did not return until the park closed but Ernie was STILL there and still smiling and pleasant! Our bags were already going up to our room. The room was good--plenty of towels.  The pool was big and not too cold; the hot tub heavenly after traipsing around the park all day. My only cons were with the bed (but I rarely like hotel beds) and hardly any outlets to plug chargers into. Oh and the creepy people dressed as zombies wandering around the lobby, but I guess they were SPOSED to be creepy for Halloween.

We ended up staying an extra night after visiting Disneyland Park and our other hotel was sold out.  Got to the hotel late. Staff was friendly. I got the ground floor room- and it's a bit gloomy! It is not a big room and the amenities are a bit outdated.  Clean but I expected the room to be a bit brighter. Vending machines are on the second floor, a bit odd but I needed a walk so that was fine.  Overall, I would stay here again if we go to Knott's Berry Farm next time, but mainly for the convenience purpose.

Summary Heading: Very nice people but park isnt clean
Summary: The day was very warm, but our 3 year old had a great time. She was able to go on tons of rides and loved camp snoopy. My main complaint is how run down the older rides are looking. Anything not built in the 5 years looks as clean as a neglected gas station bathroom. The walls leading up to the rides, the ground, and especially the rides themselves were gross and dirty. Please clean and repaint so we can come back.

I thought the place was quite clean.  The staff were super friendly.  The restaurant was reasonably priced and the room service was not overly expensive either.  The hotel is a bit dated.  The pool and little spray park are fun!  I would stay here again.  It is nice that it isn't far from Knott's Berry Farm.

The room itself was a bit small thought standard for a regular type room in a not so lovely hotel! I am aware that this is an older hotel which they have upgraded so that could explain the smaller size! Rooms were smaller in "those" years!!  Nice bedding and comfortable beds. Pillows also provided some flexibility in comfort as well. We had a fridge! We were short on toiletries provided by the hotel. Actually one of them had been used prior to us using that room. We were on the 8th floor so had a nice view. The elevators are fast. Staff pleasant and friendly. It was my grand daughter's 12th birthday and she got a birthday button and dessert in the restaurant down by the lobby.  The walk to Knott's takes about 10 minutes or so. It would not be great for those with small children

Booked the snoopy room at Knotts berry Farm for a quick getaway! Rooms are super clean and cute. We missed the snoopy visit to the room for the kids, but had two plush snoopy Toy's waiting for them. The staff is friendly and efficient. The stay was enjoyable. We had breakfast in site at the Amber Waves restaurant. It did the job to start the day. Will stay again if going back to KBF. Just a short walk to the park.

There are several good things about this place: very friendly, courteous staff; great location literally about q 2-3 minute walk past some nice shops to the park.  The hotel is way "long in the tooth," however.  It's clean and comfortable, but beware of the faux balconies.  The photos make it look like each room has a balcony with sliding glass doors.  Actually, the doors open about 3-5 inches, and there are no balconies at all.  If you look closely at the photos, you'll see the outdated (and extremely loud) air conditioners are located at the bottom of the "balconies"  Be careful, too about the quality of the views.  Our room looked out over some sort of alcove with a wall about ten feet away.  A plaster owl sat on our windowsill to scare away the pigeons.  It didn't work, as

Summary Heading: Surprising Alternative for Business Traveler in Unusual Locale
Summary: I recently spent 4 nights in Long Beach (o.k technically Buena Park) California at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  I booked it using a travel aggregator and had never stayed there before.  I got a room rate that was lower then many typical "business" hotels only a few blocks away, and at a facility with more amenities.  I was very pleasantly surprised, and would return.  As this is a company hotel on the edge of the Knott's Berry Farm Theme Park, I sort of expected to be inundated with kids and families, but this must be a low season for the park and I was blissfully unbothered by crowds.  Large pleasant lobby.  Decent workout room (with cardio and weights).  An attached restaurant offering food all day, at lunch and for dinner.  I usually avoid hotel food like the plague,

Summary Heading: I love the fact that everyone there was very nice and helpful.
Summary: I love that you can walk right out the door and Knott's is only a few steps away. The Hotel was very clean and well kept. The pool is kid friendly with splash pad for the kids. The beds are a little firm and I would prefer softer sided beds but over all the rooms and staff were great. I love the gift shop being right down the hall and the restaurant with good food and very nice atmosphere. Overall I will keep coming back to stay every trip. Thank you!

This hotel is average. For the price we paid I was disappointed. The hotel is dated and customer service is lacking. Bathrooms are also very small. But it was nice to be super close to knotts berry farm park so overall I guess it was okay.

The hotel is ok as far as cleanliness and amenities. The pool did give a little extra with the little water park for the kids. However, what made the trip was the tuck in by snoopy in the camp snoopy room. The kids each received their own snoopy when we arrived and snoopy tucked in the whole family.

This is a tough review to write, there were parts that were outstanding and others that were a little lagging. I'll start with the pros. Of course the location to Knotts can't be beat and the hotel does have some charm to it. The heated pool was bigger than I thought and the splash pad/zone adds some nice variety. The front desk was prompt and incredibly kind and courteous. We took the upgrade for the themed room which comes with two Snoopys, when they saw we had three little ones, they immediately called to have a third sent up before we got there. The Snoopy tuck in was a huge hit with my 6, 5 and 2 year old. I asked if they wanted it the second night and it was an emphatic yes!  On the down side, the room had no microwave or mini fridge. The room also felt small for us (party

I was hesitant about staying here due to other reviews but for the most part this is a very nice & clean establishment the rooms were also very clean and bathrooms as well. Friendly and helpful staff. Happy with my visit.

We stayed for two nights while visiting Knott's Berry Farm next door and the hotel is fine. The room is very clean, the bed is ok, the air conditioner is nice and cool (a must on a hot August night), the staff very helpful, and of course the location for our purpose was perfect. The 'average' rating is because that is what this hotel is, average, which is fine! The price is budget, there is enough room, although the bathroom is a little small, the hotel and room is a little dated, but this is what you pay for. I would definitely recommend a stay here if you are visiting for a few nights, visiting the theme park next door, or even visiting Disney, which we did for a $10 uber ride (there is also a free shuttle I believe).

The hotel is very nice it has a pool fitness centre and laundry room. So let's be honest it's not a 4 or 5 star hotel but it's a very good budget hotel. The hotel rooms where clean and clean every day staff a very friendly . I think this hotel has a great location for visiting knotts berry farm and Disney.

This was our first stay at the Knotts Hotel, we will definitely return. The rooms are a bit older but very clean. All the staff were very friendly and treated us well. The hotel is very close to the park so it made it easy to walk over for the park during the day and for haunt at night. We had a camp snoopy room which snoopy comes and tucks in your child, what a great experience. Thank you for a great visit.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and reviewing your experience. We are thrilled to learn that you had a pleasant stay and hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: This was our third stay at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. As always our stay was great. Booked a Scary Farm Package,was a good value for money.Room was clean, beds comfortable and quiet. Nice to just walk from the  park no need to move the car.
Manager Response: We are so happy to learn that you still find great value in the package and continue that tradition with us! We are already looking forward to your visit next Scary Farm Season! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Stayed here as we wanted somewhere relatively close to Disney, we weren't entirely sure what to expect but this is an excellent hotel, it is located in the edge of knots berry farm and is a 20 minute drive from Disney. The staff were helpful and the pool was great! There are plenty of food options available at the hotel and in the area.
Manager Response: We are happy to learn that you enjoyed your experience. You referenced a Disney trip as well so I wanted to be sure you were aware for future reference, we offer a complimentary shuttle to Disneyland that runs about every other hour. We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Love, love, love this hotel.  Used to stay at Radisson across the street but really tired of sleep number beds that deflate in the middle of the night.  Keys that time out on you so you run to the office to get it reactivated and run back to the room before it deactivates.  Also the smell of mildew made me decide it was time to find a new go to place.  Assumed without checking first, thought it would be priced like a Disney property.   To my surprise it was the exact opposite.   Super reasonable, close to Knotts to where a three  minute walk takes me to Mrs. Knotts Chicken Dinner Restaurant for the best food in Buena Park.   Also you feel like you are part of the action when here because they have the park characters come to the hotel to entertain the little ones.  Rooms are
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us a chance to earn your loyalty. We pride ourselves on being competitive with our rates however I am a bit bias in feeling that our staff is just a cut above the rest in our area. I am thrilled that their passion translated to a positive experience! We look forward to seeing you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations - Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Stayed for a week at Knott'sberry farm hotel for the final week of our 3 week vacation. Room was at end of hall on 6th floor adjacent to stairs. Room was small and had very poor amount of power points and none handy near bed for charging phones etc. Pwr point alongside bed was loose in wall and did not appear safe. Good size flat screen TV but some channels were stuttering and were annoying to watch. Have to pay 7 Dollars a day for parking which is ridiculous in my opinion. Pool area is o.k. but pool towels are tiny. Front desk and parking Staff are friendly and helpful. A bottle of Dasani water is supplied in room which I thought was complimentary until I read it was 4 dollars if used! Location was fine for what we wanted although approx 50 mins from downtown LA.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review your experience. I am glad to learn that the staff was a positive element of your stay however I am sorry that you had maintenance issues in your room. If you are willing to share that room number with me it would greatly help ensure that the issue has been resolved so it doesn't affect you or another guest in the future. We appreciate your feedback and hope to have a chance to host you and your family again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations - Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: The hotel staff is very nice. We stay mainly during Haunt season to avoid driving home at 2AM. The rooms are decent, fairly newly remodeled but still a bit outdated but clean and nice.  Everyone is always very helpful and nice. We love Amber Waves and the staff there. They make amazing drinks and the food is pretty good too. If going to spend a day or two at Knott's I would recommend the Knott's Hotel. It's a short walk from the theme park to the hotel and very convenient.
Manager Response: We are so happy to learn that the restaurant and overall staff were highlights of your experience. We are in the middle of an on-going renovation project that started with flat screen TV's and Serta Master Suite mattresses in the rooms and the lobby however we have not gotten to carpets, restroom rooms or furniture. I feel confident that you will like the changes seen in your coming visits! We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to seeing you again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations - Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Where to start?   Well Knotts Berry Farm offers great location, clean comfortable rooms, good service, good facilities, plenty of parking and free wi fi.  We don't have kids but if you do I would recommend staying here over Disney. Cheaper and you don't have fake happiness rammed down your throat.   I don't see how any one can moan about this hotel. Yes you have to pay for parking... welcome to California, you do every where.  I really enjoyed Knotts the Hotel, and I would recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: I am so thrilled to learn that the sincerity and passion of our team helped enhance you and your family's experience with us. We take great pride in our property and love seeing/ hearing when our efforts result in positive guest interactions. We look forward to earning your loyalty for many stays to come! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations - Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: We stayed one night in the snoopy room. Room was very clean and spacious. Two queen beds. Snoopy came at 8pm to tuck the girls in bed they were thrilled was so nice to see such big smiles.  Checking in was fast recieved discounts and a free childs meal at  the waves restaurant at hotel. Nice size pool with a kids play water area on the side. Pool stays open until 11pm my granddaughter and her cousin loved staying up late playing in the water. We loved the experience look forward to staying there again staff professional and very friendly.
Manager Response: We are so happy to learn that your granddaughter's birthday was made special by the experience here at the Knott's Hotel. Personally, I think it is great that you were able to share this visit with her as I remember all of those experience with my grandparents growing up and they are my fondest memories. Thank you for allowing us to be a part of that! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations - Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: This is a fantastic hotel, massive size rooms with a queen size bed EACH! Very clean, complimentary water in room and tea/coffee making facilities. Close to supermarkets/restaurants and next to a good themepark , on arrival you get discount for the hotels restaurant "Amber Waves" which i went to for breakfast, really nice buffet breakfast. And you can get takeout from them if you are going on a trip. They had really helpful reception staff who help you with transfers, trips to universal etc. If you want to stay here and visit hollywood, Beverly hills etc then i would reccomend hiring a car cause it is a good 45 minute journey down the freeway and taxis are a rip off! I ended up downloading uber and lyft apps on my phone they was a hell of a lot cheaper than taxi! Great stay :)

The location is very good if you are visiting Knott's Berry Farm. The hotel has good free parking and is easy to get to. The room we stayed at was a little bit small, but it was clean and nice but maybe a little bit run down. Free wifi.Staff at the reception were nice. There are plenty of restaurants and shops close to the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and especially families staying with kids.

The hotel personnel was extremely good to us, was kind and it looked as tho they enjoyed what they do and want to be there.  We are planning on going back to Knott's Berry Farm and we will stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.

Location - This all depends on what you want to do and how long you're staying! This was the only thing that I can fault (due to our needs) however that could be due to the type of things we were doing. Whilst only about 36 miles away from Hollywood & Beverly Hills the sheer amount of traffic in LA made each journey a nightmare! However if you are here with kids and plan on doing just one park (knotts berry park) it's perfect. With shops and restaurants a really short walk away you can't ask for more.  Hotel - the rooms are amazing so big and clean with good coffee making equipment for free! The wifi is free and really fast. The pool and hot tub are great and love the fact the pool is open till 11pm !  Price- I felt this was a hotel that offers amazing value for money, as

We took our grandsons to Knotts Berry Farm and stayed overnight at the hotel.  The room was a nice size for four people.  It was clean and well appointed.  We arrived early before check in and they accommodated us.  We only had to wait a half hour for the room.  We went to the restaurant to grab a bite to eat while we waited.  It was awful!  The service was terrible, our order was wrong and the food is only mediocre.  I still recommend the hotel because of the proximity to Knotts Berry Farm.  If you stay at the hotel it is free parking for Knotts.  It is within walking distance of the hotel.  The hotel has premium rooms that have a snoopy theme and someone comes to read to the kids at night.  You must reserve early to get these rooms.  The staff is very friendly, helpful and

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Knotts
Summary: Stayed here beginning of September for one night as visiting Knotts Berry Park in the day.  Good hotel, although think it would have benefited from a fridge.  Room was clean but a/c was noisy and had a weird smell.   Your room cost literally is the room, there is one bottle of water in your room which you can buy. Surely this should be available within the room price.  That said, it was still a good hotel and very convenient if spending a day at the theme park.  Stayed in a basic family room.

took last minute trip with kids and grandkids to knots.  Tripadvisor had really to deal to stay at knots berry farm resort hotel. Hotel/staff was great and very friendly. Pool was heated and even stayed open till 11pm.  I would advise any one looking for a  hotel room to check out tripadvisor first.

Summary Heading: Great location and staff but room needs improvement
Summary: Stayed at the hotel one night using their package deal that included one night stay in the Snoopy room, parking, Knott's Berry Farm tickets for four and breakfast.   Pros: The location was great, within a quick walking distance to KBF. Staff were very friendly and genuinely happy to be working there. The Snoopy room was adorable with the characters on the wall and the two Snoopy stuffies left on the bed for my boys. We arrived very early at about noon and were pleasantly surprised that our rooms were ready! Breakfast buffet had a wide selection of food which included many hot items, bread/pastries and fruit. Juice was also included with breakfast.  Cons: there was a very unpleasant smell in our room (strong mildew odor). Initially had thought it was stale air but turning on the

It was the first ever time I have been away to California and it was a great place to stay. It had two parks right next door and as the hotel owns them they give discounts off the tickets in the hotel. There is a restaurant joint to the hotel so you don't have to go far for food. On the other hand, the hotel is quite far from Hollywood and Los Angeles so if you don't want to go through Los Angeles traffic maybe you want to book somewhere close.

Checked in for one night just for a quick last minute trip before the start of school. Room was fine and it was close (less than 10 mins) to the front of Knotts. Parking is $7 depending on the package you book. Price was just as cheap as the neighboring motels.

My sister and I just spent a night here for our recent Disney trip. Although it's 10 minutes from Disneyland,  they have a shuttle so you don't have to deal with the Disney parking structures and long tram waits.  We got a room on a holiday weekend for $105 fees included! Couldn't get a cheap motel for that in Anaheim.  Our room was clean and had a view of the fireworks.  I did find it odd that there is a basketball court directly below the rooms, it wasn't a huge nuisance,  as we were exhausted and fell asleep quickly, but if you're a light sleeper maybe ask to be on the opposite side of the court.  We ordered room service and were very impressed.  Two full, delicious breakfasts and coffees delivered for a total of $30? Excellent.  We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your experience with us at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel! Our rates fluctuate throughout the year based on area demand however we pride ourselves in always having competitive pricing that allow  families like yours to be able to enjoy a variety of available amenities and attractions. I am glad to see that the location of your room, while near the basketball courts, did not adversely affect your stay. For future stays please let us know if you have a preferred view as we have several different options based on room type. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to host you and your family again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Excellent location for visiting the theme park. Can walk in about 3 minutes. A little dated but rooms big  and clean.  Staff nice and helpful. Would definitely stay again as so convenient for theme park

This was my favourite hotel I stayed in in the United States! They had pretty friendly staff and had everything organised for us such as busses and rooms! Had no problems with elevators or anything like I did in San Francisco. Can't say much about this place it was just great!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review! I am pleased to learn the experience was seamless and efficient so that you could maximize your vacation. We hope to see you again should your travels bring you back to our area in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel in Los Angeles. First of all, its quality of Food along with the ambiance of the rooms were awesome. The Staff was very courteous. A very friendly place to put up yourself. The location of this Resort is very convenient. It is accessible to most of the prominent places in Los Angeles.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, great location for theme park
Summary: The staff are what made our visit. The lovely cleaning lady on floor 5 was fantastic and day to day requests were dealt with very well. One small issue was the dismissive tone the young lady n chrck in used when she couldn't find our booking for a second room and looked at me as if I was crazy! When I gave her the voucher from our travel provider, which showed we had booked two rooms, she eventually found it but made no apology. However this was a small thing and all other staff were delightful.  The rooms were cleaned every day and to a very high standard. They were large and well stocked. A small fridge would have been a bonus though.  The location, right next door to the theme park, is great. The amenities are good too: a pool with long opening hours, restaurant and gym etc.

Summary Heading: Sooo close to Knotts its unbelievable
Summary: I was really happy with our stay, the staff was amazing.  Camp Snoopy does visit the hotel which my daughter adored (she's 1yo).  The buffet was pretty good, you do get 20% off so that helps.  The pool was really nice and big although they only had hand towel sized towels to use. (I complained)  The carpet in the hotel walkways is stained but clean.  I brought my black light in the room and it check out clean!  They don't have a place to throw out your trash when it becomes full in your room which would be nice considering that we had 5kids, 6adults, 3rooms (I complained since it would be of great convenience)  All in all we had a great time and it was sooo close to Knotts.  Oh, and they also can rent electric wheelchairs from a 3rd party throught the hotel that allows you to

So I am checked in this hotel whoever checked me in was nice but later I called down to ask if they had coffee in the lobby and Jackie sarcastically laughs at me not once but several times not cool they charge for parking nickel and dime you hotel but the location to soak city and knottsberry farm is within walking distance and medieval times and pirate dinner show is just down the road...shame on you Jackie for treating your guest disrespectfully..six workers walked by me and my grandson who were shrugging with bags not one person offered to help. I check out in 6 days so I will update just to give you an idea of the service

The staff provided the most excellent customer service ever.  Easy check in/out process. Package deals including park passes, parking and meals (supreme was our choice) were beyond affordable. Food at Amber Waves was great. Snoopy went table to table for photos (nice touch). Rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable.  Just a great visit all around.

This was my first ever visit to the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel and it did not disappoint. The King Suite we stayed in was immaculately clean and filled with everything you might expect in such a room. The bed was firm but incredibly comfortable and the whole room smelled very fresh making for a very relaxing and pleasant night. Despite the computers being down upon arrival, check-in was a simple process and the staff were always professional, courteous, and exceptionally friendly. The lack of a microwave or mini-fridge was a little disappointing but this was easily overlooked when compared to the cleanliness of the room and hospitality we received. Undoubtedly an excellent hotel with great prices, fantastic staff, and comfortable rooms.

We were so impressed!  First our bell person, Tomas, went out of his way to find us a good room after I rejected the first one offered (window looked on a block wall).  He even put our luggage in the new room as we ate dinner at the restaurant.  And what a dinner - our bartender/server, Jacquiline-Antonette, was a delight!  She offered recommendations and liquid refreshments with a joyful attitude.  We'd go back just to have her wait on us.  We were impressed that the glasses and coffee cups in the room were real glass!

We stayed here 4 nights and although the room was a little dated, it was comfortable and clean. The public areas were spacious and well decorated and the swimming pool was heated with swimming towels supplied. Overall it was great and all the kids around seemed to love it.

Great location.  Nice rooms. Friendly staff. So convenient when attending Knott's berry park.  Snoopy in lobby everyday for pictures. Restaurant at property fair   $7 per night parking fee,  park tickets reduced rate when staying at hotel

The staff was friendly and very helpful. They explained all the extras I had. The breakfast buffet  was OK I have had better but the restaurant  staff was friendly and attentive. Always coming and checking on me

I stayed here for 2 weeks with my two teenage kids. It was a really good location for access to Knotts Berry Farm and Soak City, and got discounted tickets for staying in the hotel.
