The staff are super friendly and helpful, the pool is great and the restaurant is pretty good too, though expensive. Easy access to LA and beaches such as Huntingdon, Newport and Sunset. There are also local shops within easy walking distance. I didnt hire a car whilst here, and just used Uber for any journeys, which worked out cheaper. The hotel itself is slightly dated, but the rooms are comfortable and well kept, and cleaned daily.  The only criticisms I would have was our room was not ready when we arrived, which after a 11 hour flight and 15 hour journey was not good, and we had to wait till 5pm

This place is fine for a night or so and great to access the park itself. (5min walk)  Entry by car was confusing as was guided by attendant to front entrance with no further info. I had to get out and check in before we could self park our car (and display our permit which is an additional cost)  Lobby is beautiful. Amber waves bar/grill on site is great. Desserts are huge! I'd recommend sharing! Pool area is big and lots of loungers.  We were on 5th floor. Room is tired. Lots of wires sticking out of the wall. One trailed over the floor by the bed! No fridge or microwave. Ironing board was unusable!! The cover is so rippled and old that you can't use it. I attempted to iron on the floor!! Shower temp and flow varied for no reason.   Just disappointed as being affiliated to the

The hotel lobby is quite nice, the pool is a good size and they have a water feature playground thing aswel. Tennis court and basketball court, sauna and just down the road from knott's berry farm and soak city. The suites are old though and the set up is not really practical. In the bathroom there is nowhere to put your clothes for a shower. The sink mirror is outside the bathroom . The rooms were clean though and the bed and pillows are comfy and the wifi is nice and fast aswel as the elevators. Would stay here again definitely

Summary Heading: We even met Snoopy at the Hotel!
Summary: This hotel is very  Roomy, clean and much more than we expected.  We loved the convenience of having only a short walk to and from the amusement park.  All hotel employees were friendly and helpful....We stopped a maid and asked for more coffee packets when she had a moment, and she stopped what she was doing to go and get them (that surprised us).  Park tickets are available at the front desk which makes entrance to the park quick and easy. The Amber Waves Hotel restaurant is very nice with a wonderful staff that goes the extra mile for an enjoyable dinning experience. The workout room/gym and steam room are clean and well stocked with towels.  The pool and spa areas are all clean and well stocked with towels.  As we were returning from the park in the early evening, we met

Loved the place, people were helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and comfy! My family enjoyed our overnight stay in Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel. And if given another chance to be in Buena Park, we'd still book at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort and Hotel.

I stayed at his hotel with family over Easter time and cannot fault it. We hired a car so it was a good location a short drive from Beverly Hills, Disney Land Hollywood etc. The rooms are spacious and clean and the bathrooms are decent although perhaps a little dated. The pool is lovely especially at night time and the hotel is very peaceful despite being next to a huge theme park (which looked fantastic although we didn't have time to visit unfortunately). There was also a shuttle from the hotel to the Disney parks which was handy to avoid parking there. Overall a good stay here definitely would return if I were to visit LA again.

Summary Heading: Kids last fun day before the new school year
Summary: I wanted to do something with the kids before they started the new school year ,so I decided to take them to knotts berry farm for a fun day and as a special treat get a room there at the park.so I reserved a room at knott''s berry farm resort which is only a 10 minute walk from the park, after a long day the kids wanted to take a shower so we can go to dinner, I went to turn on the shower for them when noticed there was stuff in the bottom of the tub well it turns out they were pubic hair's I was so mad that I went down to complain the only thing they told me was they'll check to see why the tub wasn't cleaned right. I ended up cleaning the shower so the kids could take a shower not cool at all

lovely place the rooms are a bit dated but very clean, ideal for knotts berry farm walk to and for and the restaurant in the hotel is lovely great bar snacks and evening meals. Staff are friendly i would definitely stay here again

Arrived around 2:30pm expecting to check into our room immediatley after a long drive from Las Vegas. Unfortunately we were told our room wouldn't be ready until 4pm. We hose the hotel based on location as it was near the Irvine Meadow Amphitheatre and Disneyland, both venues that were on our to do list and not too far from Los Angeles attractions and Universal Studios Hollywood. Location is good for these venues and we made Universal in approximately 40mins, but probably more to do with leaving the hotel at 6;30am - LA traffic is bad. If you think your journey will take 30-40 minutes allow 90 mins for anytime after 7am until late at night !! The hotel is on the site of Knotts Berry Farm park (which we didn't visit) and has shops restaurants (TGIFriday) on site. Parka t the

This hotel is exactly how I thought it would be.  Good budget accommodations without any flare.  The lady greeting the cars at the lot entry was very friendly and informative.  Check in was busy, but went very well.   The hotel furniture showed signs of wear, but everything was clean. I was impressed by the pool area, it had a mini splash park and large hot tub.  The pool was a good size.  Parking is not included in price, but you can leave vehicle here and take a short walk to the theme park.  It was a very busy time to stay, the hotel was booked solid, but we still had a good night sleep.

Summary Heading: Kid's loved Camp Snoopy Room better than Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: We (3 adults, 1 teen, 2 tweens and 2 little ones) just visited Disneyland, Knotts and Medeival Times a few days ago.  We stayed 2 nights at Disneyland Hotel and 1 night at Knotts Berry Farm Hotel and the kids loved this hotel room (Camp Snoopy) so much more.  We got a package deal which I found on their website and booked via their reservations office.  We booked a standard King room (one bed) and an oversized Camp Snoopy room (2 queens and they added 2 roll away beds) because that's all they had available and unfortunately, they were on different floors because we booked too late. The total for our stay was $820 for two room (Snoopy Room was huge), 8 Knotts tickets, 8 breakfast buffets, parking and great deals at their restaurant.    It was $800 alone for the Disneyland

We stayed at the hotel for a week The staff are very friendly and polite The rooms were a reasonable size with free coffee facilities  There is a free shuttle bus to Disney that runs at set times of the day By car Disney is about 15 minutes away There are plenty of restaurants near the hotel and a Walmart and Target There is a laundry room with 4 washers and 4 dryers There pool is nice and includes a hot tub and splash zone for the kids. We all enjoyed our stay there and the theme park is adjacent to the hotel

We really enjoyed our stay at the Knotts Berry Farm hotel. Good customer service and excellent location. Rooms are average, nothing fancy, clean and comfortable, just a place to sleep after a long day at the park. Bathrooms need to be remodeled! Very family oriented, our kids loved seeing Snoopy everyday in the lobby. We enjoyed some adult beverages and food from Amber Waves and also ordered breakfast, which was delicious. We are already planning to go back in December.

This is our second visit here and again we were not disappointed, food in Amber Waves restaurant was excellant and reasonable, staff were very friendly, car park charges apply but not too bad and room was spacious and clean. Free safe and complementary coffee in the morning, lovely hotel and enjoyable stay

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Knotts Hotel
Summary: This is year 5 for my family making a trip to Knotts Berry Farm. They did not disappoint. We stayed in the over sized room that can sleep 6. With all of our kids considered adults we can get a package deal for 2 days cheaper than we can do Disneyland for just admission. Love that our teenage kids still want this every year. I would highly recommend staying here if your thinking about visiting Knotts.

I took my grandchildren to this hotel and Knotts for a treat before they go back to school.  It was a treat for grandma too!  We loved the hotel.  I booked a superior package in the Snoopy room.  The room was adorable with Snoopy decorations and a Snoopy plush toy for each child.  The room was clean, well appointed and the cutest ever.  The Snoopy rooms also get a special good night from Snoopy.   The package included tickets to the park, parking, dinner and breakfast and our room for a reasonable price.    Hotel staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful.  Food in the Amber Waves restaurant was very good and breakfast buffet was plentiful.  We throughly enjoyed are stay.  The grandkids thought it was a very special place.  We love it!

We stayed here in the snoopy suite and we all had a blast. We had a pool view and were on the 2nd floor. Amazing room. Breakfast was yummy. Walked right over to knotts berry farm. The pool was great we could see the kids from our room window.

Was a wonderful and family friendly place to stay. With shuttle servicea to and fro Disney. There is a walmart nearby to. The staff was gracioud and the rooms were spacious as well. There is a grea selection of food near the vicinity including Indian Vegetarian.

The room was great and parking was free. Totally convinient to get to the amusement park. Would love to stay again. We ate at the hotel restaurant for lunch both days. It's got a great variety. Wished we woulda make it to breakfast. It's so nice after a full day of rides and walking the hotel is just right there.

I had a great time at my Family Reunion...at the this hotel .The staff was friendly . Nice clean room ...my bed was very comfortable. This is such a busy hotel. Good location! Everything is close by in walking distance shopping  & eating places.

First the good: staff was very nice and helpful.  If you are going to the park the hotel would be perfect for the location especially during Halloween.    The bad: walls are so thin you can here everything and I do mean everything.  First it was children arguing  at 6:30 AM , the next morning it was someone with bad sinus problems.  I honestly thought the rooms , especially  the Snoopy rooms would have a refrigerator, but they don't.  You can get one  for a one time fee of 20.00.   The Snoopy rooms are the premium rooms but no premium view of the park.  I had a lovely view of the entry to the hotel.  One would think that they would put the rooms on a higher floor with a view of the park but sadly they are on the second floor. The pillows and bed linens need to be replaced ASAP.

Well. The room was very small compared to lesser expensive hotels I've stayed in. I stayed here b/c I could use my miles to pay for it. This was my first visit to Knott's Berry Farm & hotel and was more impressed with the hotel I stayed in the next day that was down the road from here. Knott's still charged me for parking although I was a guest. Not cool IMO to charge a hotel guest. They didn't even tell me I was going to be charged for parking, I found that out when I was checking out the next day. They should give hotel guests a pass to display on the dashboard or hang from the rearview mirror to show they're staying there to avoid any possible hassle from the parking attendant. The room was clean and sufficient, just quite a bit smaller than expected. The park is quite a far

The Knott's Berry Farm Hotel was clean and comfortable. The shuttle to Disneyland is a plus. Be sure to reserve your spot on the shuttle. More frequent shuttle times for Disney would have been convenient. All in all, a good experience.

Sent this email TWICE to Knotts and still haven't received a response.  Yes I have called and was transferred 4 times before speaking to someone in housekeeping, who says they didn't find my purse.  I was giving them the benefit of a response and since I haven't received one I will post my email.  If/when i receive a response I will update this post.  We stayed with your location for 2 nights with a Ride and Soak package(Wed-Fri).  Upon check-in to the hotel room we noticed the AC did not work.  I called the front desk to report and was informed they would send maintenance down to fix for us immediately.  From looking at the AC unit(it was open) it looked like this was a common occurrence in our room.  We waited until 10pm and no one ever showed up to fix the ac.  I finally

Summary Heading: Great location for a visit to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times while visiting Knotts Berry Farm and it is the perfect location.  Safe, easy walk to the park from the hotel.  Only complaint I would have is that the rooms do not come with a fridge.  Considering this is a family oriented hotel, it seems odd that no fridge is in the room.  I would have liked to have kept snacks and drinks on hand.

Horrible customer service. I booked two queens and they messed up my reservation along with trip advisor and Priceline. So They charged me 20$ per night extra to "upgrade" my room from one queen to two queens.... When I had already paid for it. Horrible experience and horrible customer service. I will not be using a third party anymore to book.

I was pleasantly surprised, the hotel and rooms sre clean, size is average/ good Some reviews I read said they were small but that is not the case. Updated, nice furnishings, flat screen tv. Staff is very friendly,nice bar and lounge also has friendly staff. Would stay again gladly!

Bathroom needs an overhaul.  Mattress was hard as a rock and had a terrible's night sleep.  Only nice thing was seeing Snoopy in lobby and being close/walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm.  Cost is reasonable but not for a very dirty bathroom.

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stay When Visiting the Park
Summary: Check in went well although I did find it interesting that you have to leave your drivers license in order to use one of their suitcase carts.  The room was clean and very comfortable.  We stayed in a Snoopy suite and the whole Snoopy experience was fantastic.  Only down side of the stay and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5, was the housekeeping schedule.  They showed up to clean around 4:30 PM which was the time we came back to rest before going back to the park.  So no cleaning for our stay. Otherwise the entire stay was very nice.  I would come back again in the future.

The hotel staff was extremely nice and accommodating.  Our hotel room was situated above the pool area which the kids enjoyed.  The food at Amber Waves Restaurant was very good and reasonably priced.  Knott's Berry Farm was just a short walk away from the hotel which was also very convenient.  We had a great time and look forward to staying here again.

My stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel was very nice. The employees were professional, it is located right at Mrs Knotts chicken which was an old favorite restaurant of my family, being that I am from Buena Park. The room was clean but the bathroom was not such quality as I expected, a little dated. The best part was the great bed. I am very particular and the bed I gave AAA.there was a complete mattress cover and white comforter, not heavy. I had had surgery and I felt very comfortable in the bed with 2 pretty good nights sleep. I highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed while visiting LA. I love how it was close to everything. I also like the park and hotel combo. It was clean. Receptionist was friendly. Lobby was well maintained. Pool area was nice. Free wifi, room service. Workout room and sauna. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

My wife and I and our son stayed here as our base in Anaheim. Was ideally situated not far from everything we needed. Disneyland was a 5 minute walk and Knotsberry Farm was close. Shopping mall was soo close so it made it soo comforting to know that everything was close if needed

We've stayed at this hotel before and had a good time. They offer a hotel & ticket deal that seems amongst the best values. When we purchased this package we took into consideration the proximity to the park and its amenities.     The hotel itself is a bit old,  but well kept. You can tell they keep good maintenance specially around lobby /entrance area.    The rooms are basic and serve the purpose of resting after a long day at the park, however, I would not call them luxurious.  Beds are comfortable. Bathroom is a bit small, but again it a basic room. It felt clean and comfortable overall.     Staff seems friendly and polite,  however, didn't interact with them much.   Overall this hotel is a really good choice when visiting Knotts theme park. Just don't spect super fancy

This was our first stop on our recent holiday. Everything from parking, front desk & pool was amazing. Rooms were beautifully decorated and finished. Modern. Facilities were great.  We didn't visit the pool as it was always very busy.  Handy access to all local sights. Would definitely stay here again.

Great location, if you're visiting Knott's Berry Farm; an easy walk to the park.  Very nice lobby, decent rooms and bathrooms, clean, and we had very comfortable bed.  The breakfast buffet wasn't bad, but a little expensive at $14.  I'd stay there again if going back to the Berry Farm, which we won't... but that's another review.

Very dated hotel rooms!!!!!!!!!! Dresser old and damaged. No fridge or microwave. Hard bed. Pancake pillows.Expensive. pOol area....tons of lounge chairs. Small very dated pool with cracked cement all the way around. No bar or outdoor food service. bUffet breakfast only. Eggs,sausage,bacon,hash browns,muffins,French toast,cereal and fruit.  no Omlets made to order or waffles. Very poor hotel considering owned by knots. Will never stay there again

1 night 11 June 2016 We bought the classic package which gave us a nights accommodation, buffet breakfast, park tickets and parking. Comfortable room, nice breakfast and a lovely lobby. Did not have the opportunity to use the pool complex. After going to the Park, I do like the Disney Parks much better and would prefer to stay in that area. This was a change for us, which we would not do again more for our Park preference rather than the Hotel.

We booked the family package on their website, we had several options to chose from and it was very convenient doing it online. We traveled from Las Vegas and we were looking for a place where to stay after our visit to the park. The package included the room, the parking, discounted tickets for the park and breakfast. Some of our members drove the morning of our visit and even though their rooms were not ready, they were able to pick up their tickets to the park early in the morning even before the park opened. Once the rooms were ready they got a text to go and check. The rooms are very clean but no microwave or fridge but the bed were comfortable. The pool are has lots of chairs and they also have a tennis court. The hotel is conveniently located next to the park ans

Hello,  We had a very fun first time at Knott's Berry Farm. Its kind of like a county fair themed park. I dont have any dislikes about our visit.  Employees were very helpful park was clean. Our kids had a great time as did we. OMG, the Snoopy Blockbuster on Ice was AWESOME! Ill be honest, im not a fan of ice skating and i was there for the kids, but i was cheering and clapping and frankly enjoyed the show! Seriously, if you go to Knotts Berry Farm, make that show a must! If i could describe the show in one word, it would be AMAZING. I have an all new respect for ice skaters. Ghost Rider a must too. Here are some tips for your first visit that we did that was great: 1) take a back pack with waters and snacks. And a mister for the heat. 2) buy some food vouchers. You can eat

The facility was very clean, good service and 5min walk to the park. You don't need to move your car, leave it at the hotel while you enjoy the walk. The pool was very nice and clean. If you need to store refrigarated items or want to microwave popcorn/late night snack you wont be able to as there is no refrigerator and microwave. May be some day.

Summary Heading: A perfect location to stay at and have loads of Family Fun!
Summary: This hotel is geared for Family Fun, Kid-Friendly, and we absolutely LOVE IT!!  We visit at least once to twice yearly, and I would not want to stay anywhere else!  Everything you need is really on property between the Hotel and Theme Park.  Mrs. Knott's Restaurant is truly one of our favorites!  Amber Waves (inside hotel) is also very good food, great service, and a wonderful menu choice for even the pickiest of eaters when it comes to the little one's.

We just stayed there for three nights (06/09-06-11) and although the lobby area and restaurant look really nice, the rooms are lacking. They're lacking a comfortable bed, I tossed and turned all night. They're also lacking microwaves and fridges. It's a shame to throw away great leftover food because we had no place to store it. The walls are very thin as well as the windows; Ghost Rider kept me up until about 2am one night because it was running so late, even after the park was closed. A friend and I, after spending all day at the park wanted to relax our achy bodies in the hot tub, but that was extremely difficult! There were so many children jumping in to it and splashing around and stepping all over us that we kept having to tell them to settle down. Hot tubs are not

We had never stayed in the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel before. The only benefit I can see now is convenience. You can't beat its proximity to Knott's Berry Farm. It was truly an easy 3-4 minute walk. But our stay there was not great. The room had no fridge or microwave. And we certainly needed a fridge for our Chicken Dinner Restaurant leftovers! We ended up having to toss them the next morning, sadly. The sheets were very scratchy. We also weren't certain the sheets were new to us. A few stains appeared fresh and not from us. Every time I rolled over during the night, the plastic mattress cover made such a racket it woke others up. The bathroom did not appear clean, with hairs on surfaces. The next morning we heard exactly how thin the walls were. We heard everyone on every side

The hotel is very convenient, walking distance, to Knott's Berry Farm.  The hotel is very large and nicely decorated.  The room was very clean.  The staff was very nice.  We had a hotel (accommodations), parking, buffet breakfast and admission to Knott's Berry Farm amusement park at a reasonable price. The pool area was large with lots of chairs. Also, just down the road, a very short distance is Medieval Times and Pirate Dinner Adventure.

Knotts Berry Farm Hotel is a great choice for both families and couples who are planning on going to Knotts Berry Farm amSee usement park. I suggest paying the small  extra for the Superior room as it is more roomy and has a nice bar . Also I would suggest getting the package deal that includes both the breakfast buffet at the Amber Waves hotel restaurant and the 2 day Knotts Berry Farm Amusement Park tickets. It is a great deal although would be nice if the hotel also offered a 3 day park ticket package.The restaurant is fantastic and remember if you have kids to ask the front desk for the tickets that allows kids 11 and under to eat free with each paying adult entree. The  daily breakfast buffet is fantastic!! It has  a great selection and is an added benefit when added to the

This was our second stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel.  Our previous stay was three years ago.  This is a great hotel for families.  The close proximity to Knotts Berry Farm means you can go in and out of the park as you like.  The pool was a hit with the kids and they have a great water playground for younger children.  There is a basketball court and tennis court which the kids loved.  Staff are friendly and can't do enough for you.  Will definitely be back again.

We take our grandkids every year and they have a great time. We stay at Knott's hotel, so it is real easy to go back and forth. The food at Amber Waves is good and reasonable, plus kid friendly. They also sell tickets, so you don't have to wait in long lines, plus as hotel guest you get a discount

Summary Heading: Decent place, could use some updates
Summary: We stayed here June 8-12, 2016, since it seemed like a good central location for all the places we would be visiting (Huntington Beach, Universal, Knott's).  It is a very short walk to Knott's Berry Farm, so that is a plus.  Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the back parking lot.  We had a partial view of the Ghost Rider roller coaster.  The room itself was "just ok".  Most standard rooms nowadays include a small fridge and microwave; ours had neither, just a coffee maker which we didn't use.  It also had just a desk & chair instead of a small dining table & chairs, which would have been useful.  The sheets were clean but had a few small holes in them.  The bathroom walls and floor were nicked with markings/stains.  Could probably use a fresh coat of paint.  There was also a

Summary Heading: Beware: Stay away from this booking company & The Knotts Berry Farm hotel!!!
Summary: I booked a room on this website (which ended up being booked through a company called CancelOn). I checked into the hotel and headed to the amusement park for the day. We had dinner and headed back to the hotel around 6 pm. Our room was absolutely disgusting. The carpet was covered in stains (some of them were actually sticky). The room service menu was dirty and covered in a sticky brown substance. It was just GROSS!!! This hotel was certainly NOT a 4 star hotel, even 2 stars would have been too many for this hotel. I decided that I would rather drive my two kids home at 7pm rather than risk staying in this totally disgusting hotel. I talked to management and they said I needed to contact the company I booked the room through to get a refund. (This was Saturday night).  I ended

Summary Heading: Could easily have been 4 stars but for beds and noise
Summary: This is a well located place to visit Knott's Berry Farm theme park, the rooms are a reasonable size and reasonably equipped. The hotel is tidy and well run. Guest Parking is $7 per day. However the rooms do not have refrigerators, the beds are hard and noise comes from the adjoining rooms. We had the misfortune to be next to someone who left the television on all night and only in the early hours of the morning I figured out how to make the air conditioner fan stay on all the time to drown the TV out. Next night similar TV noise came from the other side but fortunately it was turned off at a reasonable time. I intensely dislike listening to someone else's television. I am sure most people feel the same. WiFi was excellent.

Summary Heading: Very good place to stay, hughly convenient to Knott's Park
Summary: We stayed at this hotel, largely because of convenience. We really didn't expect much because of some of the reviews a few months earlier. The days were high 80s, so, expected a stuffy room with fluctuating room temps . We also expected lots of noise and kids making noise in the hallway.   Whether through happenstance, or design, we were given a room at the end of the hallway. This worked well for us as the noises were confined to traffic between us and the elevator. The room was very comfortable, as the temp remained constant. We retreated to our room for a comforting mid day nap. The room was clean. Our travel companions in another room asked for, and got, a small refrigerator in their room (note to self). We used the in-room safe. Grandkids really enjoyed the pool.  We were

Check-in was good, a bit of a rocky stay. Last minute stay and was able to get a room but was given a king bed for 2 adults and 2 kids and was told there was a sleeper sofa (which there wasn't). When we asked we were offered a roll away for $15 extra, which ended up not being available. All in all there was some missteps but Knott's hotel management made it right and eventually (after bringing 8 extra blankets) around 12:30AM got us a room with queen beds. We stay every year around Haunt a few times and go up just for the day to Amber Waves because we love the bartenders so much. It was a bit of a mess but all in all would suggest staying if the price is right.

Very nice hotel. I didn't think they should charge for parking though the parking is very convenient. If you are going to Knotts  or Disneyland location is great. Room was comfortable, clean and quiet. There is a restaurant on site but I didn't get a chance to dine there.

Nice hotel and staff. Only issues were dirty window on 7th floor, trash behind the dresser means not fully cleaned (looking for extra outlet for unplugged coffee maker), musty smell from cooler, and $4 sodas in the vending machine. I don't usually rate 5 stars unless it meets high expectations. I wouldn't say it is perfect but fine for families that don't want to worry about their room quality.

Our stay here was nice. The rooms are comfy and clean. However, this is a very noisy hotel. The walls are thin and we had "neighbors" that kept their TV on very late at night and we could hear it through the walls. In the early mornings, we could also hear people's conversations as they gathered in the hallway to prepare for their park adventure.  (We did not visit the park during our stay)   There was also a prom held here during our stay one of the nights on the 9th floor. We were on the 8th floor. We could hear the "boom boom" of the music and could feel the vibrations through the ceiling as the kids danced.  Not a very restful vacation.   Another thing that was frustrating is they put out the signs about "Saving the planet and Saving Water" and if you want to help, hang up

Summary Heading: Overnight trip to Knott's for birthday
Summary: Hotel was very nice. Nice big TV, close to both parks, very clean, large room, soft bed. The room service was good but expensive. And there was no refrigerator in the room to save you leftovers. The staff was helpful. The parking was free, as long as you have the season pass. Snoopy wanders the hotel for pictures. The only problem we had was our shower was not working correctly. We called the front desk, and they had maintenance people at our door at 11 o'clock at night. They were done fixing it and out of our room in about 15 minutes. Then our room was perfect.

Our room was located next to two rooms under construction. So at 7am in the morning we were awakened to the sound of workers coming, going and other construction sounds. The room was musky and the exhaust fan in the bathroom didn't work. The shower knob was hard to turn on or off. It was just an awful two night stay. If would have been nice if the front desk had informed us of the construction or even offered a room change but no. Upon checking out we weren't even asked how your stay was. Only bright side was the gift shop,bar, and housekeeping staff were very nice.

Summary Heading: A great hotel that caters to its' clientele
Summary: I had called ahead to ask about parking at the hotel since we had reservations for a Friday night, and planned to go to Knott's Berry Farm on Friday.  I was told that I could check in early, receive a parking pass, and they would text me when my room was ready.  My husband and I arrived at 9:30 a.m. and they had a room available for immediate check in.  The room was spacious, very clean, and a woman from housekeeping stopped by to check and make sure that we had everything that we needed.  As advertised, this is a very child friendly hotel.  We had several interactions with Snoopy during our stay.  All of the staff members were friendly, the price was very reasonable, and it was only a 5 minute walk to Knott's Berry Farm.

Summary Heading: Only way to see the Park
Summary: I have been here twice with the grandchildren and for me it is really the only place I would stay when visiting Knott's.  Great proximity, free parking, great package deals and decent restaurant.  Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Somewhat spacious room with good food around
Summary: We stayed for six days here. Room was generally clean and well tidied every time we came back from touring.   Location was better compared to some hotels with barely any restaurants/eateries nearby. There were also shops within walking distance, such as the cute Snoopy shop, bakeries and Walgreen!

Had a fun time. There is so much to do , really need two days to do it all. There are plenty of rides for all ages. Lots of roller-coaster.  There are fun shows, to see. It's a nice alternative to Disney.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your experience with us! We hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Average hotel but for the money good
Summary: Average hotel but at the price it's a bargain. Drive is about 1-2 hrs from LA or anything interesting due to the horrendous traffic around LA! But it is a city so I guess this can be expected!  There are a few decent little places around to eat and drink and the hotel has a pool which is good for a relaxing swim or jacuzzis after a long day! Hotel staff are both friendly and helpful. The Room itself is ok very average and has no fridge which is a shame, coffee machine and hairdryer as expected. Bottle of water is 4 dollars!! No thanks garage is 2 dollars easy choice!! Not sure why they don't offer you a free bottle is beyond me but seems to be the standard thing is USA to rip off hotel guests with over priced room items!! The bed is comfy and the place is pretty quiet which is
Manager Response: We are pleased to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us overall. We are always striving to improve so please let us know if there is something that you are interested in seeing in our rooms that would enhance the experience for the future and we will add it to our discussions for renovations in the coming year! Thank you for being our guest and we hope to see you again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We chose Knotts Resort Hotel because we were visiting Knotts Berry Farm, and because I'd heard they offered Snoppy themed guest rooms. I was very happy with the hotel---the staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel and rooms were clean.  The Snoopy room was really cute...it was a big hit with our grandson. The hotel goes above and beyond to give kids the Snoopy experience....it's pretty special. The only negative of our stay...our bed was uncomfortable...the mattress was very hard.  Other than that, no complaints...great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review about your experience! We are glad that your stay overall was positive however we are sorry to learn that the bed was not up to your liking. The mattresses were all replaced this past year with Serta Master Suite pillow tops however we do still have a limited number of rooms with our former mattress style which may be slightly softer. Please ask for a manager during your next check-in with us and we will see if there is a room that would better suit your preference. We hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed here for one night; bed was VERY comfortable but the rest of the room and hotel could use some upgrading.  No huge red flags, just don't expect the most modern place. Saw Snoopy as we were checking out; although both teenage boys were with me, I made them take a picture with Snoopy!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review of your experience. We are thrilled to learn that the overall experience was positive however I can understand your feelings towards some of the dated décor. I am pleased to announce that we will be updating several areas within our building as part of our on-going renovations. I feel confident that the design will be a huge step forward for our guests who value a more modern look. On a side note – nice job getting that photo with Snoopy and your teenagers; we know that is no easy feat! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: The wife and I stayed for 2 nights so that we could visit the Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park which is located next door. The rooms have had a makeover since our last visit and we were pleased with the results. Again we found the bed very comfortable and the staff were always friendly and helpful. We opted for the package deal which included breakfast, parking and theme park tickets.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and reviewing your experience! We are so pleased to learn that you have returned and noticed some of the changes we are making to the property. We are committed to on-going renovations that started in our lobby last year and will continue into our guest rooms this and next year. We hope to continue the positive relationship we have with you and your family for years to come! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel in Buena Park
Summary: This hotel has the friendliest staff from the front desk as your greeted when you arrive, to the courteous maids, and all other staff as well. They make the effort to make you feel like your a guest in there home. The rooms are very clean,the walls are kept clean as well as the light switches.  The pool is awesome. It's huge with an area for kids to play in a water park.  After a day at Knotts Berry Farm it is nice to come to the hotel and enjoy a delicious meal at the restaurant inside the hotel and relax with great vibes.

Summary Heading: Horrible experience, no attempt to make things right.
Summary: We stayed 2 nights April 17 & 18th. The first night wasn't too bad. The second night my entire family was jolted awake at 1:45 AM by a fire alarm. Apparently there was an issue with the alarm, but it was impossible to get any information. By about a quarter after 2 I gave up (as did about a dozen others) as the girl at the front desk was busy apologizing on the phone to everyone who was calling and the security guy was telling everyone to come back later in the morning when a Manager is on duty, no info, no apology, just come back later. WTH? Nobody can tell us what the problem is, and whether or not it will happen again? Nobody can get a hold of a Manager?  Needless to say my family of four pretty much laid awake the rest of the morning, the kids too freaked out to sleep and my
Manager Response: It was a pleasure speaking with you last month regarding the unfortunate Fire Alarm that occurred during your stay. I feel terrible that this unique situation left an insecure feeling towards our property and hope that our discussion helped showcase the immediate action that has been and will continue to be taken to ensure that our emergency management procedures are not only being followed but being communicated to our guests throughout. It is clear from reading the reports and speaking with you that there was a significant training issue with that individual who was assigned to these duties. That employee has since undergone extensive retraining before he was left in a similar situation. In addition, all future hires will be required to take an exam proving their ability to confidently and effectively operate both the Fire Alarm system and the Guest Communication Intercom system so that something of this nature does not affect your or another guest in the future. You have been more then understanding throughout these discussions and for that, we greatly thank you. I hope that we have an opportunity to earn back your trust on your future visit as I remain extremely confident in our ability to learn from this situation as a team. Thank you again for your business and for taking the time to review our property. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Tons of Fun, Great Value and Service!
Summary: Before booking and arriving I had read a few reviews that said the Hotel was old and run down, so we weren't sure how it was going to be. Upon arrival we found that although some areas showed the hotels age it was immaculate and nothing was really 'run down'. We received top notch service from ALL of the staff from the front desk to housekeeping and wait staff. Everybody had smiles for us and was always more than happy to help. I do mean EVERYBODY was very friendly and happy to have us (very rare anymore). We booked a 3 night stay that included 2 passes to the park for each of us. The total cost for room, passes and the works cost us less than a just a 1 day entrance each into the Big Namedland park down the road. Also included was breakfast buffet for each of us every morning

Good room and location.   Great place to walk to Knotts Berry Farm from.   Front office supervisor, Giselle Bishop, was extremely helpful and made our stay much better.   Friendly staff.  Older hotel but adequate for us.

We found this to be a cookie cutter hotel. Nothing special but right next to Knott's. Daughter was blow drying her hair and the smoke alarm went off. So loud and didn't stop. Had to send out repair man to fix it. Other than that it was comfortable and clean. Bathroom is very small though.

We stayed the night at the knots berry farm hotel this past year with out kids and had such a wonderful time. We had a snoopy themed room and this room was definitely worth the cost. We received a great package that gave us a room for the night, 5 tickets to the park and free dinner for the kids. It wasn't even much more than if we just bought 5 tickets to the park. The room was adorable and clean. Each bed had a large sized snoopy plush for my kiddos. When we got in the room there was only one plush on each bed, so two total, but we have three kids. We asked if it was at all possible to buy a third plush and they brought on up to us right away free of charge. Then at night snoopy comes to the room to tuck in the kids. So fun. we will be back.

Walking distance to the park. Restaurant on site & kids eat free. Visits from Snoopy. Park & Play. The hotel is dated, but clean & staff was friendly. The convenience of staying here when visiting the park is outstanding.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and reviewing your experience. We are thrilled to learn that the staff left a positive impact and are pleased to announce that we have some exciting renovations planned for the end of this year. We hope to see you back soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights room was large and very clean but hotel needs updating bathrooms old and shabby!! Lots of undesirable hotel guests wouldn't rush back! Restaurant expensive!! pool area good for kids
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your experience. I am sorry to learn that the rest room was not up to your or seemingly our standards. We are expecting to have some renovations at the end of this year which will include several improvements to those areas. It bothers me to learn that you encountered 'undesirable guests' as we offer 24 hour security and a zero tolerance policy for disturbing other guests. I apologize that these elements so adversely affected your stay but we hope to have an opportunity to earn your trust in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: This is a very average hotel, certainly not anything fancy, but the staff was exceptionally friendly and the location just can't be beat if you are planning a visit to Knott's Berry Farm. We also had only about a 10 minute drive to Disneyland. Kids loved meeting Snoopy in the lobby, added bonus! We ate in the restaurant two mornings in a row, the buffet had decent food for a great price. The rooms were average size, beds, comfortable enough, but the bathrooms were a tad small. Our room was on the ground floor directly next to the tennis courts, which we could not hear at all, but we could hear the basketball court noise a little too well.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your experience with us. Seems like an overall positive visit however I can understand how that proximity to the tennis courts could have interrupted your experience. I hope that our quiet hours were enforced and you were able to get some rest however we apologize for any disturbance you may have experienced. Thank you again for your business and we hope to host you and your family again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Old Stale hotel not worthy of 3.5 stars by priceline
Summary: This hotel is not a luxury hotel at all and. It was rated 3.5 stars on priceline which usually describes a Doubletree or embassy suites.  It is old and in a weird scary part of town near beach Blvd. It took a long time to check in because my reservation wasn't found but the lady at the front desk was nice.  They are very inexpensive most times and now in know why.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us. I am bothered to learn that you had difficulty checking in and were not satisfied with the surrounding area. We feel confident in our star ranking based on our guest perception and available amenities but hate to see any guest leave with a negative perception. If you are interested in elaborating a bit more on the specific things you felt were missing from the experience it will only help us grow closer to our guest satisfaction goals.  Thank you again for your business and we hope to have an opportunity to earn back your trust in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We stayed one night to visit the park.  The room was very cutely decorated, the kids got free stuffed animals, and Snoopy came and tucked them in!  Snoopy was also at the restaurant (where the kids ate free with the upgraded package)' and we ALL ate free the next morning at the buffet breakfast.  All the staff went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful.  The park is a 4 minute walk from the hotel, and if you come early in the day (when the park opens), they will text you when your room is ready!  All in all, a very delightful experience.

My partner and I stayed her for 2 nights during our 7 night trip to LA and Las Vegas. Just to say this hotel is really convenient if you are visiting the theme park, as it is right next door so in walking distance and there is a massive car park here too. We arrived quite early at this hotel but they allowed us to check into our room which was really convenient. The reception staff were lovely and very helpful. They assisted in organising a sightseeing trip for us to visit LA and all the wonderful places there. It was an amazing day! The hotel is fairly dated and looks a little dreary in some of the areas. Our room was spacious with 2 large double beds, TV, coffee and tea making facilities, hair dryer, iron and board, soap, shampoo etc. The room was dated but clean and had all

We used to stay at Radisson Suites prior to finally deciding to stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  With a package deal (buffet breakfast, room, and tickets) we found this the quantum place to stay when visiting Knott's Berry Farm.  And we stayed in the Snoopy Room, whereas Snoopy and his care taker would come to your room around 8:00 PM and tuck any and all (children & adults) in bed and remain for pictures.  It was great!  We arose the next morning and attended the buffet (scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage and bacon and cereals and fruit, and juices and milk, and then headed to the park.  The park is a short walk from the hotel.  We enjoyed the day and then had our traditional lunch at the Chicken Dinner Restaurant, and it was as usual, fantastic.  After the days

I was very pleased with this hotel and where it is close enough to everything.Very helpful Staff behind the front desk the room was clean all in all would  come back here again.Good value for money close to Disneyland although I preferred their own park.

Despite it being a family hotel don't be put off if you are not traveling with a family as although it can be a bit noisy it offers a clean comfortable  place to stay. Free wifi, tennis courts and a swimming pool. We used it as a base to visit various places of interest  in the LA area.

This hotel was fantastic, we stayed here for 9 nights in January. the staff were very friendly and the facilities were good. The WIFI is free and you don't even have to login. we didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant although from what we saw it looked good (a little pricey though). The swimming pool was FREEZING! so we spent most of our time in the Jacuzzi which was lovely. It is in a great location and only a little drive to Disney. There is a shopping center just down the road, this has a Walmart, a few clothes shops and a handful of restaurants. i had a great stay here and i would love to go back again.

Lack of reasonable procedures create irate guests.    Avoid this hotel at all costs.  Musty rooms with cigarette smells permeating the stained carpets and dated furniture.  WiFi is a joke as it limits its "free" usage.   Can't wait to be further disappointed over the next few days.  I'm taking notes.
Manager Response: I am very sorry to learn that you had a frustrating experience at the beginning of your stay. I hope that it had improved of you at least had an opportunity to discuss your frustrations with a member of our leadership team. We are completely non-smoking and have been for quite some time so how your room gained that smell is strange however I am sure that coupled with the stained carpet you mentioned was cause for a valid frustration. I am very interested in the 'lack of reasonable procedures' that you mentioned. If you are interested in elaborating a bit more so that we can grow closer to our guest satisfaction goals. Please reach out to me directly so that I can better understand the issues while I work towards correcting them for the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We were celebrating my wife's birthday. At check in they upgraded us to a King suite and gave my wife a button that said Happy Birthday! Every where we went the staff went out of their way to acknowledge her day! Our room was a wee bit dated, but clean and comfortable! We LOVE this place and are looking at heading back down in the next few months!

The hotel was not as modern as we thought. Our room was smaller than expected and very plain, but the location is very close to Knotts Berry Farm and that makes it very convenient. Parking is free, and there's lots of available space to park. They have a basketball/tennis court, and a very nice swimming pool.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel but lacking in Peanuts Theme
Summary: I was really worried about our room before arriving after reading the reviews about mold and cleaning issues but found our room to be really nice!  There was no mold to be found and the room was quite clean.  The only weird thing was the closet was in the bathroom.  I don’t remember ever staying in a room where the closet was in the bathroom.    Another thing happened as well before we arrived.   We were charged for the first night 3 days before we arrived which was new to me.  I have not been charged like that before at any other hotel that I have stayed at.  Which freaked me out thinking I booked the days wrong for our reservation.    Oh and before we arrived as well, I received an email about early check-in.  (Another thing I was surprised about since the only time I do that

This hotel is very convenient if you are heading to the Knott's Berry Farm park! However, this hotel was extremely dirty! When the maids came to our room they never changed our sheets! We had multiple black and even a few blood stains on our sheets! We had long hair in our shower and in our bed and even under the mattress! Finding hair in our sheets was very disturbing. I do not recommend this hotel if you like cleanliness.
Manager Response: Let me begin by offering a sincere apology and assure you that what you experienced is extremely unique. We take great pride in our Housekeeping department and learning that you experienced something like this is very odd and extremely disappointing. I apologize for the delayed response however if you have not had a chance to speak with a member of leadership I encourage you to contact me directly so that I can not only understand the issues better but so that I can work towards earning back your trust in the future. Thank you again for staying with us; I hope to get an opportunity to provide you with the experience many of our guests have grown used to over years of loyalty. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. My boys loved it and was very close to the park. Room service was very affordable and the food was delicious. I will definitely be booking here again for all our future stays.

We enjoyed a very good1 night stay at this hotel. We'd booked it as we were visiting the theme park and it's right next door so you can leave the car in the car park and walk. We had 2 adjoining rooms on the 4th floor. Both were comfortable and clean. House keeping did a good job. We got a pretty good deal online. Also discounted theme park tickets. No complaints and would recommend.

Recently visited Knotts Bery Farm Hotel. Stayed 3 nights. Distance from the park is great, closer than the Disneyland hotel is to Disneyland. The front desk staff was fantastic. Room wasn't ready when we got there at noon (which was expected) and they sent me a text message when it became available. They stowed our bags for us and we went straight to the park. The beds weren't super comfortable but the sheets were soft and clean. The room was pretty quiet. The main reason I didn't give more stars was because of housekeeping. We had room service the first morning and my son hadn't finished his milk before I put the tray outside the door to be picked up. They didn't put a ton of work into cleaning the room each day and on our last night I realized the congealed milk was still in

I took my daughter's here to stay the night before we played all day at Knotts! Staff were very helpful and polite! We will definitely stay here again, especially since we have Season Passes! The hotel is extremely close to the park as well.

Hotel is busy. Clean and staff is friendly. Great hotel for a tourist going to Knott's. Unfortunately, we were not going to Knott's but it worked out for us. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Buena Park

Really should get 2.5 stars, but that is not an option, and there were some real disappointments with the hotel.  On the plus side, the rooms are large, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was very nice to us. I really like the online check in, the vacation package is not bad since it includes the breakfast and a couple kids eat free tickets for Amber Waves.  However, there were some issues, and for a resort hotel that costs this much I expect better.  1.  The sink was filthy. Whoever was there before must have a had few days between shaves, because the sink was filled with shavings. Already had the stuff in the room and unpacked when the wife noticed, and was grossed out. Not wanting to break her mood or have to change rooms, I just grabbed some toilet paper and wiped the

The saving grace was that the staff was very friendly.  The room itself while adequate had NO refrigerator or microwave.  There was not the traditional breakfast - you had to pay for it at the on-site restaurant.  No outside food was allowed in the room according to the rules posted in the room, however I did see other guest carry it in (I don't believe it was enforced all the time)

Summary Heading: I love the hotel and service
Summary: if you are visiting the park is the best place to stay. we had a blast! my 21 months old loved it. breakfast in bed was pretty good and affordable. The front desk people are very friendly and polite.  we enjoyed our staying at the Knotts.

Summary Heading: Business account calls in the area
Summary: The property is well maintained, rooms are small but comfortable. This property offers good value for the money. The in-hotel restaurant bar and grill offers a good food and beer selection at a great price.

Summary Heading: Location and friendly staff is the only thing they have going
Summary: Our reservations were made well in advance, they did not warn us about its location.  Room 109 is across the hall from the gym, is ground floor with a large window next to the parking spot for new guests to check in at the lobby.  We asked for a different room and even offered to pay for any upgrade to move, but they claimed they had not a single other room available.  So our window shades could never be opened and we had vehicles coming and going all hours of the night.  Plus, the gym room's door was opening and closing non-stop into the late hours and first thing in the morning.  When we first arrived, we saw what looked like people smoking cigarettes in the laundry room right by our room and the whole hallway reeked.  Then when we woke up, the hallway reeked of

I stayed here over 30 years ago while visiting the park in early 90's, the hotel has not changed in that time. Very dated rooms and common areas. I known hey have a rustic theam here but don't think peeling paint goes with it! Should have lost it's 3.5 star rating long ago! Breakfast buffet is $15.50? Way overpriced! The staff is friendly though!

Summary Heading: Always a must stay when visiting the park
Summary: We have season passes to the park and always stay at the Hotel when we are in town. The staff is always friendly and being that close to the park is a plus. Snoopy is in the lobby at different times and in the restaurant. Breakfast is the best to see him. The pool area is also a great amenity to the hotel.

Stayed here for four nights in January 2016. Quite satisfactory. Rooms clean and tidy. Breakfast adequate. Lovely staff. Appreciated the free shuttles to and from Disneyland. Good value for money and would stay there again if visiting the themeparks.

We stayed at Knott's berry farm resort seven nights. Rooms were very nice and clean. Breakfast was plentiful. Anaheim area was nice and peaceful. The pool could have been a little bigger. It took about one and half hour from this hotel to Hollywood.

We were greeted by a friendly desk clerk who comp'd our parking fee and had a text sent to me when our room was ready.  The room itself was simple but very clean and oversized as we had requested.  The location of the hotel to the park and shops made it worth the extra dollars to stay here.

I've stayed at this hotel several times because of its proximity to Knotts Berry Farm.   It's always been decent.  Nothing special, but the location makes up for any other shortcomings.  My stay last week changed my feelings and I seriously doubt I'll stay there again.  I had to pay the full rate for the room since all the discounts (AAA, AARP, and others) were sold out.  Okay, not a big deal.  When I made the reservation I let them know I needed a rollaway bed.  I checked in at 10:00 a.m. and again said I needed a rollaway bed.  The room wasn't ready and I got a text message later in the day when it was.  We didn't make it back to the hotel until 10:00 p.m. after spending the day at the park.  I get to the room and there was no rollaway bed.    I call down to the desk and tell
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit to our property. I apologize for the misunderstanding regarding the roll-away bed. While I am very surprised that our communication system failed to work in this instant I can completely understand how this inconvenience affected your family. I was happy to learn that our manager granted a complimentary stay in another room however I agree that you would have benefited much more had it been in the same area if it had been available. I hope that this unique and unfortunate experience does not deter you from visiting our property again in the future as I assure you that this is not something you should expect from our property. Please feel free to contact me directly should you wish to discuss the matter further as I would appreciate an opportunity to earn your business. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: I hadn't been to Knott's in over 10 years. There's been lots of changes. Went with 4 other family members. We all had a great time. 2 hour wait to go on each ride was a little dissapointing, but I did enjoy watching the videos they played, during one of the waits.

I decided to book a room here as part of my kid's birthday celebration. We were going to the Pirates Dinner Adventure that night, and heading to Knott's the next day, as we have season passes. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom, which was perfect for my boyfriend, who's in a wheelchair. The amenities were decent, only drawback was that the accessible room was a single king bed option with a rollaway bed, instead of a double queen-but again, the room was spacious so it wasn't really a problem. Plus, the price was great (comparable to some other theme park and resorts-looking at you, Disneyland.) Great drinks at the bar. I'll definitely be staying here again for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! I am thrilled to learn that you and enjoyed your stay and will return again the future. We appreciate your understanding of room type limitation and am thrilled that the space worked our for your family. I would assume you were in a room that ended with '11' so to continue enjoying that size space please request one of those rooms in the future (i.e. 111, 311, 411, ect) as the layout makes the room feel larger! Looking forward to your future visit! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We decided to try out the Knotts hotel this last trip.  Stayed 2 nights, had the dining package with tickets to the park. Had a great time. Everyone was friendly and helpful.  Just my wife and I with 4 small children. Staff was very patient, food at hotel Very Good. The park Always a pleasure. We'll do this trip again!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay as a Snoopy fan
Summary: As it is near the park, it is easy to access the park. I chose 1 night Snoopy room, 1 night is standard room. The room are clean, comfort and quiet.  When I stay in Snoopy room, the decoration all beautiful and suitable. Snoopy will visit 8pm every night. I am so happy to see him

Summary Heading: Okay hotel right next to the park.
Summary: This hotel is okay if you're just gonna be there for a couple nights. It's no resort to me, but it's comfortable, the rooms were clean, and the price was fine for a one night stay. The lobby is really nice, and they have a pool, restaurant and gift shop onsite. It's in an excellent location because you can literally walk from the hotel to the park entrance.   The staff at this hotel was very nice. The lady who helped us at the desk, was not only nice, but very helpful in giving us information about the park and surrounding area. We purchased items in the gift shop, and the older gentlemen who was working that day was super nice. BTW, if you want to eat ouside the hotel restaurant there are a lot of other restaurants on Beach Blvd which is only a block or two away from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review your experience! While I was pleased overall with your review I was saddened to learn that it only earned us a 3 star or 60% satisfaction rating. We are always looking to grow as a team and would benefit greatly from some more specific areas of improvement to which we could earn your loyalty. Please give me a call directly should you wish to share any specific that you would like to see or experience in the future! Thank you again for staying with us and happy New Year! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: It STUNK! Mold? Sewer? All of the above?
Summary: We paid over $180 (with a discount) for a room and breakfast. The room was on the first floor. On the way there, the stink was so bad we had to cover our noses. The room/bathroom had a mold smell to it. There was no way I would take a shower in it. When I asked about the smell, they said they would check it out. They did. And covered it with the air freshener (in the hallway). Not in the bathroom- because nothing can cover THAT smell. It was nice to be able to walk to the park. However, they were supposed to text me when the room was ready (the check-in is at 4, and we were there before that). At around 4 we decided to go and see if the room was ready- YES, it was.. I have no idea how much sooner we could have checked in IF they DID text as promised. Anyway, I seriously doubt I
Manager Response: We appreciate your business and apologize for the frustrating experience that you had with us. Reviewing the time period of your stay I believe I have pinpointed the issue causing that odor and am happy to report that it has since been resolved. I am very concerned as to which room you were in that did not a window lock as our housekeeping team has been instructed to check each room on that room and did not locate the room you are referring to. It may have been reported and fixed immediately following your stay however I want to be sure you and fellow reviews understand how serious something like that is and would be for our team. I would love an opportunity to earn back you trust being that both major frustrations, while well warranted, were isolated and have since been corrected. Please give me a call directly should you find yourself returning to our area and I would be happy to detail a reservation for you. Thank you again for staying with us and I hope to host you and your family again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids!
Summary: Very beautiful hotel! It was decorated nicely for Christmas. The staff was super friendly and always wished us well on our way out the door. We were acknowledged by multiple staff members of all job titles and each one seemed genuinely happy to see us and to work there. Snoopy was a total bonus. My kids loved him. I even snagged a picture with him by the Christmas tree. The gentleman in the gift shop was friendly too. Our room was very nice. We had a view of the pool and it was breathtaking at sunset. We had a baby in the room next to us and couldn't hear a peep. The only way I knew was when I opened my door at the same time they opened theirs and I heard him/her crying. Nice! No wonder we slept so good. The location of the hotel was great. We were close to everything including

I booked this room through Groupon. I must say that I was satisfied with what I got. I went on this trip with my 6 yo daughter so I chose the one queen bed room. It was small but perfectly fine for us. We had an early flight and arrived at the hotel just before 11am. I wasn't expecting to be able to check-in that early, but they easily accomodated us. I was grateful for that because I was able to unpack my stuff and only had to carry what I needed for the day in my backpack. I was given several "Kids eat Free at Lunch/Dinner" coupons for the Amber Waves restaurant, so I took advantage of that and had 2 lunches there. The pizza was pretty good. The kid's pizza was the same size as the adult personal pizza!  The room was clean other than some minor mold in the crevices of the

1x Adult, 1x Child (8) Ultimate Package 2x nites 484.16 USD. Check in 11/21/2015  Okay so we arrived with handful of luggage and chid in tow after 0900. Hotel seemed to be bustling with holiday makers making their way to KBFTP, kids everywhere, people checking in/out and people walking through to Amberwaves Restaurant. In fact, it was quite exciting watching, as this would be us once we checked in.  We were met by Emery I think his name was, who was pleasant, cheerful and provided lots of information at check in. I thought his manner & professionalism was fantastic. I expected to store our luggage for the day and then go to Knotts Berry Farm for the day while our room was being cleaned. Much to our surprise, there was no need to leave our luggage in storage for the day as Emery

Summary Heading: If you're going to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: Stayed one night at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel and it is perfectly adequate for a night or two.  If you're not a points/miles collector, don't care about loyalty programs, or won't miss a mini fridge then this hotel will suit your needs.  It is a very easy walk to Knott's Berry Farm and the hotel even has a free shuttle to Disneyland.  The pool and splash pad area looked great for providing a distraction for kids.  The best part about this hotel is the staff.  Every staff member that I spoke with was very nice, helpful, and guest focused.  We were part of a luncheon in a ballroom and the banquet staff was very good also.  The only hiccup was a little confusion/making up of the fly rules regarding the hours of food service at the Amber Waves restaurant. Room guide indicated

The staff was very accommodating for both late check in and for attempting to put me close to my sisters room.   The room was clean other than some minor mold in the crevices of the bathtub . Everything else was clean, no bugs or nothing like that.   WiFi was decent, but I didn't use it much, since I wasn't there much.  Plenty of towels given, 4 big ones, several smaller ones and washcloths. I had a 2 queen bed room, 4 pillows on each bed and comfy bed linens. Air conditioning/ heating system worked great.  No refrigerator or microwave, but there is a hairdryer and coffee maker complete with glassware. Watch out for the 4 dollar water, if you don't read the tag, you might think it's free. Cheaper to walk down to the Valero or 7-11, for drinks or just get some free ice and let it

Room was clean and very quiet. Linens good, shower needed an upgrade. Staff very helpful about nearby places to visit. Close to shops & restaurants. We got there earlier than scheduled, but our room was available,so they let us check in early.

Summary Heading: Nice stay - just the resort is kind of missing
Summary: The people in the hotel are very friendly and the hotel itself is OK as well. It is not the newest one and could get an upgrade at least for the price they normally charge. What they call resort is an outdoor pool and a old baskatball court. I got a great deal via Hotwire and was really happy with my stay. The only thing I did not like was the wireless reception. Parking was free for hotel guests and you always found a good parking spot. This may be different during summer season. If you get a good price I really can recommend to stay there, for the regular price I think it is a little overpriced.

Walking down the hall to our room, it smelled like wet dog. Phew.   We had asked for a room overlooking the amusement park, was given a room on the other side of the hotel. Upon calling the front desk, she said there are no king rooms on that side of the hotel. Did not offer a queen, or some other alternative.  The room had stains on the carpet and the curtains, and mold in the bathroom (see photos.) My husband's company uses this hotel often, when they send their employees for training nearby.  They had paid for the room, so i didn't want to make a stink by calling to complain. I just wore my shower shoes and sprayed everything with disenfectant. But, it went steeply downhill from there...  We were only staying three nights, so in the interest of conservation, i opted to skip
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review your experience. I was very disappointed to learn that you were disrespected by one of our employees in the way that you describe. Cleanliness issues in the room are unacceptable however poor service, language barrier or not, is even worse. I would like an opportunity to speak to that employee personally however I need some more information so that I can research who cleaned that room on that particular day. If you are interested in helping us correct that behavioral issue please contact me directly. Thank you again for your business and I hope to have a chance to earn back your loyalty in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: The hotel offered a special military/veteran discount for a few weeks in honor of Veterans Day. We did not notice this until after we made the reservation through the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel website. When we arrived, they said that they would not honor this discount as advertised. It is upsetting to see companies say they are doing things to help the troops and meanwhile, they do not stay true to their word. On a positive note, the hotel is nice and is a perfect location if you plan on visiting Knott's Berry Farm.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us in November and reviewing your experience. While I can understand how this would be frustrating for you, we take great pride in our dedication to our troops. I cannot imagine a situation where you had a direct booking that was not a package (as clearly marked on our website in multiple locations) that we would not transfer to a Military discount. This is extremely common throughout this time of year as Knott’s offers hundreds of thousands of dollars in discounted services and amenities to our troops each year around this time.  I am happy to discuss this matter with you directly to learn more about your specific situation however I will not accept such a heinous and unfair accusation that we do not stand by our commitment to our troops. Feel free to visit our website KnottsHotel.com where you will find all the information pertaining to our military discount program. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: I guess we should have asked for the snoopy room? our room was old and the bathroom was ugly and culk was peeling, there was something on the toilet seat, thank goodness for Clorox wipes. I felt yucky all night

My wife and I had booked a 3 night stay at Christmas but found out later that the Park is closed Christmas Day. So I called to reschedule and although New Years Eve and New Years Day were booked solid, Michael, Knott's Berry Farm's Resort Revenue Manager released one of their reserve rooms to allow my wife and I to relax for a few days at the Farm and celebrate my wife's 55th Birthday and decompress after losing my mother to a long term illness. Thank you again Michael, you are a champion. I will post another review after the trip next month.

We arrived later in the evening and was greeted by a friendly front desk agent.  We were hoping to upgrade our room, the hotel was completely sold out and the manager and agent did try to accommodate our request...unfortunately we were not able to.  I was impressed by efforts to assist us.  The hotel was busy, but very well ran.  Our room was comfy, beds were great.  Free shuttle to Disney, and right next door to Knotts Berry Farm!  Overall a great stay!!

Check in took about 20 mins with counter fully staffed, the room carpet was very sticky feeling (kept shoes on) carpet needs to be replaced with wood or tile for more sanitary room. This is caused by the water from the pool being tracked in from wet persons. Other than the floor the room was average.

We just returned from a 5 day stay at the hotel and really enjoyed our time.   The location was great.  The pool and hot tub were warm and inviting as well.  The staff at the resort were helpful and friendly and I really appreciated having free wifi.    My husband and I forgot our jackets in the closet and didn't realize until about 2 weeks later.  We called the hotel and they had our jackets and mailed them home to us in Canada - that was over and above in our opinion.    I had only 2 complaints the first was that there was no fridge in the room.  We had Mrs. Knott's chicken dinner and had to throw our left overs away and would have loved to have them the next day.   The other is no continental breakfast - it enables you to get on with your day really quickly and economically.

Loved my stay at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel! The staff are all excellent at what they do! The rooms are great, and clean, the beds are comfy. Whatever you need is provided downstairs, there's a great place to eat and a gift shop with little items in case you forgot to pack something. The pool is beautiful, with a fun water feature for the kids. If you have a season pass, or are a return visitor the room rates are discounted which is awesome! Overall I loved my stay at this hotel and will be coming back!

Nice room. Third bed was made up as soon as we asked and was very comfortable for a 12 year old. We found the front desk staff Very friendly and helpful. The property is in a perfect situation for walking to the theme park. Our only negative is that the pool was literally freezing and that would certainly put us off staying longer.

Reserved two rooms at camp snoopy. No bell hop to help with luggage. I was given a cart and had to give my ID. Rooms are small and no refrigerator or microwave in sight. Paid another $20 for a fridge. Our room was not very clean. Brown speckles on the bathroom wall made me wonder ?  No coffee or drinks in the lobby, which was badly needed. Called down to the front desk six times and got no answer. We had to call and order our own electric wheelchair because guest services is almost non existent. I guess I just expected more from a resort hotel associated with knotts berry farm.  Very disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to leave a review. I am extremely disappointed to learn that you had such an unusual experience with us in October. Virtually every element of your review is incorrect as to what we offer and what you should have been provided so I can certainly imagine your frustration. To clarify what countless loyal guests experience during every visit; we do offer a concierge service for luggage and service calls like rentals and reservations. The ID is only asked for when a guest declines that complimentary service. We also offer complimentary coffee in the lobby between 6am and 11am daily. Our Front Desk is staffed 24 hours a day and we employ a specific telephone operator 16 hours a day to ensure that no calls wait more than three rings.
