It is clear that you did not experience the actual Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel product which is extremely disappointing. Please contact me directly if your travels find you back in our area as I would love an opportunity to earn back your trust. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel really goes out of its way to make it a fun family adventure for the kids. The packages are very reasonably priced and the visit from Snoopy both at night and at breakfast made the kids day. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel, the staff, and the overall experience.

Summary Heading: Good value, great customer service, nice little trip!
Summary: Review of Knotts Berry Farm Hotel  We checked in on a Tuesday for this trip. We planned a stay of four nights for our fifth anniversary.  First off from the outside, you can tell it's an older hotel. But, it looks clean and the grounds are nicely kept. The lobby appears to have been renovated and there was about five front desk associates waiting to help. I wish I could remember the gentleman who checked us in, because he was very friendly and helpful with questions about the area and things to do.   Second...I locked both room keys in the room and he was quick about helping me with that too (I'm still suffering from preggo brain 11 months later).   The room  The room I booked for our stay was a single king room. The room isn't large by any means but it's adequate and it's to

I visit SoCal every October to visit one of the Theme Parks Haunt Event. Usually it's Knott's Scary Farm and so we always stay at the Knott's resort for convenience. Nothing fancy about this hotel. It get the job done. The rooms are clean, service is always nice, and I never have issues with this place. On my recent travel I had 4 rooms booked and the reception was nice enough to only charge me for one car instead of the 4 cars that I had. Saved us a few bucks. The hotel is located about 4-5 miles from Disneyland and I think there is a shuttle that is offered, but we never use it. The hotel recently went under a bit of renovations so it is a bit nicer, but not to noticeable.

Summary Heading: Close to Knotts Berry Farm and Disney
Summary: The main reason we came to the Anaheim area was to go to Disney. However, hotels in the area can be a bit pricey, so we chose to stay a ways away. This hotel was definitely worth the price. The rooms are a bit small, but they're comfortable and convenient. It's on property for Knotts Berry Farm and there's a shuttle to take you to the main entrance. There is also a shuttle that takes you to Disney so you don't have to pay for parking there. If you are choosing to take the Disney shuttle, sign up with the concierge early because his slots fill up fast!  There is a restaurant/bar on the lower level of the hotel. If you go around Halloween, it's decorated in spiderwebs and other fun decorations, they didn't skimp! They also offer room service if you don't want to venture out around

We stayed in this hotel twice, lovely pool facilities very friendly staff with nice clean rooms. Ideal for visiting Knotts Berry Farm Amusement Park where there is lots to see & do, especially in October when the Haunt takes over the park.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Beautiful and large rooms with a wet bar. The room was very clean and in great condition. Very friendly and helpful staff and a good breakfast buffet.  We booked a package deal that included the room, admission to Knot's Berry Farm, parking and a breakfast buffet for two. We will definitely stay there the next time we are in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your willingness to return in the future. There is no greater compliment then loyalty and we look forward to getting to know your family in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Visited with another couple/family to check out Knott's Scary Farm.  That was great fun.  The hotel itself is ok, and the location can't be beat.  The room we had was well worn and could use some updating.  It was good enough though.  We did have some phantom room charges which were removed once contested.  We would stay here again given the location.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and reviewing your experience. While I appreciate your potential return I am saddened to learn that the room you were staying in had a tired feel. We are working diligently on preventative maintenance plans to refresh what I feel is a property with great potential. Being that we recognize the age of the building, we owe it to our guests to focus on these issues to provide a consistently fresh and clean environment. I feel confident that a return visit will leave you with more than a positive location perception but an overall positive experience! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We just returned from Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel and we were pleased with the property. By pleased I mean that we weren't turned off, we weren't displeased, but we weren't totally enthusiastic or ready to go and recommend the experience to everyone either. We were... pleased.  We arrived at KBFRH for a Saturday to Tuesday stay with our 9 yo and 7 yo. The rates are at a little premium because of the proximity to KBF and Soak City across the street. We were very happy with the short walk to both parks. This is a big plus on weekends with withering heat like this last one, especially if you have kids.  Check in was okay. There could have certainly been more people at the front desk helping, but the wait for me was only 10 minutes in line, not quick, but not unbearably slow. As
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our property and for taking the time to leave such a detailed review. Let me begin by informing you that I enjoyed your review thoroughly due to the interesting and often accurate perception of management. As you stated, we take great pride in our ability to correct the minor frustrations that guests may have from the undeniable age of our property. With that being said we are also committed to preventative maintenance plans that help update our rooms to maintain a fresh and clean feeling throughout the property. There are several areas that we hope to make large strides in as it related to ‘value added’ features in our pool and activities areas however you were accurate about the rate sensitivity; if we provide upgrades all at once our rates would be affected whereas a gradual development of our property results in little to no rate growth which is our goal within this market. With that being said, AC issues are unacceptable and should be noted by housekeeping and corrected by maintenance prior to guest arrival. I am thrilled that you enjoyed the breakfast because I agree that the value of that buffet is unbeatable! I appreciate your outlook on our property and hope that you stay with us again as we continue to add value to the guest experience as many loyal guests have noticed over the years. Please feel free to contact me if you are interested in discussing the stay further! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: During our most recent trip to the Knott's Berry Farm and Hotel in October (6 - 11) we were made to feel at home thanks to the entire Hotel staff. But specifically our check in and check out guest receptionist Ellery made us feel welcome and at home. He is always doing little things to make us know we are appreciated as customers every time we visit. Ellery is one of the main reasons we continue to return to the Hotel instead of using a "good neighbor" hotel. I personally look forward to seeing him every time we visit. The park itself at Halloween time is great. It is decorated family appropriate in the daytime and at night it is truly turned into a scary place. In the hotel lobby in the evening were scary creatures wondering around scaring people and just generally creeping

Went with my wife and 8 year old son. Hotel was amazing got a ticket to both parks and hotel stay for three nights for less than on day in Disney land. Rides are amazing, park was clean, staff was incredibly helpful and if you wait tell closing you can talk with all the upper management at the exit gate. Great personal touch.. also if your gonna stay all day invest in the food pass, absolutely worth the $... plenty of parking, and a good quiet neighborhood

I made a reservation 1 day before the front desk guarantee a 4pm check in upon arrival that was not the case had to stand in the lobby for an hour  The lady at front desk was however very nice and professional  Thank you knotts for wasting my time  The room was nice had a great view non smoking is already a plus
Manager Response: I see that you were kind enough to share your experience on multiple channels so I wanted to be sure to answer both as well to be sure we have a chance to communicate if you are interested. I am sorry to learn of your delayed check-in. I reviewed our management report and do not see any notation of a check-in that was so far past our guaranteed time so I would love an opportunity to speak with you directly so that I can correct both the check-in hold up and lack of communication. From viewing your photo I imagine that you were aware of the ‘Scary Farm’ event which did admittedly back up our housekeeping team but that is no excuse from breaking our promise. I apologize for the inconvenience and hope we have an opportunity to earn back your trust in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed two nights on a recent trip to Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland. It was a nice place to stay for a good price. Walking distance to  the park is a good feature. Clean and well kept. Nice pool area, but pool is not heated.

Great facilities and good location for LA but  rooms are really requiring refurbishment  and new air conditioning. Good restaurants and shops in the park and lobby and pool are good.  Booked trips with the Concierge and these were well organised and great value for money.  Would go back if rooms were improved.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review our property. While I am thrilled that your experience overall was positive I can completely understand your feeling on the ‘tired’ feeling of the room. We are committed to our preventative maintenance plans to ensure our rooms stay fresh, however I have observed some rooms that are in need of attention post guest check-out meaning that unfortunately other guests have experienced similar defects. I feel confident that we have implemented procedures to correct these issues so that the positive service you experienced matches our tangible product in every room, every time. I hope that we have an opportunity to earn your loyalty. If you are interested in discussed the specifics of the room please feel free to contact me at a time that is convenient for you. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We have three children 4,5 and 6. This is the best resort and theme park for this age. Excellent service, the snoopy rooms are great, excellent value. The kids still talk about snoopy tucking them in. Great affordable food, and happy hours. Short queues for lines at the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for providing such a nice review for our future guests. We are very proud of our property and get excited when our passion results in a positive family experience. We look forward to hosting your family again in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We booked one night with package to park tickets.  It is an older hotel, but it is kept up pretty well.  Their pool area is very nice and has a fun water structure for the kids. It is a short walk to the part from the hotel which to me is probably the best part.  I don't like dealing with amusement park parking.  It isn't overly fancy or have an great amenities, but it was worth the price and I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Older, Clean Hotel in Walking Distance to Knott's Park. Cheaper Alternative to Disney.
Summary: We used the Knott's Hotel website to book a 2-night hotel stay plus 1-day package to the Knott's Berry Farm theme park. The package included 2 breakfast buffets and 1 limited-menu dinner (the dinner did not include drinks or tip). The total was about what we would have spent to spend one day at Disneyland/CA Adventure and pay for 2 meals. We thought the Knott's package was a great value.  Anyway, the Knott's hotel (and the park) are aging and don't look like they've been through a major renovation in many years. I think most of the money is going to new rides at the park. But I hope they DON'T spend the money to renovate because they'd have to raise prices and likely lose business.  Instead, you get a clean hotel with some good amenities at a very reasonable price.  Nice pool,

My partner and I stayed at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel for a week in September 2015. We used it as a base to explore LA and its suburbs - it was excellently located for this purpose.  The hotel itself is a little dated and the facilities are relatively basic - it could definitely benefit from some modernisation. It was however clean and the staff were helpful.   I wouldn't stay again but would recommend to couples and families travelling to LA on a budget.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review your experience. While I was disappointed to learn that we didn’t earn your loyalty I was pleased that this is a property you would recommend moving forward. We take great pride in our ability to adapt and grow our brand both in tangible amenities and guest service. I feel confident that the continued renovations and added value elements would help our property develop into a place where you can call home when traveling to our area in the future. In the coming year there will be continued renovations to guest rooms, the courtyard, and our restaurant Amber Waves. Please let me know if you would like to come visit us again as I would be happy to personally inspect your room to be sure it is up to my cleanliness and maintenance standards. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We have been coming here for over 10 years during October for the haunted Dreams Package and Knotts Scary farm. there have been years when the hotel has been scarier then the haunt at the park  we have been seeing improvements in cleanliness,employees and the overall operation of the hotel for the past few years. THIS year they seem to have perfected it. Check in was a breeze with 3 employees and a VERY active manager at the front counter( Stephen ) . Despite the fact that a large group staying had decided to stay over again..we even were able to get our room an hour early!  Our room was clean...VERY clean with lots of towels great HOT water pressure. Room was quiet! despite the fact that a lot of families with young children stay here.I was Impressed with decorating in The Pre

This hotel is a good pick if you're going to Knotts Berry Farm. It's a few steps away from the main entrance. It has a great outdoor pool area too. Snoopy ran around the lobby at night with everyone.  It made it very fun. This is an older hotel and they've done some renovations. It could use more but was doable. There are no fridges or microwaves in rooms.

This will be our 4th year doing a Haunt Package deal.  We are coming from Nevada and going to the haunt Oct 11 a Sunday as it is my daughter in laws birthday. There is 4 of us , including my son and daughter who has handicaps.  We have always gotten a clean room. We usually arrive around 1pm and every time we were fortunate enough to have a room ready. With my daughter putting up with about 5 hours of travel, this has been a blessing and we hope that this will be the case this trip, but with the hotel being pretty full on a Sat night we don't expect to get in that early on a Sunday. Last time we had a room on the bottom that opened to the courtyard, hoping we get to have one of those this time,  The buffet food has always been good. And love that they do have oatmeal on the

This hotel is tired. It's needs a major revamp. No fridge in the room, loud aircon units, old bathrooms, tiny, stuffy rooms, lumpy pillows. Wow! Can't you at least supply good pillows?   This is supposed to be a family friendly hotel, yet the pool is too deep for kids under 3 foot tall! My son couldn't play in the pool as there was no shallow end so what does this mean for parents! No relaxation time! What's the point.   The Disney Shuttle was totally useless. Couldn't accommodate for the drop offs and pick ups we needed.   Oh that's right, of course, this hotel is awesome because of snoopy! Who is Snoopy?? Really???   The location is the pits, no shops nearby apart from the rip off souvenir stores on the walk to Knottsberry Farm. Stay in Anaheim.   This place is very overrated!

A Priceline bid placed us at this hotel. The lobby and exterior looked like it would be nice hotel but I couldn't wait for my family to check out the next morning. The room stunk of old toilet, the AC was loud and had a weird smell, everything was just dirty!! Never again!!!

I made reservations for the Classic Package.  We got: -4 tickets to Knotts  -overnight stay at the hotel -kids eat free with adult entree purchase -free buffet for 4 at Amber Waves -Snoopy tucks in kids -2 plush Snoopys when we got to the hotel room -A LOT OF FUN!!!!  My kids loved the whole experience.  My husband and I were very pleased with all of the amenities and overall ambiance for the children.  We stayed in one of the Camp Snoopy rooms.  They do a great job of making the kids feel welcomed and special!

Lovely rooms plenty of room. Booked disabled room by email with hotel and another room adjoining and the rooms were perfect. Directly next to Knotts Berry Theme Park and good discount given by Hotel. Lovely shopping market leading to park.  Only 6 miles from Disney with transfer service.  A really lovely hotel with lovely staff from reception to housekeeping and maintenance staff. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.  The hotel is Snoopy themed so be prepared to have him pop up anywhere in hotel.

So. Let me start by saying the hotel itself was fine. Room was clean and the pool area was very nice. The parking lot is not safe. Between 11pm and 6 am on Sept. 19, 2015 the 3rd row seating was stolen from my Yukon.  I was parked at the rear main entrance to the hotel and my Yukon was on the surveillance cameras yet still was broken into. There is a false sense of security when you enter the facility because there is a guard asking why you are there, found to be pointless. The staff although attentive to the situation was some what carefree about the entire situation. I was not the only one effected. There was a Escalde parked next to me that also had the same break in. They did call the police so a report could be obtain for insurance purposes. Overall I am very disappointed

Summary Heading: Don't count on their advertised "Free Disneyland Shuttle"
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. It was clean. The staff was very friendly. No refrigerator or microwave in the room. Low price. Free parking and wifi. Took the Disneyland shuttle a few days and that was great, except it always left late. We would rush down to be on time, only to sit for 10 to 15 minutes waiting for the late people. Wednesday night, when I tried to schedule the Disneyland shuttle for Thursday, at first the phone just rang and rang. I tried a half hour later and they said the next day shuttles were all full except for the one that left an hour before Disneyland closed. Fortunately we had our car and drove in, but had to pay parking and took way longer. The hotel shouldn't advertise a free Disneyland shuttle if they aren't actually going to provide
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review your experience. I am sorry to learn that you were not able to book a spot on our complimentary Disneyland shuttle for one of your repeated trips. While I can understand how this was an inconvenience, it is unfortunate that your ‘clean’ room and ‘friendly staff’ interactions were not strong enough elements to earn us higher than a 2 star review as those elements are our most important priority. To explain the reasoning for not adding trips as the schedule fills up, it takes about 15-25 minutes depending on traffic to get to Disneyland and that same amount of time to return. Our property (as well as our friends at the neighboring Radisson that you mention) all work off the same contract with Anaheim that control our shuttles frequency so while your advice may be heralded by future travelers I fear that they may have a similar experience at any local property who offers this complimentary service. Thank you again for writing your review and I hope that you find a perfect property to meet all of your needs for your future visits!  Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: The location of this hotel really cannot top any other for Knott's Berry Farm.  It's a quick walk but available parking was pretty disappointing for a paying guest.  We were way way out in that parking lot and we arrived at nearly 8am. Check in was easy and I was told that if our room was available earlier than the 3 pm check in, they would text me.  At 4 pm we finally went to check to see if our room was ready and I asked why we never got a text earlier knowing we were waiting with our grandkids to have a rest period.  He was not able to give me an answer. You get docked for not being able to answer my question.  Elevator waits were time consuming but after all, we were there at the beginning of summer for most kids. A/C worked well but oh my goodness, the bathtub drain was a
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and for taking the time to review your experience. I am happy to learn that your staff interactions were mostly positive however it is unfortunate that you were not able to benefit from our complimentary early arrival text system. Being that Trip Advisor uses aliases, I am unable to research your room but I assure you had a member of leadership or maintenance been aware of the drain issue, it would have been resolved before that second shower. We have management and maintenance on-site 18 hours per day and slow drains are usually a very easy fix. I would imagine the issue has been resolved since your review was left last week but if you are interested in following up with your room number is would give us an opportunity to guarantee that a similar issue does not affect a guest in the future. Thank you again for staying with us and I hope we have a chance to earn your business in the future! Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: snoopy came over to tuck the kids in BED ...they LOVED IT ... cant wait to go back Amazing Hotel ,pool was great and the breakfast was yummy loved the short walk to Knott's.... thank you all for a great weekend the Schweitzer family

To visit Knott’s Berry Farm I thought it would be a good idea to stay at the Knott’s Berry Farm hotel too. I was glad I made this decision. If you go to their hotel website you will find that they offer packaged deals. Before I describe the deals let me talk about the hotel first. We found the hotel not fancy but above average. All the normal amenities were provided (soap, shampoo, iron, hair dryer, room service, etc.). What we found to be above and beyond for a theme park hotel in this southern California area was that the parking and wifi was free! As for the customer service we found everyone to be friendly, helpful, and professional. The park itself was maybe a 4 minute walk. As for the packaged deals we bought the Bed and Breakfast. This included the room, one day park

Very quick and easy check in. Lovely hotel and theme park was amazing. Room was very clean and spacious.  Short walk to theme park with plenty of eating places with lots of choice. Nice bar to relax in and finish the night off with a couple of cocktails.

The location was perfect. Within walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm. The room itself was good. It was clean, had double beds, flat screen tv , free wifi, and loved the pool. It has not only a pool but a hottub and a splash park area for the kiddo's. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby.  Was a wonderful weekend, would stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights and although the room was nothing special, it was ok & clean, which is the main thing! There is no fridge, which seems 2 come in all other American hotels as standard! The restaurant is rubbish & a waste of money! We were told there were no potatoes, no coors light! The chicken was  dry & the rice over cooked, we won't b visiting again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and reviewing your experience. I am glad to learn that your guest room was up to your standards however your account of the restaurant is both shocking and upsetting.  Like any high volume restaurant, I have certainly heard of ingredients or certain beverage brands being out but there is no excuse for poorly prepared meals as it seems like you experienced. I know that you are not interested in returning based on that experience but I assure you this is nothing that you should expect from our brand.  I hope that you reconsider and we have an opportunity to earn back your trust in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Perfect for Knotts Berry Theme Park
Summary: Got a discounted room from Experian to take my kids to Knotts Berry theme park.  First time visiting hotel. 4 of us fit comfortably in the basic double queen room. Hotel room was clean and our beds comfortable. Maid service was great. The rooms were quiet and I did not hear any noise from adjoining rooms. Hotel is modern enough and probably had some upgrades. Staff was very friendly. I did not eat at hotel as prices were a bit high, but this location is close to a lot of eateries on the main street, as well as close to Buerna Park's downtown that has a 18plex theater, restaurants and even a Walmart if you plan to stay long or forgot to bring something. I would definitely stay here again when visiting the theme park.  Dedicated walkway right to the theme park which was wonderful!

We decided to spend the weekend at Knotts for my son's birthday! Totally worth it. We got the supreme package in a Snoopy room! My son hasn't stop expressing how lucky he is & how he's going to remember his visit. Totally recommend to stay.

My five year old and I stayed here for four nights.  I thought it was a good central location for all the attractions and the price was good.  The first two nights were uneventful, but the third night (at 2:30am) the next door neighbor tried to get in our lock off and then the phone rang....but no one was there.  "That was scary", said the five year old.   The next night, again at 2:30am, two security guards were in the hall asking my other neighbor "What kind of movie you making?".  Well!  The hotel itself was okay.  The beds were fine.  It was clean, just old.  The pool was awesome.  Breakfast was exactly the same everyday, so I wouldn't buy the prepaid meals again.  My kid couldn't hang at Disneyland, but I got to watch the fireworks from our room.  Snoopy was the best!

I think it was a very good deal, staff were nice and they have a nice pool and spa area. Their prices to Knott's Park and Soak City are the cheapest, so wait and buy your tickets at the reception desk.  They also have free shuttle to Disneyland which is a big plus. I do wish the rooms had a fridge.  I noticed they were doing some updating in some areas which is good, because some look outdated.

The only reason they are getting 2 stars instead of one is because of their customer service. The hotel is old and the room was stained. The beds were hard but at least clean. At first site you walk into the lobby and we thought this was going to be a great hotel because the lobby is very modern and clean. Our biggest issue was that there was zero warm water in the morning. 2 of us took freezing cold showers and I mean FREEZING! Before the third person got in I called down to the lobby and they said they would have maintenance check on it. This was around 6:40am. Then at 6:50 we realized the refrigerator that we ordered, and cost 20.00, did not work so the items we had placed in there the night before were room temperature. So I called back to the lobby to get another one and

We stayed at the hotel for two nights with one day at the park. After checking in around midnight we went straight to bed, the beds were OK, the room itself was clean. The bathroom was a bit dingy, and there was some mold in two spots, showing it needed a good scrubbing. The weather was humid so when we turned off the AC in the room it did get a bit musty. The staff was friendly and courteous. Walking to and from the park and dining options was easy. I would stay here again.

The shuttle service was so convenient, made our shuttle reservations for two days four people the soonest we checked in,the shuttle can get full quickly I heard.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  The kids loved the pool. We also got to meet snoopy at the lobby before heading to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Best price for the park ticket
Summary: I checked several websites and came to the front desk b/c they offered the best price $39 (adult). There are two special gates at the park (far right) for entrance with this hotel pass and a year pass which is very convenient. Other than that, the hotel is average.

Stayed for four nights with my daughter and wish it was longer. Friendly staff. Good restaurant with wide selection of food on offer. Free shuttle to Disneyland, great pool and right next door is the Knott's Berry Farm theme park with plenty of Rollercoaster thrills. The only downside was the lack of a fridge but partly remedied by the ability to get ice at any time on each floor. Good gym available and for those with kids Snoopy visits the lobby twice a day.

Summary Heading: Most amazing staff, super place to stay
Summary: This hotel is right next to Knott's Berry Farm.  The staff are the best that I have ever experienced.  They are friendly, efficient, helpful.  Make me feel at home every time.  Rooms are comfortable and clean, king, double queen, and oversized rooms are nice and big.  snoopy rooms are awesome!  Snoopy is a huge draw for us, he is present in the hotel several times a day, and will visit your room at night, if you have a snoopy room!  We stay here every year, and always wish to stay longer!  I strongly recommend this hotel, and Knott's Berry Farm!  Better than Disney!

Stayed here for four nights on a holiday with my children. Good location with plenty of places to visit reasonably close by. Visited the park the hotel is part of and was not disappointed. Hotel staff were all very friendly, rooms were spacious and clean. Bathroom was well equipped. Beds were very comfortable. Would certainly visit again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not much time spent there
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at knotts berry farm, although we didn't spend too much time there as we were so busy. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. Staff were very friendly, we had a complimentary brownie delivered to our room as we were on honeymoon! It is quite far away from the centre of LA and Hollywood, if we didn't have a rented car, we would have struggled to get everywhere we wanted to.

I stayed at the resort with my family while in town on business. The amenities are great and provided an excellent time for the kids while I conducted business by day. At evening/night, I was able to enjoy the spa, sauna, steam room, basketball courts, and other fabulous amenities. Was really surprised for the star level rating the resort received. The rooms/decor are a little outdated, but the quality customer service of the staff (inc. Snoopy himself) made it worthwhile. On the downside, perhaps consider switching from chlorine in the pool/spa to salt water like other resorts or at least ease up on the amount of chlorine used. At times, I felt like I was in a washer machine with a full load of white clothes!

All good at the Farm, on arrival Jesus on reception was fantastic, really made us feel at home and knew his stuff. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable and the maid Smitty was really very nice, I'd stay again if we were travelling through.

Fantastic experience -- we got the "Supreme Room" deal for $200 and with it received: night's stay, 2 dinners, 2 breakfasts, 2 park admittance, free parking.  At check in, the guy offered us three tickets to that night's Angels game; someone had turned them in earlier! It was a wonderful surprise.  The Amber Waves restaurant was average, but the service very good. And they do offer maple syrup w/ breakfast, so that's a bonus.   Rooms were large and clean. Pool was fun. Park literally next door, and not crowded since it was late August.   Overall, one of the best deals and experiences I have had in recent memory. Really impressed by the place, the service, the overall experience. Well done.

Worst experience ever!!!  The online registration is completely (purposefully?) misleading. You think you're getting park tickets for each day you stay, only to find out that it's only one day of tickets regardless of how many tickets you buy. FIX THAT!  Then to make matters worse, the hotel manager, you know who you are... most unaccommodating hotel manager I've ever met.  Your smug "I'm going to screw this family so bad" face just made things worse.  Hotel needs some work. Everything about it screams 1970. Do some renovation! AND clean the rooms while you're at it.  We left the hotel early to find a place that actually want to be hospitable. Wasn't hard to find a few close by.

Everyone at the Hotel was very friendly and helpful,  Great value  . Family of 4 a night at the Hotel and entrance to the park for 300 bucks...Great deal.  all the hotel and park staff were very friendly and helpful.  The is plenty to do in the area.  The rooms were clean and up to date.  I also found the rooms to be nicely sized

Dirty, outdated, beds are terrible, no cream or sugar with coffee, no fridge or microwave The staff is friendly but it's just not enough, The stains on the floor or grow me out they look like bloodstains and the paint job is pretty pathetic the curtains look like they're from the 50s and my back pain from the mattresses is overwhelming

Pros: -staff was friendly at check-in -walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm and the water park across the street, You can leave your car in hotel lot and walk down the sidewalk to main entrance. -offer hotel and park packages that are a decent savings. -breakfast in lobby restaurant available in some packages. -just a few miles from Disneyland with a shuttle if desired. -outdoor pool is large. There is also a sprinkler play area for kids; big hot tub for adults. Cons: Room was only moderately sized with few outlets for charging devices.  Charging stations are a modern necessity. -Breakfast in the restaurant was very basic and mediocre.  Better breakfast can be had at McDonald's. -Hotel was hosting some sort of junior cheerleader competition during our stay and it was

We have known about Knotts Berry Farm since the 1930's when they were a roadside stand. My family came there regularly to buy berries.    My grandmother brought us there were when I was 8 to visit the replica of the Liberty Building and bell.  We ate at the restaurant and had a great time.  I returned in the 1980's with my husband prior to having children.  I have not been back since.  My mother has had to come stay with me prior to surgery and I needed to return for business with the YMCA.  I choose to make it a vacation for my two children, a girlfriend of one of my boys and my mother.  We have a great time!  The room, people, food and experience were terrific.  My mom needs help because of a bad hip and they went above and beyond to assist with the room and getting around.

Hotel was very nice and a great price if you were doing a package deal including a theme park.  Just staying with no package deal, nice pool and splash pad for the kids.  Also a basketball court and tennis court.  Large self laundry which I personally appreciated.  Very clean room and they offer oversized rooms for families

Stayed here in June for 10 days, staff were extremely helpful throughout the whole stay. Hotel in general is in a good location right by the Knott's Berry Farm theme park, literally a few minutes walk down the street and Disneyland is about a 20 minute drive. I would suggest hiring a car if staying here though unless you intend on just staying at the hotel, although the hotel have a shuttle that goes to Disneyland. But Hollywood is about a 45 minute drive, but well worth it! The hotel was very clean and the restaurant did great food, we didn't have breakfast included but ate there most mornings and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a few hitches with the room, the hairdryer didn't work so had to be replaced, also the coffee machine wouldn't reach to the socket behind the unit with

Earlier this year in May I and two friends travelled over from England to explore the LA area and go to a few of the parks. We settled to stay at Knotts Berry and truthfully at first we were not entirely convinced to expect much. But I can safely say that the hotel was pleasant, clean, welcoming and the customer service knocked it out the park. On my second day I came to find my headphones mangled and destroyed behind the bedside table, evidently they had a fight with the maids vacuum and lost. I explained the situation to the front desk, not really expecting much more than an apology. The manager Stephen was informed and displayed a brilliant example of customer service, offering to go out and buy some replacement headphones of an equal value. Sadly we could not get my

Big shout-out to Albert and Stephen for really making this stay perfect.   We made Knott's Berry farm our destination this trip and it was great! Hotel is clean, breakfast buffet plentiful and the pool is open late (but with a zillion families), and really a great way to spend a weekend.   As far as the park itself, all the rides are great, except the new Iron Reef - that was a really long wait for a pretty laid-back ride.   My recommendation is to stay at the hotel, and get there early with the 30 minute early admission so you don't have to wait 2 hours for the Iron reef ride. After you're done with that - then you can do all the other roller coasters which seem to move pretty quickly.

I stayed at this hotel for an extended weekend getaway. The Hotel Management made sure that everything requested ahead of time was in place. Check-in was a little congested, but I was notified within a few minutes via text when the room was ready. Bellmen helped us to the room and were very friendly. The section of the hotel we stayed in was ADORABLE! The Peanuts decor made the kids happy, and the awaiting Snoopy plush dolls were a sweet welcoming touch. The room was spotless. The housekeeping service was thorough and consistent. The kids LOVED Snoopy coming  by to tuck them in, it was a fun experience. The pool area is nice and clean. We never had trouble finding seats. The pool is large and clean. The kids loved the splash pad. I saw a menu in the pool area, but never saw a

Knott's hotel did not disappoint again this year. We have been coming here for the last 4 years and nothing changes. What you get for you money is great, the hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. I'm not talking about just the check in staff. All the staff we talked to were friendly and helpful, from the check in staff, the staff at Amber Waves, to the clean staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to people looking for a clean, friendly, reasonably priced hotel. The packages are a great deal for the money. For our family of five adults the package deal makes our hotel stay almost free!

I had an amazing time at Knotts with my family.  I was looking for an inexpensive trip to take the kids before they went back to school. I decided on Knotts because it was a good fit for the different ages (twin girls age 9 and son age 5).   The package price for a group of five was a steal.  The Knotts Berry Farm Hotel had a fast and easy check-in.  I was able to pick up the ticket as soon as we arrived.  The Hotel texted me a few hours later to let me know the room was ready.  The convenience of the location to Knotts Berry Farm was great.  The free breakfast buffet was fabulous.  The room was big and spacious.  It was just a perfect all around.  I got my money's worth and more.  I will definitely go again.

The online packages Knotts Hotel offers cant be beat. We stayed for 2 nights, vouchers for kids eat free, tickets for our family of 4 into Knotts Berry Farm including early entry. We loved the huge pool and the water jungle gym to end our day. A very short walk to entrance of Knotts. Really great experience.

Stayed for three nights at Knott's Hotel.  It was not a good experience. If I want Motel 6, I would have stayed there and saved a lot of money. I had 4 people in the room.  Two water glasses, three towels. Called management they said they usually put two glasses in the room and brought up two more glasses and a set of towels.. Really? Next day again with the two glasses and three towels, again had to call and fight thru the clerk to talk to the manager,  Again with the excuses. Next day took the free shuttle to Disneyland, the shuttle guys were nice. Got back to room late, Two glasses, three towels, did not take out trash or vacuum floor. Called manager again, forget about it. Really, no consideration here.  This place is old and need major refurbishment. The staff needs an

We spent 5 nights as a family of 4 in the hotel which is about 25 miles south of downtown LA.  The rooms are functional and clean and there's a nice bright reception area with attentive service.  There are also good facilities with a pool, gym and tennis courts.  Residents get discounts to go to the theme park.  Rooms are a little basic and walls are very thin so not great privacy. Food was OK although we tended to dine out more often and there are plenty diners etc within a mile or 2 of the hotel.   I would recommend a stay here for a reasonably priced and well run hotel.

Summary Heading: Superb experience of a quaint village in a city
Summary: Knottsberry farm hotel is close to the Disney World. It has a huge area housing a fine bakery and restaurants. Not to forget the oldest roller coaster which goes over the restaurant and souvenir shops

At Amberwaves there was always a long wait even though I could see plenty of open tables, took a very long time to be served and to get the check. There is not much of a verity on the menu, and the prices DO NOT match the food quality, for those prices the food should be so much better. The free breakfast buffet is not much better with runny eggs and dried out french toast, with rubbery bacon. IF we decide to come back, I doubt that we will eat at the hotel again, might just order in a pizza from somewhere. There are way too many places to take a family for vacation, just to be let down by the hotel food.

At first I felt the total cost of this mini vacation was a little over the top, but after experiencing the convenience of being so close to the Knott's Berry Farm Park and all the area has to offer, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  The personnel are wonderful and very helpful, the amenities available leave little if anything to desire.  We had a package deal including entrance to the park (which is right across the street), parking, breakfast and a discount on other meals.  I will note that the only negative items I can point out is that the A/C in our room was very noisy.  Basically the old window mount units with a wall mounted thermostat.  It did the job but was very noisy.  Another thing to keep in mind is that there will be a lot of "kids" doing what "kids"

My friends and I spent about 4 nights in this "resort hotel" while attending a conference in town, and at best, it could be described as a motel! This place is NOT a typical Californian resort hotel next to an amusement park. This is an old and dirty hotel in dire need of renovation, which I doubt would happen anytime soon. If you are in town for the Disneyland and cannot afford a fancier resort, just go to an average 3 star hotel for the same price and avoid waking up to a dead cockroach!

We stayed here for the holiday (fourth of July). We stayed here for two reasons. First, because we got a decent rate as a season pass holder and second, because we did not want to worry about the drive home that night.  Reason for the 3.5 is because there was mold in the shower and the tube was dirty. The mold was on the shower head and the tube seamed like there was greased in dirt not pleasant. Also it was dirty around the outside of the property.  However the rest of our visit was great. Check in was fast and easy and while our room was not ready they did text message us when it was. Free parking, pool, sauna and steam room were all nice. The restaurant was good and we were given a kids eat free voucher.

We stayed for a total of four nights.  Nice and close to Knott's theme park and the water park.  Hotel was clean and tidy. A fridge in the room would have been a big advantage.  Also the air conditioning was a bit noisy.  Pool was great and the restaurant down stairs was yum.

We took our granddaughter to Knotts and stayed at this property.  We all had a great time.  The beds and rooms were clean, waitstaff at the restaurant gave wonderful customer service and we really enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  We were very pleased to have our picture taken with snoopy at the restaurant with our own camera.  The park was a short walk away with allowed us to take a rest in the middle of the day and then back to the park.

Summary Heading: Best amusement park and hotel ever
Summary: I saved over a year to take my daughter to Disneyland. After searching numerous hotels I stumbled on Knotts Berry Farm hotel  and amusement park. After realizing I could not afford so many days near disney along with hotel I chose Knotts.   I wasted $350 going to Disney for 1 day. It was the most miserable day of our entire trip. And my child was in tears from the disaster when we left 10 hours of pure hell!    However the highlight was the Knotts Berry hotel, park, and every staff member! I have and will tell everyone I know about our experience and stay!    Every employee we encountered was so welcoming and had a smile. They seemed genuinely happy to be there and happy to accommodate us. Every part of the park was perfect! Minus the bee sting my daughter received HOWEVER she

We stayed at this hotel because we were going to knotts and try offer a good ticket/parking/hotel bundle/breakfast. It also had better reviews than other cheaper priced hotels in the area however I wasn't really impressed with anything other than the closeness to the park. The hotel itself is in need of a major facelift. Carpets were kind of gross, bathroom really old, tub looked a lil dirty. I just wasn't that impressed. It offers convenience but for the price I feel as though I might try my luck with one of the other hotels in the area near the park if I was coming back.

Next to the park, walking was great. To park your car at the hotel is expensive .  We walked into the Lobby of the hotel was greeted by Snoopy, The boys love it. The room was okay, but had mold in bath tub. The restaurant inside the hotel, is mid priced, staff not friendly. You want along time for placing order and receiving your food. Young kids in pool area running around from put to hot spa. They did not care if they landed on you. The hotel staff said parents should be out there with them, (no parents) they did not care.

After staying at a spotless hotel near Disneyland we moved to the Knotts hotel for a few nights. The grounds and staff are nice but the bathroom in our room is dirty even after a complaint. My first usage of the tub (thankfully a shower) the water was draining slow. I tried to pull the plug up and it came out to reveal a disgusting film of filth and grim and stuff hanging in the drain. In the other pictures you can see dirt that is still there after my complaint. It isn't even an area of the tub that has grout it's just not cleaned. When I complained about the health and safety dangers of the filthy drain and showed the manager the pictures I wasn't even given a dollar off my room. They just said they would snake it and clean it. If you must stay here stop at Walgreens and get

This is a great family hotel for people on a budget.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean.  It is in easy reach of many of the attractions but it can take a long time traveling because of the traffic.  However, there are attractions such as Medieval Times within walking distance and plenty of family friendly restaurants.

This hotel is clean and most of the staff are friendly and helpful. When I had a problem with collecting a piece of mail however there was one manager who was a little rude. It seems strange to put something for a guest in a safe that nobody in the building has access to outside of 9-5 hours.

Good friends of my daughter invited us to visit Knotts Berry Farm & we all stayed at this resort for three nights. We have only the best to say about the room & staff. In fact, the first day we left the room to visit the park and my daughter left her wedding ring in the room by mistake and the cleaning staff made sure to place it front and center on the table for her to see. Very trustworthy. Remember to tip your room cleaning staff, they deserve our support! Kids loved the pool & splash pad too. Amber Waves, the restaurant on site was also very great! The breakfasts were nice. We had a very yummy dinner as well. Kudos to all & thanks for making our stay wonderful.

I booked a 2 night / 2 park vacation package for my family. We stayed at the Knott's hotel. Our room was clean with a nice view of the courtyard. Breakfast was covered both days at Amber Waves. Knott's was a 5 minute walk from the hotel.   The park had lots of fun rides for my 2 year old in camp snoopy. There were cool roller coasters and a mix of family rides. There are a ton of restaurants and a mall a block away.  The park was not crowded. We didn't have to wait in line very long. Soak City is thee best water park we've been to. This vacation was far better than our Disney vacation last year... Better attractions, amazing water park, no crowds, and 1/3 of the cost of Disney.

Fun and exciting.  We stayed at the resort which is adjacent to the park (free parking when you stay at hotel). We stayed in an over-sized room as I have two adult boys.  First roll away bed was free and only $15 for second.  The room was clean.  They offered a gym, pool, basketball/tennis, steam room and more.  I would definitely stay there again.  The park was fun too.  We went on Monday and it was not busy at all.  No go pros allowed on some ride.  Overall, it was a great visit. And you get in the park 1/2 hour earlier then others (use last gates that clearly state Hotel guests (we waited in wrong line).

Visited in April 2014 (to post this review had to add different date)....Hotel is in a great Location if your visiting Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park ...and location good for other attractions too !  Staff were always happy to help ...Rooms clean & Large ...we are a family of four ,with teenage boys and the room was fine for us.. We would defiantly return

Summary Heading: FUN FUN, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF
Summary: We love Knotts Berry Farm Hotel and Chicken Restaurant, this is our second time back and we would recommend it to friends and family.  The staff is very kind and attentive.  Nice family vacation spot and at a great price...had so much fun!!

I you are going to Knott's Berry Farm theme park then this is the hotel for you. The pros are: the hotel is a few step away from the theme parks(Knott's Berry Farm and Soak City). Room is clean, front desk is friendly. Pool has water play area for small kids. Amber Waves Restaurant is on site and their food is OK. There is a small safe in the room, our is not working! The cons: room is in the small size, our room has two queen beds and not much of room around it. Our room is old, tired looking definitely needed some upgrade. There is no refrigerator or microwave which for us traveling with kids is a big minus! The room A/C is loud when it is turn on even with the fan set at constant(not much of a white noise). Bed is average and the pillows are too soft for our liking. It's an

Love this hotel, have been here many times, the rooms are very clean, food good, it's the best family hotel anywhere, I have always rated five stars at this resort, I will be coming next year and you can't beat the packages they offer to their guest I stayed on first floor at end of hall was a super clean room.....😎

Summary Heading: Large Hotel adjacent to Knotts Berry Farm but awful food
Summary: Great location for Knotts Berry farm.  Went on a trip with my son to visit the theme park and access being next door to the park is good.  After a day in the park however we went to the hotel restaurant, oh dear, it was awful. We ordered simple food, burgers and fires and milk shakes and cokes, but the waitress messed up taking the order down.  When the food came out which was about 90 minutes, yes really that long, after we ordered and the order was wrong! doh the manager was very apologetic and offered to do one of the meals for free, the waitress just kept laughing, perhaps you americans have stopped complaining? or you live with awful service in theme parks.  But when it came to paying the bill, the manager was gone and the waitress charged the full amount.  10 minutes later

Summary Heading: We loved our summer vacation trip!
Summary: We had the best experience with our trip. We pre-registered and picked up our tickets and then walked 5 minutes and BAM were at Knotts Berry Farm! While we were there I got a text from Hotel to let us know our room was ready! We got to our room pretty late and picking up our keys was fast. Our rooms were awesome, our beds were so comfortable and they even placed a rollaway bed which my 6year old fell in love with because of the comfort! The Hotel also included breakfast and it was delicious. Their swimming pool was nice and clean and they even have a little area for the kids to play. We loved our Knotts experience and we're hoping to do this again next year! Thanks Knotts Berry Farm Hotel.

Summary Heading: Best best to visit with kids
Summary: The staff was the best.  Easy pay is great for any ones budget.  great rooms,  I love taking my child here so much for them to do.  Will be back next year.  room are very clean.  only five min walk from hotel to park.

Avoid this hotel at all costs. The rooms are unsanitary and bug infested. Not somewhere I would ever bring my child back to or advise a close friend or family member to stay. There are other hotels close by, I'd advise you stay at one of those. Where you will pay the same price maybe less for a cleaner room and competent staff. We were actually able to switch rooms, and he 2nd room was worst than the 1st.

My sister and I and out grown/married children and their children had a three night vacation and our hotel was Knotts Berry Farm Hotel.  There was 40 of us.  The reservations were made well in advance through the group manager, Carol Smith. We arrived in clumps, but everything went very well.  We gathered in the lobby one night and had such fun, laughing and just visiting with one another.  The staff never said a word to us, even though we stayed in the lobby till 2am.   The rooms were nice, staff was nice.  The location was prefect for our group.   I was happy with our choice to stay there.  We are planning another family get together in two years at the same hotel.  Even though it was a little pricier than some other hotels in the area, this hotel is well worth the money.  As

We stayed in a regular room-not the Snoopy room, or other more expensive rooms. The room was basic-clean and functional, but nothing fancy. Which is how I usually travel. What sold me on the hotel was the package deal- Knotts Berry Farm tickets and all-day parking was included in the price. And it worked out great. We didn't have to hassle the Park parking lot and its lines, we didn't have to wait at the ticket counters-we just walked over and in. They also stored a suitcase that I didn't want to leave in a hot car all day. I really appreciated that. We drove to a nearby IHOP for breakfast at about 1/4 the price of the onsite restaurant, which serves a buffet.I would stay here again.

All in all a nice hotel.   Staff was friendly and and professional.   The rooms need some help.  They are really showing their age.   We had connecting rooms,   one of the rooms,  the safe did not work,  the bathroom door would not close and the door separating the rooms was missing the rubber piece on the door stop that held the door open,  my biggest complaint is that the window would not open at all.   No fresh air at all and that just sucked.   We could see Disney's fireworks each night and that was pretty good.  However the prices at the gift shop were really reasonable

Great hotel and value. Walk to Knott's is easy. The hotel and the park are in the same parking lot! Plenty of food options near.  We enjoyed the restaurant there in the hotel for dinner and they have a great breakfast buffet.

Summary Heading: Family Fun without breaking the bank
Summary: Loved it everyone was so friendly and helpful rooms are very  clean a little out dated but who cares you don't spend much time in the room with the use of both theme parks.And the surprise tuck in from Snoopy at bed time  was great doesn't matter your age it makes it all the more enjoyable. Best way to go is buy using the time payments they have several choices  so you can pick which works for you .Breakfast bar FANTASTIC ! Lots to choose from cereal both hot and cold ,eggs, bacon , french toast yummy  fill up before you hit the road.

This was a quick vacation for me and my two kids. The hotel was very nice. The pool was great. The people were very nice and extra helpful. The guy in the gift shop gave us great advice for our travel to the Angels game and he was super neat. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Great location for Theme Parks / Good Hotel / Great Staff
Summary: Knott's Hotel is a great value.  Proximity to theme parks is very good and hotel is very nice.  The staff is one of the best ever and make you feel like you are at home.  Highly recommend as Hotel is a throw back to the 'OLD' days but my family and I will come back.

This was our 2nd stay at KBF Hotel.  We chose this again because of its good location to theme parks and tourist shops, independence hall replica and park in 3-5 mins walking.  A free shuttle to and from Disneyland and bus tours of Hollywood available from Hotel pickup.  The hotel lobby is large and spacious and staff are welcoming and very helpful.  The rooms are clean, spacious and quiet with comfortable beds and a/c.  The camp snoopy rooms are great for families with young children.  Snoopy visiting for kid tuck in between 8- 8.30pm made it no problem getting our 7 and 12yr old to bed on time.  There is a self-serve laundry which is a must when staying a few days and travelling.  The restaurant has a good breakfast buffet of cereals, fruit, muffins and hot dishes with free

good room and location of the hotel near shopping and dinning area. Stay at this hotel with the visit to Disneyland , Knott's Berry and dinning at Mrs Knott's Chicken restaurant. Love it to the max. Would defintely recommend to friend and all people to stay here.

I have attended two Birthday parties one was a Sweet 16 and the second was an 18 Birthday/Graduation/Entering Marines going away combo party both were catered in their banquet rooms the food and decor we perfect. If you are in the area and are planning an event be sure to check them out.

Summary Heading: Nice being close to the park
Summary: Nice being close to the parkand the free breakfast was adequate the rooms were fairly nice the pool was good overall it was a good experience for the amount of money we paid for four daysit's a good place to take a family vacation close to Huntington Beach and we ate at Chick-fil-A real close

Myself my husband and son stayed at this hotel in June on the last 3 nights of our dream family holiday in California. The main purpose was to Vist Disneyland but i also picked this hotel on its price, location and the snoopy theam. We were not disappointed on anything infact we wish we had longer to go to Knotts Berry theam park and Knotts water park both are walkable from the hotel. We arrived late on our first night at Knotts Berry and were happy to find the restaurant still open, so checked in, which was fast and the staff were friendly and then we dumped our stuff in our room and went to the restaurant. At first look we thought the menu to be a little pricey for just burgers and salad and stuff, but ordered anyway as we had driven from Las Vegas and were tired and hungry.

First visit to this park, we traveled from Las Vegas. The front staff was really polite and helpful on meeting our accommodations and the hotel stay was good. Kids really enjoyed snoopy visiting the room and at breakfast. The pool was nice and the walk to the parks was extremely easy without having to drive from the hotel. We've done several visits to California on family vacations. Sea world/safari we loved. Legoland we didn't like and wouldn't plan on ever going back and this year knotts berry farm, which we are already making plans to visit again. Really great time and both amusement and water park. Will recommend as a vacation place. Thank you.

The hotel is clean and in walking distance to the park which is a great park for the price.  The packages they sell are affordable for any family of 4 or more who are looking for a fun weekend getaway.

Summary Heading: Great deal not only for visiting Knott's Berry Farm, but for OC in general
Summary: Staying at this hotel was well worth the $. I was able to purchase tickets for Knott's Berry Farm at a reduced fee (almost half price) and we were able to park two cars at the hotel for free which saved us a lot more money. They offer free breakfast but I had breakfast delivered to our room in the morning and was very pleased with the quality and price. I wish I would have stayed at this hotel during my entire vacation instead of just the one night. It has a free shuttle to Disneyland and is only a few miles from the beach.

The hotel and restaurant were fantastic, the staff were very friendly and helpful, walking distance to soak city and Knott's berry farm. It was a very pleasurable experience. My kids enjoyed the pool ,hot tub and basketball court and especially the timber mountain log ride.

We purchased a package deal for my daughter's graduation from USC.  All went very well: buffet breakfast was delicious, well kept rooms, friendly staff, both at front desk and restaurant,  The Amber Waves bar is the place to hangout:the bar staff were excellent.

We took a bunch of seniors for their "project grad" and cannot say enough about the wonderful staff that assisted us in the months prior.  The price was awesome as we were, obviously, on a budget coming from Hawaii.  We arrived early morning and, even with all the graduation celebrations going on, they went out of their way to allow us to drop off all our luggage early morning and stored it for us as we left for all day/night at Disney.  The convenience of the Knotts park for the next two days was perfect, especially with the exceptional group admission price.  The kids (and chaperones) LOVED it!!  The front-desk staff were AMAZING!  Thanks to the concierge's assistance prior to our arrival, I was able to hook up with the greatest taxi service I have ever experienced!    We had

The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. If you plan on visiting Knotts Berry Farm it is the only place to stay. They have great package deals that include tickets to either park (Knotts or Soak City), free parking and free breakfast. The hotel is also walking distance from both parks and shopping and restaurants. We did not drive our car until the day we left.  Definitely recommend a package with a hotel stay.

The staff at this Hotel was amazing - they made sure that my rooms were close together so that we could ensure the grandchildren had a great time.  Very clean rooms and hotel atmosphere.  Front desk staff was the best - ensuring all requests and needs were met without hesitation.  Friendly, informative, very personable staff that went above and beyond....close to the park.....Snoopy in the lobby everyday to see the kids.....anything you could ask for, the staff did their best to accommodate your requests and needs........ absolutely a great place to stay...thanks Giselle

U get what you pay for. Room was large but building was really old.  Window wouldn't close so noise from pool was loud.  Had to keep the ac permanently on to drown out the noise.  Elevator was so busy we took the stairs quite often.  Sauna was under reno. June 2015.  But hey.... It was cheap.

We have stayed here before and it never disappoints. Great value, great food options, and convenient. Love Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. You feel like you are at high end hotel without the high end price.

My son and I stayed for three nights, the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable with the exception of one front desk person! The room we stayed in was descent, the bathroom tub and toilet had pieces of hair in/on it, but they promptly came up to our room and cleaned it. It can get a little noisy at times, but overall it was not bad. And it was just footsteps away from the theme park. Our overall experience was very nice! BTW the Knotts Berry Farm Chicken dinner was some of the best friend chicken I've ever tasted!!! Will definitely be going back soon!

Had a blast with the kids at Knotts Berry Farm. The hotel was nice and clean and the staff was super friendly! The kids really enjoyed the pool/splash area. I will definitely stay here again for our next visit to Knott's  Berry Farm.

What can I say - if you're spending a few days at knotts berry farm this place is great and ultra close to the park. Laundry, wifi, foxtel, good pool and splash area plus walking distance to walmart. It made it really easy to visit the park at night when the lines are much shorter and has a well lit 400 metre walk to the hotel reception. If you go to the park have a boysenberry funnel cake - they are awesome! One small hiccup - avoid using your credit card in the vending machines if you are from os - with transaction fees, processing and exchange rate we paid $10.76 Australian for a 500ml sprite.

My best friend and I stayed here while we were on vacation. The staff was super nice and helpful. The rooms were a little small but clean. The WiFi was pretty fast as my best friend had to take care of some work. Plus it was only minutes to the park which was awesome! Overall, it was a really good hotel and I would totally stay here again.

Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. Very nice staff and hotel is pretty clean. They also offered a great deal for Knotts Berry Farm tickets which we took them up on. They also charged a small resort fee but it was really reasonable.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to the park is the best part
Summary: The hotel is a little out dated, but you can tell they tried to recently update the rooms.  The room was clean, bathroom is small.  Downfall, you can hear everything going on in the rooms around you! The hotel restaurant was short staffed and the wait was horrible.  It was nice to be able to walk to the park.

My family and I didn't actually get to stay here, but had a fantastic experience with an assisant to the GM. We needed to cancel our trip due to a death in the family. I had asked to cancel after the cancellation allowed date and was not getting helpful information from the reservations desk. She called me back the same day and was so kind. She helped with reversing charges already charged to my credit card and was sincere in telling me how sorry she truly was for the loss in my family. After speaking to her, I will definitely recommend this hotel (especially if this is a reflection on how they treat their guests). I hope to be able to take my family in months to come. Thank you!

We reserved a room for 5 and after 7 hours in the car we checked in to a room for 4 and offered linens for 1 to sleep on the nasty floor!!! A room for 5 should have a bed for each body!!! We had to rush around to find a room for the night that our family could use.

check in was easy , our room was clean and exactly what i was expecting the staff was friendly we had no issues with noise the beds were comfy and i got a good nights sleep. the pool area was ok my only issue was not enough towels they seemed very thin for my granddaughter's cool little body. what we paid for 3 adults and 1 child with knotts tickets and free breakfast with a 2 nights stay at the hotel was cheaper then 4 tickets to disneyland we had a blast at knotts lines were short and rides were fun.. we would return

Summary Heading: It was great to have the hotel within walking distance of the park.
Summary: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with a smile at all times.  The rooms were cleans.  It was great to be able to walk back and forth to the hotel and both of the parks along with the marketplace.

We really enjoyed our stay at Knotts Berry hotel. The room was clean and spacious and housekeeping did a great job of refreshing, making beds and replacing towels every day.We had a ground floor room at the back and so noise was ok , only ignorant guests running down corridors early spoilt it occasionally but we were so exhausted after days in the theme parks that we slept well  in comfy beds. The pool was lovely on a warm day with towels supplied and lots of loungers.The hotel staff were really helpful, especially Claudia, Processo and Ruby and made us feel relaxed and happy. The free shuttle service to Disneyland was great and ran every two hours or so from 7.30 am to 11 pm .You needed to book a place just so that the hotel had an idea of numbers travelling. We didnt use the

We spent the first week on June here at the resort.  The staff was excellent! The hotel as well as Knott's Berry Farm were both very clean and well maintained.  Staying at the hotel was worth the convience of just being able to walk a short distance into the park. We purchased the packages that included the buffet breakfast and also a food deal within the park.  Both were good investments.  If we return to the area i would definitely stay at the resort again!

Summary Heading: Loved having a nice hotel so close to Knott's!
Summary: The hotel was very nice. The rooms have recently been renovated, and looks like it has a great pool. There was plenty of parking when we arrived but we noticed later that night the lot was full. We arrived early and the front desk allowed us to park in their lot so we wouldn't have to pay Knott's parking fee for only a couple of hours until we could check in, which we really appreciated. They allowed us to check in early (with  our luggage still in the car), and we went to Knott's. About an hour later we received a text message from the hotel saying our room was ready and we could come by the front desk and pick our key up at any time. That was extremely convenient! A fire alarm went off one morning at 9am and ended up being nothing. I figured it was probably just kids messing

Spent Memorial Day weekend with my kids. From check in to check out stay was awesome! Purchased the package that included tix and breakfast, great value. Despite being the holiday weekend and fairly crowded everyone was friendly and courteous, always smiling and asking how we were doing. Needed a fridge and though it cost extra (20 for the stay) it wasn't just a small dorm fridge but a good size so I could buy enough from the close market for the entire time and not have to shop daily. Room was small but beds were comfy. Vanity outside of toilet/bath. Coffee maker was pot for 4 cups, wonderful when I wanted to make cup of soup for all of us at the same time instead of cup by cup the way I normally have to.  Snoopy in the lobby several times a day for photo ops. Parking was

Excellent staff all around from front desk to house keeping. Hotel and parks were very clean. Defiantly will be back next year if not sooner. We have already told family and friends of our great experience.

Summary Heading: Overall this hotel was fine, no complaints
Summary: Have no major complaints. Staff was helpful, especially Claudia at Front Desk. I really wanted a small refrigerator due to my long stay (about a week). Not only did she pull through for me, but she was very pleasant, very good customer service manner and  personality. Rooms are average, the safe box in my room didn't work. This hotel has a fitness room but it also has steam and dry sauna along with a Jacuzzi and swimming pool. I would recommend this place if you have kids because it also has a wet playground.

Very nice hotel. The room was spacious, clean, and just right. The staff was nice and helpful. The restaurant down stairs was delicious. The only thing that I have bad to say was the doors slammed hard! They were so heavy!  The hotel is just a hop, skip, and a jump from the park. And the park closes early, it closed at 8:00 while we were there(I know the times vary slightly depending on time of year and we went the beginning of June) so the noises from the park stopped abruptly at 8:00 and we heard nothing after! Nice and quiet. Besides, Snoopy himself makes regular appearances! :). What's not to love about that?  I recommend this hotel whole heartedly!

Hotel staff were very helpful and polite at all times. Also provided a free shuttle service to Disneyland which is about 10 miles away, much appreciated. Room was a little small bot you're only there to sleep. Visits from Snoopy in the lobby each afternoon. Great stay

Summary Heading: nice spur of the moment stay
Summary: My daughter and I spent the day at Knotts Berry Farm and didn't feel like driving the 150 miles home. We chose the smallest room, which upon entering I dubbed the "micro room". It was quite small, but very clean. No fridge or micro, but there was a coffee maker which I think is more important. It appeared to have been recently refurbished, except for the toilet/shower room. Bed was a bit firm for me, but my daughter said it was comfortable to her. The toilet/shower room does need to be remodeled, but it was very clean considering it's age. Front desk was wonderful, check in and out easy. The price for the area was very reasonable. The only thing I would say is a negative is that you could hear outside noise. Otherwise, I would stay again.

Very clean hotel.  Travelers - Please do not let your doors just slam shut and especially late at night.  It's very disruptive when you've had a long day at the park(s) and need a little shut eye.  That being said:  This was a super hotel to stay in, even while under remodeling.  The pool and water attraction at the hotel was very nice, and walking distance to parks (theme park or water park) was easy.  Make sure you understand whether or not breakfast is included in your plan though.  I thought ours was included but when I got to hotel, I was informed that it was not.  Which was quite disappointing when you are traveling on a very tight budget.  Other than that, the accommodations are very nice.  Beds are comfortable.

Summary Heading: Good for the money, convenient to the park.
Summary: The hotel is aging, sure, but it's very well up-kept.  Our room was clean and comfy.  Can't beat the price for the area, it includes parking, and you walk out the door and across the parking lot to Knott's Berry Farm amusement park.    The beds were very comfortable and there were lots of variation in the pillows so we all found the thickness/firmness we wanted.  The breakfast buffet was good with bacon, sausage, 2 kinds of eggs, lots of breads, oatmeal, cereals, juices, fruit, etc. (purchase that as part of a package, it's not automatically included).  We had a pack-n-play with us and it fit in the room with 2 queen beds.   Really good Wi-Fi was included.

We stayed 2 nights in May 2015. The hotel is convenient to the Park and all hotel personnel were professional and helpful. We did have a problem however with our room.  Initially, neither the phone in the room nor the safe was working. The safe issue was resolved quickly. There was something wrong with the phone. At 12:30 AM the first night the phone rang and woke us up. When we answered it there was only static in the line. At 3:20 AM the same thing happened. That's when I disconnected the phones. I plugged them back in the next morning. While we were out of the room between 5PM and 8PM the second day we received two messages. Upon retrieving them once again there was only static on the line. I left the phones unplugged the remainder of our stay.   We were in room 111, which is

My family and I stayed here last year for vacation and the room was great. Exactly what we payed for. The bathroom was a little small though. We were a little squished when were getting ready in the morning.

Being able to wake up and walk to the park was amazing. There are several places within walking distance to eat and shop.  We purchased the family ticket,  breakfast and one night stay package and it was very reasonable.  The breakfast was average,  coffee below average,  and rooms/amenities average. There is also a tennis, and basketball court on location. All that said,  I'd definitely stay again for the convenience factor alone.

We booked this hotel at the last minute because of an error in booking the original place we wanted to stay but found the Knotts Hotel to be surprisingly accommodating and nice.  The hotel is well appointed and the breakfast we ordered from Room Service was excellent and reasonably priced. (Each room was $119.00 per night and we booked by calling the hotel instead of a discount site.) The hotel has a beautiful ballroom and an event was going on when we arrived but the hotel staff was still very attentive and accomodating.  The hotel offers free wifi (for emails and web surfing) and paid wifi if you want more speed to stream video.
