Free parking is provided (unusual for hotels in the area) and the lot appeared to be secure and safe.  The only thing keeping me from giving this

Summary Heading: Annual Trip to the Fabulous Fords show
Summary: The hotel is always very accommodating for the large group that shows up every year! The staff is always helpful--smiling. The room is clean and neat--everything worked! We didn't have to ask for extra towels, as often happens. I plan to stay there again next year!

Overall the property was your average hotel and within close walking distance to the amusement park.  Our biggest issue was the way we had to book our two rooms.  Our main family of 4 arrived on a Friday and we had a daughter fly in from college on Saturday morning.  So, we needed to book one room Fri-Mon and a second room Sat-Mon.  We specifically told the reservation person our situation and wanted the rooms next to or near each other.  She told us it would be noted in our reservation.  On the Friday check-in we told the front desk attendant as well.  She told us there are notes in the system to make sure that happens and she put us on the 1st floor because the room next to our would be available starting Sat-Mon.  Sooooo, when we checked in the second room on Saturday

We booked online and got a package of the hotel and tickets to the park, based on the ticket prices alone, the hotel was almost free!  Nice room within walking distance of the park.  We will be back again for sure!

For the money, I think this is a great hotel. It's a quick walk to Knott's. Clean rooms and friendly staff. The buffet breakfast was just okay.   Good pool with a water play area. Parking is easy. We have stayed here several times and will come back.

Stayed here again for two nights during a west coast trip.  Hotel is in a nice area and within a good distance of Disneyland.  We had one evening meal at the hotel which was nice, but there are other restaurants nearby.  Room was modern, clean and spacious.  My only negative comment would be that  albeit small, charging for using the car park is a little bit naughty.  Still, with that said would recommend this hotel.  Free wifi in room was very helpful.  Staff very polite and helpful.😄

We could check in at 10 in the morning, that is good service! Had a family room and it was nice and a good size! Bathroom was a bit old but clean. Swimming pool are is nice with a hot tub and children's splash zone! Walking to the park is 5 main. Lots of fast food in the area!

This Hotel was located very close to Knotts Berry Farm you can easily walk, kids enjoyed the pool area and the room was clean, beds were comfortable. The Knotts ticket package and free parking made this a great deal.

After searching for a day, we took a risk and booked through one of those surprise hotel deals and luckily got the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. The front desk was super friendly when we arrived. The facility was clean and calm, too had the restaurant was closed by the time we got there. Oh well, maybe next time. The night was quiet, didn't wake up at all and the bed was comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: great for kids, not so great for adults
Summary: This hotel was a complete disaster, apart from one helpful staff member who drives the shuttle bus to Disney and back but he really was the only helpful member. The hotel is attached to a theme park, Knotts Berry Farm, so I was expecting the hotel to be full of families but this hotel really did take the mick.  The rooms were a nice size but the windows were filthy, the bathroom wasn’t very clean either, but the beds were comfortable. The Wifi was good in our rooms but we were on the 1st floor. One day after getting back from universal so at like 7:30pm we found in our sink a horrible hard green mess, we have no idea what it was but when we went down to speak to the manager all he said was im sorry here are some breakfast vouchers. They didn’t offer to come have a look or bother

We thoughts we'd try Knott's Berry Farm resort - wish we hadn't. Don't get me wrong - it wasn't dirty or anything but you can get so much more for your money elsewhere. The room was tiny - the smallest we'd had on our recent trip. We were trying to pack to go home the following day and it was just impossible in the room that tiny. We raised it with staff who said it was a room for one - what we booked - but we'd booked a room for two and all the equipment in the room was for two. Considering the cost of the room plus parking and the fact that this is a resort hotel we expected so much more. Last night of our holiday - it didn't end on a high. Won't stay here again as KBF is clearly trading on being a resort hotel but without the standard of rooms it should be provinding. Would

Stayed with my husband and 2 children in the Snoopy rooms. Very clean and quiet. Staff in all areas were friendly, and helpful, and made our experience a personal one. We never felt like we were just another guest. Snoopy is fantastic with his visits at night for the little one's. It's wonderful how close it is to the park, and restaurants, and very close the the freeways. We are already planning our next visit !!!!

I was pleased with the service and cleanliness. The wifi is decent and better than most. I had a corner room that was very quiet and clean. The rooms in the middle with 2 queen beds are large. There was no small fridge or microwave but there is a family restaurant in the lobby. My overall experience was very pleasant.

Very nice and convenient to have While  visiting the amusement park Makes the trip easier.   Someone In our party paid to park and we Couldn't. Get refund or credit.  Employees are friendly and helpful Steam room was great. Returning To clean and quiet room sure beats Standing in line to use restrooms

My son and I stayed at the hotel for 10 nights in late January, I have probably stayed at this hotel 20 times in the past 15 years. It is close to major freeways, walking distance to Buena Park mall. My wife and her mother are sying at the hotel next month, we are already planning to book again for January next year.

We booked this hotel as we wanted to visit the park, the discounted tickets were an excellent bonus. The staff are friendly and helpful, the restaurant is good and the room was nice. My only complaint was our room was right next to the laundry/housekeeping so on a couple of mornings we were woken by noise in the hallway. Location is good for local restaurants and shopping and tours can also be booked to pick up and drop off, we did Disney and six flags magic mountain which we booked through the front desk. Overall a lovely stay and would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Had a real nice time staying at the Hotel.
Summary: Everyone was so nice and went out of their way to make it an enjoyable vacation. Would like to stay there again. So clean! And beds were nice to sleep in. I liked being able to stay parked in the lot for the whole day even though we checked out at noon. That gave us more time to shop!

This hotel isn't the cheapest in the area, but you pay for your proximity to Knott's. I got my room on a discount for an event so the price was actually very good, but without a discount it's a little high.  The room I stayed in was your standard basic hotel room - two queen beds, large TV, desk, mirror, and bathroom. Good-sized room but it was just me staying in there so it wouldn't have mattered even if it was small. Everything was clean and the beds were comfortable. Staff was very nice and welcoming.  The pool area is pretty cool and features a large water play area for kids, large pool, and large hot tub. Unfortunately it closes at 10PM so late-night relaxation wasn't really a possibility. Bummer.  Still a good place to stay!

This hotel is like being in a warm hug ;) lol  Seriously, it may just be a hotel, but it is absolutely a wonderful place to be. The staff is soooo warm and welcoming, they genuienly care about your stay and making it the best it can be. There is  never a lag in help. The hotel food is delicious and Amber Waves is well priced for being in a hotel. The parking is included in the price of the hotel, so you dont have to pay for theme park, parking so you already have saved! The hotel price is always fair and affordable! Its quite and clean. I truly can not say enough about this place!

We stayed in this hotel on a prev trip 12 years ago and enjoyed it so booked here again this month. We were very disappointed in our stay this time. The room cleanliness was not very good - we arrived 5 nights ago at 2am and the bed had not been changed from prev guest - luckily there was a spare clean bed in the room (840).Cups were left unwashed.  The room was left at 9am during the day and we returned at 3.30pm and the room still had not been serviced yesterday. Today we are being collected by shuttle for a 15hour flight one hour after hotel checkout time and we couldn't get the room use extended by one hour. I am very disappointed in the hotel and will not be staying here again.

Stayed here for a few days in April 2015.  Lovely, friendly staff.   Good facilities if a little tired.   Reception staff could not have been more helpful, we had booked tickets online for a trip but needed their help to get them printed out, which they did happily. Pool, bar and rooms were well sized and clean and we had a view of the park from our room.   Beware of late dining tho as they seemed in a hurry to get us out of restaurant at 9pm, but food was lovely.  A few places to eat and drink close by and a 24 hour supermarket just up the road.   Would happily go again.    Right next to Knotts Berry Park which was much better than we expected.  Lots of fantastic rides and roller coasters, wild west theme to park itself and in April it was lovely warm weather there were NO

This is the second time we have stayed at the Knotts Hotel. It was great! Our family stays in the Camp Snoopy room. It's super cute with Snoopy visiting your room at bedtime. My little one loves it! They give you a stuffed Snoopy doll to keep. The hotel is clean and reasonably priced. The package deals are good and there is a season pass holder discount. The staff is friendly and available when you need them. I highly recommend staying here with young children.

We stayed at the knotts berry farm hotel for 14 nights and all i can say is this hotel is excellent, very helpful cheerful staff who always said hello everytime you walked by reception, the housekeeping staff were super, the room was spotless, Snoopy was always around  and posed for photos gladly, the shop gave 10% discount, i can't recommend this hotel enough. Next time we go back to L.A. Knotts Berry Farm is our hotel of choice

Our package was a one night stay inclusive of the park tickets and parking.  We had a wonderful experience and would like to thank Janelle at the front desk and Rodney at the Amber Waves restaurant for making it extra special for my family. Special thanks to Snoopy for coming by during dinner as well as  coming by to tug  the kids to bed!! They are still talking about you!!  For a 3star hotel it is definitely value for money. Room &bathroom are clean and we slept comfortably in our beds.  We will be back!!

Having stayed at Knott's Berry Farm Resort recently, I cannot brag enough about the exceptional level of service from 'Ellery' & 'Efrain'. Efrain organised all our tickets 2 Disneyland &Universal Studios as well as the car hireage & Ellery sorted out our Knotts Berry tickets & gave us best shopping & eating places in L.A. They took the time out everyday 2 ask what our plans were & if we need help & because of   their service to my family holiday,we will be staying with them again in our next family trip. All the staff are awesome but these two made our holiday that much more enjoyable!! Our room was always serviced & restocked everyday which was great after a busy day of either shopping or theme parks (i loved it) One thing we didnt have was a fridge in our room (which u can

Exceptional Customer Service received at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel this weekend during my Great Nieces 10th Birthday Celebration. We were pleasantly greated upon arrival by Parking Attendant, Lobby and Front Desk Staff. During pre-checkin we receiving everything outlined in our Ultimate Vacation Package then headed to Amber Waves for Breakfast as we waited for additional family members. Breakfast options were tasty and again the customer service was outstanding. Soon after additional family members arrived and fortunately were able to take photos with Snoopy before heading off to the park. Within a couple of hours our entire family received text confirmation as our rooms we ready. (Of course the children were not ready to go) After enjoing a nice Sunny California Day finally

Summary Heading: Good Hotel,with good bar and bar food
Summary: Had a 3night stay here and couldn't fault the room, it was clean and comfy with the facilities you require. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the reception staff even printed directions off for us to Universal Studios along with how to get to LA airport. Also gave information with regards local shopping outlets. The bar and bar food selection was excellent and very reasonable price wise, we were looked after 2 of the nights by a staff member called Nelson who was very friendly and gave excellent service

Had a 3 night stay at knot's Berry, could not fault the room it was clean, tidy and pretty quiet to say how busy it was. The reception staff was friendly and the bar staff especially Nelson (a stand in bar tender) was excellent and really made us welcome.   The food was traditional bar food which didn't disappoint, it was reasonably priced with large portions.  We had an excellent stay in a comfortable friendly hotel.

Went to this hotel with a large group.  They did a great job accommodating . Clean basic rooms.   Our group has 15 rooms and they were good at keeping us close together  Another loud group next door and when called front desk they took care of it.  Thank you

We've always made day trips to Knotts, but decided to stay a couple of nights at the hotel. With a season pass, the price was very reasonable. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It was very convenient to go to the amusement park. The nicest surprise was their pool area. Not very crowded when we went, and there's a little water play area for the kids. I highly recommend staying here.

Stayed at Knotts Resort for 13 nights over Easter , it was a family trip for my 50th birthday so we had 3 rooms . We were very pleased with the hotel , right from the minute we arrived the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were on the top floor which I had requested and we were able to have a fridge in each one (had to pay$20 per room, but it was well worth it). We had loads of room and a view of the pool, very comfy beds and all the facilities needed. I have to say just a slight niggle was that the cleaner always seemed to come at around three thirty which was usually when we had come back to the room to cool off , this resulted in our rooms not being cleaned very well although we did get fresh towels .I suppose its such a big place its always going to be difficult to

We really enjoyed our stay - The Hotel staff were engaging, informative, confident, helpful, extremely pleasant and friendly!  The room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities needed by us....perfect location for visiting the Park.

We really enjoyed staying at Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel. It is close to park, they have great package deals and Amber Wave's Restaurant has good food. Rooms are not fancy, but they are clean and well taken care of.

Summary Heading: Good for package deal and location
Summary: Took family to Knot's and stayed here the night before to be close by in the morning. Also they had a package deal for hotel, park tickets, parking, and breakfast that was a good deal. Parking was on property and you could walk to park while keeping free parking until that night leaving the park. Breakfast was standard continental buffet style, expect a wait to be seated. Room was reasonable, but for a theme park hotel, I expected better. The bathroom, had signs of not thorough cleaning. The pool was super cold, the sauna and steam room was nice though.

When we decided to stay at Knott's, we were expecting nothing more than a clean room at a decent price in close proximity to the amusement park. That's exactly what we got. Service was prompt and friendly.   Negatives include the free wifi being frequently inaccessible due to a 400-simultaneous-user limit, the lobby ATM being out of service, and cleaning people knocking on our doors WAY before we intended to check out... or wake up, for that matter.   If I wanted to do another day trip to the park, I'd consider this place again.

Summary Heading: Night stay at Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: We booked this night the morning we wanted to stay and luckily they had a room available. We asked for a roll away in our room and they were able to provide that. It is easy waling to and from the park and the restaurant on property has a nice breakfast.

great stay, excellent rates. Rooms are a little dated by clean and tidy. Lots of restaurants near by.Car parking is around $4 a day, staff very accommodating. Disney land about a 10-15 minute drive, would recommend you hire a car if possible

Summary Heading: Great Staff, great location, great value.
Summary: We bought the Platinum package for our family vacation that included the hotel room, park tickets, breakfast each morning, and dinner.  While the package wasn't cheap, it was a great value.  Staff was super friendly, and the public areas are nicely updated.  The restaurant is decent, if nothing to get excited about.  We were very pleasantly surprised by the room.  There were 5 of us in a 2 queen room with a rollaway.  I was expecting the room to be cramped with the rollaway, but it was very spacious.  The rooms were clean, and while not as recently updated as the public areas, they were what you'd expect from a mid-class hotel.  In short, I'd highly recommend Knott's Berry Farm Hotel to anyone going to the park.  The location, convenience, and staff ensure a great stay and an

Summary Heading: great place to stay for any age
Summary: stayed 3-28-15 for one night, everything was great the rooms were very nice and was nice and clean and smelled fresh. all the staff was very friendly and even saw snoopy walking around the hotel. amber waves bar is nice and has a great selection of drinks. makes it nice its so close to knotts, just a short walk  definitely would reccomend. i will be back

The room was average and my blanket smelled like someone had used it before. We also thought the parking was free ,but when we woke up we found a bill at our door. I tried to take a bath but they have a button set up so the tub won't fill so that was a bit dissapointing.

Summary Heading: The convience is worth the stay
Summary: We have utilized the "package" deal for room, meals, and park entrance on 2 occasions.  The first time, after checking in and going to the room, the cleanliness was a little below expectations.  I will say that the person who helped us book our package went above and beyond to make sure we had what we needed.  Being able to park and not have to go to our vehicle until we were ready to leave was well worth it.  Being able to go to the theme park and back to the room for a childs nap was also a blessing.

Summary Heading: Pleasant place to stay for families
Summary: Stayed at this hotel in Feb 2015 .this is a great hotel for families. Acess to Knotts berry farm is a short walk.Our hotel booking also included entrance to Knotts Berry farm for 1 day. Location is also good for Disneyland (only a 10 minute drive. Penty of places to eat in the area and the resturant at the hotel has a good breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We even got to meet Snoopy at dinner time.

This hotel is at a great place (right next to an amusement park, very near a decent shopping mall), it is showing its age but well maintained, nice and clean. Decoration is almost non-existent when it comes to corridors and rooms, which is a bit unusual compared to hotels on East coast, Canada or Europe. I was there on a business trip but I would say this hotel is perfect for families with children. It has friendly staff and good amenities (apart from the amusement park and a huge parking lot): fitness room, laundry room (with washing machines, dryers, etc.), outside pool. I did not have any lunches or dinners but breakfast is decent. You are safe to stay here.

Summary Heading: Great hotel on the amusement park grounds.
Summary: We stayed at the Knott's hotel overnight while visiting the theme park. I was impressed with the quality of the hotel and staff. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean. The pool area was great for kids and they had a blast after a day at the park.   I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Spent 7 nights at Knott's Berry Hotel, staff extremely friendly, made sure we had extra towels each day. Hotel is dated but the amenities are great. Loved the pool area with children's spray area, large pool & hot tub. Parking was reasonable just $7 dollars a night. Shuttle was great to Disneyland. We had our 6 year old & 5 month old grand daughters with us and they loved Knott's Berry's theme park, had planned one day but added an extra.

Pros:  The public areas of the hotel are nice and up to date, the staff is great, and it's close to Knott's Berry Farm Cons:  The package deals are expensive, the restaurant is expensive, the rooms are below average and are a little crowded. I'd recommend it to people going to Knott's Berry Farm (and you can charge park purchases to the hotel), but I wouldn't purchase the package deals again as I think you can get better pricing if you buy things separately.  Restaurants in the area are a little scarce but they do exist if you look.  If you don't have a rental then the on-premise restaurant has good food, but it is pricey. We found mold growing in the tub surround and they promised to clean it up but it never really changed.  Our room was just above the pool so there was quite a

Travelling from Hawaii for a much needed vacation with my wife and 5 year old son.  Since we have been to disney several times already(and I found out that half the park was closed anyway), we decided on Knotts and got a great deal on Groupon.  I must admit that I was concerned about some of the reviews I read prior to our trip as they were not that good.  However...  From the moment we arrived, the staff was excellent.  Ellery at the front desk was very kind and informative.  We did arrive early so our room wasnt ready but they stored our luggage and promised to text me when the room was ready.  We went to Knotts - which my son LOVED, especially CAMP SNOOPY.  Then right around 1pm we got the text.   When we got  to the room, it had been renovated and it was perfect!  The beds

Let's start with the Pros: great location and convenience if KBF is your only destination.  We parked our car Wednesday night at check-in and didn't move it until check-out Saturday morning.   Room was clean and pleasant.   Doors, elevators and halls were very narrow which showed the age of the hotel, but everything was updated well.  It was perhaps a little noisy, as I have read others say on here, but we simply switched the AC fan from "AUTO"  to "ON" for plenty of white noise to keep our baby asleep.  Daily breakfast at Amber Waves restaurant in the lobby was totally worth it and convenient.   Now for the dissapointments: I jumped in the car with the family after work and drove 7 hours across the desert to get there.  I was a tired pup when we got there at 11 PM to check in.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to review our property. I greatly appreciate the effort and detail in your review because it allows us in management the opportunity to identify failure points so that we can improve in the future. Addressing your first concern, those gentlemen should not have been hanging around the desk while off the clock because of the perception that it creates to families like yours. We do have bell services until approximately 11pm or 12am nightly depending on our shuttle transportation schedule however the delivery of that message should have been better. The only way the pool would ever be closed during their normal operational hours would be if there was a sanitary concern such as a child who had an accident. These things unfortunately do happen when you have the volume of children who stay with us and our procedure is extremely ridged in how we handle these incidents for the safety of our guests. The vacuuming housekeeper in the lobby seems like just a failure on the part of the organizing shift leader for that particular team member. Similar to the park issues that you experienced, I believe that through feedback like yours we can improve on the training and sharpen these areas. Thank you again for your business and we hope to see you again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: You are looking at a great location and very convenient.............  but it's really outdated..........especially the bathrooms.........shower does not even have a curved shower curtain rod, which have pretty much been the standard for 20 years now...........
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your experience with us. While I can understand your comments about the property décor given our age, I am not sure how that resulted in the 1 star you gave us for service. I am happy to announce that the décor and overall property maintenance will have a major renovation over the next three months however the service, in my opinion has been extremely consistent and should not be affected by things such as a curtain rod. If there was a negative incident with a member of the team I would be greatly interested in learning about it so that we can identify and correct that failure in training. Otherwise I hope that you have an opportunity to stay with us again to reshape your perception after our renovations in June.  Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: I stayed 2 nights for a workshop, when I arrived the staffing was great. Polite and welcoming. When I stepped in my room there was 2 queen size beds with their colorful comforters as I set my bag on on the bed closest to the window I notice silver/white hairs on the comforters which set an alarm off. I did not make a complaint because I did not want to deal with the whole changing my sheets or room. Now in the evening hours as I got ready for bed I began to look for an outlet within reach of the bed but there was nine, the only outlet I could see anywhere near was where the alarm clock and radio was plugged in. So I made the decision to unplug the radio and use my phone as an alarm. But to get to the outlet I had to move the bed with the hairs on it and when I did I saw a layer
Manager Response: Please accept my apologies for what was clearly an unacceptable experience. We take great pride in our training program however it is clear that the team member assigned to that room was not doing a good enough job with our cleanliness procedures. While I appreciate your desire to correct the issue on your own, our management team greatly appreciates any opportunity to see these issues when they happen so that we can not only correct the issue or move you immediately to a room that meets our standards but also so that we can see exactly what the issues are for follow up training purposes. Your review has given us that opportunity on a broad scale however any additional information would be greatly appreciated. We value guest feedback and I assure you this information will help our team grow closer to our goal of 100% guest satisfaction.  Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Stay in the snoopy themed wing, Totally worth it! The hallway and rooms are decorated very cute. Inside the room you will find 2 Snoopy stuffed animals that your kid/s get to take home. No extra charge, its included in your room rate. The top highlight is you get a personal visit from Snoopy himself!! This alone is worth the few extra dollars to stay in the snoopy themed rooms. Snoopy will visit between 8-8:30pm to "tuck" your kid/s in. We didn't tell our daughter he was coming, what a great surprise it was for her!!   The room is a comfortable size for 3/4 people. I do agree with other reviewers that it could use a facelift especially the bathroom, its just ordinary, no frills. Also they have a very old safe. You can only fit a wallet and maybe one other very small thing inside

Summary Heading: Great service, location, and value for money.
Summary: I booked this place for a 1 night layover whilst passing through LA.  Large parking lot on site, and check-in was quick and welcoming.  Room was very comfortable, clean, and despite facing the main road, was very quiet.  Great choice of TV channels, and plenty of restaurants in the local vacinity.  Disneyland is a quick drive away, and LAX only a 40min drive, I would stay here again when in the area for a longer time.

Overall it was ok. If you go on weekends, I recommend packing noise canceling headphone and extra patience.  On weekdays, there is plenty of parking, no issue being able to sleep in and the wifi is more than enough to stream movies or use skype. On weekends it sounded like ringling brothers had set up stop in the hotel. Above me was the heard of elephants. I could clearly hear the parents next door,  I think I still remember all their names! The internet slowed to a crawl, I assume too many people were downloading at one time. Children were playing tag in the hallway causing it to be very difficult to access the elevator.  The hotel decided to cut off the water for 8 hours, with no offer of compensation for the inconvenience.  Overall, it was ok, but if I was paying full price I

I had  planned a 3 day trip for me and 2 daughters , my husband and I spent our honeymoon there and we list him a year ago I wanted my girls to see the wonderful place we stayed.. I was disappointed because the room was no different from the low budget hotels we stood at before, they charged us $7 a night for parking as well as if we used bottle water that was in the room we would have to pay $4 for each bottle thank god we brought our own water, also something in the room caused me to have sever asthma attack after the second night we checked out..
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the information regarding your stay. I am equally disappointed to learn about your frustration specifically regarding the asthmatic reaction you had. We do our best to qualify all chemicals that we use with our provider, Ecolab to limit any chance of potential irritation however there is always the chance given the various sensitivity levels of our guests. The parking charge is consistent with neighboring properties who offer a secure lot. The 1 liter water is an added amenity which is only recommended after the guest reads the information and makes a decision based on the value and convenience. There are vending machines on every floor that have several beverage options including water for a lesser rate. We are going through a major renovation in the coming months so I hope to have another opportunity to host you and your family again so that we can try and change your perception of our property.  Stephen Ruggiero, Director of Operations Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We stayed there for 4 nights in February 2015.  Have stayed there before so knew roughly what it would be like.  Its fine, a plus was that the pool was open and we did use it.  The weather was warm and it was nice to be able to chill for a couple of hours after walking round and visiting other places.  The Amber Waves restaurant is good especially for breakfast, and if you catch happy hour for drinks then its not too extortionate.  We did comment that the reception area could have a nicer, better seating area, a lot of wasted space.  Overall though a nice destination.

We booked 3 rooms for 3 nights. Only good thing is how close it is to the park. Rooms need remodeled! Beds are not comfy at all didn't sleep at all. Yup walls are paper thin and they booked a wedding 2 floors above us without telling us before we spent almost 2000 for the weekend!! I'm sitting in my room right now after being told there's nothing they can do. Wedding is on until 12!! I want a refund for tonight!! We have 4 kids and a 7 hr drive in the am!!

Had a great time! Lovely staff. Place is a little bit off from LA and Uber drivers can cancel on you when they hear where you are going but it's close to great outlets. Free shuttle to Disneyland was super. Awesome restaurant in house. Area around hotel is nice if you don't walk too far. Take a 20 minute stroll in the wrong direction and things become a little stabby.  We were there off season so the kids had the pool to themselves.  No complaints.

It's true what others say - the walls are paper thin and kids are constantly running around - but if you get a good room, all can be forgiven! We stayed in 809, lovely king sized bed simply by letting the check in staff (James, what a sweetheart!) know it was a special occasion. We didn't spend much time at the hotel as we were doing all the attractions during the day, but the mattress and pillows were comfortable! Disappointed there was no fridge in the room, nor was water in the room complementary, but you can get around this by asking Amber Waves bar for a plastic glass with tap water. Very helpful indeed! Love the fact that you can meet Snoopy - guess I'm a big kid at heart!!

Big hotel. Looks like the rooms have balconies but they don't, it's a false one. Very attentive staff if a bit slow in the restaurant hosting area. Swimming area quite nice, free towels! The room was adequate for our requirements, really comfortable beds and the housekeeping staff are fabulous. Free shuttle to Disney is very good, you must book it though. Takes 20 mins tops and punctual. If you're travelling from the UK be warned, the prices for food and drinks are horrendous! Average price for a meal in restaurant $70 with say, one drink each. Disney the same. Surrounding area of hotel, the same. And that's one course. Not to say the food wasn't nice but definitely not worth the prices. Disney itself though is WONDERFUL. Spotlessly clean. I'd say 3 days minimum. Cars Land is a

Summary Heading: Nice for kids and Close the Theme park
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay, I was very happy with the prices we got thru Groupon.  I liked being walking distance to the Theme Park, Shops and Restaurants, very convenient if traveling with kids.  The last day we were there the fire alarm was set off, everyone ran out of the hotel to come to find out it was a false alarm, hotel staff could have made a intercom notice stating false alarm instead of all these people running around in a panic. But other than that I would stay again.

I absolutely love this place for a numerous of reasons. I enjoy the parking. It's not a hassle to find parking if you get there an hour before it's opening and the spaces aren't crowded. They have plenty of dining options outside the gates and also in the surrounding areas. It's also inexpensive and always has beautiful weather. I prefer this over Disneyland because I as an adult can get on rides and it's less crowded. The staff is always friendly and too notch.

The hotel is aesthetically pleasing on the outside as well as in the lobby, however the rooms leave MUCH to be desired!  The rooms are dated and old.  There was hair in my bed.   The showers are so old I didn't want to get in.  The walls are paper-thin and we could hear every word in the room next to us and could smell the shower when the neighbours got out of it.  The hotel restaurant was horrible - bad food and unfriendly service!  The hotel is close to the theme park which was was the only good part of this stay.  Ugh.... NEVER AGAIN!!!
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology for the extremely uncharacteristic stay that you experienced with us earlier this month. While I can completely understand your unwillingness to return after such an experience I feel extremely certain that the numerous shortcomings of our staff were rare and isolated incidents. The design of the building is not something I can change in the immediate future but there is no excuse for the cleanliness issues or poor service. I have addressed these concerns with our management team and feel confident that changes have been made to prevent the occurrence in the future.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Good rooms but bad service at Restaurant
Summary: We stayed here just for a day during our holiday. Rooms were pretty spacious and clean, and we didnt have any hassles during our check out etc. too. We went to the restaurant for Bfast and it was just an average experience. We requested for some warm milk from the hostess and she outrightly refused that there is nothing like warm milk which is available. We were asking it as one of us had a bad throat, but they didnt oblige. We think all it takes is few seconds to get this done for guests who stay with the hotel, especially when one is feeling not so well.   So i would rate it just as an average experience.

Summary Heading: Ants! staff who couldn't care less
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights while visiting disneyland. We were on the third floor and there were dozens of small ants in the bathroom. I asked for a different room, as my 2 year old daughter was scared of them, and without even looking they told me that there was no other rooms. In a hotel of over 400 rooms and us there for 6 nights I do not believe that they could not have moved us up a few floors at some point.  Upon check-in I was told that parking was free, upon check-out I was told that it was $7 per day. I complained and they only charged me for 3 nights parking.  Location is good for disneyland, only about a ten minute drive. Lots in the area, wal-mart etc.  Overall not a terrible experience, but I won't be staying here again

My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in January on a great deal from a groupon.   Our room was on the 6th floor, near the elevators. This is obviously an older hotel, but it has been nicely remodeled. We had a king bed room that was clean and relatively comfortable. There was a chair w/foot stool and desk w/chair also in the room.   The bed was a little firm for our liking and the pillows were terrible, but the bed linens and towels were good. The furniture was in good condition also. The TV is a flat screen and had plenty of channel options.   My only complaint would be the noise. Our room was an adjoining room. We could hear the people in the next room laughing and playing around. I'm not sure if they were just extra loud or the wall is that thin, but we could plainly

Got a great deal on groupon,  the room was nice.  The bed was so comfortable.  Didn't have any problems.  The staff was very friendly.  Would definitely stay here again. After that steak from ruth's chris definitely was pleased with my stay.

We had two connecting rooms, which were a good size .Note that the shower head needs first to be pulled out before being turned around. The room had a coffee percolator and safe but no fridge or microwave. The walls were pretty thin and you could hear the TV next door. The air conditioner was very noisy. We found the staff very helpful and went out of their way for us to get tickets to attractions and transport to the station. The breakfast was basic and you had to order toast and tea although it was a Buffett. It is a 15minute walk to the Buena Park Mall which had good shopping and bargains. Over the road is a Walgreen pharmacy which is also like a mini supermarket. You can purchase wine.  Go to Mrs Knots Chicken Dinner Restaurant for great chicken meals. Sometimes there is a

We had a great experience at this hotel. Our family room was very nice and roomy. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was excellent. Aircon and heating actually worked. The hotel staff were very knowledgeable about the surrounding region and very helpful. One or two staff members were superb and could not do enough for you. The hotel wasn't noisy even though it was busy. The restaurant was not the best but was adequate. Being a resort hotel, it has a fabulous theme park next door.

Customer Service was excellent.  Shuttle service to Disneyland only - if you need to go to the Convention Center, you have to walk from Disneyland drop off.  The website was misleading on that, which was the deciding factor for us to book at this location.  We arrived at noon and couldnt get a shuttle until past 5pm.  The shuttle runs on appointment times, which you have to reserve in advance - SO CALL AHEAD BEFORE YOU GET THERE, at least a day in advance.  We were in town for NAMM, rates were great through getaroom.com during a peak weekend where everything around Anaheim is oversold and incredibly high priced.  It was great to be so close to Mrs. Knott's Chicken Dinner restaurant.  As with any theme park hotel, you get a LOT of kids.  The walls are pretty thin, as are the

The knott hotel is located right next to the park. It's a great hotel.  My kids loved it. And my husband and I liked that it was so close to the park. We could go change our clothes and go back into Knotts for the night. We would stay again if ever in the area

The hotel is conveniently located next to the park and also close to other atractions like Medieval Times Dinnet and Tournament. The stuff was really good with accommodation upon early arrival and texting us when our room was ready to check in. It was my birthday so they offered a wonderful ice cream treat big enough to share with 4 others

Summary Heading: Great to be by the Park but an odd hotel and rooms
Summary: Generally staying here gets you great access to the park, generally a really good deal on tickets from their web site when combining with the room cost and for the kids Snoopy rooms and visit. Now in this case didn't have a Snoopy room but they conned me into a 34 dollar upgrade in an email after booking to get 100 ft larger room... i assumed the whole room would be nicer for the money and maybe even a sofa.... Wrong !   room just had a ton of extra space between the bed and the tv and the sort of kitchen counter...    Never seen such wasted space before.... the bathroom had a really weird really long feel to it as we.. Now mind you the view... while being away from the park was good on a high floor... you have to pay 15 extra to view the park or the gardens.. which i would

Summary Heading: Best features: pool area and free Disneyland shuttle
Summary: I had a Groupon with a good rate at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel, so stayed there three nights even though I was spending all four days at Disneyland. The website said free Disneyland shuttle. The really important thing to know if you are planning to stay here and go to Disneyland is that the shuttle runs less frequently than shuttles that pick up at hotels in the Disneyland area. So you might have a choice of 7:30 and 9:30 for leaving in the morning. We got there at 11am but there wasn’t a shuttle to the park until 1:30. One night we went to the 8:45 Fantasmic and couldn’t catch the 9:20 shuttle pickup so had to wait till 11:20. You make a reservation ahead of time for both going and coming back. The shuttle times can change depending on the park schedule. Just a heads up. It

Our room was surprisingly tiny! We had a queen bed but expected a little more room. We got our room cheap on Priceline, however, so I won't complain too much about it.  The property was nice and comfortable and staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't eat on the property but saw Snoopy in the restaurant. There is a tiny waterpark-like structure at the pool where we saw several kids having a good time. I enjoyed the sauna and steamroom. Hotel was SUPER convenient for a day at Knott's Berry Farm. We could walk back and forth between the hotel and park within five minutes. Great location. Too bad that the hotel doesn't offer a breakfast but overall our stay was really good.

LOCATION  You cannot beat the convenience!  The hotel has entrances in front and in back, so getting to the park is super-fast.  Five minute walk at a normal pace.  ROOMS  The rooms themselves are pretty good, depending on how many people are in your party.  We had an over-sized room with two queens and two roll-away beds.  Plenty of room for everyone.  The only downside is the small bathroom with no tub.  Only a shower.  That's a bummer with small kids.  The roll-away beds were okay.  Nothing special.  They do the job and small kids don't complain.  :-)  I wish we had a room on a lower floor because the elevator can get very busy in the morning.    BREAKFAST BUFFET  Buffet breakfast is perfect for families.  Plenty of choices: eggs, bacon, french toast, hash browns, oatmeal,

Pleasantly surprised by the service rendered by the hotel staff especially Tonez and James. Rooms are decent and beds are soft too. Snoopy also came by the hotel reception and was energetic and fun loving. Do give this hotel a try!

stayed there in may june 2014. the staff was fine on check in hotel room needed help as it was a tad old to say the least  You could smell the chlorine of the swimming pool everywhere you went  the breakfast was good and the staff in there friendly  did not go to the park as we was only there for 3 nights and wanted to go to disney and hollywood  we only paid for one days parking $12 not bad  there is a few shops around by car and walgreens just down the rd and a couple of food outlets near to as well   all in all a nice stay but a refurb is needed

Summary Heading: Old dated bathrooms and big carpet stain
Summary: Well I played the Priceline roulette game for a three star hotel near Knott's Berry Farm and ended up with this hotel. First the positive.....Free parking was included and there was plenty of parking. 2nd the pool area is nice although if you have kids, they better know how to swim. It's an old school deep pool.   Now the bad.... Knott's Berry Farm resort is OLD! I was told the rooms were renovated in 2012 but it was mostly a cheap cosmetic renovation. I walked down a dirty hallway that smelled of "Funk" and puke! Obviously ventilation was poor in the halls. That's something that the hotel should fix. Also If you have kids watch out! Some of the rooms have stand up showers only. Yep NO BATHTUB in a family hotel? That makes no sense!!! Then I notice upon walking into my room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am very sorry to learn of your negative experience and subsequent perception of our property. While we are an older building we do our best to maintain it through a weekly preventative maintenance program that is designed to limit the occurrence of the very experience that you had with us. Clearly that room was in need at the time of your stay however I am not able to locate neither that stain nor the odor so I am confident that the problems have been resolved. The comment surrounding the occupancy may be based on the room type.  It is very possible that while the total percentage was lower than an actual sell out the inability to move your room may have been due to the sell-out of that specific room type.  Without the exact dates it is tough to say for sure but it is hard to believe that we would be lying to our guests so I have to imagine a more likely explanation.  All in all I apologize for anything less than a comfortable stay and hope you give us another chance in the future.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: Spent a weekend here for a staff party in the hotel. Breakfast and parking was included in our rate.  Rooms are tired, and in need of renovation. Staff are really exceptional.  Very close to Knott's Berry Farm - 5 minute walk.

Summary Heading: Great price, clean room, accommodating staff and great parking. close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for days, three nights. Arrived after check in (3pm). We were greeted with a smile and our key cards. Only $7/night to park. Had plenty of parking as it was off peak. Room with two beds was very spacious (included a chair with ottoman), small desk with chair, large dresser, bathroom vanity outside of bathroom, descent size closet. Plenty of room to put two large cots in room or pack and plays. No fridge or microwave. I was ok with that. Less than a ten minute drive to Disneyland - easy freeway access and even an take backroads. Plenty of places to eat around area. We needed extra sheets and pillows and they were brought to us without question. The shuttle is FREE to Disneyland. Just schedule your pickup (super easy and convenient! I got this hotel through a Groupon

Excellent value on this package priced room. 3 night stay came with tickets to knott's berry farm amusement park. The property was close to Disneyland and easy to get around.  Cons: beds were extremely firm and the halls always had kids running and scream like crazy!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us this past January. I was pleased to see your ranking of our service however the sleep quality and overall room was regrettable. I appreciate you bringing your mattress preference to our attention as this is something we are aggressively pursuing for change. We are looking into several options to give our guests more of a preference so I hope we can improve on your experience in the future. I have also spoken to our Security Manager to encourage him to have his team provide more consistent rounds to limit the noise. Thank you again for your review and I hope to host you and your family again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Short walk to Knotts Berry Farm.
Summary: Only a 2 night stay for my family.  The bonus being a discount on our Park tickets and only 10min walk to the entry gates to "Knotts Berry Farm".  The room was comfortable with 2 queen beds and a decent bathroom.  We enjoyed a late meal from the bar and we were treated to great service.  Highly recommend going in early December as the park was not very full during our time there.

Summary Heading: Stones throw to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: If you are planning a trip to Knotts Berry Farm (KBF) - this hotel is a great choice.  The front desk was very helpful with questions regarding KBF and the surrounding area for restaurant choices, etc.,. The room rate was reasonable and we also took advantage of the discounted tickets to KBF.   We upgraded to the Snoopy experience and it was a huge hit with the children.  The room we stayed in was dated and in need of renovation, but it was clean and all the services were in order. The hotel is taking steps to modernize and the other areas were lovely.  We ventured to Downtown Disney for dinner and it took us about 10 minutes.  The hotel also offers a shuttle to Disney that leaves on regular intervals and it took us only 5 minutes to walk to KBF.  Overall - very good.  The kids

Summary Heading: Fun for kids, poolside rooms are loud
Summary: Booked this hotel for two nights using the fire & police personnel discount which is offered in Dec. and Jan., and is a nice way to appreciate law enforcement. We had to cancel because our kids got sick, but they recovered the day we were supposed to drive there, so I was able to reserve the same room for he same price I originally booked it for. It's nice to know that they don't jack up the prices for last minute reservations.  We booked the Camp Snoopy room with breakfast and parking included. The room also came with two plush Snoopy dolls for the kids. There was only one in our room, so I called the front desk for another, and they promptly sent another one up. Parking is usually $7 a day and discounted breakfast is usually about $12/adults, $8/kids.  The room was decorated

We checked into this hotel on December 29th and out on December 31st.  We booked it through Hotwire.com, taking a chance on hotels not knowing what hotel we were going to get when we clicked the button.  When we looked through the pictures after we were told what our hotel was going to be, we thought, wow! It looks really nice! BOY WERE WE WRONG! It was ranked as a 3 star hotel on hotwire.com and comparable sites, but I would give it only a 1.0-1.5 star.  There was no free internet and the rooms were incredibly small.  When we arrived at the hotel the parking guard informed us that parking would be free because we were hotel guests. We were corrected of that information when we got to the front desk.  The manager ended up waiving that fee because of the mis-understanding,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to review your experience. While I was glad to see that the manager was able to promptly move your room it is regrettable that there was such a need. We are always trying to improve in the training and development of our team and your information that night did help us with that specific room attendant.  We also have a thorough room inspection procedure that seems to have been overlooked as well. I have shared your feedback with the entire team in a recent meeting about our standards and feel confident that helped drive our message home. I hope that we have an opportunity to earn back your trust on a future stay. If you would like to discuss the experience further please feel free to contact me directly via a phone or email.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary: We booked two nights at the hotel as we were visiting Knott's Berry Farm for one day. The hotel offers discounted tickets to the park.  Check in and check out was quick and efficient and the staff very helpful.  The hotel was good value for money as we stayed during early December which is not a busy time for the park.  Our room contained two queen size beds and was a good size.  The hotel room was tastefully decorated and very modern.  The bathroom was modern and sleek.  The beds were comfortable with great pillows.  The only negative was the parking charge.

Summary Heading: Great room, great breakfast, steps from Knotts.
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Knotts resort, part of their in house promotional package that included a stay at their resort, breakfast and theme park admission. It was a good deal on paper, and even better in person!  The room was very clean, two queens and a partial view of the water fun area. There was a coffee maker, and hair dryer as well. Standard hotel room, but clean and well maintained.  The beds and linens were all in good repair, and the bathroom had been recently updated from what I could tell.  There was breakfast that came with this package in their onsite restaurant, Amber Waves. GREAT hot buffet; eggs, breakfast meats, cereals, french toast, etc, Plenty of choices for all. Everything was quite tasty, good quality and kept well stocked.  The package we purchased

Hotel had a great Groupon deal.   Hotel staff was very helpful at check in,  the rooms are spacious and comfortable.   Pool and spa area (children's spray water section, too) had plenty of lounge chairs as well as several tables with chairs without the over crowded feeling.  The hotel has a meet and greet with Snoopy a few times each day which our granddaughter loved!  The hotel offers a shuttle to Disneyland but with limited times so we decided to drive, (there is a parking fee at Disney which allows you to leave and return the same day without an additional fee), this didn't restrict our day by having to meet the shuttle at a specific time.

We have stayed here several times over the years and have never been disappointed.  We take advantage of the Veteran's special they off each Nov through early Jan.  It appears the room we were in (516) was just refreshed.  Everything looked new and was in good working order.  The front desk was very friendly and public areas were clean and well maintained.  The Knott's Berry Farm Hotel is very charming and conveniently located very close to the park.  I was a little disappointed to see they charge for parking now but it was included in our rate.

We where for a family visiting, fast service  and clean room. Food service  was good, close to the park, good location.we will come back for our next visit  to knotts  berry  farm. The parking was good and a lot of handlcap parking.

My family stayed here for our Christmas vacation and it was excellent.  The minute we walked in we were warmly greeted by Ellery.  He gave us all of the necessary information we needed for our stay and was genuinely helpful every time we met.  Professional, kind, funny, efficient and did I mention genuine? Thank you Ellery for making our stay at Kotts a great one!  The room was a fair size and very clean.  Housekeeping did a great job on a daily basis.  Shuttle to and from Disneyland was an awesome bonus.  Also if you're looking for thrilling rides, Knotts has some good ones.  Thanks Team Knotts!  Warmest regards, Team Powell

Summary Heading: Good place to stay when going to Knotts
Summary: We booked this last minute and was bummed that they would not allow us to use the police/fireman discount. Hotel was very busy. Had some huge groups having functions. Front desk wasnt very friendly. Room was clean although the beds were pretty hard. TV didnt have a remote but they brought one to us. Maids woke us up wanting to clean the rooms at 9am! Not happy about that when check out is noon. Love when Snoopy comes down to the lobby to see the kids.  We come every year but prefer to come in the beginning of Dec rather than the end of the month. Much better experience when its not so busy. Like that we can walk to Chicken Dinner and Knotts Berry Farm and leave the car at hotel.

Our trip was originally planned for 2 days at Disneyland. After looking at the costs of the tickets and hotels we thought it might be worth looking at one day at Disneyland as well as one day at Knott's Berry Farm. The costs of staying at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel with Military Days and free parking was considerably less than staying closer to Disneyland. Add to that the free shuttle service they had to Disneyland allowed us to stay the two nights with two rooms at Knott's Berry. The staff was friendly, we had adjoining rooms that were large enough and clean. We also had dinner and breakfast there and a few drinks in the lounge as well. Having this hotel within walking distance of Knott's Berry Theme Park was also a great convenience. Overall, for a tourist location this was one

Summary Heading: Good hotel let down by staff who don't listen
Summary: Stayed here many times over the years and always have a good stay but each time it's let down by staff ... And there lack of being able to sort out a small issue ...  The hotel lobby has been refurbed and is very nice ... Rooms are dated but clean .. Next door to the park and shops .. Overall a good stay ... Any issues we had were down to staff any issue or concern is met with ... Oh I'm sorry .. But they never offer to actually sort out the issue ?? Which is infuriating and let's the hotel down ... One instant we asked for liquid creamer milk for our room it took 3 attempts and 2 days and they still couldn't deal with our request ! .... We also had a gift that we accidentally left in the laundry stolen  within 2( mins of leaving .. There's cctv and It's room key entry however

I stayed here with the wife and two teenagers for one night as we visited the park. The room was very spacious and exceptionally clean. The beds and pillows were comfy and warm. The pool area was great for adults and kids. I really enjoyed the fitness center. They had lots of equipment a wet and dry sauna and free weights. This place is a great value for the area. I would definitely recommend it especially if traveling with children.

Summary Heading: Walking Distance to the Knott's Berry
Summary: The hotel is with in walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm. The staff is great. Friendly, helpful and pleasent. Their is plenty of room in the rooms. You do have to request a refridge. Some of the mattress do need to be replaced. Mine was not bad but could have been better. The other mattress seemed to be newer.  I had a problem figuring out how to turn the bath tub facuett handle on and it was hard to pull out. Other then these miner things the room was very clean and had a great TV.

We stayed at this hotel during a trip we took to Disneyland.  I booked it on Priceline for a pretty good rate. The initial date we were supposed to stay we had a family emergency, I called Priceline and they said the my could not reschedule the stay and that the hotel would not let me. Instead of going back and forth with Priceline, I just decided to call the hotel. They were very empathetic and compassionate about my situation and had no problem rescheduling my trip. I was very appreciative of them for this and it was a glimpse into the service I received during my stay.   The room was adequate for one nights stay, the beds were not too comfortable and you could hear every noise around you. I feel this place has some potential if they would update some aspects of the rooms.

We saw a deal advertised online but the dates required to book a stay and visit the KBF resort did not work for us, but we decided to visit anyway. Most of my family had never been--there were 4 of us. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and professional. The front desk was terrific and gave my daughter a birthday pin, so cute! The restaurant in the hotel was reasonably priced and the food very good.   FYI: skip the "See Snoopy" time in the lobby and go eat. He will come to you in the restaurant! He even sat with us during the meal for a brief time.  Then our waiter brought out a HUGE free sundae for my daughters birthday.  Another plus, the hotel is right next to the shopping area and the resort itself.  Downside: Because it is so close there are a lot of parties or

Summary Heading: There's always a first for everything...(Especially in your 20's)
Summary: My family and I booked a room at the Knott's Hotel during the Berry Bloom Festival that was being held at the park itself. First of all: Guys, seriously, You Do Not HAVE to be a child to stay in the "Peanuts" section of the hotel OR to be tucked in by Snoopy. For I was 20 years old and getting tucked in by Snoopy was just  like YAAAAS! This hotel is Amazingly Clean and the Room Service is DE-Lish! Finally, the Knott's Hotel, in general, not only looks Gorgeous, but the heart & soul of this place is Wonderful. So in the end, with my experience, this place is a 10 out 10! Hopefully my review inspires people to give it a chance and go!

Our family stayed here for 4 nights in September for Knott's Scary Farm Halloween. We usually go to Disneyland but this year we decided to omit that and just do Knott's and I'm so glad we did. We bought the Haunted Dreams Package and it was amazing. Hotel,tickets,dinner,breakfast and souveiners included. So close to Knott's we couldn't believe it! Love this hotel and it has a great pool area. Will definately come back every year for this! Staff was helpful & friendly. FREE parking too.

Summary Heading: Knott's Berry Farm Hotel "A MUST STAY"
Summary: Every Year since my kids were born...ages 13 Girl and 15 Boy, we take a vacation to Disneyland during Thanksgiving.   The past two years now the kids are older we have deviated and last year we went to Universal Studios...Great Once  and this year to Knott's Berry Farm. WOW! were we impressed with the whole vacation.  The Knott's Hotel was very affordable and offered discount tickets to the park all in a nice neat package.   I am very picky about accommodations since I don't have tons of money but I can tell you that this Hotel treated us first class and made us feel we spent a fortune to stay there...But we didn't!  FIRST CLASS service and easy walk to the park.  Plenty of parking and a GREAT pool! Only Negative was the room did not have a Micro or refrigerator so we had to go

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  Due to street resurfacing, I was looking for a place close to home.  I booked the room on the theme park's website.  It was a large room with 2 double beds (although more than I needed as a single traveler), with the standard amenities of a Holiday Inn.  My package included the breakfast buffet, which was good albeit not great.  The hotel is right next to the theme park, so it is an easy walk, and parking in included in the price.  There is a shuttle to Disneyland (about 5 miles away) and, as I recall, to other locations, but I did not use it. It's very convenient and reasonably priced for those staying in the area. For those with small children, there is a Snoopy themed floor. The wi fi was very good.

We loved staying at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel.  The hotel was very clean and affordable.  The convenience to the park is wonderful too.  This was a last minute decision to stay at this hotel and I luckily found a groupon that made it much more affordable.  We have stayed there twice and both times very impressed with the cleanliness.  The kids loved having a picture with snoopy who was downstairs at breakfast time.  We didn't eat at the restaurant because the line was very long at breakfast and the prices seemed very high for very little so we just drove a couple blocks away to a Denny's.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. I am happy to learn that your stay vacation has been clean and comfortable. We look forward to hosting you and your family back with us again.  Michael Raskin - Guest Services Team Leader

Summary: First, this is a 2 and 1/2 - 3 star hotel. I am rating it in comparison to other similar hotels and not comparing it to a 5 star resort. Buena Park does not have 5 star hotels or really even a 4 star hotel, so you have to take this into consideration. Our room was clean and large. We had a king size room and there was plenty of space for our two child sized air mattresses and a playard/crib for the three kids. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. This was challenging with a 1 year old. We were told we would need to pay $20/stay for these amenities. Since we were only staying one night it wasn't worth it to us. This is an amenity I would expect at a 3 star hotel and why I can't give it 5 stars. The staff we encountered, really only at check in, were very pleasant.

This is a standard hotel like all others, the rooms are the same as other hotels. The staff here are friendly and helpful. Snoopy was there every morning and night. You also get discount for Knotts berry farm tickets for staying here.

I've never written a review before. I never thought it was really necessary, but this time I feel like I really need to help anyone thinking about staying at this hotel. It's truly horrible. The room is really filthy. My husband, who was sinusites is really suffering. When we touch the blankets we can fill all the dust. The room is really small also.   The staff is a whole another story. First, they lie! Be careful! I was told that they had discounted tickets for Disneyland and when I went to buy it they didn't have it anymore! How weird is that? The front desk receptionist didn't care about my concerns. When I told her that our room was really bad her answer was: "I'm sorry for that". And that was it. Nothing else… She didn't even want to know why was the room so bad!!! Or
Manager Response: Thank for your reviewing our property this back November. This is an unacceptable experience and extremely uncommon for our property as you can see from the feedback of our other travelers.  There is no excuse for cleanliness issues or an apathetic response from our staff. I apologize for the delay in my response but if you are interested in discussing your experience further please feel free to contact me directly via email or phone. Thank you again for staying with us and I hope we have an opportunity to rebuild your perception of our property in the future.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com or 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Would stay again if I go to that area in the future.
Summary: Front desk couldn't find my reservation and it took them about 30 minutes to find it, but they were very assuring. The hallways looked a bit creep but the rooms were nice and looked updated. The only thing wrong with the room was that the vent in the bathroom didn't work. Other than that I was pretty satisfied with my stay with them.

The hotel is perfectly located and a short three minute walk to Knott's Berry Farm.  The hotel was clean and the staff professional.  Our beds were comfortable and furnishings relatively new.  The TV was rather fuzzy, but internet worked well.    The pool was nice.  Soaking in the hot-tub after a long day in the park was a bonus.  I wasn't planning to stay here, but hotwire dropped us in this hotel on a rate of about half of what we were quoted by the front desk on a veteran's special.    We upgraded to a Camp Snoopy room.  Fun room with nightly tuck ins from Snoopy.  All in all, a great stay.  The onsite restaurant has very good food and excellent service.  Don't forget to bring your room key or print a coupon online for free kids meals and/or 20% off.

Absolutely amazing place. Well California in general.   We stayed at this hotel for the first 3 nights of the holiday before moving onto Vegas for Halloween, then we returned back to Knotts for the rest of the holiday.   Very, very easy to get to. Smack in the middle of everything in my opinion - about the same distance to get anywhere we were going. We were about a 40 minute drive from Los Angeles, an hour from San Diego (unfortunately never went to), jus the convenience of the hotel is awesome.   As soon as we got there (after battling through the traffic... if you've never been to Los Angeles, be warned!!) the staff were so friendly and informative and had a good laugh with us about our hair on our forms of I.D. The hotel is a good size and rooms are spacious enough even for

We have stayed here four times this year and have two more trips planned. We have had rooms on both sides of the hotel all were quiet. If you have yearly passes to KBF you get a discount at the hotel and the restaurant. Parking is included (we recently had to pay $40 a day to park at a hotel in San Diego in addition to the $265 a night for the room) we arrived at the hotel at 9am and they gave us a parking pass, we were checked in parked the car and went to Mrs. Knotts for breakfast then to ghost town until we got a text from the hotel that our room was ready.  Dinner at Amber waves was great as usual.  The staff is the best thing about the hotel and KBF, they were all wonderful.  Room Tip: book in advance I have seen weekends in May, July and Oct. when hotel was full.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your past stays with us. I am happy to learn our staff and the amenities of the hotel and Knott's Berry Farm are enjoyable for your family. We are happy to be able to host you, and looking forward to having you back again in the future.  Michael Raskin - Guest Services Team Leader

Summary: We stayed overnight so as to take advantage of the free entry to the Knotts Berry Farm Amusement Park on Veterans Day. The hotel was easy to find and there was plenty of parking which was available until midnight the following day. The entry to the park was just a short walk away. The staff was very cordial and helpful and our room, on the seventh floor, was great. We did have a simple breakfast in the Amber Waves restaurant in the hotel and it was just find. It was a good choice and we would stay there again.

Booked this resort through Priceline & was very happy with this resort & would stay here again. Was worth every penny we paid. Close to Knotts Berry walking distance. Close to restaurants ideal location.

I 've been staying at the hotel for several years for the annual Halloween haunt.I enjoy staying here very much.The rooms have always been pleasant.Will be coming back in the near future.The pool is a big plus .

First time staying at the Knott's Hotel.  We bought the Haunted Dreams package and it was so worth it.  Myself, my hubby and 14-year old son stayed in a king room.  We brought our own full-sized aerobed and the staff at the hotel did not hesitate to provide extra bedding/pillows and sheets.  The package also came with: dinner with the monsters, a nice full breakfast, entrance to the park a 1/2 hour earlier, and t-shirts!  The 1/2 hour early entrance in to the park was so worth it! My son and I sat "dead" front on Accelerator lol!  We also rode Supreme Scream twice, without having to get off and get back in line because there was none! Oh, and the bar at the hotel will allow you to take your drinks to your room as they will put it in a nice sized plastic cup for you to do so.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your hotel stay with us. I am happy to learn that our Haunted Dreams package was a good package for you and your family. We do our best to provide the best value deals each year, especially for our annual Knott's Scary Farm. We look forward to hosting you back with us next year!  Thank you,  Michael Raskin - Guest Services Team Leader

Summary: We had a absolute blast....we go every year!!!! #HauntHoodlums2014  The rooms were clean..staff was helpful...the Haunt was awesome...can not wait until next year....The only downfall prices for packages are up...but still a blast.

Summary Heading: Halloween at Knotts with the Kids
Summary: We stayed recently at the Knotts Berry Farm hotel. I stayed with my 3 small children and my mother. What I would say is that the room itself was adequate, it was smallish and the tub small and dated (and the plug didn't work well at all). However, those are the only things that could be even potentially negative (and I would argue that they are about the same size as Disney hotels).  Other than the room, there are many things that I loved about the hotel. We got there really early but my little son was ill. Even though the night before the hotel had been sold out, the front desk had our room cleaned very quickly and allowed up to check in early. The front desk and lobby area was beautiful and welcoming. The front desk staff was polite and attentive and accommodated all of our

Booked the Gruesome Package and it did not disappoint!!!  We arrived earlier than expected as we drove in from out of state and Knotts was completely accommodating.  They succeeded in getting us a room an hour earlier than posted check in.  Our dinner Boo-fet was great and fun.  All staff were professional and very helpful with all of our questions, this includes the room maids!!  I also like that we could take our time in the morning since we didn't have to check out until 12.  After breakfast at the hotel we were allowed time to shop the near by stores.  This was not our first time here and will def will not be our last!!

accussed of smoking in room and charged 300 dollars totally pressured into saying we smoked in the room or get thrown out first asked how much cash we had on us like we could just pay them off then was told if we did not admit to smoking we would be thrown out

Staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. As soon as you walk in the entrance, staff are smiling and waiting to assist. The rooms were clean and nice. There was a big event, Halloween Haunt and there was some excitement in the hallway but we were all there for the same reason. Great place.

Been planning this trip for a while. Called up the hotel, they were very nice and were able to answer all my questions. I bought the Knotts Scary Farm package deal, hotel stay, 2 park tickets, dinner for two, and breakfast, 2 T-shirts. Every staff member was extremely nice and helpful. I was able to check in early. I would not stay at any other hotel, if i were going to Knotts Berry Farm park.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your hotel stay with us. I am happy to learn that our staff was accommodating and informative for all your questions and needs throughout your stay. We look forward to hosting you and your family again, should your travels bring you to our area.  Thank you,  Michael Raskin - Guest Services Team Leader

Summary: The rides are excellent and plantiful, the staf are so friendly. Far more for your buck than the other theme parks. It will be our plesure to go back. The hotel has a fantastic pool and snoopy visits the kids at night, now cool is that.

Summary Heading: Clean, Courteous and Convenient for a Knott's Scary Farm Stay
Summary: We stayed here to participate in the Knott's Scary Farm Event on Halloween Night. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised at the level of professionalism this hotel gave guests. I was expecting a worn out hotel with lackluster service. I couldn't be more wrong. I had purchased a hotel stay and Knott's Scary Farm tickets online. I would have to offer that I am a mature person acquainted with how hotels charge your credit card. On the website, the hotel's policy is clearly spelled out and we were prepared for the 3 days before your stay the credit card you posted would be charged. Be sure you are acquainted with the fine print to avoid confusion. Nearly all of the couples at the registration desk were going ballistic because they failed to adequately prepare for this

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Especially for Knotts Scary Farm
Summary: Great place to stay especially for knotts scary farm! Friendly staff and quick check in. Love the rooms. The room service and maids were on it as far as keeping the rooms cleaned and customer service. Another cool thing is that check out is at noon which is rare in this area.  Great hotel!

It's the most average standard hotel I've even been in, and considering the location and the price, it's well worth it. There is nothing special about the place, but nothing bad about it either, and considering that I can be so close to all the touristy stuff in the area (Knott's, Disney, etc. etc. etc.) it's astounding that I can get a room here so cheap.

Everyone was very helpful and friendly.The room was clean and very comfortable.Dinner and the breakfast was delicious.I had an amazing stay.I would definitely recommend it.Already planning my next visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay at our hotel. We are very happy to learn that everything from your room, to our staff, as well as the restaurant was an enjoyable experience. We look forward to hosting you again on your next visit.  Thank you,  Michael Raskin - Guest Services Team Leader

Summary: We have been visiting knotts since I was a child. It's convenient to stay at the hotel and walk to the park. It's price is same as competition and you usually get more! Like a great breakfast!  I just like the rooms at the hotel are clean and comfortable!
