We were able to fit a roll away bed and a full size air mattress and still had room to spare. Our room was on the 7th floor facing the pool. We are used to sleeping with the noise of a fan so we brought our big fan and it drowned out the outside noises.

Summary Heading: Short Walk To The Park Entrance
Summary: A short walk through the parking lot, under the roller coaster, past the chicken dinner restaurant and gift shops to the main entrance of the park makes this a great place to stay. We have stayed here a few times. During the Christmas Holidays the park has their Christmas Craft Fair which is a great way to kick off the season with the opportunity to find wonderful hand made items for gifts or your home. The Crafts Fair converts the Ghost Town and offers free admission to the public Monday through Thursday. During other times of the year this resort hotel is a convenient way to attend the park with the your accommodations so close to go back to take a nap or pick up forgotten items in the middle of the day, then go back for more fun. At the end of the day it is quick and easy to

Summary Heading: Excellent value and better than expected standard
Summary: Stayed last week for 2nights- loved the room and brilliant location for the theme park- excellent value for cost- will stay here next time we visit disney rather than staying in hotels closer to disney. 5yr old son loved the pool and water fun area.

We had a great time at knottsberry farm. We stayed at the Knottsberry farm hotel. Can't wait to visit again.  The weather was perfect not too hot. Prices on souvenirs were reasonable. My daughters took pictures with the characters and didn't have to wait in long lines to do so.

A good an economic option to enjoy your visit to LA. Near everyplace and a lot of fun or your children!!! Good restaurant and bar. Very friendship people but need to work hard about the cleanning in the room and toilet... Good service un general...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property this past March. While I am pleased to see that your overall experience was pleasant I was not satisfied by the quality of cleanliness that you received. I have shared your feedback with our Housekeeping team in hopes that we can improve on these areas in the future. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: Had another great stay at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Everything was as expected. Such a great stay we have already booked another stay in May. Thank you so much.

Our group returned here after having such a great time last time. We did the stay/play deal and got 2 nights at the hotel and a day at the park for a very good price. The rooms and lobby are very clean. They are basic hotel rooms that have all you need. Not super modern/updated, but the beds are comfortable and it is very clean! The entire staff was SO NICE! They are genuine, welcoming, inviting, and laid back. It really felt hospitable in a bed & breakfast kind of way. They have a nice pool area and hot tub as well. It is about a 4 minute walk to the park, as well as their shops, restaurants, bakery, Cinnabon, and a TGI Friday's. We ate at the Amber Waves restaurant last time and it was good. The grounds are extremely clean, and everyone is very friendly. Free parking and free

Summary Heading: Fantastic if u like adventure parks or are travelling with children or teenagers.
Summary: This is a feel good hotel targetted at families with kids and teenagers and people who love theme parks, if also one that comes across as pretty no frills. The bathroom is really tiny, as with their bath tub and there is no fridge in the room. The lobby also has this unpleasant smell all the time and WiFi is often very splotchy and goes down completely at times. The pillows they use also tend to be very deflated. Seriously Knott's? Am sure you can afford to give people better pillows! Now for the good parts. The food at the restaurant Amber waves right at the lobby of the hotel serves great food, in particular great soups and pizzas. The famous Mrs Knott's fried chicken and pot pies round the corner of the hotel r also very good. Didn't get a chance to experience the theme park

Checked in on Sunday my room is ready! got the second floor bedroom and my view was the courtyard it was beautiful specially at night with all the little lights on. I ordered room service for breakfast 2 order of the Denver omelet and a continental price is very reasonable.  I just have to add this that you have to bring your own conditioner they didn't have conditioner and I have a very thick hair which makes it hard to fix.  But other than that it's all good!

GOOD for-- access to Knotts Berry farm cheap no parking charge (if you can find a parking spot) no internet charge helpful staff if your kids are into snoopy clean   BAD for -- cigarette smell in room (even though they claim the hotel has been smoke free for 3 years!) flaky internet access the whole hotel needs updating food in restaurant is limited and expensive - (go to Dennys down the road instead)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. While I appreciate your kind words regarding the level of overall convenience and staff helpfulness I do apologize for the smell of smoke and poor internet. We have been making great strides to crack down on people who unlawfully smoke in our property and feel that this occurrence is significantly more limited than in the past. We had also added many cost saving options in our restaurant and an option for a faster internet service at a small fee. Thank you again for your business and we hope to see you again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: We booked for the half term in Feb, we read the reviews and were unsure about our booking but decided to book anyway. we arrived quite late in the evening and were checked in efficiently. We were pleased with our adjoining rooms as we had asked for. they seemed clean and spacious if a little old fashioned.  The hotel wasn't busy but it seemed everyone was on the 4th floor with us.   We could not fault the cleanliness of the hotel, everyday we saw maids cleaning all areas of the hotel including windows, doors and walls. the pool area was clean and the laundry area was too.  All the staff we had contact with were pleasant and helpful.  We had to pay $4 a day parking which I was surprised about.   The location was excellent with lots of things in walking distance and the park was

This was our second time here. The hotel prices for the stay are good. The parking is included (at least it was in the price we got). The problem is that there is not a microwave around. Not even one the guests can share. I have lactose intolerance, travel with my milk and my own oatmeal. Needed a microwave and there was none to be found. The kitchen has a no outside food policy, which is fine, but, what about guests who have baby bottles to warm up? The room was a little dirty and felt damp. Aside from that, a very basic option if you are going to the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued loyalty to our hotel. I apologize for the inconvenience that you experienced regarding the lack of microwave availability. While I understand that this can be frustrating it was a decision that was made as part of our ‘Going Green’ effort that the local area is participating in. The ‘dirty, damp’ feeling that you had in the room is completely unacceptable and unlike what our guests are used to experiencing from us. I have shared your feedback with our Housekeeping Leadership team with the goal of a more consistent inspection process so that you or any other future guest does not have a similar experience. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary Heading: Better than I expected, very pleased!
Summary: Stayed 5 nights here and we read the mixed reviews and made a decision to try this Hotel anyways. Check in was fast and we were able to check in early at 2pm with no issues. Parking was plentiful and always found a spot. Room was on 5th floor, nothing fancy, but clean and comfy. Small bathroom with low ceiling, 2 beds that were comfy. Again not the Ritz, but doesn't pretend to be either. For what we paid per night, we were more than happy. You can walk out the back of hotel and be at Knott's Berry Farm Park in 2 minutes. Snoopy was always around at scheduled times in the lobby area of the hotel or Amber Waves restaurant (excellent food). Hotel is across the street from a Gas Station and just 2 min walk from a Walgreens, lots more shops/restaurants/bars/stores are within 2 mile

There's absolutely nothing special about this hotel. The hotel has a beautiful lobby, chandelier, sitting area and it is impeccably clean. I was checked in to room 342, the very last room on the floor right next to an exit door. Upon entering my room I was taken aback at the size of the room. I have never, ever, stayed in such a small room, and when I say "small" I mean "small." There was a chair lodged between the window, the bed, and the nightstand, and I kept bumping into it as there is really no room for it in the room. I had asked for a king bed, but was told that all the rooms with king beds were booked, so I was given a tiny room with a queen bed and only one night stand.  The balconies are just for show as there is no balcony to speak of. The so-called balconies are just
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and leaving a review about your experience. I would like to begin with an apology for what was clearly not up to our brand standards. While I was pleased that you enjoyed the décor I can agree that the room that you stayed in was definitely a smaller than average space. There are very few of this room type available at our property and they are designed to give a significantly discounted option for those guests who do not plan to be in their room to often. While this design does allow for guests to stay at our property who otherwise would not be able to it also can create a frustration for those guests like yourself who find themselves there only due to a sellout of the larger options. We are very careful to ensure that the balconies that you speak of are not advertised anywhere as being for guest use as they are only there to provide a safety resource for the engineers who conduct maintenance on the AC units in the rooms. With that being said from your comments I assume that this room was in need of such maintenance which I will verify has been conducted since your visit. I am not aware of an issue with the internet although I will also follow up with that provider to ensure that we have a consistent signal throughout the property. I greatly appreciate your detailed feedback and thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I hope that you stay with us again and experience the positive visit that most of our loyal guests have grown accustom too. Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: We originally booked at the Lemon Tree, but after getting scared off by reviews, I re-booked here since we were going to Knotts berry farm all the way from Ohio.  We were very impressed!  The rooms were exceptionally clean, up-to-date and reminded me of a Sheraton.  The lobby is very pretty and large.  The pool was very big.  We only had to walk 4 minutes and we were in the park, amazing.  After a long day, it was nice to walk back and not have to buckle up in the car.  One thing I really liked was the landscaping....it was so manicured!  We got a heck of deal on the room price, maybe because it was February??  We were on the third floor and overlooked a court yard with huge palm trees out our window....very nice view to wake up to!  Snoopy was in the lobby and our 3 kids liked

Summary Heading: Close to park but nothing special
Summary: We stayed here for its location close to Knotts Berry Farm. Rooms were older but large and clean. Other then the park there was not really much around the hotel to do or places to eat. There is a ok restaurant in hotel & TGIFridays was close but we found both of them to be overpriced. Good if you just want a hotel close to Knotts Berry, if you want to go anywhere else you will need a car as there is not much for restaurants/stuff to do in area.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to leave a review. I am very pleased to inform you that we are conducting a very large renovation so that your next visit will find a much more modern and updated experience. The restaurant Amber Waves that you mentioned in our hotel lobby has also updated their menu and changes management which promised to enhance that experience as well! Thanks again!

Summary: Very helpful front desk staff. Rooms were older and small but it was clean and comfortable which is the important part. Seeing Snoopy walking around was an added bonus. It can't be any more convenient for visiting the amusement park. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Restaurant on site was nice and food was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty to our property. I am pleased to inform you that we have be working on a very large renovation to our property so that your next visit will be even better! Thank you again for staying and taking the time to leave a review! Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: have stayed here many times over the years and feel sometimes this hotel does get a hard time  again its not the ritz  ... but then your not paying those prices ..I feel for the price we paid we had a clean comfortable friendly stay .  we had a refurbished room on the 8th floor  which had new carpet and furniture nice flat screen tv  housekeeping daily was excellent ... and much softer comfier bed than our previous stay .  front desk and check in was excellent , found all the staff friendly and courteous   restaurant : this is very hit & miss  if your not on the  breakfast buffet rate I felt like the staff weren't interested , even the basics were missed , we ate there 3 evenings too again very hit and miss one evening was good , thanksgiving evening was a disaster !! we waited

Summary Heading: Loved staying at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel!!
Summary: While visiting California for the BCS Championship game, we ended our trip with one day at Knotts and one day Disneyland. It was so convenient to both parks to stay at Knotts Hotel. A bonus was that Knotts offered a free shuttle to Disney, which we were unaware of prior to our arrival. We soon found out that taking this shuttle saved us $18 in parking fees!  We reserved the shuttle and it was very timely and efficient. In addition, we saved a lot of money by purchasing the Classic vacation package online prior to our trip. This package included the hotel rooom, hotel parking, breakfast buffet for everyone in our party and our tickets. Very reasonable price.   We found our hotel room to be very clean and the beds were comfy. Everything worked as it should. The breakfast buffets

I would like to start off by saying the greeting that we got from Peter the front desk agent was exceptional. He showed such great emphasis when giving us details about or stay prior to check in. Although many guest came up to ask questions he was so polite and having them wait while he assisted us. Seems like he really enjoyed his job and went out of his way for us even though he didn't know us.  He made us feel like we where his first priority which is a plus in my eyes. The classic package is great tickets, breakfast, parking all included for such a great deal plus our children ate for free which Peter mention to us to save us a little money. The park is a very short walk from the hotel which is very convenient. The rooms are a little dated but what they lack in appearance

Summary Heading: We celebrated New Years Eve with Snoopy and the gang!
Summary: We had an amazing New Year's Eve at Knott's Berry Farm! The hotel was clean and had great amenities. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were able to get into our room early which was a big help having flown in from Seattle very early in the morning with three young children! The hotel is just a short walk from the park which made it very convenient to take a nap break during the day. The hotel restaurant was very nice and we were given a free meal for the kids. Snoopy comes to the lobby to meet children and take photos which was a thrill, especially for our 2 year old. I was unsure of the offerings of the park for young children having seen the huge roller coasters but I was very pleased to find something for everyone in our family to enjoy! Our only regret was

Stayed here for 5 nights what a wonderful hotel staff very friendly would stay here again .my only complaint and not the hotels fault EWT (World Travel Australia what can I say noise and the girls how rude and disrespectful they was .but not the hotels fault and would come again

I booked a package for 2 nights from Dec 30 till Jan 1 to celebrate New Years. I wad told all they had available was their "deluxe" "upgraded" rooms for $300 a night.  My definition of upgrade and deluxe obviously differs from theirs.   The room was bigger than a standard room. It had a makeshift wetbar and some counter thing that looked like it was made in someone's back yard probably something salvaged from someone's home remodel. It was awful.   The mini fridge was useless, it didn't keep anything cold. Luckily I brought a cooler!!  The room smelled awful. Mildew/body odor/farts/smoke  The bathroom was basic... But get this ... there is no fan in the bathroom! I thought that was standard in every hotel! The shower was awful, its like taking an RV shower. No water pressure at
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and share your experience. While this experience is clearly not up to your and our standards it is extremely helpful for us as we work towards our goals of increased guest satisfaction. I am unaware of any ‘makeshift wetbars’ in our rooms but I will certainly address the quality of the products being used when designing these add-ons to be sure they are projecting a higher quality. The odor you experienced was unfortunately found to be an area wide sewer issue that has since been corrected so I assure you that you will not experience anything like this in the future. The issues with the television and refrigerator are both unacceptable and extremely uncommon as both of those amenities are inspected daily to ensure the highest quality. While your review is extremely helpful for us from a maintenance and training stand point it does not take away from that fact that you had a very uncharacteristically bad visit to our property. My team and I take this type of information very seriously and offer the most sincere apology. If you are interested in discussing this experience further please feel free to contact me directly at your earliest convenince. Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: We stayed here for the convenience of taking our 7 year old son to Knotts Berry Farm and just staying the night.  Regardless of the parking convenience,  I would have driven hours to go home in traffic or stayed in Huntington Beach or elsewhere in Orange County.    This hotel is nothing more than a larger scale Motel 6.  It is old, worn and simply dirty.  We were so disgusted that we could not shower there and drove home the next day excited to shower in our home!  The clientele does not leave much to the imagination either!  I get the "heebie jeebies (sp?")) thinking about the place!  I was so concerned that I called a friend from our room that night and she referred me to the bedbug registry.com to check for bed bugs!  Thank God we did not find any - ugghhh.  The hallways
Manager Response: Please allow me to begin with a sincere apology for both the experience that you had with us and the delay in my response. I am embarrassed to learn that your visit to our property left you with such a negative perception. I assure you that your experience does not even resemble that of what our guests are used receiving from our brand. I am pleased to inform you that since your visit our hotel has been continuing our renovations and many areas have been completely redone with an entire renovation set to complete within the year. That does not take away from what was clearly an unsatisfactory experience with us last year. I understand your hesitation to stay again although I feel very confident that any future visit would only further demonstrate our goals of guests satisfaction and drastically change your perception of our hotel. Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Great stay except bathrooms need to be updated and our room smelt like mildew carpet. When we turned air on it smelled nasty also. Had the buffet breakfast both days of our stay. It is nothing special. I expected a little more for the price we paid. I've had better breakfasts that WERE included in hotel stay. We won't be eating there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us last December and taking the time to complete a review about your experience. While I am glad the overall experience was pleasant I do apologize for the quality of the restroom. We have since corrected an area wide plumbing issue that was causing a foul odor in some of our rooms so I assure you that this is not something your should expect from us in the future. The frustration with the breakfast buffet options is surprising as this is not something we find to be an issue often. We are always interested in ways to improve the presentation and satisfaction with our products so please feel free to contact me directly if you are interested in sharing any options that you would like to see to increase the value of the buffet. Either way we appreciate your feedback and thank you for your business. Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: We are on a cruise to Mexico over Christmas. As a bonus we flew into LAX a day early for a Knotts adventure. We made our reservation in September and the person who booked the trip also was at the reception desk. Amazingly he remember the reservation. Rodney also noticed I was a military member and updated our rate and made recommendation on how to save money on tickets. We arrived at 1100 in the morning and the hotel checked us in, held our bags and sent a text when the room was ready. That evening we received a follow up call about service which was refreshing. Though our stay was a "touch and go" Rodney and the staff were attentive and saved us a few dollars. Amazing considering the place was crazy busy with holiday travelers.

We stayed on a Thursday night during Knotts Merry Farm. We visited the Calico Christmas at Knotts on Thursday night (free admission). Then went to Knotts Merry Farm all day on Friday. The park was empty and there were no waits on any of the rides. We were able to leave our car in the lot until midnight the day we checked out, so that was nice to have a spot to park so close. We were able to take our coats to the car in the middle of the day, etc. and not pay for a locker. The bummer for others with this deal is that when we went to leave the whole lot was full and people were desparately circling for a spot.   As for the hotel itself. It is is need of some updating. It was very much like a Motel 6. No fancy amenities. The in-room safe was about the size of a small book, so our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. While many elements of your experience we positive I was definitely not satisfied with what seems to be a poorly maintained and serviced room. I assure that this is not what you should expect from our property moving forward. I have spoken with both our Executive Housekeeper and Chief Engineer in hopes that we are able to fix these issues as soon as possible. We take this information very seriously and hope to use it to better our overall guest experience. If you are willing to elaborate a bit more about your experience please call or email directly so I can learn more about the nature and specific location of the issue. Thank you again! Stephen Ruggiero Front Office Manager, 714-243-2006 or Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com

Summary: Affordable and great location.  Room was modern and clean, nothing fancy.  Bathroom was clean, but could use update. With small children being able to walk back to our room so easily was great.  No problems during our stay.

We loved this place! Prices were decent to get in but very expensive to get anything inside.  We paid over $11 for 2 slushies! The rides were very fun and the staff were very friendly! They even had a reenactment of the old western days.  Very neat!

Summary Heading: Great place next to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: Stayed for Halloween Haunt 2013. Great value if you book it with their stay and scare package. We received t- shirts, dinner, breakfast, and early entry to the Halloween Haunt with the price. Pool area was nice and the gym was a good size.  Bar and restaurant inside hotel was nice. Only complaint they needed fluffier pillows.

We stayed for a Friday night, going into a Saturday, which we spent in the park.  The staff was extraordinarily friendly and my daughter loved seeing Snoopy walking around the hotel.  They offered a terrific miltary rate for the room that also included a breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant and bar.  With the little time we spent in the room, the children were easily entertained between the pool/hot tub and the basketball court. They also allowed us to remain parked in the hotel parking lot on Saturday while we were in the Knott's Berry Farm park, saving us a parking fee.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and I would certainly stay there again.

This is a pretty good place to stay in general.  Rooms were clean and well appointed for the price, and the staff friendly.  Though, we stay there (about 6 times now) for the location to the park.  For a package deal there is a discount into the park, free parking, and right next door...so easy walking distance.  I recommend this place if you are going to Knott's Berry Farm.

Had a great time! definitely the way to go to attend Knotts Scary Farm. Pre registered early, got discounted day passes to the park, free parking, and received a text when our room was ready. The staff is excellent and friendly. The decorated restaurant for the included dinner had the right ambiance and we got free t-shirts to commemorate the event as well. I would completely recommend staying here at any time!

Stayed for my daughters birthday!! Everything was wonderful!! Arrived early and was able to pre register and they texted me when our room was ready! Our room was very clean and spacious! We stayed in the oversized double queen room! Rollaway was in the room as asked at check in! Staff was all very pleasant.  We saw snoopy around the hotel both days which was amazing!!  Check out was easy, the only thing that was strange is that checkout is at noon but they deactivate the room key at 11.  The maid kindly let us back in so we could pack up our things.  All in all is was a fabulous experience and I can't wait to go back and do it again!!

I gave this hotel a 4 star because of the condition of Hotel.  Rooms need to be renovated. But at least they are clean and comfortable. The staff is great and the room and extras for the price, just can't be beat! You get room, dinner,breakfast,parking and entrance to Knott's  scary farm for one low price. Believe me when I say if you priced this all separate it would cost you $$$$. Also if you plan on drinking its a great excuse to stay the night. My husband and I come every year for our anniversary!  Thank you again to the front desk staff for being so great :)

Summary Heading: all in all it was a very pleasant visit I always have a good time when I stayed the Knotts Berry Farm hotel.
Summary: is very very good just stay thereit was a very very very pleasant stay the all the employees were very sweet and nice to us dinner was good breakfast was good whenever I go to the haunt I try to stay at the hotel I really like that hotel the room was very comfortable two bed really really needed one but it was very very wonderful

Summary Heading: Staying at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel was a great experience!
Summary: We got the Knott's Scary Farm bundle deal, this is definitely the way to go. At check in to the hotel, the staff was great, they were very friendly and comforting. Than we had dinner at a restaurant in the hotel, food was excellent!  We walked over to the theme park and had an awesome time. This is definitely the way we are going to go to Knott's Scary Farm next year. It's not expensive and you definitely get your moneys worth.

I had a blast everyone was so helpful. The room was Nice I had a great view.front deslot so was so helpful with the questions we had. And I loved that we were close walking distance to knotts Berry farm that was the best part. The next day we didn't want to leave but before we did we had a great breakfast which was amazing i prolly ate to much too but it was all really good. I look forward to staying there again hopefully it will be soon.

In my opinion it is a very nice hotel.  It is located right next to the park so it is only a short walk. Most of the staff were very friendly. The dinner we had was very good however the breakfast could have been better.  We stayed for the Halloween haunt. We will come back next year.

Summary Heading: I loved Knotts Scary Farm and want to go back every year
Summary: I would recommend Knotts Berry Farm any time of the year it is relaxing and exciting. I personally would like to go back at least twice a year or more. My family had such a good time at Knotts Scary Farm

Summary Heading: Best hotel stay in a very long time
Summary: First Class service from upon  entering parking lot, greeted at entry first drove in ,greeted as entering hotel lobby,service desk and check in went prefect,room very neat,and tidy cleaning service was excellent!!!

My wife and I used to drive home after going to Knott's Scary Farm. Then we found out the hotel has a great package that includes tickets, a great dinner and a great breakfast (if you aren't too hungover, like I was.) Getting the package makes picking up your Scary Farm tickets extremely easy AND you get to go in 30 minutes before everyone else.

EVERY employee I encountered was great! The parking attendant, the front desk staff, the dinner buffet staff, the breakfast buffet staff, the bar staff, everyone. The hotel check in was very busy but no one was rushed.I think that the extra time the front desk clerk takes to explain everything in detail actually makes the check in smoother and go faster because you don't have to spend time asking a lot of questions. The food, both dinner and breakfast, was very good. I have stayed at many hotels, and this is the first one where everything exceeded my expectations! I will be back, and recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in the area. Thank you!

Let me start by saying I wrote to the management of this hotel over a week ago & still have not gotten a response from them. So, any response they may post on this review is worthless. They had the chance to "make it right" with me, but failed to do so.  Immediately upon exiting the elevator at this hotel, we were met with a sour, nasty smell in the hallway. It smelled like dirty, wet carpet. The rooms are old and in poor repair.   The shower in our room was the WORST I have ever encountered in a hotel and that's saying something, because I stay in hotels extremely frequently. The water pressure was so poor that I could barley rinse the soap off of my body. My girlfriend had the same problem. A maintenance person came to the room while we were away, but that had no effect. The
Manager Response: Please let me begin by offering a sincere apology for what seems to be a very negative experience with us. While I am in no way attempting to justify the issues you experienced, it is extremely unique for me to just be finding out about the situation in this forum. As you can see from many guests before you it is extremely uncommon for our guests to leave our property with this feeling and I assure you we take it very seriously. While I understand that you have made attempts already I am not sure who you have spoken with. If you have a moment please contact me directly at 714-243-2006 so that I may learn more about the situation in hopes of correcting the issues moving forward. Thank you for your business and again I apologize for the extremely unique frustrations you have experienced at our property. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: My Daughters and I arrived at the Hotel on October 30, 2013 to celebrate my Daughters 18th bday, we were greeted by the front desk people and were very Warm an friendly. We found our room clean and quiet. Although the beds were a little hard i still slept like a baby. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will be returning again soon. Thank you to the staff for making our trip memorable!

Summary Heading: The best place to stay if you are going to the Halloween Haunt!!
Summary: The price is moderate, amenities are pretty good, but the best reason to stay here is the convenience to Knott's Scary Farm!!  Just a few minutes walk to the entrance of Knott's Berry/Scary Farm.  We had to pay $20 to get a refrigerator in or our room, but that was okay.  We got a pretty good package deal when we called in to to reserve our room - room, admission to the Haunt and parking.  The room and linens were clean and location was quiet.  The beds were a little hard, but overall, it was a great stay!

Summary Heading: Have an excellent adventure at Knotts Berry Farm.
Summary: I hadn't visited Knotts Berry Farm in over two decades and from my last visit on October 13th 2013. I will tell you, Knotts Berry Farm has raised the bar with live entertainment and new thrill rides that will excite you. Affordable hotel room rates for rooms that are clean, comfortable, and all the amenities that you just can't beat for a price you'll love. My adventurous appetites? I got everything I wanted and more all at one place. I'll be making Knotts Berry Farm my next vacation destination again and again. Maybe you should try it too.

We take our family to Knott's Halloween Haunt every year.  We look forward to being greeted by all of the staff:  Miss Edith at the guard house, Miss Jeanet, Mr. Stephen, and Mr. Peter, all greet us as honored and expected guests.   The rooms are always clean, tidy, and fresh.  After closing down the Haunt we look forward to the cool sheets and comfortable beds. The breakfast at Amber waves is worth getting up for, even though we have a Haunt Hangover.  Free flowing orange juice and superb coffee offset any lingering hauntings.   What would I change?  We are not fond of the food served at the pre-scare Monster Dinner.  We would prefer either food brought in from Mrs. Knott's Chicken Dinner Restaurant or a voucher to Mrs. Knott’s restaurant. We are already saving and planning for

We stayed in the hotel and my daughter and her husband went to the scary farm while I stayed with my 4 year old grandson.  The staff at the hotel was fantastic!  My grandson and I chose to take our meal back to our hotel room, too many monsters running around the lobby.  One of your staff carried our beverages back to our hotel room as I had my hands full with a  4 year old and our dinner. My grandson, as well as myself, loved the pool area.

We went for the knotts haunt. I only went because a friend talked us into it and the hotel was part of the package! Very convenient, clean, good food, clean rooms, great pool and a cool little water park for kids. Service at the front desk was awesome. Even though a line was behind us at check in, Jeanette at the front desk took the time we needed to check in with a smile and great sense if humor! I will go back just for a staycation w my kids!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit and for taking the time to leave us a review. I was pleased to learn that our staff made such an impact on your visit. I have also recognized Jeanet for her specific efforts in our recent staff meeting. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you soon!  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Fun and close to home getaway!
Summary: We were completely satisfied with our experience at the hotel and park. The staff is well trained, courteous and hard working. They ensured that our visit was easy and pleasant.  We live in Southern California only 45 minutes away and I would do this again. We spent the day in the park and had lunch in our room. After spending the day in the park, we went to the pool and played in the pool until 11:00 pm. It was the perfect day. The kids were happy and so we're we.

Summary Heading: Close to park, good package rates
Summary: We stayed here when we went to the haunt as we needed a place to stay close by. With the packace deals they were running for a Thursday night, we couldn't beat the price. We booked a double queen room with the bare bones package. This included the room, free parking, 2013 haunt logo key cards keepsake, admission to the park for each registered guest.  We arrived to find plenty of parking at the front of the hotel. The friendly lot attendant checked the list and told us to park t9 the right for free. Checkin went smooth and quick.   We got up to our room which was nice and clean. The beds however could be a bit better. The foundations on both were a bit wobbly.  However after a long late night in the park, they were fine for sleeping.   Would stay here again if back out for the

For the most part it is very convinet, the employes r always very nice and the price is great considering the parking, how close and free breackfeast in the morning. We never have trouble reserving our room, infact if you are a season pass holder you get a discount which we love.

Took the Kids to Knots For Knots scary farm on 10/11 .  We bought the Haunted Dreams Pack which was bought thru them,  which Includes:    -Hotel Accommodations for one night    -Knott's Halloween Haunt Admission for one evening for each registered guest    -Breakfast Buffet for one morning for each registered guest    -Access to the Pre-Scare Dinner Buffet at the Hotel for each registered guest    -Souvenir Haunt Shirt featuring this years Halloween Haunt logo for each registered guest    -Collectable Haunt Room Keys featuring this years Halloween Haunt logo    -Hotel Parking for one vehicle    - One set of lanyards with 4 Haunted pins per package   Front desk people where great at check in and answering all my questions! Also wait was very short , well staffed. No waiting in
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit and for leaving such a detailed review! I have shared this feedback with my management team to then pass to our front line employees who really do an amazing job! Our ‘Haunt’ season does make it tough to allow for late check-outs due to the amazingly high room turn over numbers and limited time to prepare for the next arriving guests. With that being said we can certainly revisit these strategies for next year. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you soon!  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: This was about our tenth haunt, but the first time that we took advantage of one of the Haunt packages. Considering that it is an older hotel, we were surprised and happy to find our room so nice and clean.  We were able to check in a little early, so had time to visit some of the shops.  Both the pre-scare dinner and the buffet breakfast were enjoyable.  There is a large pool and Jacuzzi, but there is no shade.  We are looking forward to staying there again next year.

We stayed here this past week on vacation. We were able to get two rooms where Snoopy came and visited us every night and tuck us into bed. My kids loved this. The hotel is getting older and showing age. It needs a little renovations. My only complaint is that the fire alarm went off while we were still in bed and we had to leave our room and the bathrooms need a little updates.  But the staff is friendly and we always have a great time while we ate there.

Summary Heading: The best place to eat breakfast after a night of terror at KNOTTS SCARY FARM‼️
Summary: I have been coming to knotts scary farm for the past 9 years with my wife. The haunted package is great‼️ the pre scare dinner and buffet in the morning ...... To die for ‼️ All in all great service and great times to be had for all‼️

For this being the oldest theme park around we had a lot of fun seeing shows and riding on rides. It was a lot of fun but there weren't many rides pregnant women could go on so we saw a ton of shows. It was so much fun.

I surprised my fiancé for his birthday with a stay at Knotts Hotel and tickets to the theme park. Everything was perfect from the parking to the room. The staff was very friendly towards us. After we left the theme park we walked back to our room where we relaxed then walked down to Fridays restaurant and had a nice birthday dinner with drinks. We will definitely be back again.

We were just passing thru Anaheim and looking for a reasonable place to stay. I ended up booking a 1 queen bed small room for my boyfriend and I. Staff was very friendly and helpful and I ended up booking the 'classic' package which included a breakfast buffet ($14/ person value) plus tickets to the farm and parking fees. We were up early (breakfast buffet starts as early as 6:30) and we were the first to enter the theme park (opened at 10:00am on the Wed. ). We did all the rides in under 2 hours. There were no lines and the rides themselves were just enough thrill to make it memorable. I especially liked the wooden roller coaster one. Hotel was in walking distance of the park and all in all it was a great last minute booking. The only complaint I have was the air conditioner
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit. I am very happy to learn that your overall experience with us was positive. I can imagine that the noise created by the air conditioner in the room must have been frustrating and I certainly apologize for that. We have been conducting an on-going renovation which does include updating the AC’s in the room so it is possible that your unit had not been replaced quite yet. We hope to have this project completed by spring of next year. Thank you again!  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: We stayed one night while visiting Knotts Scary Farm. We had dinner and drinks at Amber Waves Resturant in the hotel. The food aand drinks were very good. The hotel staff were very friendy. I got a great deal on the room and tickets. I must say say that I will definately be back again next year.

This was such an awesome time with my family. My grandaughter turned 12 and she had the best time. The hotel was super clean and the vist with Snoopy was memorable for us all as well as the adults . Having the tickets to the park included and the parking taken care of was really great and conveinent, the walk to the park was great and so close to where we stayed. And after the long day at the park, the pool and Jacuzzi was perfect for the adults, and the children enjoyed the pool.  And to end the night the beds were so comfortable. We  all had the best time,this was our first time. and we will be doing this again .. and it was so affordable . thanks for the memories!

We have stayed here every year for the last ten years. We love Knotts and find the ability to walk to the park worth every cent. This year we booked a Halloween package. Loved the mazes and were pleased at the lack of crowds at the park. This time we found the room a bit worse for wear. Worn door edges and blood on the curtains.  Snot on the wall by the bed and unknown substances on the side do the toilet.  We spent very little time in the room as we were off enjoying the mazes. We pointed out the room issues with the front desk as we checked out. He said they will be renovating soon starting with the Lobby ( it looked ok to us do the second floor first).
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review. While I am thrilled to learn that you enjoyed your time at Knott’s Scary Farm it is definitely unsettling that you room had so many issues. Reading your review I feel strongly that those issues are within our immediate control. If you have an opportunity to contact me directly it would greatly increase my opportunity to provide a better experience for our future guests. Either way I thank you for your business and look forward to what will hopefully continue to be an annual visit. Thanks again! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed one night while visiting Knotts Berry Farms amusement park. The hotel is walking distance from the park. The rate I got for a mid week October stay was very reasonable and the room was clean and adequate, nothing fancy. Staff was very polite and accommodating. A nice stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent visit. I am thrilled to learn that the staff was a accommodating during your stay. We are currently working on ongoing renovations throughout the entire hotel and are very excited to see the final outcome scheduled for next spring. Thanks again! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Great service and location but needs a upgrade
Summary: The service here was very wonderful and location was ver covenante but the rooms were lacking as I felt I walked into a sixes cabin .. I don't mean to be mean but it can use a upgrade .. If service is what you are looking for then it's a gem but if u are looking for a upgrade room look or feel u wouldn't stay here...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am very pleased to learn that the staff was such a positive element of your stay! We have been working on an ongoing renovation project throughout the entire hotel including the lobby, restaurant, function space and of course our guest rooms. We are pleased with the progress but are more excited for the final outcome! I expect that by your next visit you will be pleased with our new additions. Thanks again! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Good if you're just doing the theme parks
Summary: My mum and I booked for five nights in September - main purpose was to visit Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland. Obviously the location was perfect for Knott's Berry Farm, and also great for Disney (because of the complimentary shuttle to and from). Only issue we really had was the location for food & shops - as we didn't have a car. We found we had limited options within walking distance. We ended up eating at the hotel, Mrs Knotts and the theme parks, which was fine.  The staff were good, helpful and friendly - especially the team who not only dropped us back and forth from Disneyland, but also gave great advice about surrounding attractions/places to shop (even if we did need to taxi to them).   Basically a good hotel to stay at if you're keen on spending just a few days at
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your visit and found the staff to be helpful. I can see how the area is a bit too spread out if you don’t have a vehicle. There a few more options that you may not have had a chance to trip such as TGIFriday’s, Pinks, and some of the small shops along the market place like Virgina’s. Please come and see us again if you are planning a trip to our area! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed for my son's birthday everyone was so nice! Even got a special birthday surprise brought up to room, breakfast buffet in morning included and passes for Knott's Berry Farm. Clean room, 8th floor view of Soak City and Independence Hall

We have only one complaint about this hotel - the air conditioner in the room was very noisy - as it was extremely hot for the duration of our stay, we had the air con on 24/7 and the noisiness did cause some sleep disruption. The in-house restaurant is called Amber Waves where we breakfasted daily at a charge of $12 pp, good value for a buffet consisting of juices/cereals/hot foods/endless tea & coffee - we were superbly served by a Jeanette, a lovely lady who is a real asset to this hotel, nothing was too much trouble for her and she suggested various shopping malls that we would like other than very high-end ones. In addition, Amber Waves makes a very good frozen Margarita in a large glass called the "fishbowl"!! Of course, must not forget to mention that a life-size Snoopy

Back for our second stay of the year at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel.  We booked the Haunted Dreams package, which includes a night's stay at the hotel, two tickets to the Haunt, two t-shirts, dinner, breakfast, and parking.  Great package!  We arrived early and checked in, though our room was not ready until just past 3 pm.  Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful - they held our bags and gave us keys to the hotel swimming pool so we could play until our room was ready.  A word of caution: the pool is not heated, and can be extremely cold when you first step in.  But, once you're used to the temperature, it's very comfortable.  We got room 817, which faces the street.  Nice views from the window - you can see Independence Hall, and, if you know just where to look, the

We booked a weekday trip to California and Knott's Berry Farm online. Having never heard about Knott's Berry Farm Hotel I was a little skeptical about the hotel but it was actually amazing! The hotel was beautiful, clean, and the grounds were lovely! My kids enjoyed the water features and the pool, the rooms were spacious and well appointed, the restaurant was great and the prices were fair. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. It was great for the kids to see Snoopy each day we were there too! The parks were just a short (and I mean short!) walk out the back of the hotel. We have already booked our next stay at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel and this time we will add some days to Disneyland as the hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to the other park. Above all

We came to celebrate my son's Birthday.  Best Birthday Ever!! Everyone is very friendly we arrived early our room was not ready but they took our luggage & gave us our tickets. They texted us when the room was ready, it was nice of them.  The room was ready an hour & half before check-in time. We stayed in a Snoopy room Great décor.  Snoopy came at 8:20pm to tuck my son in. My son Loved it. We have Great pictures! We will do this again!!  Snoopy is in the lobby about 9:30am & 6:30pm every day for hotel guests.  TGI Friday's, Mrs. Knott's Chicken restaurant  are with walking distance. Also plenty of shopping. Hotel staff was Excellent they were very Friendly & Helpful.

Such a convenient way to spend a weekend at Knotts Berry Farm. The hotel is quiet and has great amentities. This was our third trip there and we will keep coming back. The staff is very helpful as well.

We stayed in a nonSnoopy room. The staff was friendly. The bed was uncomfortable.  The window air conditioner was hard to get the room regulated to a comfortable temperature.  The hotel is conveniently located and we were pleased with the hotel shuttle service to Disneyland as well with the exception that they did not offer one late enough to stay for the World of Color show at California Adventure.  They offer high speed Internet but charge extra for it, A Walgreen's Pharmacy is right near the hotel also if one forgets anything. Snoopy is in the lobby about 6:30 every day for hotel guests,TGIFridays, Mrs Knott's Chicken Dinner restaurant and Amber Waves are also walking distance food places, The pool is not heated but there is a heated jacuzzi and a water play area for the kids
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review. I apologize for the discomfort you experienced on the mattress but was otherwise pleased with your experience. We do have a couple of different mattress options for future bookings. Just let the agent know that you prefer a different type and we will do our best to accommodate you! Just a quick correction, the pool is heated but set to 78 degrees as part of our green initiatives to save energy. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your next visit! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Great value and a great time!!
Summary: We went here on a day trip and had a great time. Park was not very busy so we got on all 10 roller coasters quickly. We purchased tickets online as well as the souvenir cups and got free refills all day. Booking online was the way to go. Pay for parking online as well. Staff service was average. No was was too friendly. Just going through motions it seemed. We did not stay at a hotel. But definitely family and bank account friendly.

Summary Heading: Location and Staff Great...Hotel and Rooms not so much.
Summary: HAD A BLAST at Knott's Berry Farm this weekend this was our first visit and the park did not disappoint . As for the hotel the staff was Excellent they were very Friendly, helpful and attentive. The Package deal is a Great Value definitely check them out. Buffet Breakfast was good and had a late dinner from the hotel restaurant Rib Tips and fries very tasty and priced well. Overall terrific time. I would be remiss if I didn't comment on the Hotel itself it is what kept this from being an Excellent rating first off it smells moldy and really brings to your Attention how old the Hotel must be which in turn for me being a big Germaphobe was awful. Even after I did my usual re-clean and disinfecting sprays I still had a hard time It still felt Dirty. The Curtains in our room were

We booked a Snoopy room at the Knotts Berry hotel. The reviews I had read were mixed so I was a little apprehensive but from the moment we arrived the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was really nice and we enjoyed a drink at the bar. The snoopy visit to 'tuck-in' was a lot of fun. Five stars all round!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words regarding our team! We are extremely proud of this property and love our jobs so I am thrilled that this was apparent in your experience! See you soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: Thought there would be plenty to do in Buena Park that is why we decided to stay at knotts Berry but turns out unless you are just going to the theme park there is not a lot nearby. The restaurant at knotts berry was fantastic, has excellent service and was reasonably priced. Rooms were ok at the hotel but we were expecting a little more.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! I agree that Buena Park can be a bit ‘slow’ at times but I assure you it is on the rise. With new attractions popping up all over the area I expect your next visit will be even more positive! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: stayed here set 2013 for a week have to say we were very pleased wit the hotel.  The location is great the on site restaurant is brilliant and guest of hotel get 20% discount our room and a faulty shower head and the batteries needed replacing on the remote both job where completed within 1 hour of reporting.  Room was cleaned everyday with out fail.  if your looking for a clean friendly hotel, close to all the attractions look no further 10 min from Disney (drive) walking distance to soak world , medieval times

We stay at this hotel quit often I love it we have 3 children one disabled 4 yr old  the hotel gives us a room on the bottom floor the staff is so great housekeeping brings you what you need ASAP  as well as room service there restaurant has great breakfast as well as dinner we ordered pizza and it was probably the best fresh pizza we've had in a long time  It is so close to knotts we would walk over to knotts and when we would get tired we would come back to room and rest and then back again this is a great hotel to stay at the pool is amazing for adults as well as children they have a play area with water sprayers. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone we travel often and this is by far my families favorite from the service to food to closeness to knotts I give it a

Summary Heading: One of the best family hotels
Summary: We stayed here Labor day weekend.  The staff was very friendly and eager to help.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The parks are within walking distance and very convenient.  My grandkids loved staying here.  With the hotel package deal, I can afford to visit with my grandkids often.

We came to Knotts berry farm go celebrate my 32nd birthday and it was a great decision! My boyfriend and I brought 9 people with us and it was awesome! Having the hotel right next to the amusement park is a great idea!! The easy pay option was also a great way to pay for the vacation before you even get there!! We are already planning another trip next year!!

We stayed at Knotts Berry Farm to break up our travel between Australia and New York. We couldn't decide on where to stay in LA but came across this while looking. Having the theme park next door was a bonus and the shops out the front provided added ways to pass our time while we were there. The room was a little dated but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The A/C would only operate on high fan, we overcame this by pre-cooling the room before going to bed. I thought Knotts Berry Farm Resort was value for money especially when we purchased the package which included a park pass and dining. Reception staff were always friendly and willing to assist.

Stayed in neighboring rooms with son, wife and grand daughters.  Rooms were near parking lot which made it a little noisy, but not a problem.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Housekeeper Anna even went out of her way to find my little granddaughter's sock monkey that was accidently taken with the sheets.  Service was over the top!  Food at the Amber Waves was enjoyed by everyone.  I would recommend the package for people with little ones.  The pool area was nice with a splash pad area for the tots and a nice spa as well.  Short walk to Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park. Great vacation.  Would definately return.

Summary Heading: Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel and Grand Express Tours
Summary: Hotel was great for the money,friendly staff,one guy showed me how to unlock our ipad,very help full. Ice machines poor,on our floor,the ice machine didn't work,the other floors were empty. The hotel use Grand Express Tours to take you to Disney Land etc,so that is what we used. We booked Disneyland,Universal Studios,and a Tour around LA. The LA tour was booked 3 days in advance,on that day, was our last day in LA,we arrived down in the foyer at 8:45am being picked up at 9:00am at 9:10am I went to the concierge,and was told they would be in traffic,at 9:20am my wife went back to them and they were phoning Grand Express Tours,and was told they had forgot to pick us up,and they would not be coming back to get us,so 1 day not sure what we could do,so jumped on a bus and went to
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! It is never a good situation when plans don't work out but you have such an amazing attitude about the situation that you deserved the positive experiences to follow. We hope to see you soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: this hotel is nice for the price and close to the park. kids loved seeing snoopy without tons of kds swarming him as in the park. the kids did not care for the splash pad because they said it was cold (but they are small kids). the pool was very chlorinated but I guess it has to be to kill germs. all in all the trip was fun for a family of ten.

We wanted to take 2 of our grandchildren to Knotts Berry Farm for their birthdays.  I booked a night at the Knotts' Hotel with their room and park entrance package and then read the reviews some of which wre not too favorable.  Good thing I went with my first instinct and kept the Knotts Hotel reservation - EVERYTHING was great.  Check in was a breeze and the room was clean and comfortable .  The kids loved the pool and the water park at the hotel. I loved the fact we could walk from our car (which was parked at the hotel for free) to the main gate of the park in less than 10 minutes.  We even had a 30 minute early entrance to the park by staying at the hotel.  Between convenience, amenities, and price - we could not have done better and would go again.

Summary Heading: Nice, affordable hotel walking distance to the park.
Summary: Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Excellent value when you include room, tickets, and parking. It is only a short walk to shops, restaurants, and Knotts theme park. Only issue is that there is no fridge in the room. It would be my nice to cool down some waters to take with you to the park. I have stayed here several times and will continue to stay there whenever I visit Knotts. Hotel has on site restaurant and a fun water play area next to the pool for the kids.

I prefer a more upgraded room, but the experience was very satisfactory. All the employees were cheerful and helpful. I felt like they liked their jobs. The location to Knotts is great. The pool area was not to my liking - If we had stayed longer that might have been an issue - just concrete and chairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. I am pleased to learn that you had positive interactions with our team as you are 100% correct in our passion for service! The pool area is something we have considered revisiting with our continuing renovations so thank you for that feedback as well! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: I'm going to start out by saying this was a great package. I went to the Knotts Berry Farm website and checked out their specials and found a pretty good deal for the money. Our package included a room with 2 queen beds for one night, parking and 3 adult tickets to Knotts Berry Farm (to be used the day of arrival or the day of check out). We even received a pass to get into Knotts Berry Farm a half an hour before the park opens. I paid a grand total of $168. All of the staff we had contact with were very pleasant, friendly and helpful. The room had a nice view (a prefect look at the blue moon for us). It was not crowded so really no noise inside the building and parking was not a problem(first row and I could see the car from the room). Knotts Berry Farm is steps away so very
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us! While I am pleased to learn that the overall experience was positive I feel terrible that you experienced such a foul odor in your room. This is not something that you should expect from our property. Please contact me direct prior to your next visit and I would be happy to personally inspect your room to ensure it meets all of our cleanliness standards. Thank you again and we look forward to your future visit! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: The hotel is just a three star by American standard. I stayed last year in a three star hotel in Orlando snd the facilities were much better inside the room. There is no fridge no microwave. Even the safe is very old and small. The beds however were comfortable and large. The rooms were cleaned every day. The staff were friendly and keen to help. The gym is for use by over 18 years old. My son of 17 was escorted out of the gym by the security guard because he mentioned his age. My son was not impressed with this behaviour.

This hotel is definitely convenient if you are going to Knott's Berry Farm. It is a bit deceiving though because when you enter the hotel, it appears to be updated and nice. The lobby and restaurant are nice and make you feel like you are staying in a 3.5 star hotel. Then you get to your room and discover that it is seriously dated and need some work, which makes you feel like you are at a 2.5 star hotel. Our mattress felt, and looked, like it was 20 years old and the AC unit in our room was one of those old wall units that you see in a lot of older motels. The AC unit was seriously loud, which made it hard to sleep at night.My brother and his family stayed in another room and their door handle came off as they were trying to leave the room. He got lucky and was able to still
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel. Reading your review I was thrilled to learn that your positive perception was built primarily around our team. While the negative elements are unfortunate and definitely issues that we hope to correct through renovations, the quality of our team is what separates us from our competition. We have incremental renovations that have been going on and will continue into next year. I hope that you have an opportunity to stay with us again in the future so that we can hopefully earn some more stars! Thank you again! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: We did the classic package - free parking, buffet breakfast for 4, one day in the park and the snoopy room for one night $327.00. We showed up at 9am August 23rd everyone was very nice. We were given a ticket to put on our car and are breakfast and park passes. I was able to check my lap top in so it wouldn't sit in the hot car. The lobby was nice and Snoopy was waiting to take pictures with us. You also get a discount at the gift shop. The gift shop was very small and they should consider adding on for guest convenience. We had a short walk to the park. I received a text from the hotel when are room was ready. We stayed until eight and then made a mad dash to see snoopy in our room. Check in took a while and we saw Snoopy heading up stairs luckily we made it in time, but they

We chose this hotel for the main reason that my children would be able to have a personal meeting with Snoopy inside the room. Aside from that, this hotel is the closest to the park as well.  We checked in yesterday, Aug 24, 2013 for an overnight stay. We booked the twin bed Snoopy room and paid for the package deal. When we arrived at the hotel, our room was not yet ready and that the only room they had available for us was the second floor. I went back to my car to park it when personnel told me that our room is already available.  Our children were told that two Snoopy toys will be waiting for them in the room. They were so disappointed when they saw nothing in the bed. I have to call front desk twice(!) and it took them 40 mins to bring it up. We could have gone to the park
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking take to share your experience at the Knott’s Hotel. In further researching your reservation after our conversation I see that you arrived over two hours prior to our guarenteed check-in time which may have been the cause of your delayed check-in and wait for the complimentary Snoopy toys. In that conversation I remember explaining the Snoopy character visit is contracted from the theme park and unfortunately not flexible should you miss the scheduled visit included into your package. I am not sure why the character’s escort would not have informed you on this when you saw them in the hallway the morning of your departure but I will certainly discuss it with that team to ensure it more property communicated in the future. The issue you experienced with the air conditioner is, however, something that my team and I should have caught prior to your arrival and for this I do apologize. As I mentioned in our telephone conversation I would like you and your family to return so that you can have the positive experience that keep many of our guests returning year after year. If you change your mind and would like to discuss this or any potential future bookings please contact me directly and I would be happy to assist in any way possible. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Fun but needs a little updating
Summary: 5 years ago we stayed in one of the Snoopy rooms for my son's 9th birthday.  This year my daughter turned 8 and wanted to do the same thing.  Not a lot has changed and it might be time for an update.  We scored a great package deal online.  The Snoopy room, tickets to Knott's Berry Farm, vouchers for the breakfast buffet for everyone in the party and of course a visit from Snoopy at bedtime all for under $350.  Parking is free, the room is comfortable and clean and the employees are pleasant and helpful.  We had a nice view of the pool area which we didn't get a chance to use but my daughter was chomping at the bit to go play in the water play area.  The Snoopy room was decorated in the Peanuts theme which was cute but sparse.  I'd really love to see an upgrade though.  More
Manager Response: What an awesome review! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a detailed and well thought out review. We are thrilled that you had a positive experience with us and hope that your daughter’s new snoopy doll will remind her of an awesome birthday experience. I have shared your review with my team and feel that several of your suggestions are completely within reach. We will continue to discuss these changes and hopefully create and even better experience on your next visit! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Customer Service Compensates for Small Rooms
Summary: We live close by the Knott's Hotel and wanted to have a final vacation before school starts up again. Our kids are 7, 4, and 18 months and my mom joined us.  We got two adjoining rooms on the eighth floor. The rooms are standard motel size but very clean and revamped, with a nice desk, flat screen TV, and attractive light fixtures.  Our rooms were clean and in perfect working condition.  The only two bummers in my opinion: no fridges and the beds have those old comforters that probably get washed twice a year.  Knott's, it's time to upgrade to duvets that can be washed after each guest stay. On to all the great things!  The hotel is so darn close to the park.  We came and went as we pleased, taking breaks when we were tired and never worrying about parking or driving The hotel

This was the second year for my girls and I to stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel.  We like the convenience of being on the premises of the theme park and especially love the early access to the rides!  Last year we purchased the option of a room with 2 queen beds, breakfast for 2 days and 2 days of park admission.  This year, I opted for the 2 night stay with 2 queen beds and 2 days admission to the park.  Upon check-in, I was told there was an overbooking problem when I made my online reservation. The staff graciously offerred a king room with a complimentary roll away bed, 2 days of complimentary breakfasts, and they gave each of my girls a Snoopy doll.  Although we prefer the 2 queen beds, the king bed was large enough as we were too exhausted from our fun!  The room was

Our whole experience at Knottsberry Farm Hotel and Resort was great from check in to check out.  The service at the main desk was awesome, they were incredibly helpful with every question we had.  All staff were very friendly.  Our room was very large. We loved the pool area and made great use of it during our stay.  It was great that the amusement park was only a few minutes walk away.  I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staing in the area.

We are long time visitors to Knott's. This was our first time staying at the hotel. We stayed in the Camp Snoopy room and my kids were thrilled to get the Snoopy dolls and the visit from Snoopy to tuck them in. The park is not that far away and yet you couldn't even hear the roaring coasters or screaming passengers. And the perk of early entry into the park was definitely a plus! The food in the hotel was very good also!

On the plus side this hotel is very close to the resort allowing you to rest during the day. Unfortunately we found a lot of negatives and wouldn't stay again. 1.  Bathroom was very tired- the plug in one bath didn't work and it was very difficult to turn the water and bath/shower settings on and off 2.  Air conditioning was very very noisy and windows didn't open 3.  The hotel appears to have a policy on rationing shampoo! Both rooms we were using ran out of shampoo - just very bizarre 4.  Rooms dated 5. Long queue to check out
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a review. While I was happy to learn that the hotel’s location was a positive the rest of your review was definitely upsetting. I have brought the concerns regarding the air conditioning unit and condition of the rest room to the attention of both our Executive Housekeeper and our Chief Engineer. I assure you there is no shortage of shampoo so I am not entirely sure why they were not replaced daily but that has been addressed with our housekeeping team as well. I would feel much better about the situation if you would consider giving us another opportunity to provide you with a better experience. If you are interested in discussing this or any future reservations please feel free to contact me directly at 714-243-2006 or by email at Stephen.Ruggiero@Knotts.com. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: Staying at the Knotts Hotel was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was basic, however, being in walking distance of Knott's and Soak City was priceless. Not to mention Amber Waves, the restaurant inside the hotel. The breakfast was truly delicious. I will always book a room at The Knott's Berry Farm Hotel when planning a trip to the area

My husband and I took our two grandaughters for a little get away. I booked the Camp Snoopy room which included two stuffed Snoopy's and a visit from Snoopy to tuck them in. The girls loved it! The room was adorable and not over done. Nice to be able to park the car and walk to Knott's Berry Farm and back to the room for some rest. The pool was also very nice.

My husband and 2 adult children had spent 3 weeks travelling California and decided to visit Knotts Berry Farm, we had been recommended to stay at the Hotel so we could spend the day at Knotts Berry and walk to the Hotel to check in later in the afternoon, it worked so well for us, we left the car at the Hotel at 10.30am, registered with reception, spent the day at Knott's Berry and being so close and not worry about where to park the car.  The Receptionist had left our keys for the two rooms at the counter so when we returned at 6pm we were handed our keys and off to our room.  Our rooms were furnished nicely and spotless.  We had a beautiful dinner in the restaurant and our waiter Anthony was awesome.  We ordered 2 desserts to share between the 4 of us and they were the

Summary Heading: Wonderful place for a family vacation.
Summary: It was a fun weekend and hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ok but could have been better with their selections. Limited juice choices, but still worth the package price. Walking to the park was great and not having to look for parking. Ma Knott chicken dinner was delicious and worth the wait in line.

I am horrified to learn of a grievous event that happened during our stay at Knott's Berry Farm Hotel August 6, 2013.  One of the reasons I chose to stay at this hotel was its free shuttle service to and from Disneyland.  I was traveling with my mother, younger brother, and 8 month old daughter.  On the night of August 6th, my mother decided to take my daughter back to the hotel on the 7:20pm shuttle as the baby was tired and hungry, and we didn't want to keep her at Disneyland until a later time.  My mother had called Knott's Berry Farm Hotel and made reservations to be picked up at 7:20pm.  However, after waiting for the shuttle until 7:30pm and realizing something was wrong, my mother called the hotel (being placed on hold for a ridiculous amount of time) only to be told that
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you taking the time to complete a review regarding your family’s stay last week. I have received your email with the information you have detailed here as well as our other social media outlets. I hope that you found my email response to be honest and sincere. While I have not heard back from you yet I wanted to be sure to leave a response to your comment here as well. It is very important to me and my team that you and other potential guests researching our property understand our management’s passion for the guest experience. As I mentioned in my email response, I fully understand and in many ways share your frustration but still feel strongly that our team did everything within our power to accommodate your family with the information we had available to us. I am very interested in discussing this situation further if you would please contact me via email or by phone at 714-243-2006. Thank you again and I look forward to speaking with you soon. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great deal for the park, outdated rooms
Summary: We visited in late July and got a great deal on a room that included 4 tix to the park. Just to be clear, this hotel is NOT a resort. The rooms are like stepping into some time warp. Ours was clean, but older furniture, linens, fixtures and the whole feeling was just ok. The beds were not very comfortable.   That said, we had a blast at the hotel. The pool is nice. We posed for pix with Snoopy that evening in the lobby. We were thrilled to get into the park 30 minutes early in the AM. My son rode a bunch of roller coasters before the crowds arrived. It was also nice to keep the car parked (for free) at the hotel and not have to pay more for parking.   We would visit again because of the perks, not the hotel itself.

Spent 2 days at this resort. The location is the BEST if going to the Park. Easy parking, clean rooms, and great pool area on site. The kids truly enjoyed their stay! Snoopy was around for meet and greet, and good photo opportunities. Again, this is a place for families with kids to enjoy.  Downside, it can be noisy, and there are many families. Thus, the reason for 4 stars v 5. We had a room overlooking the pool. It was everything one would expect for this type of resort. We will stay there again, with the kids. It was a very GOOD experience!

Summary Heading: A good example of staff making a typical hotel feel like a resort.
Summary: Just my son and I on a "boys" trip to Knott's Berry Farm.  This is a very simple hotel but it is clean and everyone we made contact with were very friendly.  Starting with the Parking attendant through the desk clerk and porter everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there and shared an attitude of a resort hotel staff.  The room was spacious and view was of the park.  The room had all the standard decorating and amenities with nothing really remarkable.  That is not an insult.
