The pool was nice and a good getaway from the park.  The park itself is a five minute walk and of course near the park shopping area which was nice although strictly theme park related.  In our case the package deal to get the tickets along with the night's stay made our choice easy.  This was a good hotel

My husband and I spent 2 nights at Knotts Berry Hotel recently.  The hotel is very clean and the service is excellent.  The only downside is the noise!  The walls of the hotel are very thin and you could hear people talking in all the rooms around you.  Even the TV could be heard clearly!  The hotel restaurant is very nice with very generous servings.  The salads are huge!  We had a buffet breakfast daily which was nice.  There was a good selection of food.  The pool area is clean and relaxing and there is plenty of room to enjoy the sun.  A nice place to stay and would be a great place to bring a family.  Snoopy wanders around in the evening for the kids too.  Knotts Berry Theme Park was a 2 minute walk from the hotel.  There are also plenty of options for food close by if you
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We are thrilled to learn that you and your family enjoyed the hotel and our restaurant Amber Waves. Unfortunately there are areas within our building where the noise travels more than we would like. If you find yourself visiting our area again please let me know so I can ensure that you are in a quieter part of the property. Thank you again! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager- 714-243-2006

Summary: We really enjoyed staying at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel. Every interaction we had with hotel staff, from the check-in, housekeeping and restaurant staff, we were always greeted with a smile and a friendly attitude. These people really enjoyed their job. If they didn't they hid it very well. :)   The rooms were clean and everything worked like it should. I would have preferred a slightly softer bed. We really missed our pillow top mattress.  Being close to Knott's was great. And they are close to Disneyland which is nice. AND to top that off, they even provide a free shuttle to Disneyland. I'll bet you don't find a Disneyland hotel providing a free shuttle to Knott's!  Great job KBFRH! See you soon.

Nice, reasonable hotel adjacent to the park. Short walk to Knotts Berry Farm with lots of restaurants and shops in between.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is very friendly, great free breakfast buffet,  free parking, and a nice pool.  We could see the Disneyland fireworks from our room which was an added bonus.  We would definitely stay here again.

It was great staying at the hotel everyone was nice and pleasant. With the location by right next door to Soak City where you can just walk under the street and not have to pay for parking was great. Also no parking fees for Knotts Berry Farm when you just walk over from your hotel room. There was also a Portillo's close by that me and my family were able to walk to and enjoy great Chicago Food. Having a 5 and 12 year old there was something for everyone, including getting a snoopy room and being tucked in by him. Great value for your money. We got the 2 nights stay and a day at Soak City and a day at Knotts Berry Farm, including the parking at the hotel.

my family and I stayed in camp snoopy. it was my daughters birthday and she really enjoyed the room. the staff was friendly and the room was spacious and clean. we slept great and we were able to walk right over to park in the morning after a nice buffet breakfast. I would recommend Knott's to all my friends.

I am a single mom with 3 kids 1 of them is 5 & he as special needs . Our stay at the Knott's Berry farm Hotel was the best We have stayed in, it was easy to access for us to get in & out with his wheel Chair. The employee's were so very friendly. All the ones that we had contact with had smiles on the faces & were eager to help with what ever we needed. In the morning we were heading to Knott's for the day & we saw Snoopy in the lobby & he stopped to say hello & take Pictures with my family. I would Recommend it to all. I would give it a 10 Star rating but the isnt one. In my eyes it is a 10. Thank you for being so friendly

Summary Heading: Convenient, bundle park deal but BLACK MOLD!
Summary: While the convenience, pool and bundle ticket deals to the park are positives, the negatives need to be addressed. Mainly a ton of black mold around the upper surrounds of the bathtub which you don't notice unless you get down and look at eye level. This is due most likely to the dated rooms which lack room fridges and look stuck in the 80s. Since Black Mold is a major health issue for some, this should be addressed immediately within all rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us at the Knott’s hotel. While I was happy to see that you had an overall positive stay, the cleanliness of the restroom area definitely needs to be addressed. I am happy to inform you that we have scheduled a complete overhaul of these areas starting with the grout and cocking around all of the tub/ showers through the property. I assure you that by your next visit black mold will be a thing of the past! Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: I read previous reviews about this hotel and did not really expect much but I booked there for the easy walk to Knotts Berry Farm.  The hotel in fact is a very beautiful well kept hotel.  My grandchildren used the pool a lot but even though they are older they also loved the kids water play area.  I had a problem the first morning with a crying child at 5:30 AM that woke us up and continued to cry all morning.  I spoke to the front desk and was moved right away to another room.It was great to be so close to Knotts so we could take a break mid day and go to the pool.  I really would have given it 5 stars but the walls are a little thin.  In our room we could hear the family's conversations next door.  It was acceptable because there was no screaming child and it was an acceptable

Check-in process took more than 20 mins, no apology or explanation. Breakfast was chaos, plenty seats available but we had to wait for 10-15mins, the waitress was not helpful, the food was very average. Won't stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving feedback regarding your stay last month. I am sorry to learn that the wait time at check-in and then again in the morning for breakfast so adversely affected your experience with us. While a more empathetic explanation may have been necessary it is not uncommon for there to be a wait during either of those areas of our guest cycle. We do our best to spend enough time with each family to ensure that they understand all the elements of their package. Unfortunately, this can take a bit longer than at properties with less attractions and unique amenities. I do hope that you will reconsider and give us another opportunity to provide you with a better experience in the future. I would suggest our off season, November through March to ensure a speedier registration and overall wait times. Thank you again! Stephen Ruggiero, 714-243-2006

Summary: Good evening,  Let me start by saying I grew up going to Knotts Berry Farm every summer as a young child with my family. My last trip was in 1970 before my family moved from Los Angeles.  So as you can see many years have gone by.  Now with my husband, son, daughter in-law and 2 grandaughters we made our yearly family vacation choice Knotts Berry Farm what a woderful choice. The rooms was clean, spacious. The staff in all areas were kind, happy and very friendly and courteous! MOST OF ALLL MY GRANDAUGTERS SIMPLY LOVED SNOOPY :)!!!!!! I must say their Snoopy room was simply adorable and snoopy coming to tuck them in was simply adorable. The resturant was great and  delicous!! I went back to work showing pictures and highly recommeding Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel/  Thank You so

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel with the exception of a lack of a free breakfast and the 4$ price for a bottle of water in the room.during our second stay at the hotel we found out that the hotel website have some great value packages which I was disappointed about because this was not mentioned to me a few days earlier when I stayed at the hotel,and the clerk knew I will be returning with the entire family to go to knotts.( for a mom that loves to get the best priced for her family - this was very disappointing ) but everything was great.we were greeted by snoopy at check in. As a mom with a special needs son the closeness of the hotel and the early entrance into the hotel makes it easier on the entire family to enjoy the park. What we did was allow the older children and

Summary Heading: Convenient location to Knott's berry farm and Soak City
Summary: My son and I had a great stay at Knott's hotel. Our room was very spacious with 2 queen beds and was very clean throughout. We ate at the restaurant 'Amber waves' several times it was good food although it was quite expensive. There were plenty of towels in the swimming pool area which were frequently replenished. The pool was nice but did feel a bit cool at first. All the staff were polite and helpful at all times, there is also a security guard who walks around the property which was reassuring. Snoopy is often walking around the lobby area and is keen to have photos taken with you!! Knott's berry farm is a short 5 minute walk away and the water park Soak city takes a little longer to walk to. There are several Knott's shops located along the roadside which sell Knott's

We come up here every year and stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel. The people are always nice and they go out of their way to make your trip memorable. We get the deal that includes tickets to the park and with 5 of us it is a great deal. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. In fact, next year we plan to stay 2 nights and go to Soak City as well.

We picked Knotts berry farm for my 10 years birthday last month. He was completely surprised, as we live in Las Vegas, NV. We had an outstanding time. Everyone was very friendly. If I had to Critique something it would just be the morning servers in Amber waves. Yes we were in there for FREE breakfast both mornings. But they could just show a little more effort. They were still nice and the breakfast was great, just had to wait a little for refills. But I would go back in a heart beat, and we will probably when my girls are tall enough to ride. Highly recommend taking a weekend trip!

We had a great time! Everyone that works there was wonderful! From the front desk to the house keeping service. The food at th Amber Waves restaurant was very good. The overall stay was great and memorable. I recommend to anyone with children of all ages!

There are 5 in our family, and it's hard to find hotels that are roomy enough for all of us to be able to relax in, so we were pleasantly surprised. We booked their largest room, which is like a spacious suite. The package we bought included all day tickets to Knott's Berry Farm, as well as a free 30 minute head start on enjoying the rides before the general public is allowed into the park(9:30a.m. - 10:00). It is a fantastic deal, and the kids had a blast. Well worth the cost!! The only downsides were (1) the bed pillows are flat as pancakes, so be prepared , and (2) The pool stays open until 11:00p.m., so expect a lot of noise until after 11:00p.m.  Good deal though, and we would definitely go back!

We are a family of 4, we have twin 2yr olds. We did the package deal with Camp Snoopy rooms, Knotts tickets and free buffet. Awesome pricing on packages and nice hotel. Camp Snoopy rooms/floor are awesome perfect for kids! Beds are too hard not comfy and Darker curtains do not close so no nap time for little ones in the very bright room. easy check in and parking awesome hotel staff, super easy to and from the park all day with little ones. Amber Waves restaraunt has Delicious food but horrible service! Staff will seat you and take your order and disapear! if you can track someone down they come over once and disapear! The server forgot to order some of our food so we had to share plates while waiting then ask the bus boy for the check, i had to go find a mgr to get the check

We were here to attend a family reunion scheduled at this hotel & stayed 2 nights.  The lobby really smells bad!The staff is adequate but not very friendly or helpful.  My husband asked where the fitness center was & they couldn't tell him.  I did like that they text you when your room is done & they seemed to really be hustling to get people into their rooms early.  Overall though, a terrible first impression. The rooms were not very clean & very outdated.  Housekeeping was working their butts off but I think the constant traffic & the speed of turnover is making it impossible for them to get the rooms as clean as possible.  The windows were absolutely filthy.  Oh & the upholstered chair in the room was stain splattered with something that looked disgusting.  It was very
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at the Knott’s Hotel. I assure you that the negative experience that you describe in your review is far from our culture and has left me a bit confused. Arriving in our lobby you should have been greeted by a pleasant environment with knowledgeable and friendly team members. Our housekeeping department, while consistently busy, do an amazing job handling our quick turnover so finding a poorly cleaning room is both rare an unacceptable. I have spoken with our Front Office and Housekeeping teams regarding these missed service opportunities and feel confident that your experience will help us grow closer to our service goals.  If you are interested in discussing your past stay further or would allow me to personally design a reservation for you in the future please contact me directly at 714-243-2006 and I would be happy to do so. Thank you again for your feedback and I look forward to possibly speaking with you in the future. Stephen Ruggiero

Summary Heading: Outdated... but you get to have breakfast with Snoopy!
Summary: Spent one night in this hotel, so can't really comment on the resort amenities. Overall, the hotel felt a bit outdated and although well maintained it didn't meet modern standards. However, room pricing reflected this, so one really shouldn't complain too much about this.  Staff was very friendly and the breakfast was very good - and Snoopy spent plenty of time with all of the guests during breakfast. This really was a great way to start your day, even for two adults who aren't the biggest Snoopy fans ever.

Upon entering the resort, we were very pleased with the lobby and was looking forward to seeing our rooms. We were notified @4pm that our Camp Snoopy room was ready and promptly returned to pick up our key and luggage that we had checked earlier in the day. There are 16 Camp Snoopy rooms in the hotel that are, of course, more expensive because Snoopy will come to your room in the evening and tuck your little ones in. After entering the hallway to the Camp Snoopy rooms we were even more excited to find Snoopy and the gang all over the walls leading to the rooms. Then we entered the room and while decorated with Snoopy doghouse headboards with Snoopy and Woodstock perched on top and dog prints on the carpet, my excitement died right there. The room needs some serious updating. The

The hotel room itself is a little dated compared to other theme park hotels but the price and location and amenities are great. We got the buffet package and got the breakfast buffet in morning. Food was fine, hot and cold and was all we needed to start our day. You can walk to Knotts Berry Farm within minutes and Knotts Soak City. We drove to Soak City and parking is free when your a guest at hotel.  We went to Midieval Times which is barely a mile away. As is the Wax Museum.  The hotel offers a shuttle to Disneyland (which we didn't know until after the fact) which is great even if you want to go downtown Disney to watch fireworks which Knotts does not have.  Also, Knotts offers a discounted late entrance at 4pm for $33 which is a steal. Highly recommend.  Coffee maker in room

Upon check-in, the staff were very friendly and polite. The porter was a little too friendly having been told that we could manage our own bags, he insisted in taking them to our room with my wife and son before I had finished checking in and I didn't even know what room we were in and didn't have any room keys. My wife then felt obliged to tip him and he continued to try and push additional tours and services. Once I had checked in I was then able to join them in the room where my wife had started to unpack. We then discovered a condom wrapper by the wash basin. Naturally I took it to reception wrapped in tissue to complain. The porter said he would get the manager, who was dealing with another incident at the time. The pool had needed to be closed, which was disappointing.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your recent stay in July. While it was nice to learn that several of our staff members met or exceeded your service standards those few employees that were disconnected, defensive, or ‘over the top’ would have frustrated me as well. Reviewing management reports, I do recall the situation regarding the edge of the condom wrapper being left in the room. While you seemed to be more than understanding for the unfortunate and unusual situation it seems our team leader in the housekeeping department was not nearly empathetic enough to make you feel better about the department. I have spoken with this individual as well as the entire bell/ porter staff to ensure that we are doing a better job matching our demeanor and body language to the situation in an effort to make our guests feel as comfortable as possible. I greatly appreciate you providing my team and I with an opportunity to improve. Please contact me directly should you find yourself returning to our area as I would love to personally design a reservation to earn back the trust in our brand. Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero 714-243-2006

Summary: Knotts Hotel is a great! The room rates are affordable which allows us to stay longer.  The kids love the pool & the gym is well equipped.  We also like the location of the hotel.  It's nearby shopping centers & restaurants.  I hope the rooms will eventually come with a fridge and microwave.  Thank you Knotts for always being military friendly!  This is becoming an annual homecoming from deployment tradition for our family!

Had to choose between staying near Disney, Knotts or Universal.  Glad I had booked at Knotts Berry Hotel. Yes it's not the newest hotel but it is well maintained, friendly staff, breakfast could change up the breakfast meats and potatoes.  It's not hard to do different items and it will not add to your food cost. I know there is not an executive chef there but corporate office must have some idea to make it exciting, if not and you want to keep up with everyone else hire a executive chef to consult you guys. Why does it always seem that corporate does away with an executive chef then thinks they can run a F&B operation well???

We had the pleasure to spend 1 night but our experience was so good, clean rooms, nice staff, fast check in, good price on package, if you get directly with the hotel is a better deal, I was worried for the bad reviews I read after my reservation, so it was amazing to discover everything different in a positive way, my children enjoyed so much, food in the restaurant, is good and we are planning to comeback.   I surely recommend this place!!   we slept very good, no disturbance, !!

My 3 children and myself had a great time at the resort and knottsberry farm. we wished we could have stayed longer but, my 17 tear old had to get back to Phoenix for work during the 4th of july weekend. my 9 yr old  opened the door to the hotel room and shouted this room is awesome, then called dibs on 1 of the beds. Thank you for making our stay a most memorable one.

The rooms were nice, customer serves was amazing and the breakfast was better then most places by far.I would tell everyone to stay here. It is close to the amusement park and that is a very big plus. Thanks for a great trips to all The Knott's staff.

We had four rooms for all our family members.  We had kind of a little family reunion.  The rooms were clean and the staff were all very nice and helpful.  Breakfast at the Amber Waves was very good.  It felt like Knotts park was in our own backyard.  The kids felt free to just go whenever the wanted to.  The pool was alittle smaller than what I pictured but was nice anyway.  Will be back again next year.

Employees were friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms very nice. Walking distance is fantastic, with the added amenities, (pool, Jacuzzi, fitness center, tennis and basketball courts).  Breakfast was included but only OK, We would definitely stay again. Our grandson loved our stay

I had stayed before in this hotel and when we go to visit Knott's Berry Farm for the convenience we stay here and the service and quality of the hotel is really good with the reasonable prices. The Restaurant in the hotel we had never visit before until this trip and the quality and food is really reasonable for the prices. The kids meals are huge and can actually feed 2 children. The pool at the hotel is really fun for the kids.

My daughter and her friend had a great time at the pool.  The fountains & water play toys kept them busy.  Almost too busy to leave and visit the park.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, parking is easy.  Entrance lobby is beautiful.  There was a wedding party while we were there and the group at the top of the stairs looked great.  Nice hotel, good theme and walking distance to Knott's shopping area and park.

We have stayed here several times- the staff is always super friendly, rooms are always clean and comfortable. Pool is nice and clean. Restaurant is moderately priced- great food. Great Location. We are always pleased with our stay & Can't wait to stay again!

Just minutes away from park, great value when purchase tickets at desk. Parking in hotel lot easy to enter Park. Buffet breakfast was part of the package and well worth it. Desk staff was friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze, on way to park in minutes.

Our family had a wonderful time at the park and the hotel. My husband and I brought our two grandchildren, our son and daughter. We spent the day in the theme park and then went back to the hotel. We were all pleased by the large room, very, very friendly service and the wonderful breakfast. We spent the next day at Soak City. I wish I had bought season tickets so we could come back again this year. We all had a wonderful mini trip. I also felt the price was very reasonable.  Thank you for the wonderful time!!!!!

Great walking distance to knots berry farm, package deal was nice, included breakfast and tickets to Knotts.  Staff was very friendly, allowed us to use the pool area while we waited for our rooms. Roll away bed was not comfortable, we put the mattress on the floor for better back support.  Air conditioner was a little loud, but overall the room was clean and quiet, nice view of the pool and water spray area.

I was looking for something to do for the weekend with a child , picked knott's berry hotel  package, had the best time , It was very clean, Staff was great We ordered room service it was very Nice,  My child enjoy Snoopy, Overall great place to stay, will visit again soon, Great Manager. Great Choice. happy with My visit.

We bought a package that included tickets and a 1 night stay in a snoopy themed room. What a treat in the evening to have snoopy come tuck the kids into bed. The staff was also very nice by making sure each one of my kids got a snoopy plush. Thank you for that...we will return just because of the customer service we got.

We picked Knotts Berry Farm over Disney because of the price and in hopes that there would be shorter lines.  It worked out perfectly!  Tons of rides for our little ones (3 and 5) and they got to visit with Snoopy in the restaurant every morning and before bed in our Snoopy rooms.  We never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a ride, even on the 4th of July.  All the staff at the hotel were really friendly and helpful.  Dinner service in the restaurant was slow, but they made up for it by discounting our meal and being very apologetic.  And the dinner was excellent!  Highly recommend this for families with small kids.  Seems like it might be a good choice for pre-teens too, because they had lots of fun rides that had shorter lines than Disney.

I stayed at the Knott's Berry Farm resort and hotel for work and tried to be very upbeat about it. However, when me and my colleagues checked in at 11pm it was anything but.  The lobby was spacious and beautiful, and the lobby bar/restaurant did its work but the front desk and bell service could have been friendlier and dare I say, would it kill to smile or show some personality when you are dealing with guests?  Once we got up to our rooms, we weren't any more satiated. The six of us in our party were greeted with mildewy rooms, one of us had hair in the washroom and sink, and another had a clogged toilet that he undid himself - ewwww! For some reason, the six of us were spread through four floors, and for another unexplained reason, I was in an extra large handicapped room. I
Manager Response: Please let me begin by offering a sincere apology for what seems to be a very frustrating experience with us. Reading your review I am shocked to learn about the nature of your issues as we have been extremely proud of the hotel’s progress as we strive for 100% guest satisfaction. Reading other more positive reviews on our property as of late, I hope you trust that service and cleanliness are normally our strongest attributes. This of course does not take away from your seemingly terrible experience. I feel strongly that a return to our property would demonstrate our passion for service and our eagerness to earn the loyalty of our guests. Please contact me directly if you would like to discuss this or hopefully a future reservation so that I can personally ensure your next visit is a better one. Thank you again for your feedback! Thank you again for your feedback, Stephen Ruggiero 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Great Time at KBF Resort Hotel
Summary: Traveling with elderly parents can be difficult.  We took a chance at the KBF Resort Hotel.  We were pleased.  The front desk personnel were excellent.  I have to say kudos to Michael.  This young man is extremely personable and professional. We had two adjoining rooms.  The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable.  The "Supreme Package" purchased was an excellent buy!  We had breakfast at Amber Waves- hot eggs, bacon/sausage, hash browns, cereal, and oatmeal etc...  What a treat! The walk to KBF amusement park was a five minute walk.  We wheeled our mother to the park with no problem.  Our shuttle to Disney was on time- both going and coming to Disneyland.  Again, no problem.  I definitely recommend KBF Resort Hotel!

No better hotel to stay at if you are heading to Knotts Berry Farm.  You are directly next to Knotts and across from Soak City USA.  The rooms are a decent size and very clean.  The staff are extremely helpful and you can get discounted tickets at the front desk.  There is a pool, basketball court and a tennis court on site.  There's nothing quite like playing a game of tennis while hearing the screams of people on Ghost Rider behind you.  The onsite restaurant had good meals with kids eat free which was great value.  Don't miss out on some chicken from Mrs Knotts though it is the best chicken ever.  The Buena Park Mall is a 10 minute walk through the Soak City Car park.  It has all the major shops like Walmart etc.  Planning another trip next year and will be going back to stay

My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in June for a dance competition.  The room was spacious and clean.  The staff was helpful with regards to check in and recommendations for mechanic when my car had an issue.  Bell staff in particular was great.   We were on the 7th floor and the dance competition was on the 3rd.  We could easily hear/feel the music until the competition was over each night around 11pm.  If we had not been at the hotel for dance, that would have been very annoying.    The ballrooms/meeting rooms used for the dance competition were not well suited to dance.  The floor was small, the ceiling was low, the lights/cameras blocked a high percentage of the audience's view.  I hope this dance company will NOT use this venue in the future as it was not conducive

Our family (2 year old, 7 year old, mother and grandmother) stayed at the hotel as a package deal the hotel was running and had so much fun we added another night to our stay.  The packages were a great value and the staff and hotel were wonderful.  Would stay and recommend the packages and the hotel!!!  Have fun.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We are thrilled you had a great visit so please come back soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: Great stay at  Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel the room and service were outstanding.  Loved the pool and continental breakfast.  The hotel was just a short walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm Amusement center which made it all the better.  Very affordable and great return for your dollar.  Wonderful shops within walking distance of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and trying out our restaurant, Amber Waves. We are thrilled that you had a nice experience and look forward to your next visit! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: We had the extended double queen room and the little extra money was well worth it.  Plenty of room for my husband, 17-year-old and 12-year-old sons and myself.  The room was clean when we arrived and the staff kept it clean each day during our four-day stay.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had the breakfast buffet added on to our stay and it was fabulous as well!  I definitely enjoy my stay and would recommend the hotel highly.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with and taking the time to share your experience! We are very proud of our team and really get excited when it translates to a positive stay! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: Best choice for staying at Knotts.  Great service-checked in took 5min. They texted me while we were at the park letting me know my room was ready.  Vacation pkg gets you in the park early. Rooms have closet and bath closest to the hallway to minimize hallway notice from bed area. Terrific morning breakfast- food was delicious and well prepared. Hotel was very clean and well decorated.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the tme to share your experience! Our packages are perfect for a family visit and we were thrilled that it all worked out according to plan!  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, very easy stay and play!
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights while taking a trip to Knotts. Check in was a breeze, staff was very friendly and made us happy to be there. The room was spacious and clean, not the most upgraded rooms but they were still nice quality. There is a breakfast buffet downstairs and we had free passes to that and it was very nice, many choices for the kids, cereal, pastries, etc. The walk to Knotts was super close!!! After a long day we went to the pool and really enjoyed ourselves! There is even a section for the kids that has a couple of water sprinklers and other toys... Overall, this was a great experience for my family and I would definitely return again.
Manager Response: We were thrilled to learn that you took advantage of our 'Two Day' package and enjoyed your experience. We really hope that you come see us again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Ideal location for knotts berry farm
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights on our west coast tour from San Francisco to Las Vegas. The hotel is in a great location for visiting knotts berry farm as its straight across the road. The rooms are spacious and clean,there is a outside swimming pool ,a good restaurant which if you go to reception you can purchase a buffet breakfast voucher which works out much cheaper than paying for breakfast on the day in the restaurant. You can also book different tour trips to Los Angeles at the reception desk,we booked universal studio tour,bus picks you up from the bus stop just outside the hotel grounds. A short walk from the hotel is a selection of restaurants if you feel you want to eat elsewhere,there are also some supermarkets close and a small shopping mall all with in walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and for choosing our property. We are thrilled that you had such a positive experience and hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: We stay at Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel at least three or four nights each year, when we go to Knott's Berry Farm or Disneyland.  I recommend staying only in the two-bed rooms; the single-bed rooms do not have a table, which makes in-room dining (we love to bring back chicken from the CDR!) difficult.  My only suggestion would be for the property to include a refrigerator in each room (the substantial upcharge for a room with a refrigerator seems a bit much to me).  Those picky comments aside, you will be hard-pressed to find as nice a hotel with as nice a staff as this one.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback regarding your recent visit to our hotel. I agree that refridgerators in our rooms would be super convenient and hope to accomodate your request with our next renovation. We are always looking for ways to improve based on our guests needs and your detailed feedback allows us to get closer to that goal. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for out of towners visiting Knott Berry Farm
Summary: Staff was accommodating, rooms were clean and room service cleaned again when we went to the park. Very convenient for park visitors, within walking distance. Walgreens and convenience store down the street also within walking distance to pick up water, batteries, memory cards or aspirin from taking too many rides. Breakfast Buffet was over priced and low quality but convenient, it'll make a turd....

The hotel and rooms were clean. The staff was very courteous and pleasant. The price was right, we had a Great package deal including tickets to Knotts and free buffet breakfast (each morning). The food was really good. Much more cost effective for a family of 8, everyone had a great time. The park was in walking distance.

We are two grandma's who came to Knott's with six grandkids. My friend came from Venice and I came from San Diego. We both can't say enough how wonderful our stay at Knott's Hotel and the day at the park were. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, both at the hotel and the park! The pool area was great and all the kids loved it. What really excited the younger kids was finding Snoopy in the lobby and the GREAT hug they all got. We ate at the Amber Way Restaurant and again found everyone so friendly. The food was great too! We can't wait to come back again in August. We had joining rooms which were big and clean. Again all the staff were great. We want to THANK YOU all for our great trip.

If you are always looking for ways to save money, this is it! First, cannot afford Disney this year, so we looked at Knotts.  Our 5-year-old loves amusement parks and water parks, so that's we looked at for her birthday.  In looking for hotels, we are always looking for packages to includes breakfast and/or shuttle where convenient. This had it all.  A friendly staff, great room, clean, nice beds. The pool is large and accommodating as well as having a water park for the smaller ones!  They have package deals that include it all: hotel, tickets, breakfast, parking, and so close we walked to either park in @ 10-15 minutes.  In addition to the package deal, we were offered to add Water Park tickets for only $22 more, which we did!  Then, we couldn't afford the Snoopy room upgrade,

The Knott's Hotel was an awesome experience. We booked a Snoopy room which included Knott's Berry Farm tickets (and early entry to the park @ 9:30 instead of 10). Check-in was a breeze and they even kept it a secret that Snoopy would be tucking them in that night since my kids were standing there when we checked in. You can also receive a text message when your room is ready. Our room also included parking, tickets, free kids meals at the Amber Waves restaurant located in the hotel, and free buffet breakfast for all of us int he morning. For the money this was totally worth it! Snoopy comes in at night to tuck the kids in....but really.....could they sleep after that??!! There were so stoked, they couldn't sleep. We ended up taking them to the pool which also had a kids splash

We went to the park and had a good time, It's a great park for kids, adults can have a good time too. But I think the little ones will enjoy it much more it's not as busy as Universal or Disney. But the highlight is the Restaurant the fried chicken is great! They give you so much food!

This hotel is a hop skip and a jump from knotts. Just stayed with my family of 4 and with my room got tickets in to the park and a buffet breakfast! Great deal. Nice clean pool- relaxing jacuzzi and nice clean rooms

Nothing too special about this hotel, but the location to Knott's is great.  The rooms were standard, but clean and the staff was helpful.  The water pressure was terrible and taking a shower in the sink almost seemed like a better option.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a review regarding your recent stay. I was pleased that our staff made your stay comfortable but bothered to learn that you had such poor water pressure. Honestly, we have had that issue in the past but felt confident that the systems we have put in place have ensured that our guests would not be adversely affected moving forward.  I would love the opportunity to discuss the situation further so that I could inform our maintenance team and correct the issue moving forward. If you would be so kind as to contact me directly my number is 714-243-2006 and my name is Stephen. Thank you again for your feedback and look forward to speaking with you soon!

Summary: We were visiting family members about an hour away and decided at the last minute to visit Knott's Berry Farm (6/9) before we drove back to CO. First, I am a bargain shopper and for our last minute reservation, the Knott's Hotel direct website was the cheapest by far from any of the other websites. We booked a package deal for one night hotel, park tickets, breakfast buffet and parking. We came from staying at a Courtyard in Riverside, CA and I can tell you that this hotel's standard room was by far better. The staff was always friendly, the hotel was very clean and our room was a very good size.  Yes, the tub/toilet area had been horribly caulked a million times and could have used a bit of a overhaul but everything else in the room was great. It's not a 5 star hotel and for

Decent hotel for families, rooms hadn't changed much since I'd been there 6 years ago but the flat screen tv was great! The service was really good, 2 young people in particular (sorry I can't remember your names) were really great, they were super friendly and personal.  The free shuttle to Disneyland is the best part! When checking out, the shuttle driver was even kind enough to drop me at my next hotel near Disneyland! Pool was good, buffet breakfast wasn't as amazing as I remembered it but there are a few good food choices around, Fridays was my favorite.  Only criticism was that the bathroom door was almost falling off its hinges when I got there but I talked to reception the next day and they got someone right up to fix it.

Summary Heading: defective coffee maker destroyed my lap top
Summary: the rooms are small, out dated and cheap looking. the crappy $5 coffee maker in the room was defective and leaked all over the deal destroying my lap top. when checking out nobody asked how our stay was our even offered a discount for destroying my personal property. never again knotts hotel, never again.
Manager Response: Please accept an apology on behalf of the entire team at the Knott’s Hotel for what was clearly a frustrating experience. I do not see a report regarding the situation in the past few days surrounding your review so I am hoping to get some more information if possible. We do have several room types at our property of varying sizes designed to cater to the space and financial needs of our guests. While I do not see them as ‘out dated’ or ‘cheap looking’ I can certainly understand how the room may have been too small for your needs depending on the chosen room type at the time of booking. I would be happy to facilitate a claim regarding your lap top and discuss your stay further if you would please contact me directly at your convenience. I thank you for your feedback and again apologize for your negative experience. Stephen Ruggiero, 714-243-2006

Summary: Stayed here for one night with my partner and another couple. i really enjoyed it. It was so nice. staff were friendly and helpful. it was right beside the theme park and water park soak city. it was so cool. if i return ill def be staying here.i loved it.

We were looking for a fun place for us and our 2 kids to stay a couple days before a cruise, and being only 15-20min from the cruise terminal, this hotel was perfect! We took advantage of the package deal which included tickets to the park, breakfast each day and 1 dinner.  The hotel is old and shows signs wear and tear, but it is clean and overall a very good value. The hotel is right next door to Knott’s Berry farm. It has an onsite restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.  We requested a room on the upper floor and the management was happy to oblige! For best views of the park, ask for a higher floor on the west side of the building.  Only draw back were the beds. They were so hard I had to peek at the mattresses, which suprisingly, looked new! LOL

Summary Heading: Everything we wish for a hotel was here
Summary: This hotel got everything we need; Internet, free dinner, free breakfast buffet , swimming pool , work out gym  and  the  Knotts berry Farm  ticket is included . Amazing deal 392 bucks tax included for 5 people ! My kids loved it!  We'll be back here next year.

Summary Heading: Very convenient for Knott's and nice amenities!
Summary: Stayed here for my birthday celebration with my husband.  Went on a Tuesday thinking it would be less crowded but it also happens to be Graduation time.  It ended up being fine, we enjoyed ourselves.    OK now onto the hotel.  We got the Supreme Package which was a King bed and lots of goodies.  We had free parking, Knott's tickets for two, breakfast buffet, and a nice dinner with more options than are listed on the web site.  The food was really good in our opinion for both meals.  No, the eggs weren't watery.  The hotel was nicely appointed and decorated as was our room.  WiFi was good.    We checked in early and we couldn't get in our room, but we were able to pre checkin and request a high floor, and also get our Knotts tickets.  We had an ice chest in the car, so we

This was a perfectly good place to stay despite one or two minor snags which the staff dealt with promptly and with good humour. Charging is always an issue with us Brits though and we can take most of the local ways re. tipping as we are after all in a foreign, albeit very friendly country. However small things can jar a little and after waiting some 15 minutes for bar service and ordering two happy hour 16oz drafts I was asked if I would prefer two 32oz. Not wanting to wait another 15 minutes for my next order I said yes. Bang --got you--the 32's are not on the happy hour listings and so we paid extra . No big deal perhaps but then why upset a customer for a lousy three dollars in total ,especially if it means no further beer orders.

Summary Heading: Beware of the "lets get you a good deal" line
Summary: I booked my room at least 4 months in advance to lock in a good price rate for the hotel. it was a little over $800 bucks for 7 nights with parking and breakfast buffett. I thought great and booked it. We show up late in the evening after traveling all day from Alaska with a toddler and older pre teen. Start checking in and the manager Stephan walks over fast talking and says let me get you guys a way better deal. Then he tells us our bill will be a little over 1,000 bucks which is fine since knots berry farm tickets were now included. 3 days later I check my bank statement and realize the hotel had taken $1,400 dollars from me. Go down and ask why and get no answers. I send my husband down and he gets a manager and she says we were bumped up to a package deal. And he says we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. I remember you and your family well and feel terrible that you got the impression that I was in some way trying to deceive you. That, of course, was never my intension but instead only to design a more efficient reservation for your family’s needs. I would be happy to explain the saving again either by phone or email to hopefully help you see how I viewed this adjustment as a beneficial option. Again, I greatly appreciate you sharing your frustration and hope that we have an opportunity to make this right for the future.   Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: We had stayed at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel back in September of 2012 to attend the Halloween Haunt and had a wonderful time.  For this stay we decided to spend a night there as part of our May "Staycation."  I booked a package deal off the Knott's website that included a king sized room, parking, and a breakfast buffet for $100.  I can say that I was pleasantly pleased with the hotel once more.  Check-in was a breeze.  We had a room up on the sixth floor, overlooking the pool.  The room had been remodeled and featured new and comfy bedding.  The mattress was very hard - but because I have a bad back I found it very comfortable - take note if you are sensitive to hard mattresses.  We went down to the pool for a few hours.  I like the pool - it's simple, with no slides or

Summary Heading: Camp Snoopy as hosted by Norman Bates
Summary: Not impressed. It's 3am and no sleep. Bed is sawdust hard, pillows without form, room hot and no air ventilation so feels stifling, claustrophobic. Need fresh air. Amenities might be luxuries for prison gifts but pass on the 'soaps' and crummy coffee / tea. Concierge non-existent. Staff does not answer phone, Room Service does not deliver food within 40 minutes but keeps on tray 70 minutes in kitchen so ice cream melts and grilled food goes cold under saran wrap. Also splurged for Club Room, at $60 more per night to have tuck in by Snoopy. However, while at room by 8:22, Snoopy was down in lobby and would not come up to room despite having told trainer in lobby earlier we'd be ready at 8:25 so rushed from park. Thus gone to bed hungry, without Snoopy tuck in, broken air
Manager Response: Please let me begin by apologizing for what seems to be a completely unsatisfactory stay. While I was pleased to see that your son enjoyed your visit, the service and cleanliness issues that you experienced are completely unacceptable. I would love the opportunity to discuss your experience further and find a way to have your family return to our property. I feel confident that your inconveniences were isolated and a return trip would allow us to provide you with the experience that we are proud of. Please contact me directly at 714-243-2006 at your earliest convenience. Thank you again for your feedback, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary: We decided to go all out for a recent trip to Knott's Berry Farm.  Even after reading the reviews here, I decided to take a chance.  We booked the Snoopy room.  While I wanted the cute factor for my son, I was secretly hoping for a better than decent room.  While checking in, the lobby feels old, and hearing that the person checking in next to me was getting a "Joe Cool" rate of $79 a night really made me worry about what I booked.  When we arrived on our floor and saw we had to enter our hallway thru a door, my son went bananas.  He was so excited! Our room was cute and clean.  The air conditioner, a window unit, was loud.  He was over the moon that there was a stuffed snoopy waiting for him in the room.  What I didn't realize was that Snoopy visits the room each night of your

Summary Heading: Worth it to get the Package Deal! Big Oversize room for a family of 5
Summary: Our family of 5 is from Arizona and one of the kids had never been to Knotts. I purchased the package deal, 2 nights, one day in the park, plus breakfast each morning.  I was impressed with the ease of booking it online and when I had to call the 800 # the staff was very prompt and emailed my confirmation. Because of the 5 we ordered a roll-away bed and it was in the room before we even got to our room. The room was nice and over sized. The kids were really impressed! Room for the roll-away and nice space for the chair and TV. (not that we spend anytime watching TV). The morning buffet was average but filled the purpose and was easy in easy out. It was nice that the restaurant provides coffee to go right in the bar area.  No need to purchase anything.  It was so nice to walk

If you are going to Knotts Berry Farm while staying at the hotel, the front enterence into the park is just  a short walk down a shop filled walk way. If you are going to DisneyLand the hotel offers a van shuttle to Disney which is nice.   However, hotel is out of date from the awful carpet to the old webspreads. That being said you get what you pay for, the hotel us always offering awesome deals.  If you get a chance try the steak place inside the hotel for a steak and beer if you get a chance. Also Miss. Knotts Fired Chicken is a must do which staying here.

I decided to book one night here because we planned to visit Knott's Berry Farm amusement park on a Saturday and I didn't want to drive back to San Diego after a days worth of walking at the park. This is the closest hotel to the park - a short 7 minutes walk from the Hotel and saved us $8.00 for parking my car at the hotel before going to the park since we were going to check in the afternoon anyway compared to $15.00 parking for non hotel guest.  It really depends on what kind of room you booked and how much you willing to pay to get a decent room. I booked an oversized 2 Queen non-smoking room with a pool view and that's exactly what I got. As expected this is an older hotel so the AC is not centralized like the newer hotel. Every room has it's own AC unit attached inside the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent visit to the Knott’s Hotel. While I was happy to see that several elements of your stay were satisfactory, I would love to see your positive experience become the expectations for all of our guests. While you are correct that the oversized room you requested is a higher rate, guest’s staying in our standard rooms should expect that same level of cleanliness and service no matter what the rate! Thank you again for sharing your experience and we hope to see you again in the future. Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: I just stepped back in time to 1965... this hotel/property is ancient... amenities are few... and those that are here remind me of a 1960's Motel Six... sad sad sad, you can't get a decent cup of coffee... and God forbid you want to grab a nice coffee or tea and a muffin... what hotel doesn't have a lobby coffee bar these days? And mention triple sheeting beds?  And you  get a blank stare like you've just arrived from a distant planet.
Manager Response: Please accept my apology on behalf of the entire team here at the Knott’s Hotel. The level of service that you experienced is far from our goal as both a company and management team. While many areas of our building are unfortunately a bit dated, I feel confident that your experience with our service culture is very unique. We take a great deal of pride in our training and development of our future leaders and learning that you received ‘pathetic’ service is simply unacceptable. We do provide complimentary coffee both in your room and in the lobby although I can certainly understand how either can be over looked given your level of frustration. I have shared your feedback with our staff to ensure something of this nature or similar does not so adversely affect you or any guests in the future. Thank you again for your feedback.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager KBF Hotel.

Summary Heading: Average hotel, the kids loved it though.
Summary: My family and I decided to stray away from tradition last Thanksgiving (2012).  We usually stay home and do the whole Thanksgiving dinner; however, we decided to go to Knott's Berry Farm and stay at Knott's hotel. We stayed in a Camp Snoopy room which had two double beds, a bathroom, flat screen T.V., a table, lamp, and telephone in the room. The room has Peanuts decor, it includes two Snoopy plush dolls for the kids, and kids (I think 12 and under) eat free at the hotel restaurant with every paying adult. The cool thing about staying at Knott's hotel is that between 8pm and 8:30 pm Snoopy visits every room and takes pictures with the family/kids, then tucks the children into bed. My kids were very excited to see Snoopy in the room. The staff was friendly and the hotel is next

Summary Heading: Good hotel if you want to go to theme parks
Summary: We stayed here as part of an organised tour that also took in San Francisco and Las Vegas. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the rooms are large and of a good standard. The location is great if you are going to the theme parks but a bit isolated if you want to explore. There is a small shopping area about 20 minutes walk away and a number of restaurants within walking distance. That said, the local buses were good ($2 a ride) and there is also a train service into downtown LA. Restaurant was ok with usual fare on offer plus Snoopy coming by to say hi.

Summary Heading: Not bad if the location is in a better place
Summary: We booked this via a tour agent and were initially quite apprehensive because there seems to be nothing in the area where this hotel is located (when we checked google streetview). Upon reaching, we noticed there are shops, bakery, restaurants & Walgreens (24-hour supermart/pharmacy) nearby hence were happy to know it wouldn't be difficult to buy essential stuff and get our meals settled.   Hotel provides free shuttle to Disneyland (20 mins ride) for all guests (book with concierge in advance in case your preferred timeslot is full). Make use of the shuttle if u need to go to Anaheim as even the car rentals wouldn't pick us up as this location is a little out.  We slept quite well at night since there isn't much activities in this area in the night.  Our package didn't include

Summary Heading: We were not impressed with the Hotel (but staff were GREAT)!
Summary: My husband and I made reservations for an overnight stay with our 3  1/2 year old granddaughter in one of the Snoopy rooms at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel (April 13, 2013).  For an extra charge (around $50.00 or so) you can stay in a Snoopy Room where it is decorated in a Snoopy motif and Snoopy himself stops by between 8:00PM and 8:30PM to tuck in the kids.  We opted to take advantage of the Bed & Breakfast package that included the king bed Snoopy Room, Parking (normally $7.00) and breakfast buffet for each registered guests at the Amber Waves restaurant adjacent to the hotel.  We also got a nice discount because we are annual pass holders to the park so our total (with the discount) came to around $178.00.  A bit pricey for an overnight stay just up the street from our house
Manager Response: Thank you for your extremely detailed review of your short visit with us. I know you have since spoken with one of our Supervisors but I wanted to follow up again and thank you for the invaluable feedback.  I have recognized Peter for his service and discussed this expectation with my entire team to ensure that it becomes a standard. I do hope that you have an opportunity to return for the full experience as we do have many snoopy rooms that do not face directly at neighboring walls. Again I thank you for being so understanding and we look forward to hosting you and your family again soon! Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: The place to stay for Knotts Berry Farm!
Summary: We stayed in the oversized room with two roll aways and it was a perfect size for 5 of us. Including three teenagers. The room was very clean, hot tub was large and hot! Short drive to Huntington Beach  from the hotel. The package deal was the best value including  breakfast buffet and park passes.

This was our second time and my kids just love it there!!! from the quick walk to Knotts Berry Farm to the clean room with comfy beds. We get a  camp snoop room and Snoopy comes in to say goodnight. FOR ABOUT $400 we got two double beds 4 tickets to Knotts Berry Farm park 4 breakfasts buffets and parking. About parking make sure you park in front. This time around our car got keyed from front passenger door to back door and of course nothing was done. Security driving around when they want. Our stay was great until we  came upon our damaged vehicle.

We booked a room that included breakfast and tickets to the park. It was a decent deal and we enjoyed ourselves. The biggest benefit to this hotel is the location. It is right next to the park. The rooms and the breakfast are mediocre at best.  We saw Snoopy in the lobby two times, so this was fun for the kids. Outside of this, there was nothing to differentiate the Knotts hotel from any other place.

The hotel is obviously older, but kept up well, and very clean.  I used to work in a bed and breakfast.. and am a clean freak. The rooms and bathrooms were clean.  Nothing fancy.. but they offered a really great room service menu - and we indulged in breakfast.  The restaurant downstairs was outstanding.. for simple, but good meals, and the service was really great.  The hotel is next to the park.. and one block off a main street with lots of good restaurants, including Bubba Gump, The Pirates Adventure, Medival Times, TGI Fridays, an Asian Bistro.. and many others.  There is also a Walgreens just down the street for last minute items.  Also, be sure to reserve your shuttle seats for Disneyland as soon as possible the day before - -they fill up really quickly -we learned the

First room horrible on the 1st floor, smelled like pot and than the tub was not draining. Called and was moved to the 7th floor much better no smell and the tub drained.  They offer shuttle service it's by appointment only! Overall it was a nice hotel with a pool, tennis and basketball court. Staff was very friendly and somewhat helpful.

I'll admit it, ok, ok...I'm a Disney Girl. I've always thought of Knotts as Disney's "Ugly Step Sister", so to speak. My family & I have had Disney passes for years, we've done Disney "staycations" (yes, I said staycations, we live in The OC; really don't NEED to travel). What brought us to Knotts? Simply, we were blacked out on our Disney passes for Spring Break.  I found a deal on the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel Facebook page for a room upgrade *woot* and hoped to score a Snoopy room for my boys. Booked the room (last minute) called about the upgrade and was to call and ask for a manager the next day. Since I was checking in the following day, I would just talk to them then. To my disappointment all the Snoopy rooms were booked, well of course they were...it's Spring Break...what

I spend 80+ nights a year in hotels, so think I have a basis for minimum expectations.   Check in was a very long line @ 3:40 in the afternoon with only 2 people. Knew I was early, so no big deal that I had to wait for my keys at the prescribed 4pm check in time. After signing that is was OK that they send me a text when the room was ready, I finally returned an hr later and still the room is not ready. At 5:05 I was handed my keys. Mgr on duty did apologize and said she would reduce that nights stay for my inconvenience.   Bed spreads are a multicolor pattern, so hard to tell they are not clean till you fold them down and see the stains on the "white" backside. Ended up just taking them off the bed and putting them to the side on the floor.   On my third night, after they had
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. While it was frustrating as I can imagine, it was a learning experience for my team and we have since revisited many of the procedures noted in your review. We have had shifts in management in several departments and feel very good about our growth since your last visit. While I understand this experience has left you with a negative perception of our property, I would love the opportunity to provide you with the visit that many of our guests have grown accustom too. Please contact me directly should you be returning to the area as I would love to personally design an upgraded reservation for you and your family. Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: Pros-Classic package 1. 5 minute walk to Knotts Berry Farm so no need to pay $15 for parking 2. Breakfast and resort parking included 3. Swimming pool 4. Tennis courts 5. Basketball area  6. Free but slow wi-fi 7. Friendly staff 8. Clean room  Cons 1. Breakfast at Amber Waves was kind of bland  Overall, a great family hotel that I would definitely come back to.

We enjoyed our stay here.  It's a nice, middle-of-the-road hotel.  It was right next to Knott's Berry Farm (walking distance), and we could hear the roller coasters at night.  It's a block from a drug store for drinks (cheaper than the $3.50 in the soda machine).  The 2-Queen room was big enough for our porta-crib.  We added breakfast to our stay, and it was decent.  The pool and kids' water area was also nice, but we came in March so it was a little bit cold for me.  My 7 year old had a blast.  I used the fitness center, small but had everything I needed.  Everyone was very friendly.    The room didn't have a lot of surface space.  If we go back, we'll upgrade to a suite.  There's only a small counter at the sink, and a tiny bit of space on the dresser, desk, and end table.

Stayed as part of a larger group and was very pleasantly surprised. Great reception area and Amber Waves provided nice meal. Rooms a bit dated but was great value for money. If you want 5+ accommodation look elsewhere - decent, clean spacious rooms are what you get. Snoopy visits were great! Wonderful location - check out Mrs Knottsberry's Chicken!

I have stayed at the Knotts Hotel 3 different times recently.  It is not a big time resort with all the perks.  It's more like a budget family deal resort.  Knott's Berry Farm is a short walk away. The rooms with 2 queen beds are spacious and clean, but are a bit outdated although they recently redesigned the hotel and changed it to be part of Knott's.  It has a restaurant inside called Amber Waves and has good room service.  They charge $7 a day for parking, but if you book on certain websites like Priceline parking is included in your room charge.  I learned that from the front desk lady (thank you very much). There's a place inside for kid's birthday parties and Snoopy walks around there, good to catch him for pics.  They also have a free shuttle to Disneyland now which is

Summary Heading: Some people here any stange expectations
Summary: I'm struggling to understand the reasoning behind some of these negative reviews. This is the "Knott's Berry Farm Hotel." Knott's is a poor person's Disneyland. I think that should give you enough information on what one should expect from this hotel.  My wife and I stayed here 3 nights in Feb 2013 while visiting family in the neighorbood. I paid $60/night. The room was clean and had furniture in it. At $60/night, that's about all I'm expecting. If (i) you are/were expecting more, or (ii) you are paying/paid much more than $60/night, then I would say both of those are/were bad life decisions.  Hotel was good value. As others have mentioned, make sure to ask for a room on a higher floor and not facing the pool (but, pool looks great if you have kids).

Summary Heading: Good value when getting package deal.
Summary: Basic room.  Friendly staff.  Arrived at 10:30 and we were very happy to be allowed an early check in so we could enjoy the park.  Bought a package deal which included room, parking, tickets, and breakfast.  Great value.  Dinner at Amber waves was okay but the breakfast buffet was fantastic!

OUTSTANDING !! We went for the weekend for our yearly family vacation we stayed in the oversized Snoopy room it was clean & very large beds were comfy & the Snoopy tuck in service was awesome! Hotel staff were amazing & very helpful there's a gift shop located in hotel & the breakfast buffet that came with pacakage was delcious & the waiters were awesome as well this has to be one of the best hotel I've stayed at that accompadtes kids happiness pool area large & spray area for kids to get wet was a treat! I highly recommend this hotel !!! At night Hotel was quiet. shower heads excellent water pressure!

Summary Heading: Good and Very Convenient for a visit to the park
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel every time we've visited Knott's Berry Farm and have always had a pleasant visit.   The rooms are basic and clean. We typically don't spend a lot of time in it so that is just fine with us. The swimming pool area is excellent and all of the staff we've encountered at the hotel have been friendly and helpful.  You do have to pay for parking which is a strike but the lot is well lit and regularly patrolled by park security which may even it out.   The proximity to the park and Knott's California Marketplace (including the famous Chicken Dinner restaurant) make this the perfect spot for our family when we visit.  Don't forget to head through the tunnel and and under the street to visit the fish pond for a little quiet and the reproduction of

Took the kids for a four day weekend in February. We were able to check into our room at 9:30, and the front desk was very friendly. We had help to our room without even asking, and they gave us coupons for a free kids lunch or dinner.  After arriving back from the party we were all tired so decided to have dinner in the room. The hall smelled like smoke, and the property is smoke free. We called the front desk and they immediately switched us to another room and helped us move all of our belongings. I was very appreciative since I was alone with my three kiddos.  We will be staying there again over spring break.

The hotel is older, but well kept.  it is within walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm. The rooms are good sized, very clean. The room we stayed in had been completely redone, new paint, carpets, furniture, Television, and light fixtures in bath and vanity areas.  Excellent pool, and hot tub.  Outstanding work out center with cardio machines, weight machine, free weights, dry sauna, and steam room.  Staff was excellent very helpful and courteous. Good restaurant on premises, but you should not miss the best fried chicken ever at Knott's BF.  It is about a 10 minute drive to Disneyland, and the hotel also provides a shuttle.

We had to stay here during the natural food expo in Anaheim. It's an older hotel, the rooms aren't maintained. Hard-water scales in the toilet bowl (one would think that's pretty easy to clean, right?), moldy odour in the bathtub, although I didn't see any visible mold. Unfortunately my TV also didn't work when we first checked in (which was around 9pm). I called the reception to ask them to fix it, and they responded by saying they don't have anyone who can help and it will have to wait until he next morning. I didn't have time to wait, so I unplugged all the cables and connections, and re-connected them in the proper sockets. Thankfully it worked. I called the reception desk to inform them that I had to fix the TV myself; they responded by "oh, okay". Not sincere, no
Manager Response: Please accept a sincere apology on behalf of the entire team at the Knott’s Hotel. Your experience cannot be further from the ultimate goals of the Knott’s brand. We pride ourselves on clean rooms and above all else excellent service. I feel terrible that we were unable to provide you with that experience.  While I understand this experience has left you with a negative perception of our property, I would love the opportunity to provide you with the visit that many of our guests have grown accustom too. Please contact me directly should you be returning to the area as I would love to personally design an upgraded reservation for you and your family. Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: We went for the Halloween Haunt, the package deal was an amazing value for the 3 of us. The hotel is nice and clean, the guest services were great, our room was spotless...but the bed was horrible. We had backaches, and tossed and turned all night. If it wasn't for us losing sleep over hard beds I would have rated it a 4. We ate in their restaraunt for dinner the night of the Haunt and dinner was terrible. Don't bother eating there. However the breakfast was alright. We will return for the Haunt...but we will choose another package thru another hotel.
Manager Response: While I was excited to see that your visit was during our Halloween Haunt, I was very disappointed to learn that you did not sleep or eat well! Our restaurant, Amber Waves, has made several changes in the past year and I am pleased to say that the overall quality of the food and service has improved significantly. We have also renovated many floors and replaced the majority of the beds since your last visit. I hope that you consider giving us another chance in the future! Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary Heading: Who knew Knott's had such a nice hotel? And park tickets, too!
Summary: I remember when the hotel was built years ago.  I never had the occasion to stay there.  It was under different ownership/management back then, but this time, it's all Knott's.  The most outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff.  I can't say enough about the front desk staff, they were that good.  Everyone I came in contact with from the front desk to housekeeping and in between made eye contact and greeted me.  I haven't gotten that walking through other resorts where their "specialty" is customer service.  The room is no frills (no fridge or microwave) and was comfortable.  There were the noisy neighbors--you can never get away from that, but the walls seemed sound-proof in a way so it was rather muffled, not in-your-face.  There is a beautiful pool and tennis courts!

We stayed Feb. 15-17th. Excellent service, clean,comfy and location location location. My husband forgot his toiletries however, the front desk gave him toothbrush with paste razor and shaving cream. The gift shop had a travel size deodorant for under $2.00. Our son is I'll and had a horrible nose bleed. The housekeeping staff was so kind and gave us extra towels and tissue. They told us if we needed anything at all that would help to let them know. Now that goes above great customer service. If any staff member was around when we were entering or leaving the hotel they would always open the door for us. Thank you for that.  It is a very short walk to the park. We took a 4 hour break from the park and enjoyed the pool and spa took a nap, work up fresh and stayed late in the

Stayed 6 nights mid February. When I checked in, the city had advised all the buildings in the area to shut off their water for some reason having nothing to do with the hotel, The front desk staff at Knotts were all ready with free water on hand and the problem was corrected that night. Special thanks to Stephen and his team for making us feel at home throughout the week.  The rooms were clean. A little dated and tired but nothing broken. The beds were comfortable and the TV and internet were great. The restaurant downstairs had AWESOME food. When they were busy, the wait for food was a little longer then you might like, but the presentation was like you see in food magazines, and the staff were awesome. Especially Gino and Mario. I ate at least two meals there every day and

I stayed here one night for a conference that was being held at the hotel.  The hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable.  No frills, but it had everything I needed.  I didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel but there was plenty of places around if you wanted to leave the hotel to eat.  It was nice and quiet and the bed was comfortable.  I did get room service for breakfast the next morning and it arrived promptly and was good and hot.  Would definitely stay again if I went up for Knott's Haunted Nights or just wanted to go to the park for a day.

I stayed here with my boyfriend and his father visiting from England (two separate rooms) for a night last March.  This hotel is just fine, it's clean and comfortable. It's low frills, like a Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn, but it has all of the basics.  We got it as a package with tickets to Knotts Berry farm. I didn't pay and am not sure of the cost, but it sounded like we got a very good deal.  It's a short walk to Knotts, which makes this an ideal spot for a Knotts vacation.  It included a breakfast buffet, which had cold and hot options at an adjacent restaurant. I wouldn't have paid for this, but since it was included, it was a good deal. Decent food and definitely an upgrade from a continental breakfast.  The best part was the pool, which is outdoors, but heated in winter.

This hotel was very nice. We arrived a little early and asked for a "quieter" room. The girls at the front desk worked very hard and were able to get us a nice room away from the elevators on a quieter floor, and still have a single king bed. Every one of the staff that we dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful. During check out, it was the hotel manager that helped my wife and seemed genuinely concerned that we had an enjoyable stay.  The room was very nice and clean. This hotel is being renovated and it is very nice. We stayed here a few years back and it was much nicer now. The pool area was always clean and well stocked and the play area for kids was pretty cool.  Our only real complaint was on the first day we were there, on of the grounds keepers was running a leaf

Just came back from a weeks stay......room was great; larger than I expected actually - a fridge would have been nice though. Shuttle to Disneyland was great --- times were a little limited but of course we went off-season, so it was expected. Front desk personell were very helpful, and the restaurant is fantastic --- some great deals @ Happy Hour! I would not hesitate to recommend for an off-peak stay.

Paid for this hotel with airline miles, so I can't say if it's a good value or not.  It's a bustling, characterless hotel that appears to do a lot of business with conventions, etc.  Our room was nicely appointed, on the first floor with a sliding glass door leading to an expansive patio area; that was very nice, but it was also next to the housekeepers' area, so we heard a lot of chatter when rooms were being cleaned.   No microwave or refrigerator in the room.  An easy walk out the back doors to Mrs. Knott's chicken dinner restaurant, where we had a nice nostalgic dinner.    A major reservation was the needlessly complicated wifi system; which did not belong to the hotel but was provided by some outside contractor.  Logging on was a complicated procedure, and needed to be

We have season passes to Knots but we didn't stay there for a park visit. We had a water polo tournament that weekend and searched for a cheap hotel so we wouldn't have to drive home in traffic. Its one of the first that popped up. I knew that they had bought the older hotel so i was sceptic. I was shocked to see all the beautiful work they did there. Totally brought it up to a higher level. The bar and grill there was very nice and well priced and the pool area is perfect for kids and spacious. It even had a splash pad. Very good place to stay especially if you're spending the day at the park!

Summary Heading: Typical hotel experience, convenient to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: The Knotts Berry Farm resort hotel has the advantage of being very close to the park.  It is an easy walk, and simplifies parking.  It is also close to a number of other stores and restaurants if you need anything.  I wouldn't consider it a luxury resort hotel, it's a pretty average hotel, basic furniture, showing wear and tear, and with it's share of minor problems. Overall it was a good stay, and suited our needs.  We stayed in a two queen room on the 8th floor, under the 9th floor ballrooms, facing the pool.  We had no problems with noise from the pool, but we could hear the music from the ballroom (the event in the ballroom was the reason we were there, so we understood and didn't have a problem with it, just noticed when we ran downstairs to get something).  Our reservation

Overall a very nice stay.  We did have an unpleasant experience in the hotel restaurant.  We were enjoying a meal there with our granddaughter, that include a wonderful visit to our table by Snoopy.  From the restaurant's bar there was a loud drunk screaming obscenities over an NBA game being shown there.  That would never happen at a Disney property.

We stayed here with our family because my husband's Christmas dinner was at Knott's. For the price it was awesome. Everything was VERY clean and the staff was very polite. You can add the all you can eat breakfast for an extra few bucks. (I think children under 9 eat free). The food wasn't absolutely delicious but, it was convenient. They have a cereal bar, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon and fruit. It was your typical continental breakfast. They have a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland as well. So, if you're on a budget and want to stay somewhere nice near Disneyland, I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Off to a bad start but overall experience was good
Summary: This hotel with tickets to Knott's and free meals for the kids was s great value.  We were initially assigned a room on the 8th floor.  When we walked in it appeared physically clean but smelled like s moldy sewer and the bathroom floor was sticky.....disgusting! When we went and complained,  they reassigned us to the ,3rd floor .
