It was clean and met our needs.  Knott's was a convenient short walk.  The pool looked nice with s water feature for kids.  We would absolutely stay here again because of the great value and proximity to Knott's Berry Farm.  Meals at Amber waves was part of the package and the food was actually good.

We chose to stay at "The Knott's Berry Farm Hotel" not expecting a five star resort but just a clean, family friendly, safe hotel.   Instead, we paid for paper thin walls, horrible un-accommodating service & a lack of security features that are typically found in hotels across the nation.  The hotel restaurant "Amber Waves" customer service was no betters than the service received in the hotel. We literally walked out of the restaurant after being seated because no one ever bothered to acknowledge we where sitting with menus and waiting to order for 30 minutes. This was after making eye contact with a waitress on more than one occasion.   This hotel is simply not what I would expect to find in a hotel associated with a larger theme park located in Orange County Ca.   Very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share you experience. Although unfortunate, it does create an opportunity for growth for my team as we grow closer to our ultimate goal of 100% guest satisfaction. The issues that you experienced as it relates to service in both the hotel and restaurant are completely unacceptable and go against everything we stand for at Knotts. While I understand this experience has left you with a negative perception of our property, I would love the opportunity to provide you with the visit that many of our guests have grown accustom too. Please contact me directly should you be returning to the area as I would love to personally design an upgraded reservation for you and your family. Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: I only stayed here one night but had a very pleasant experience. The room is a nice size, beds are comfortable, extra pillows and linens are in the tv cabinet, coffee maker in the room. The only downfall would be that a fridge and microwave do not come with the standard room. There is,however, a restaurant/bar on site that is open late and has nice food. Also, right outside the door and across the parking lot is TGI Fridays and Knott's Berry Farm. The staff was helpful. We booked on Priceline for only $40 and upgraded to two queens for only $10 when we got to the resort. The price was well worth it. I would recommend this hotel to to anyone wanting to visit Knotts or Disneyland. The hotel provides a shuttle each day that takes guests to Disneyland. Great value!

We drove up and to our kids delight snoopy was outside waiting to greet guests. We got to check in at 9:30 am which I never experienced before. Because we got a good deal we opted for the snoopy room. It was well worth it. Snoopy came to tuck in our kid and really took his time and our kid loved it.  The staff also saw that we just got to our room so they hit the other rooms first (if you miss the tuck in you are warned that its your loss). We had a view of the pool and it cleared out somewhat early due to the time of year, but I could see where it could be noisy. The room is dated but its not like we spent much time there and our AC was loud. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful especially Tom in the gift shop and the bartender who both went beyond the call of duty.

The Knott's hotel has been around forever.  Even though it's showing its age a bit, it's still a perfectly decent hotel and definitely a notch or two above most of the hotels in the area (many of which are on the seedy side).  The room was very basic, and much smaller than what you would find in a more modern hotel.  The bed was comfy, but I think they skimped on the pillows.  The outdoor pool and jacuzzi are quite nice.  For what it is, the list price of $100 or so is a bit on the high side, and one of other major chains in the area might be a better choice.  But it's a good value if you can get an AAA or online discount that would bring it closer to $80.

Summary Heading: Knotts Berry Farm Hotel-Location, Location, Location for family of 5
Summary: We stayed at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel over the xmas-new year's break.  Since we are a family of 5 (1-17teen and 2 college-aged), we were surprised that they could fit all of us in a room. We had to buy the 1-price package which included a room for 5 with entry to the park, and "breakfast".  (Most hotels make you book two rooms for a family of five so we were okay with that).    Our room was on the 5th floor facing west with a view of the pool and parking lot, the view didn't really matter to us. (Pool had east coast idiots in the cold rain, trying to swim, because California never gets cold rain, right?) Temps were in the 40's and 50's.  The elevators were fast and that was impressive given the age of the facility. The morning rush for use of the elevators is busy.    The

Summary Heading: Great price if you book a combo
Summary: Knott's Berry Farm offers lowered prices if you ordered tickets and a room through their website.  The hotel is a short walk from the park, and its location is the major reason for staying here.  The hotel room was average across the board (size, bathroom, cleanliness), but I am glad I stayed there after spending a long day at the park.  Although understandable given the clientele, the hotel was very noisy (lots of kids running up and down the hall at all hours), so I had to turn the A/C on full blast to drown out some of the noise.

I wanted to stay one night so that I could stay at Knott's until they kicked us out and not have to drive home. I also wanted a place where my kids could swim, jacuzzi and use the spray ground. I really researched the $50 - $80 hotels but decided to go for a bit of an upgrade. I ended up paying $99.00 with a AAA discount at the Knott's Berry Farm Family Resort. I think I would have done just as well in going to a $49 hotel as the $99 hotel. A small list of things wrong with the room...TV remote broken, heater blew cold air for 20 minutes before it would put heat out, the heater sounded like a plane taking off every time it would kick off. It was so loud we ended up turning it completely off and slept cold. The shower would cycle between extremely hot, then freezing cold while
Manager Response: Let me begin with a sincere apology and ensure you that our management team takes each negative experience very seriously. We view these unfortunate occurrences as an opportunity to improve in the future and I feel terrible that our Front Desk Agent was unable to demonstrate that empathy. Given the time frame when this issue happened I fear that I will be unable to offer much more justification although I hope to have an opportunity to provide you with the experience our guests have grown accustom too. Please contact me directly should you be returning to the area as I would love to personally design an upgraded reservation for you and your family. Thank you again, Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: We stayed the night on December 29th. Our room was clean. The remote needed new batteries and someone came up to replace it quick. It was my daughters birthday and 2 staff members were very kind to her and gave her a birthday button and a Snoopy doll. We were definitely not expecting that. Overall we were very pleased with our stay.

Our bathrooms had hair in the sink and the tub, maid finally came up and cleaned and but there were many obvious hairs still there!!  We found stains on our comforter possibly hair/bm and hairs on the sheets. Management and nite was lacking and had no compassion at all. After enough complaining finally got another room which looked ok but found several hairs dealt with it and slept with out clothing on. The entire hotel had no drinks in the entire resort even the next day empty. And very loud all nite. The day manager was polite and said wed get some compensation waiting too see if that does happen. I don't understand how the unsanitary conditions could even exist.  You are charged 30 cents a min to use the net and a min 3.00 charge. The breakfast buffet was good but they need
Manager Response: Hello again Heather and thank you for taking the time to complete a review. Once again please let me apologize for the poor cleanliness of your room and lack of soda in the vending machines. I was actually not aware of this or the noise issues from our conversation the morning of your departure so I appreciate you letting us know so that we can ensure the issues are corrected. I have looked into your bill and as promised your refund has been issued for the poor experience. Please come visit us again if you find yourself back in the area as I would love to design a reservation that would earn your business back. Thank you again for the information as it will help our team develop closer to our goals of 100% guest satisfaction.  Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Extremely noisy. Great location. Great restaurant.
Summary: We are leaving here quite unsatisfied, the noise level from adjacent rooms is terrible. The management thought that putting a wedding party in adjacent rooms on all sides would be a good idea,they were wrong.  The location is excellent adjacent to Knotts and the Amber Waves restaurant is probably the best I have been to in a while.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. While I was thrilled to see that you had a nice experience in Amber Waves Restaurant I do apologize that the noise disturbed you and your family. We do our best to section off areas of the building where we anticipate potential noise issues but clearly we unable to satisfy your needs. We hope that you return to our property in the future and accept our apology. Thank you and we look forward to providing you and your family with a better experience during your next visit. -Stephen Ruggiero, Front Office Manager 714-243-2006

Summary: Took my grand kids to Knott's right after Christmas as part of their present. Stayed in Snoopy room and loved it. My 3 year old grandson was thrilled to have Snoopy tuck him in bed, and we even bought him Snoopy PJ's just for the occasion. The service was wonderful, and everyone was smiling and looking happy. Made for a great after Christmas relaxation trip.

We had a nice stay at this hotel with a few hiccups. Our room on the fifth floor had a toilet that wanted to overflow and as we were only there at night the regular maintenance man was not working so they sent an older gentleman with a plunger but he got the job done. Also on our second night there the hotel fire alarm went off at 1am which panicked a few guests. But the room was comfortable and quite and kept very clean and the staff was very friendly.

I got this hotel room through a HotWire Hot Deal.  When I bid, I was positive that I was going to be getting a Holiday Inn Express or Sheraton.  When I found out that I was staying next to the Knott's Berry Farm park, I was so upset.  Many travelers at TripAdvisor commented on hearing roller coaster noises and an over abundance of rowdy kids.  We're AARP age and do not travel with kids.  This seemed like such an inappropriate place for two almost senior citizens.  I even wrote to HotWire begging them to let me change my reservation.  It didn't work.  My fears were for naught.  I called the front desk before arrival and asked for a quiet room.  They gave us a room on a near empty floor, and all the way at the end of the hall.  We heard very little noise from the hall or any other

Great military appreciation offer!  Our rm was on 7th floor and we could hear music from an event that was on 9th floor, luckily we were to eventually fall asleep.  All staff encountered were friendly and helpful, including Amber Waves folks. VIP card is available for 20% off meals at Amber Waves and for hotel guests, 10% off at sundries shop.  Location is a minute walk to park, a great convenience.

We stayed here for 1 night while visiting the park.  We arrived 3 hours prior to check in, luckily there was a room available for us which was great.  Our room was much bigger than expected and had a nice view of the garden.  Loved the fact the room had internet access from the TV. The only thing missing in the room was a refrigerator. Our room was next to the elevators and ice machine but you really couldn't hear them which was great.  Very close walk to the park.  Will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in Orange county, CA
Summary: If you are planning a trip to Orange county, CA, you should consider staying at Knotts. Dont get caught up in that Disney, convention center, or other hotel reasons to stay somewhere. Knotts is hands down the best experience for the money bar none.       I was making the trip of the decade. I was going out to Anaheim to be with my fiancee for two weeks, and also to meet my son and his fiancee, and my daughter there. My fiancee was out there with her family to do Disney.       We went to Knotts to check in, the staff was fantastic. We got a room with a great view, and an upgrade from "just a room" to a romantic package. It came with alot of nice extras and was very reasonable. It also included all you can eat breakfast in the hotel restaurant; which was rather excellent.

I stayed in the hotel for my daughter's 12th birthday.  She and her friends shared an oversized room and I had a smaller adjoining room, which works out nicely.  For a 3-star hotel, the rooms were about what I expected.  Clean, but nothing too overwhelmingly special.  The service at the hotel was tested when the girls and I returned from the park and ordered room service. The food came over an hour later and half the order was missing.  The girl at the room service line actually tried to convince me that she got the order rigth and that I did not order half of the items on my list.  This was more than insulting to me, as was the tone of her voice.  The night manager called me, after I asked for her twice, and basically said "what do you want me to do about it?"  I currently work
Manager Response: Gina, I apologize that you had such a negative experience ordering room service. That is a very unique situation and definitely something that we take very seriously. We thank you for bringing it to our attention again as I do remember discussing the situation with you the morning after. I do hope that the complimentary breakfast for you and your family presented a much better experience in our restaurant and that you return to us again in the future! -Stephen, Front Office Manager

Summary: After travelling 400 miles we arrived at Knott's requesting a room, a very polite receptionist sorted it out in 10 minutes flat. The room was was spotless, beds good, everything was perfect. We decided to eat and that was no problem, seated within 10 minutes and had a drink and meal. After our journey we decided to use the pool & Jacuzzi nice and warm and no charge for the pool or fitness center.Tea & coffee free in the room, maid could not do enough for you. Beds good, room clean, food good service good, staff polite. Recommend you go to Knott's for your breakfast and have the biscuits, served fresh and warm, staff brilliant. Good marks all the way also Snoopy will wave goodnight to you when you go to bed. Good value would go again.

Summary Heading: Great if your going to the theme park.
Summary: This resort is a great place to stay if you plan to visit Knott's Berry farm theme park. You can walk to the Theme park, get discount tickets from reception and the rooms a quiet and spacious for this style of hotel. The room was clean with a normal size bathroom, plenty of room for bags and plenty of car parking. My room didn't have a fridge and considering the amount of food you get from the Knott's restaurant a fridge would have been handy for left overs.

Summary Heading: Gets bad reviews, but I didn't experience anything bad
Summary: We just concluded our first trip to Knotts Berry Farm hotel.  I was a little worried with the reviews.  For the price I felt like this was a very nice hotel.  Location was great, Amber Waves food was great, staff was friendly, beds were comfortable and the room was clean.  Noise level??  What do you expect at an amusement park.....you get close proximity.  If you want a Hilton go pay the price for the Hilton.  If you want location with a nice pool and good food I would suggest this hotel.  Snoopy in the lobby in the evening....so cute!

My wife and I stayed here last year on our honeymoon and thought we would stay again for our Anniversary. We enjoy going to Knott's Berry Farm as it is right next door.  For my part, I thought the pool, and jacuzzi were excellent and I thought the fitness room was great.  They even have a steam room, which I enjoyed.  We didn't eat at the restaurant as it seemed expensive, so I couldn't say if it was good or not.  I don't like the fact that they charge you $7.00 for parking though.  The staff were very friendly at all times. My wife will finish with her thoughts.   The room was very clean and decorated nicely other than the chair and ottoman, which was very comfortable by the way, but were light blue whereas rest of room in earthtones. The bed was extremely comfortable though I

Summary Heading: Rip Off price for an old unfriendly hotel
Summary: My family stayed in early November.  This hotel costs three times what the other next door motels cost. The only thing you get is the name. It is an old hotel with small rooms. The staff was very unfriendly.  Besides the overpriced hotel you had to pay to park there.  The 3 small elevators always had a waiting line and were extremely slow.  There was nothing I liked about this hotel.  My wife had a problem plugging in the iron as there were no plug ins except for the tv toys, and be carefull if you even touch one there is a charge. Don't even get me started on the restaurant. To get a refill on their $3 cup of coffee was an act of congress. They just kept ignoring you. They must be taught to save all the money on refills as they will neaver see you again.  Too bad they can't
Manager Response: Elmer, I apologize for the negative experience that you had during your stay with us. We agree that there is no excuse for poor guest service and are shocked that you were treated in this way. On behalf of the entire team at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel we hope that you give us another chance to experience the superior service and convenience the vast majority of our guests are used to.  -Stephen, Front Office Manager

Summary: We checked in at Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel in the last week of October 2012.  It was so near the Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park that you could hear the yells of the thrill riders of  the park during night time.  But was not really that annoying.  The staff was helpful, although we were greeted by a $4.00 dollar bottled water upon entering the room.  The room was nice though and the four of us could fit into its two queen beds.    They have a complimentary shuttle ride to the Disneyland, which we availed.  The shuttle van was decent.    The hotel in general was very good and the staff was very accomodating.  My only complaint was that there was this peculiar odor in one of their side stairways going to the lobby from the pool side.  Perhaps, it was the carpet.  Other than

This was a great family event! The hotel had monsters walking around "greeting" people! We went to the pre-haunt scare buffet (included in the package), the breakfast (included in the package), and our room was HUGE and very comfortable. We looked out on part of Ghostrider, and although we didn't spend much time in the room, it was perfect for three people.

As always, on our trip to Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park, we always stay for a day or two at the Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  The staff were very nice and helpful, the food is Amber Waves Restaurant is good. The place still looks the same after visiting it over the past 15 years or so. Some of the staff are still the same and they remember us. We stayed at the beginning of our trip and the King Size Bed was hard but because we had a 12 hour flight, we were shattered so we did sleep. We went back to the hotel for the last two nights and this time our beds were very comfortable but they put us in room 124 where you could here the noise from the hotel dryers in the laundry. They did offer us another room.  The best thing about this Hotel is that its the closest hotel to the

We are regulars to the Halloween Haunt at Knott's and stay at the Knott's hotel most of the time due to the packages they offer and it's just so close...it's just so convenient. I have seen major changes in this hotel over the years ( better changes). And this stay was by far the best one. We got there a little early and checked in and our room was ready. The rooms are not that big and yes the hotel is a bit dated but for the price it's pretty good. We got the Haunted Dreams package and went to our pre scare dinner. This was the best food we have ever had at the hotel. Like I said before, we have stayed here many different times for the haunt and I can tell the difference from past years. The food was fresh, the employes were helpful and very friendly. After we had our dinner we

Excellent location, right next to the park. The staff was nice, we stayed at room 818, it was OK but I personally did not like the bed sheets were rough so definitely need to change for new ones, the bathroom was clean. In general we enjoyed our stay

The hotel is right near the amusement park. We went for Knotts Scary Farm and they really go all out with decorations! The hotel itself is OK. Checkin was fast and they were friendly. The beds in my room sucked. That was the worst thing was the beds other than that it was a decent stay.

We stayed 1 night and it was miserable. The housekeeper had to physically break into the room for us (door was stuck shut). The beds are rock hard, no mini fridge/microwave (nothing to keep my medical supplies cold), coffee maker had to be carried into bathroom to make coffee, the air conditioner was sooo noisy it was extremely hard to watch TV or conduct a conversation.  There isn't a table to sit at (other than the desk) to eat at, if you were to order their breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: we appoligize that your stay was not to your satisfaction.  We really appreciate your comments.  I hope that you will give us another chance to win you business at your next visit in the area.

Summary: Really enjoyed our stay at knotts berry farm hotel. The check in was quick and easy, location is excellent and facilities were perfect for us - well equipped gym and very nice pool area. The location is fantastic esp. if you want to go to knotts berry farm. We had a car but the mall, restaurants, supermarket were all In walking distance. Parking at the hotel was easy and safe too. The room was ok, although the bathroom was in need of a reno and I was surprised not to have a fridge in the room (but requested one and got it immediately). My son loved seeing snoopy in the lobby every day and the goblin thing for the haunt was a bit of fun too. Didn't eat here at all so can't comment on the food. Staff were all very nice and a special thanks to Alex who helped us out on several
Manager Response: We are really glad that your stay was a memorable experience.  We look forward to your future business.  Thank you!

Summary: This hotel was such a big disapointment! Durring our roadtrip we planned to spend 2 nights in The Candy Cane Inn and 2 nights here whilst in LA however I wish we hadnt and had stayed at the Candy Cane! This hotel was quite clean and the lobby was nice. The pool area was good, nice play bit for the kids with squirters etc. However there were things in the room that were broken and the hotel was very noisy, from people outside walking past, in the pool and on the bacolny below as well as babies crying through the night. Our stay was okay but it was definatly not as good as the candy cane!
Manager Response: I appoligize that you stay was not everything you expected.  I hope that you will give us another chance to prove that our hotel is up to your expectations.  We appreciate the feedback so we can improve.  Thank you!

Summary: Stayed on Sept. 29 for one night.  We attended the Knott's Scary Farm event.   Stayed in room 330, double queen bed, four people.     I would stay at this hotel again only for the convenience  of walking to Knott's.  It was very close to the entrance.  You have to pay to park your car - $7 (I think this is the norm now for most hotels).  They do not have a free continental breakfast - $10.  The hotel itself is old - maybe 20 yrs. or more.  The bathroom did not have a vent for showering, so walls, door and such were wet after shower.  You could see it's been going on for some time since the wood on the bottom of the door was warped.  We had enough towels and they were clean.  One of the bedspreads had some crusty stain on it - don't know what it was.  We removed the bedspread
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We appreciate your comments so we can improve as a hotel for our guest.  I am positive on your next visit that things will be different.  We strive to be the best in service.  Thank you again.

Summary: The worst "hotel" ever !!!!  The sheets had hair, blankets had multiple stains , bathroom had hair and stains. I can't believe a theme park would put their name behind a hotel that is so poorly maintained. When I complained I was told I was in a "refurbished" room.  I am furious. DON'T STAY HERE!!! They are MANY other choices.
Manager Response: I appoligize that your stay was not to your expectations.  I would like it if you could call us and talk about it if someone has not contacted already.  Thank you

Summary Heading: Fabulous value for money - although hotel a bit tired and dated
Summary: For $150 we had a twin queen room, hot buffet breakfast, car parking and two adult entry tickets to Knotts Berry Farm.  The hotel was clean and the breakfast was good.  If you are looking for somewhere to stay near the park and can get a deal, then I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: This hotel was an overnight stop on a self drive tour. Very easy to find. Spacious parking. Disney Anaheim was within an easy commute from here although there was a 'fun park' next door! Room was clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: It is soooo worth staying at the Knotts Berry Hotel if you are going to the parks. We not only got the package for the room, tickets  (at a decent discount) and breakfast but also got to get into the park a bit earlier than the general public. The rooms were nice (although we had a issue with the closet door), housekeeping staff were helpful and the pool area was nice (kids got a kick out of the spray area). The park was a 2-3 minute walk which is really nice especially when you have a toddler. The Manager in the gift shop was very helpful and even gave us pointers on how or what we should do with our toddler when Snoopy came around (our son had been aprehensive the first Snoopy sighting). Room service was ok- when placing the order they didnt seem too professional but food was

Summary Heading: Knott's Hotel for the Halloween Haunt
Summary: We booked the Haunted Dreams package for this year's Halloween Haunt.  The package included a night's stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel, plus tickets to the Haunt.  We arrived at 2:00 pm, and our hotel room was already ready.  Check-in was a breeze.  Our room, 835, overlooked Ghost Rider, Independence Hall, and Soak City.  You could see Disneyland several miles away.  Room was very clean, including the windows.  We had stayed at the hotel 4 years ago, and we could tell that the hotel has done some upgrading since then.  Everything was clean and dusted.  The comforters were a bit on the worn side, but since I believe that most hotels never clean their comforters, I promptly removed it from the bed.  The mattresses are VERY firm, which is not to everyone's liking.  Luckily for

We were wary, as booked this via virgin, but seperate from our main holiday,as we had hired a car and drove from Las Vegas out to california,  and it was the cheaper on their site for that area, We were pleasantly surprised, beautifully clean, coffee maker and contents in the rooms, all facilities within the whole complex, great parking facilities, and the staff were cheerful, and very helpful, for children there is the theme park and water park on site, and Disney is just a couple of miles away, and it is the home of Snoopy, who visits the hotel daily,We took a day tour out to Hollywood and the walk of fame,  Yes the hotel is a little dated , but I think that the price reflects this, please don't be put off by damning reviews, as you dont have to do anything else but sleep here

Stayed for two nights at this hotel.  Upon check in there was some confusion as to the form of payment which resulted in m being charged twice.  Luckily, the accounting department at this hotel was able to help remedy this situation.   This hotel is in need of an update!  The rooms are a small step up  in that it offers a flat screen TV.  However, the bathroom area is tiny and unattractive.  For a family of four, I would not want to stay here more than one night.  Most hotels offer a mini refrigerator in each room to keep small items cold.  When asked about this, I was advised that they could provide one for a $20 charge.  That kind of nickel and diming left a bad taste in my mouth.  The pool area is nice which includes a water/play area for little ones who can not swim.
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire team at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel we apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay with us. We are very pleased to inform you that we have been continuing our ongoing renovations throughout our property and feel great about the changes to improve the look of our property. We have also revisited some of our pricing and advertising displays to ensure that we are clear and present the best value possible. Again, we apologize for your negative stay and hope that you give us another chance to experience the superior service and convenience the vast majority of our guests are used to.  -Stephen, Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Package deal with tickets didn't seem too outrageous
Summary: I have no problem with the hotel whatsoever, they've done a good job and keeping it updated.  The hallways on the way to your room remind me of a cheap Las Vegas hotel, but once inside your room, they are quite pleasant.  I enjoyed our stay and more importantly the short walk to the gates.  I thnk in 2012 it is quite stupid to charge customers to use your lobby computers, .39cents/minute and I swear they use dialup.  I prepaid and it took me 3-4 minutes to load some of the webpages...............really?  That is a minor issue, overall I felt it was a good value for the money.

Stayed here for 2 nights while doing the Disney thing!  Didnt actually go into the Knotts Berry Amusement park so cannot comment on that.  Very impressed overall with the hotel.  The room was very spacious and clean and just what we wanted after a day in Disney.  The restaurant is very reasonably priced and we had probably the best meal of our entire 3 week trip on Route 66 and we told the Chef this.  Swimming pool very nice and clean, front desk staff very helpful ,

The only thing different between this and a Disney property is Knotts is smaller, has nicer employees and way less expensive.  Very nice place to stay.  Great beds, too.  The onsite restaurant has great food, helpful servers and, again, great prices.  All this is in easy walking distance to the park.  We will definately stay again

From the minute the gentleman opened the car door until we had to depart, we had a fantastic time! Front desk guy was, as were all the personnel, over the top with kindness, helpfulness and charm.    Our room was not small, it was very clean, well appointed and well laid out.  The pool and hot tub area was great and being so close to Knotts was an added bonus.

Summary Heading: Good rooms, good food, and freakin' SNOOPY!
Summary: We stayed here for four days in January.  Being a huge Peanuts fan, all the little extras made me smile. And Snoopy walks around sometimes, and half of me knows it's not the "real" Snoopy, but the other side of me just wants to hug him. And that is NOT acceptable. I am a GROWN MAN!  Back to the point. The room was nice, clean. Only gripe is there's a bottle of water there that costs three dollars. It's just there on the counter, waiting for you to drink from its outrageously priced bottle. At least it's clearly labeled that they'll charge extra, but still.  The breakfeast buffet at the Amber Waves restaurant is nice. We were on a bdget but still got to eat decently and have a nice cup of coffee or two. And we ate there later at night and it was still good. Not the breakfast

The hotel is old and rooms are small. The staff are nice one day not the next. Close walk to park that's the only good thing. Had a good time at knots berry farm with my family but left the motel a day early.

I read previous reviews for this hotl, weighed up the pros and cons, and decided that the convenience of being right at the Park and Soak City, and the discount I got with the season passes was the deal breaker.  I stayed with my 7 year old, and honestly it was really fine.  We got nice a room on the 5th floor and took full advantage of the included hotel parking.  Maybe it was the time of year, it's been super hot, and some kids had already gone back to school that we had a relatively quiet and trouble free stay. Definitely will visit again this time of year... do Soak City in the day and vist the theme park at night...all lit up it's so much fun.  And definitely rent tubes at the water park, save you a lot of stress waiting in line for the tubes at each slide. Well worth the

Summary Heading: Spend the extra to stay elsewhere
Summary: Although it's vacinity to the park is good, the hotel was old with rude staff, and numerous problems, such as air conditioner would not turn off even after hotel maintenance tried, tv remote didn't work, and there were little green crickets in the room. Spend the extra and stay elsewhere

The positive first...The staff was friendly upon check-in and check-out. The walk to Knott's Berry Farm from the hotel is very quick and convenient. Had a cute, little pool area for the kids. The Negative...The walls are beyond PAPER-THIN! I could hear every word our neighbors were saying. Including a woman cursing and yelling at her children. It was extremely unsettling. You can hear every door slam as if you were the one slamming it. The beds are HARD AS ROCKS! It's like sleeping on a box spring. I had a headache and backache each morning. The bathroom had mildew in the grout. Very outdated. This is not a hotel I will be staying at again. Which is too bad because we love Knott's Berry Farm!

The staff was very friendly, especially Ellory.  We arrived early and our room was ready, so we didn't have to wait until 4pm check in. The rooms were nice.  We had a good view from our room of the disneyland fireworks.  I thought it was a great value for the price we paid.  A short walking distance to Knott's and Soak City.  The staff at the restaurant were also very nice and accommodating.

This is the best location when you are going to the park. This is an old hotel with a great staff, you can't get the bathtub to drain and the sink to stop up. It needs a complete renovation or just leveled and start over. The beds are maybe the worst ever.

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: I had read many reviews before going.. and got a little freaked out. But not wanting to disappoint FAMILY. I went anyway we came on a Tuesday showed up at about 12 .and where able to check right away in instead of waiting until 4pm .So that was Nice also all the staff we came across where very Nice. So i was excited going up to are room  i was like hey this is not that bad lol. everything i read was the complete opposite.  but than .When we walked into the room i was a little worried the carpet was sooooo out dated... the bedding was old.. the bathroom was not the nicest.. that was very disappointing that the rooms where in poor condition..  as for the park We also had 2 little ones 16 months and 5 there was not too much for them to do.. besides see the snoopy show so i will not

I had booked our stay with a Knotts employee in reservations, I was told the rooms had fridge and microwave and that they had a "continental breakfast". Upon arrival, it turns out that there are no micowaves, the fridge is a $20 charge, and they DO NOT have a "continental breakfast" in the common sense of the term. They have a $10 per person breakfast called the "continental breakfast"  We stayed in a "standard" room. It was less than desirable, thankfully I had Clorox wipes with me so that I could clean the room as much as possible. Our room only had 1 power outlet for our use. The sheets were stained. Towels had some hair in them. The walls are paper thin and we heard everyone all night long. Slamming doors, obnoxious teens yelling, etc. Our last night we stayed in a "themed"

My wife and I traveled to tour sights in LA.  I had never been to KBF, she has not been for 40 years.  I was HUGHLY DISAPPOINTED and she was also for different reasons.  The hotel keeps adding on one surcharge after another.  What started as a quote for $105 a night ended up at $160.  They say they will take a AAA or other discound but never did and denied statements.  Added parking but never mentioned surcharge until check out.  Restaurant was OK if you like overcooked, tasteless unpalatable food and slow service.  I wonder if the park still runs hotel or just rents name.  At Disney they have definite connections to park and make sure that access it convenient.  Here they just point to the back door and you have to walk a 1/2 to a mile for access.  Free Internet was dial-up

We have stayed here several times over the years with our grandchildren,this time was a nightmare.The first day pushing the patio door open something sharp cut my hand there was blood all over the curtains ,complained nothing happened.I left a key and letter at the desk for my son to pick up the key to get my grandkids suitcases.They couldn't find it so said you look honest and mde him a new room key.The bathroom was damp and smelly.Amber waves was terrible I waited 25 minutes for a drink from the bar.The breakfast buffet was cold and the same stuff everyday.I complained and got free 3 breafast vouchers and a stuffed snoopy.I feel we paid top dollar for this trip.It was horrible

We booked the hotel with the ticket package to the park.  We had a one night stay in the "large suite".  It was close to the park and made it easy to get to.  However, the rooms are out dated - small, mildewed bathrooms, little tub and shower area, dirty carpets, small big box tv's, minimal channels, suite was nothing more than an extra sink near bathroom.  We were told by three people we would have a roll away bed - when we arrived back to room at 11 pm there was no bed.  They brought us extra blankets as a solution.  Because we tired and only going to be there a few hours we made due but we will not be staying again.  Also, the noise from the park (screams from roller coasters) are heard in the rooms from 10 am to midnight.
Manager Response: We really appreciate the response and would like you to come back again.  We will have newly renovated rooms throughout the hotel for you to try next time.  Please give us that opportunity to change your opinion.  Thank you again!!

Summary: We decided to stay at this hotel so that we could avoid the need to drive anymore than necessary for our planned visit to Knotts Berry Farm.  We stayed in the Camp Snoopy wing of the hotel and this area was absolutely adorable and the room was IMMACULATE.  The service from the check-in staff was wonderful and the kids even got to see Snoopy during check-in as he was in the lobby taking pictures with the kids.  The bathroom was kind of tiny (makes things difficult when you are trying to crouch by the tub to give your little ones a bath) but overall it was sufficient.  My biggest complaint, and what I see is a pretty common complaint on this site is the lack of insulation/sound proofing between rooms.  I could hear people talking all day and all night from both the rooms next to
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we are glad you enjoyed the stay except for the events of noise.  Next time I am sure you will not have that issue and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you again!!

Summary: Walk to park or tons of food choices.  Diner in hotel has nice selection and great breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Best place to stay and be able to enjoy the park. Easy walk to it, restaurants right there, shopping, everything we could ask for. And a most pleasant staff ready to cooperate and help find anything we needed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and look forward to your rreturn!!

Summary: Very friendly!  We arrived at 7am after flying all night and the front desk checked us in early, got our tickets and took great care of us.  The shuttle to Disney saved us a ton in cabs and Car rentals. Everyone has been very kind!
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to your return.  Thank you!!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel to stay at if you are going to the park
Summary: We stayed at the hotel with intensions on going to the knotts berry farm park the next day. Got the stay and play package and saved alot of money which was nice. Also when staying at the hotel you don't have to pay for parking which is also a plus.  Make sure you request a room on the 3rd floor, the rooms were just renovated top to bottom a couple weeks ago and are very nice. I would definately stay again. the staff was also all very nice. And the kids really enjoyed the park
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and look forward to your future stay with us!!

Summary: We stayed here because is was recommend. Knotts Berry Farms right next store made if very easy to go back and forth. I would highly recommend this place, great for kids when we have them. Rooms very clean and the staff was great.
Manager Response: We are happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your return!!  Thank you.

Summary: Although the hotel was very busy with a big cheerleader conference we found it nice and quite.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the room was clean and the staff were great especially at 3am one morning when my glucose levels dropped and my husband had to seek help to get food for me.  A big thanks to the security guard who came to our aid.  Next to Knotts Berry farm which made it an easy walk to enjoy the theme park and the hotel runs a free shuttle to Disneyland and back several times a day.  We ate several meals on site and found the food and staff to be very good.  All in all we would return, good value for money.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: When going from LA to San Diego, we had one night in the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. It was a very pleasant experience. Rooms were okay and facilities in the hotel were very good, for instance there's an excellent gym with steamroom and sauna, amazing. Also the pool was quite big and looked good. Ate at the 'Amber Waves'-restaurant, which had good, American and Mexican food and great service. Overall a very decent hotel with great facilities and a good location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and appreciate the comments.  Look forward to seeing you again!!

Summary: My hubby booked the snoopy room package as I am a snoopy collector and lover of all things snoopy!  The corridor and bedroom was just an absolute delight. Even though I had my two teenage son's with us, the stay in the snoopy room was for me, but they loved it just as much. The tuck in service by snopy brought tears to my eyes. Seeing snoopy around the premises just brightens even the most hardened person.  The staff were all very friendly and we enjoyed the food at Amber Waves. For a really old fashioned American breaky you need to go to Mrs Knotts chicken diner which is a short walk from the hotel to the resort. There is an early bird special and I must say, we just could not eat all that was served up no matter how hard we tried.  The food was great and you could not go past
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed your stay and snoopy.  Look forward to your future visits!!  Thank you.

Summary: My husband/I stayed for an event being held there at the hotel on a saturday, we were told we had booked the last room which was called the "Snoopy Room".Due to my job I hav made it an habit 2stay @ only Marriots or Radisson hotels, but fortunately they were booked.The room was extremely clean, quiet,staff was extremely efficient and prompt to bring a shaver for my husband. We even had order room service on a Sunday morning at 9am, the food arrived in 20 mins, was still hot, large portions/coffee was grea,little pricey but well worth it.I would recommed this hotel to anyone.and yes we even received a free snoopy.I'm planning on bringing my grandkids cuz U can walk 2Soak city or Knotts within 2minutes
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and look forward to your future visit!!

Summary Heading: Great Value - book the Stay n Play package!
Summary: I booked my reservation via the Knott's website, and got two day amusement park passes (park hopper between Knotts Berry Farm and Knotts Soak City), early entry to Knotts, free buffet breakfast and free parking with three nights stay for less than the cost of the tickets alone to another nearby major amusement park.  The package deal was a fabulous bargain.  The rooms were comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The pool area was nice and there was a great exercise room as well.  Walking distance to both Knotts Berry Farm and Knotts Soak City.  Only complaint about the room is that it appears that the toilet may have overflowed at some point - the carpet outside the bathroom was bubbled up and smelled like a urinal.  Not good.  I didn't complain about it
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and appreciate the comments.  Thank You!

Summary: the hotel was great ,the beds were comfortable,the rooms were large and had frig and microwave in them,the hotel also offers rollaway beds for more sleeping capacity.The hotel also offers theme park and room packages at an affordable price.Also conveniently located walking distance to knotts berry farm theme park.
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your future business.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Old room needing maintenance, long wait for a room but worth it for snoopy
Summary: We arrived at 3.45 for 4pm checkin. Sat in reception with two young kids till 5pm. Not good enough.  Tried to run a bath, plug didn't work, tap wouldn't turn off. Maintenance fiddled with it but still not working properly. Bags didn't get brought up until 30mins after we got a room and then only after a phone call.  But the snoopy visit was great, kids loved it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we strive to improve from our guest comments.  Please give us an opportunity again.  Thank you again.

Summary: Amber waves long wait,  terrible coffee, terrible staff. Rooms clean nice and fresh
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we hope tto see you again.

Summary: We booked our room for one night; the booking included a one-day ticket package for two at Knotts Berry Farm.  We were able to not only pick up our tickets at the Front Desk in the morning, but we were also able to check into our room.  It was very roomy, modern, and squeaky clean.  Service was fantastic - the Desk Clerks provided lots of information about KNB and answered any other questions we had.  We were particularly impressed with them because they were totally nice - not snooty and not acting as if they were annoyed by our questions.  Free parking in a controlled lot made us feel secure about our car.  Valet parking is also available.
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you

Summary: you are right at the park thats the best part.  inexpensive and has deals on tickets and rooms.  pool good.  food and bar not very good.  overall well worth the price and location
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We stayed in three different rooms over a period of 6 days and each time we stepped in, the rooms were damp and musky. In addition, the air-con was noisy and did not function very well. The beds had a certain odour which was not pleasant - it was as if it hadn't been washed for a long time.And don't get me started on the pillows and mattress(you would be better off bringing your own pillow).  Worst of all, after a day of sightseeing, we were horrified to find that the toilet flushing system didn't work and water overflowed onto the floor - you wouldn't believe it but this happened twice in two different rooms. The only saving grace about this hotel were the cheerful staff from the front desk and the only restaurant there. Knotts Berry Farm hotel looks like it could do with a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear about your couple of experiences.  We strive to be better and your review is important to us.

Summary: During our recent tour of California, my husband booked our one night stay in a Snoopy Room as a birthday surprise for me, as I was a Snoopy fan when I was a teenager. First impressions were not good, the receptionist  seemed more interested in dealing with us as quickly as possible rather than be welcoming. Having stayed at 6 hotels during the trip I can safely say this was the worst. Negatives; We arrived in our room on the second floor, overlooking the pool. We were greeted by an intermittent sound reverberating in the ceiling. Worried that it would keep us awake, we contacted reception who advised they would someone to the room. When the maintenance man arrived he promptly informed us that the floor above was being renovated and the noise was from the decorators paint
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We have been upgrading our product this year  to make your experience better in the future.  Please join us again and we would love to have that chance to give you a great vacation experience.  Thank you again.

Summary: We stayed here in 2009 and was amazed by everything that this hotel has to offer.The service we received from Philip (not sure if he is still there) was fun and professional. Pool is a good size. Rooms big and clean and lots of transport available. We are visiting your theme park this September and we can't wait !
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the comments.

Summary: I have stayed here many times because of the location. Close to lots of tourist attractions. The amenities of the room are very good. My biggest complaint is that the beds are too hard and the pillows are way too soft. The bathroom was small and the upkeep on the tile and grout is lacking. The pool area is great for families. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and we are glad you enjoyed your stay.  Your review will make us that much better.

Summary: We arrived at the hotel at about 10:30 after taking a taxi from the airport and attempted to check in. We found that because it was early in the day our room wasn't ready so we decided to go to the theme park which was the only good experience of the trip. After six solid hours of standing on our feet in the sun we returned to the hotel and got our room on the sixth floor, it smelt terrible!! It was almost a mix of mold, marijuana and sweat and it was on everything by the time we left! When we finally got to the room the fort thing we did was change into comfortable clothes and get ready for bed, which was difficult considering that the sink area is about the size of a coat clost with only one tiny sink! Then the beds, oh I don't even know where to start! They were hard and
Manager Response: Sorry to hear about your experience and we strive for your stay to be the best.  Your review is important to us to make us better.  Please visit us again and I am sure it will be a better experience.  Thank you again.

Summary: We stayed there with our children aged six and eight and we loved the fact that the room was so themed (much more Peanuts and Snoopy themed than the Disneyland Hotel room was themed Disney).  Special touches were a special desert being sent up for the eight year old when they heard it was her birthday.  Extra special touch was Snoopy coming to tuck the children into bed and the complimentary Snoopy toys for the children.  We only stayed the one night but thought it was great!
Manager Response: Thank your for your review and hope your next stay can be longer.  Glad you and your family enjoyed it.

Summary: I took my son 13yrs, daughter 25yrs and her boyfriend's nephew 6 yrs to this hotel. We stayed here so we could go to Knott's but still return to the room perodically to rest if needed. All enjoyed the stay. The younger ones loved the pool and water playground. Us older folk loved the bar and restaurant and the convenience to the park.  It is an older hotel but very well kept. The staff was very friendly and efficient, the hotel was impeccably clean and the Peanuts decor was a hit with everyone.
Manager Response: We are really glad your had a great stay.  We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: We stayed at the Knotts Berry Farm hotel Mother's Day weekend 2012...Check in was a breeze ..Alex and Shane took very good care of us...From the front desk to the bellman...Love the short walk to Knotts Berry Farm..100 steps...Nice clean room, great view, flat screen TV,....Clean warm pool and spa....Wet and Dry Sauna's  and gym......Ate at the hotel 's restaurant and the food and service was excellent...Over all had a wonderful time...
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and I am glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: What a lovely hotel just right for the theme park and also choice of restaurant.  Comfortably busy, but always beds available around the pool when you fancied a rest from the rides.  Nice location to get out and about too.  Would definitely return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your opinion.

Summary: My very first day in CA and I have to say that it was a good choice booking here. Excellent service at the front desk. A philipino agent welcomed us with a nice attitude. He was really attentive and helpful. Our room just impeccable. Great location. Good deal including room plus ticket to the amusement park.

Summary Heading: Going Down Hill over the past 5 Years
Summary: My wife and I have been staying at this hotel for the past 6 years to attend the Fabulous Fords Forever Carshow. Over the past 5 years things have really turned for the worse. This visit on 4/21-4/22 being the worse so far. First we were assigned a handi-cap accessible room. I am not sure why but neither my wife nor myself are in need of these accomodations. We simply figured it was all that was availble with a single king room. We went to see the room. We were greeted by the most unpleasant of odors upon entering. I quickly returned to the front desk to request another room. I stated the reason why and we were assigned a new room. Also handicapped accessible. The new room was fine without an unpleasant odor. The rooms are supposed to be non-smoking mind you. At midnight we were

Summary: Ok, after reading some reviews online before getting to the hotel, I was a bit skeptical.  Was I amazed? YES!!!!  I went with friends and one did not come, so I had a whole two bed room to myself, the tv was a beautiful LG flatscreen, the bathroom was very nice and closet was perfect.  I loved that our rooms had private access to each other.  The staff was VERY accomodating and friendly, the service in the Amber Waves restaurant was phenomenal, the food was very good, breakfast is a buffet and their coffee is to die for!  I am looking for it online right now, yum!  The area is beautiful, parking does have a small fee, but for such a beautiful place it is worth it all!  There were lots of people staying there, including a wedding on Saturday.  You could hear some noise in the

The hotel was nice! We had a family of 5 so we got the oversized queen and asked for a rollaway. It was perfect! We were on the fourth floor and i could hear the people walking upstairs but it didnt bother me. The wallpaper was peeling away from the shower head in my bathroom and that wasn't a big deal. The problem I had was the scuzzy park!!! I'm afraid of heights and I figured that I would try to conquer that fear by going up in the Skycabin! It looked safe enough! I WAS WRONG!!!! I got trapped at the top for 12 LONG minutes!!!!! My husband and 5yr old daughter were there too!! I freaked out! My husband asked the guy if we would fall and the kid didnt know!! Really?!! Then after we get down the supervisor offers us dinner at 9:00pm Really!! If I was thinking rationally I would
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We are always working to better ourselves for our guest and your comments are important.

Summary Heading: great value, location, food, and service
Summary: We stayed with our two teenage boys for spring break.  It is a pleasant hotel of slightly above average condition, but the location, service from staff, price, and excellent food, especially dinner, at the Amber Waves restaurant in the Hotel made us wonder why we would ever stay anywhere else.  There are great other options all within walking distance of the Hotel  There is a nice outdoor hot tub, a spacious pool, and an enjoyable water feature play area next to the pool.    We have stayed at many higher quality hotels, but for the price, location, and overall experience, it is great.  Being able to walk to and from the Theme Park was delightful as the weather changed during the day several times during our stay.  It was quicker to walk to our hotel than the parking lot for

Summary Heading: Good to stay here if you are going to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: I reserved the room with the park tickets through their website.  It seems like a great deal.  We got 4 tickets, parking and room for about $220. (ticket price is $57.99). The hotel is within walking distance to the park and there are shops and restaurant along the way.  The room seems like it needs a renovation.  The pool area was nice with a kid play area.  Overall I would only stay there if I was going to Knott's Berry Farm.  They should definitely do a major remodeling job!

My day-cation at Knott's Berry Farm was wonderful.  I was contemplating on whether or not to stay at the KBF hotel, so I took that chance.  When I arrived at the hotel, I was very impressed as soon as I walked into the lobby area to check in.  The front desk clerk was very polite and very informative about the hotel and park.  The room was very appealing and clean.  My family loved the room, restaurant and the whole idea of ordering room service from the restaurant.  I could not agree with all the negative remarks that I have read prior to making my reservations.  I will come back time and time again.  KBF hotel THANKS FOR MAKING OUR STAY COMFORTABLE!!!!  WE'LL SEE YOU AGAIN!!!

Summary Heading: Best Choice for a Knotts Berry Farm Visit!
Summary: First off I would like to point out that this is a Resort that is best appointed for a Buena Park Visit, pan's down. Here I go - I must point out that I am reviewing their Snoopy Theme Rooms and have never stayed in one of their Standard Rooms. We arrived at the Hotel and were greeted by one of their check in agents by the name of Ellery. He was attentive and full of helpful tips for our Knotts Theme park spring break. The Lobby is large and inviting. We went straight to our room before we hit the park to fresh up from our flight from Denver. The room was clean and absolutely cute with the Peanuts Theme through out the room and hallway. My two girls loved the Snoopy Plushies that came free with the room. I did have to ask for them but they gave them to us. On the grounds their
Stayed here a while ago, gorgeus hotel! the resturant and service was AMAZING, best burger ive ever had! A great place to stay, the location is amazing!

Booked 2 rooms with this hotel for two nights along with several others well in advance for a week long trip to CA. with my wife and six grandkids.  This was the only hotel that did not send hotel confirmation several days in advance of arrival.  Upon arrival, found the rooms to be extremely small for four people. There is approximately 3 feet of space between the foot of the bed and the room furniture and even less space bettween side of beds and walls.  to make matters worse, there was a large overstuffed chair wedged between one bed and the window.  Was unable to enter/exit one side of the bed.  Very small closet, no room to store baggage which was now taking up what little space that was left. The beds were lumpy and run down, very uncomfortable.  Do not expect a coffee

Summary Heading: Great stay for the Disneyland/ Buena Park area...
Summary: I have seen several bad reviews on here.....none of which I could find any reason for. The service & hospitality has been exceptional. With very friendly & attentive staff. The rooms are starting to look a bit tired....but nothing that would ruin a great nights sleep. A free shuttle is available to Disneyland which saved on the parking there. Had to pay for parking @ the hotel....but they had a special offer, that made it cheaper....& got free breakfast!!!! Only little niggle here was the hotel parking lot is also used for the theme park.....so after a day out in the car, it was hard to find a space at the weekend. Pool was a little on the cold side but still very enjoyable. This is an ideal location for the Buena Park/ Disneyland area.....but was still OK for access into
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: stayed for one night....not no resort
Summary: Traveled July 2011. We were coming back from vegas and needed to rest after a long drive before taking off to lax airport to fly back home. Every hotel was booked! We were happy to find that they have two rooms available for us as we have 11 people with us including 5 kids they were exhausted. All we wanted to do was sleep. The old gentlemen was very kind and the lobby looks inviting. We thought to ourself what can go wrong its a resort hotel. But that changed quickly as soon as we walked into our room. It smells and looks like a motel! The furniture was dated the bathroom had MOLES. The carpets was dirty and stained i had my shoes on the whole time. This is no resort. We would never come back.

Summary Heading: Not Good Value for your money
Summary: We were in Buena Park for a cheerleading competition at Knott's Berry Farm.  Staying in the resort made sense.  The hallways, lobby, restaurant, pool and courtyards are nice enough.  Our room however was quite substandard.  The floor was not level therefore the drawers of the dresser would not stay closed, the window sill was an inch deep in dust and pollen, the bathtub had mold on it, the walls were very thin so every sound made in an adjacent room could be heard, and the air conditioner barely worked.  We made two calls to the front desk asking for someone to come look at the air conditioner, but no one ever came.  In addition to the room cost you are responsible for a parking fee and they do not offer a complimentary breakfast.  You are suppose to receive free coffee in your

Summary Heading: Great value, clean, friendly BUT poorly insulated hotel
Summary: Knotts Berry Farm and the adjacent hotel are an excellent alternative to Disneyland. The park is smaller and less overwhelming than Disneyland, far less expensive, and the rides are terrific. My nine-year-old daughter and fourteen-year-old niece loved it.   The hotel is also a terrific value. It's clean, and the staff are helpful. There is only one negative comment I can make and it's a BIG ONE: The walls are so paper-thin and poorly insulated that you can hear EVERYTHING from the rooms beside you and the hallway. If you are a light sleeper (as I am) I guarantee you will not get any rest. I knew all the names of the family staying beside us, and I didn't even meet them. You can hear everything like it's happening in your own room. I'm not kidding.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your comments due to we are always striving for the best experience for our guest.

Summary Heading: Very inexpensive for what you get
Summary: I booked this place with my family for only $40 a night, which was a steal for what we got. It's right smack next to Knott's Berry Farm amusement park, which you can't beat. It's also close to some small restaurants plus a Walgreens. My family didn't use the hotel as a place to stay for Disney, but we did use it as a home base to explore Los Angeles.  Distance wise, it was a little under an hour to LA, but considering the traffic that LA is notorious for, it wasn't bad. You get free wifi with the rooms, plus an upgrade in speed available for a small fee. One downside is that the walls are really thin, and sometimes you can even pick up pieces of conversation.   Beds were comfortable, bathrooms were clean, and the staff was friendly and professional. I would stay here again for
Manager Response: Thank you for review.  We appreciate your comments and are always striving for a excelence.

Summary Heading: Good Value -- Clean Hotel -- Great Access -- Friendly Staff
Summary: Knott's Resort is a great value. It is a much better value than the Disney Resorts and much less expensive. The rooms were very clean and adequate. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The location is also excellent. We were located only four minutes to Knott's Berry Farm by foot. We enjoyed our stay at the Knott's Resort very much. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: We are glad your stay was pleasant and we look forward to your return visit.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: OK stay but the walls and floors are thin and the shuttles during off peak times don't run frequently enough!
Summary: We just got back from our trip to Disneyland/Knott's Berry Farm.  This hotel was ok but unfortunately, the best part about it was the morning shuttle drivers (super nice) and the fact that you would find Snoopy wandering around the lobby. The buffet was reasonably priced and was quite good also.    The cons seem to out weight the pros though. Because of the time of year we were there (before Spring Break) the shuttle running to Disneyland was only running every 2 hours, and only if you scheduled it in advance. If you wanted to call and have them come get you at a different time (but still only in 2 hour increments), make sure you have quarters because they don't offer a toll free number and if you try to call the reservation line (same place) James will not connect you through.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate the feedback to strive for a better experience.

Summary: We stayed at the Knotts Berry in January and were very disappointed. This being the first long haul we had done we wanted something a bit special so booked through Virgin thinking that as it had 4 Virgin V's it would be fabulous. Although it is not a bad hotel it is definitely not in the luxury category. The rooms are dated and quite dirty, there is mold in the bathrooms, and what really surprised me is that there is not a "full" bathroom - there is a toilet and a bath with a shower over and the sink is in a corridor outside opposite the wardrobe. Very bizarre! ~We have a 4 year old daughter and we really struggled to sleep, the noise is very bad and seemed to be bad at all times. As there are conference rooms there are a lot of people staying for 1 or 2 nights, when we were
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments.  We alway strive daily to provide a better experience and appreiciate the feeedback.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights with a Jet Blue getaway package. The hotel was clean, staff were friendly and helpful. Great customer service, we were late getting to the shuttle at Disneyland, we called the hotel and they had the shuttle wait for us. awesome. I would recommend staying on the 5th floor since it's newly renovated. The pool area is nice and my grandson loved playing basketball at the court next to the pool. There is a 5 minute walk to Knott's park with food and shopping along the way. It wasn't peak season so not crowded. I would highly recommend staying here, the hotel tries to accomodate all your needs, geat value compared to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great location if you're visiting Knott's...average hotel.
Summary: The hotel is in a great location if you're visiting Knott's.  The surrounding area is not the best and some of the other hotels are truly scary.  That being said, this hotel does feel a bit dated, and I feel it was cleaner and better maintained when it was under the Radisson name.  We had a connecting room with strangers and I could not only hear them fighting, but I could also clearly hear their TV and every time our neighbors on the other side used the bathroom.  The check in/bell staff was very nice and friendly.  My daughter and I went for breakfast at the hotel restaurant well after the breakfast rush but they just couldn't cope.  We waited (in a line with others) about 15 minutes to be seated at 9:45am, then no one came to take our order.  There were plenty of tables, just
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your comments and we are updating our property in 2012.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: My family and I stayed here 3 nights in Jan. 2012, so definitely the off season. The staff were helpful, my kids got a photo with Snoopy in the lobby, and there was free shuttle service and a short ride to Disneyland. Good thing we wore ourselves out at the park because on Saturday night, there was a loud party on the 9th floor; we were on the 8th right below it, but we were so exhausted we slept through it which is saying something for mariachi lullaby music. We also had a great view of KBF from our windows. Towels were kind of "crispy," but then again, this isn't what I'd call a luxury hotel. It was perfectly fine for my family, though, and our rooms were clean. There's a Walgreen's across the road which we used for snacks and drinks, and restaurants over near the KBF park
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your comments and are always striving for excellence.

Summary: We just got back from Knott's and had a GREAT time! I'll review the park in another review, but as for the hotel, it was fine. Keep in mind we were there on a Wed and Thurs in Feb, so the hotel was very quiet. I don't know what it would be like during the on-season or on a weekend.  The staff was very friendly and speedy. We got directions to a GREAT Mexican restaurant. The rooms were clean and fine. This isn't the Ritz (though if you read a review of the Ritz someone would undoubtedly be complaining about the TV or the soap), but more in line with a Best Western or Holiday Inn (which I find just fine). The rooms were clean, had an alarm clock, toiletries, and flat screen TV's. Beds were queen and comfortable (firm mattress as others have mentioned, but I like that). Restaurant

Stayed here for 10 days in August 2011 Really enjoyed it, was right next to the theme park so meant could go to park in the morning and come back for a swim then go back to park easily accessible just off the motor way 10 min drive to disney a bit further for hollywood ~45 mins Clean hotel with a big room (2 double beds) nice pool and small gym but all you need when your on holiday good value when bought in a package had free wifi and free safe only problem was maids didnt always clean the room if you slept in! and quite a few ice machines didnt work so had to get the lift to another floor for ice
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and look forward to seeing you agian.

Summary: We got the two nights stay with two days passes to park and one breakfast. It was a great time, the hotel is within walking distance of Knott;s. sense we spent more time at the park than in the room it was worth the stay. the Hotel is an older hotel, but they take pride in it and keeping it looking clean and up to date. The staff was excellent. the breakfast buffet could have been a little better, but again it was a great deal. We enjoyed our experience. Thank you Knott's Berry Farm resort.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: After reading some of the "not so great" reviews on this location, I have to admit I was a bit sceptic about staying here.....But much to my surprise the hotel was very nice.  We have traveled both here and in Europe and have stayed in a variety of  properties, and it really amazes me how anyone could give this hotel anything less that a "very good" rating.  We were traveling as a family with two young children and the staff in the hotel and restaurant went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.  Even when I had to change my reservations twice, the transactions were handled in a courteous and helpful manner.  Check in was accomplished within minutes of arrival and our rooms were located exactly where I had requested.  We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant and
Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your stay.  We strive to improve our service everyday and appreciate you comments.  Thank you

Summary: Although it is close to the park, the room was small and the hotel is definitely dated. We had a 2 queen bedroom. The beds are horrible and the bathroom was not totally clean. You could see mold or dirt underneath the shower lip, the reason for the negative review. The beds were so hard, two weeks later my back still hurts, and we were only there two days. The property was clean, the staff friendly, If you are going to stay there, bring your own egg crate or something. Maybe I am just used to sleeping on my gel comforter. And $14 a night for parking was a little outrageous.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel with very good staff.
Summary: We booked this hotel for a 2 week holiday,after reading the reviews on here i was very worried but i was very pleasantly surprised,the hotel was not run down,every thing seemed in very good condition,the room was clean and well equiped although a fridge would of been very helpful,staff were very good,pool area was very clean,the visits from snoopy went down well with my daughter,housekeeping was very good,went to the theme park and had a really good time.to be honest i cant really say anything negative about it,we had a lovely holiday.
Manager Response: I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: My wonderful stay the night before.disneyland
Summary: This place was so rude and 4 dollars for some bottled water.7 dollars a night extra for parking and we paid extra for the contenintal breakfast but when we got up we were told it wasn't included. Then I was so rudely told that that is how it is bye.
