Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel strictly because her work was having their annual Holiday party there, and rather than drive home 40 miles away after a night of drinking and dancing, it seemed better to just walk upstairs to our room.  We would have rathered not drink and drove home. This hotel is extremely outdated, and there was a foul smell coming out of the A/C unit. The price was decent I guess considering we received free parking (normally $15.00) and two breakfast buffets. Breakfast was adequate, nothing to rave about.   But the worst part was the bed. We can deal with semi-hard to an extent, but this thing was hard. By far the worst and hardest bed we ever slept in. If I wake up with aches, there is a problem. We can overlook some outdated items, but can never

Summary Heading: Never again...Rude Staff and no customer service
Summary: I hope to encourage anyone that is considering staying here to stay elsewhere. We just got back from this place and we are completely let down with our stay. The brunch was terrible, the restaraunt service was very bad, and the bar drinks are way overpriced and watered down. Now on to the room and front desk. When we arrived the front desk was nice enough but refused to do anything about the noise from the parties going on. We were to spend 2 nights in the hotel. The first night party guests were outside below our window hooting and hollering at all hours of the night, I know at least until 2:30 am, I know I was up and watched the clock. Front desk did nothing. The second night another party going on, this time the bass from the music was so loud that even after 12 hours at the

Nice looking property from the outside and an even nicer front desk area but unacceptable beds, pillows, and management practices.  The front desk staff at check in was pleasant, helpful, and quick to help us to our room.  The room looks straight out of the late 70's except for the brand new wide screen TV's.  The beds are very hard and the pillows are thin and lumpy.  We asked the front desk for a foam topper for the bed but was told that the hotel doesn't have them.  The lady at the front desk suggested that they could have houskeeping put some blankets under the sheets on the bed for us to make it softer.  That evening when we returned to our room, 3 ratty blankets were sitting on a chair next to our bed.   We stayed here for 4 unsleepable nights with our 4th night being the

We stayed at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel for my son's 10th birthday.  I booked the package deal which included 8 tickets to Knott's Berry Farm, 4 Breakfasts with Snoopy vouchers, parking and 2 nights at the hotel.  Getting into the parking lot, the attendant didn't have my name on the list, but I gave her the confirmation number and she allowed us to check in without paying the fee up front.  Check in was quick but we got lost finding our room (it was on the second floor, but the stairs near the elevator went to the 3rd floor - kinda confusing).  We loved all the Halloween decorations around lobby. It was very slow getting drinks at the bar the night we checked in, even though there weren't that many people there (bartender kept disappearing).  They had to get food from

The Knott's Berry Farm Hotel was in a great location to visit the park.  This time of year, we were able to participate in their package deal which included the room, parking, buffet breakfast for two and two tickets into the park.  Snoopy was there in the lobby to great all kids which was cute.  There were a couple of the major rides closed down in the park and I saw no notice before going in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: We had a great time at Knotts and will definitely returning.  Everyone was more than helpful and went out of their way to ensure we had a great stay.  They even printed out directions to all other attractions in the area as well as our boarding passes for the flight home.  Ellery, at the front desk was especially friendly and helpful.  We couldn't be more pleased!
Manager Response: We appreciate the great response for our hotel and our employees.  I am glad that Ellery was able to be on of your memories of our property.  Thank you

Summary: So we booked the Snoopy Room for a night of rest before hitting up the park the next day.  The resort itself is wonderful when you drive up.  Service is excellent and even though we did arrive there at 8:30 pm, we still got to see Snoopy - (he does tuck ins from 8-8:30pm for Snoopy Room stays).  The main reason we were a bit unhappy was the room.  The condition of the room is not what you would expect for the price that is charged for it.  We found a cricket in our room, along with food wrappers from previous guests behind the lamp stand.  Our bathroom was looking also quite old and in need of updates.  The bath drained super-slow and the ceiling above the bath looked like it was about to cave.  So overall, the staff was wonderful, but I'm not sure about how clean those rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We apreciate the feedback so we can provide a better product each time.  Thank you again

Summary: I have lived in California all my life and never stayed at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  I now live in Las Vegas and had the opportunity to purchase the Halloween Haunt Dreams Package.  This was an awesome package.  It included a one night stay, two tickets to Halloween Haunt the night of our stay, 2 souvenir room keys, 2 pre-scare dinner buffet at the hotel, 2 Halloween Haunt t-shirts, 2 Breakfast buffets the next morning and half an hour early entry into the park and a nights parking.  The check in was great!  We got there early and was able to get a room early and get all of the stuff for our package.  We had gone to the dinner which was really enjoyable.  They get the dining area really dark with blue lights and have a nice dinner buffet set up with some of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your reponse and I am really glad that your enjoyed all of your experience here at the Knott's Resort.  We look forward to your future visits.  Thank you again

Summary: This Hotel was excellent, we were a little worried when we read some reviews but when we got there it was great, staff were very friendly and helpful, our rooms were very clean and we had more than enough towels clean every day. The Bar and Restaurant were very efficient and we had lovely meals, no they are not all English but I would have stayed at home if I wanted English. The pool area was very clean they cleaned it and checked it every day, all the sun beds and chairs were scrubbed. The Scary Haunt was brilliant as were they shows. We visited lots of places including Disney which is not that far away. We would definitely stay here again if we were to go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and I am glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We purchased the Halloween Haunt package.  The hotel check-in line at 4pm took 30-40 minutes.  The desk staff was very unfriendly.  The lobby is tired, in desperate need of renovation, and the Halloween decorations are old and tacky.  Went up to our room on the 6th floor, and the entire floor, including our room, wreaked of marijuana (worse it was skunk weed) all evening and into the next day when we woke up.  It was supposed to be a non-smoking floor.  The room is Motel 6 quality, and it was supposedly newly renovated.  The bed was as hard as a rock.  Perhaps the worst hotel bed I have ever slept in.  And don't even ask me about the pillows.  We could hear every move our next door neighbor made through the closed adjoining door and thin walls--hacking, coughing, farting,
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear about the experience you had this past October.  I want to let you know that your review is important to us so we can make our services stronger.  Please contact us directly if needed so we can assist you better for your next Haunt. Thank you

Summary: I checked out the reviews and was horrified by what I read. “In need of severe renovation, unfriendly staff, dirty beds, no ice, no pillows, towels etc” Clearly the idiot who wrote this rubbish either did not stay at Knott’s Hotel, or is a director of a rival company. The Hotel is excellent for the price. The staff are more than friendly, are highly professional, efficient and good fun. If there is anything you are dissatisfied with, they will put it right. The restaurant, food quality, and menu choice is first-rate, with service to match, at reasonable prices. (It’s America, American food. If you want English, go to Skegness) Swimming pool, spa and gymnasium facilities outstanding, easy access, and never crowded. Sun beds cleaned meticulously daily. Parking is free. Internet

My sister and I went with some of our friends for the Knotts Scary Farm Package.  I was a great deal.  The package was $160 for a weekend night and included the hotel room, park ticket, dinner and breakfast and a t-shirt.  The Park was great!  It didn't start getting to busy till later in the evening.  The hotel iteslf was clean.  It could use some updating.  The room was clean and sufficient, but nothing that made it outstanding.  The bed were very hard.  The staff was friendly but it did take us forever to get checked in to our room.  It is nice being close to the park but If I had a choice I would rather stay at a different hotel.  The did have free internet which was nice.  The food was ok.  All in all the Haunted Park made if fun.  I would do it again.

Summary Heading: Good for the Halloween Haunt, but as a hotel not great
Summary: We stayed here for one night on our last night in California before we flew home to  the UK. We booked the Halloween Haunt package for £180 which included a dinner buffet before the haunt, free parking at the hotel, 30 mins early entry to the haunt, tickets to the haunt itself, a night in the hotel, T-shirts and breakfast. Given that the tickets to the haunt were about £40 each anyway, I thought this was pretty good value. The buffet dinner was average, but enough to make sure we didn't have to eat in the park. The best bit for me was the 30 minutes early entry to the park, during which we rode Ghost Rider with  no line 3 times :) We stayed in the park until 2am, then headed back to the hotel. We literally just slept and washed in the room, then had breakfast- which I have to

Stayed at the Hotel this week and was excited to be close to the theme park.  The grounds are well maintained but the rooms are so bad they make motel 6 look like a 5 star resort.  Dirty.  Filthy carpets.  They only cleaned the room twice in four days!  The staff was friendly but this hotel is out dated and in sever need of work.  Knotts Berry farm is more for teenagers these days than the snoopy crowd.   Scary and I don't mean Haloween scary.

We stayed at Knott's Hotel on October 12th. We got a Scary Farm package which was a pretty good price. We had stayed here a few times before and have a love-hate relationship with this place. It's wonderful one time and awful the next. We love the Halloween Haunt and after taking sometime off from this hotel we decided to give them another try. We were helped right away and we asked for a remodled room. The King Bed rooms were not done yet so we took a two Queen room. We went with another couple and they gave us joining rooms which was pretty cool. The remodled rooms are pretty clean and fresh. We did have a problem with one of the beds...it was broken already. They didn't spend much on beds, that's forsure. The water pressure was poor. And as many people had stated before, no

We visited as part of a multi-centre holiday and this was our first stop for 4 days. Upon arrival we were impressed with the view of Knotts theme park! Check in was easy and the room was large and clean. Pillows were terrible however, and woke up with a stiff neck everyday! Free wifi was included so this was a nice bonus. We were here mainly to explore so the room was not a big issue.  Knotts Berry Theme park was very good surprisingly! We needed a way to fill our afternoon after arriving at 3pm. We went straight into the park and managed to ride almost everything. Not 'kiddy' rides at all so be prepared!  However, the issue was the area! We are a couple ages 25/26 and the area was too quiet for us. We found it hard to eat at night due to places closing early (9pm) Even the

The term "Resort" has been very misused on this hotel. A others have mentioned, great place for a quick overnight stay prior to hitting Knott's but please don't spend any time there. I think we had the same room as another reviewer with the moldy/old shower, etc. Ideally, you show up at 10:00pm (although the lady at the counter is pretty grumpy then) and leave to go to McDonald's (Starbucks is next door) for breakfast at 5:00am. Then you'll have a good experience. Overnight parking is not included but was only $7 and its a short walk to the park. Fortunately, we got this on Hotwire for only $50. Enjoy.

Last Friday night I brought my 12 year old son to attend the Knott's Scary Farm Halloween event in the park.  Since the park is open from 7 PM - 2 AM we decided to spend the night.  I decided to stay at the "resort" because I thought it would be nicer than some of the surrounding hotels and for convenience.  It was more expensive than surrounding hotels.  Checking in the fire alarms went off because of the fake smoke machines from the bar.  Getting off the elevator on the 6th floor where our room was located the hallway wreaked of marijuana.  At 2:45 AM the people in the room next door came in and I could hear every word of their conversation through the closed adjoining doors, and at 3:30 AM when I decided to call security to get the people next door to be quiet the phone rang

Summary Heading: Forget the Negative reviews! Great Hotel and AMAZING Staff!!
Summary: Forgot all the "bad" reviews you have read on here about this hotel.My wife and I stayed here for 15 nights in Sept 2011 and had an amazing time.First let me say the renovated rooms are comfy with a nice new king sized bed and hd flat screen tv.Rooms were cleaned everyday, no problems.Nice big pool and spa, clean as well.No noise during our stay,quiet and peaceful.Snoopy can be found in the lobby several  times a day for pictures as well as tucking kids in during the evening.The location of the hotel is in a great quiet place within walking distance to many GREAT restaurants (Tokyi Teriyaki, Portillo's, and Umami Mongolian Grill) as well as malls and Walmart.The food at Amber Waves was VERY good, considering it is in a Hotel.Try the pizza,burgers and fries they are good !Last

I have recently returned home from a  5 day vacation to the Knott’s Berry Farm Resort and wanted to give you some feedback on my experience.   I will never return to this Hotel and will advise any and all people I come  in contact with to do the same. Let me explain the reason for my disdain with this facility.   Upon check in I was told that I had to pay to park at the hotel. I have never paid for parking at a hotel I pay to stay in. This is ludicrous. I can understand charging people to park there that are going to the park, but it is unacceptable to charge guests of the hotel to park there.   We also discovered that there was hair in the pillow cases, blankets, comforters, and towels. The bathroom was not cleaned during the entirety of our stay. We had to leave a note for

My daughter and I just completed a stay at the Knott’s Berry Farm Hotel (Thursday night, Friday night, check-out Saturday) to go to the park during the day, but mainly to visit the Halloween Haunt. I have not been to Knott’s for 20 years, and neither of us had been to the Haunt. We took advantage of a package that offered the room, a “pre-haunt dinner” held at the hotel, admission to the haunt, 2 haunt t-shirts, parking, and a buffet breakfast the next morning. I actually bought 2 of the packages, since we stayed 2 nights. The price for the package was quite reasonable, but the spotty reviews I had read caused quite a bit of concern.  After our visit I felt that I had to write a review as we experienced virtually zero of the problems reported by previous reviewers.  CHECK-IN We

Stayed here this past weekend for halloween haunt. Price wasnt bad considering what you got: Parking Admission to Haunt Haunt T - Shirts Haunt Dinner Buffet Breakfast Buffet Next Morning  Dinner buffet was good, but missed the appetizer table and carving station that they have inside the park at Spurs Chophouse. Haunt was good as always, event though some of the mazes do have room for improvement.  The room though, Super 8 & Motel 6 in the dirty parts of Vegas are better:  Bed was so hard that if you bounced on it, you didnt bounce Pillows were so soft that you were better off just using the hard mattress Towels felt like sandpaper even after they were wet Shower pressure was non - existent. The highest setting was Niagara and that was definitely an abuse of the word  And then,
We, a family of four had a wonderful time during Christmas last year - loved th location. Proximity to Disneyland and other food eateries . Staff was helpful and restaurant served very good pasta

LOL what a joke. started right at the gate for parking at the hotel. the gate attendent expected $15.00 for parking. when I told him that I was a guest at the hotel he said that they would give me a placard at the front desk. now at the front desk, she asks my name and i give it. oh I see your here 4 nites that will be $60.00 for parking or $30.00 for a breakfast and free parking what would u like to do? I said what do u think. Hmmmmm $60. or $30. well with no other option. (other than leaving) i took the $30.00 buffet breakfast ( what a joke). the hotel dose not allow ordering of food to the room. u have to go down stairs to pick up food and then have the front dest people look at u like u have done something wrong. dead rats in the front entrance. (will post picture) ....

Summary Heading: Location is the best part about this hotel.
Summary: Sorry to say, many of the comments by other writers were accurate.  The cleanliness of the rooms was substandard (towels/used soaps from previous guests were left in the bathroom).  The beds were horribly uncomfortable (thank goodness we only stayed 3 nights).  The walls are very thin.  We could hear everything from next rooms, even some guy just talking on the phone at a normal voice.  The air conditioning unit was so loud and would wake us up every time it kicked in.  The staff, however, were very nice.  Especially the restaurant and house staff.  The front desk staff were ok, kind of curt and times. We were in LA to go to Knott's Berry farm so the location couldn't have been better.  The free shuttle to disney was much appreciated.  The pool area was fine.  The kids water
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment on the service staff.  We are continuing on our renovation process  and would like to see you again.  Thanks

Summary Heading: What more do you need when staying at a fun park?
Summary: Though slightly in need of a make over, Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel is exactly what you need when you are visiting Knotts for a day or two.  Excellently located adjacent to the park, their pool and kids play areas are exceptional and the service by the desk staff was some of the best experienced over our time in the US.  Yes, the rooms are older than some other hotels. and YES the theming is a little out dated. But all in all..for what you need when staying at a theme park... KBF Hotel delivers.
Manager Response: We are really glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We are continuing on the renovation process and you will see more change on your next visit.  Thank you again!

Summary: Stayed here for 2days with my kids and had an amazing time. Their pool even if it's small offered water stations for the kids to play with. Also, location is great as the access to Soak City is just right there across the streets. Would come back again. Restaurant was average.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Generally a good stay only because of the proximity to the park and other amenities however the room condition was poor.  Uncomfortable beds, shower with cracked ceramic.  The pool was dirty.  Breakfast Buffet was majorly disappointing as well.  Customer service wasn't great either, took 45 minutes to check in and then the room wasn't even ready.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  We are in the middle of upgrading and hope to have more done when you visit again.  Thank you again

Summary Heading: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR
Summary: Just returned from an overnight stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  Not sure  where the "resort" in the name comes from.  The hotel has a lobby, a restaurant and a gift shop, but other than that, not much to distinguish this from an average motel.  We took advantage of their summer special where you pay for a night's stay and get 2  free tickets to the Knott's Berry Farm park. This hotel was better managed when it was a Radisson hotel.    We checked in around noon, dropped off our bags and headed out to the park.  On our way out we tried to lock up some of our valuables in the in-room safe, but safe key was missing.  We didn't want to have to wait for a key to be brought up or head to the front desk to get one and delay our outing, so we carried our extra valuables and

Summary Heading: Ok if you ask for a renovated room
Summary: Family of four stayed here two nights during to visit Knotts Berry Farm theme park  during our trip along the Californian Coast.  Had read the Trip Advisor reports beforehand and so emailed ahead (and confirmed again at check in) to ask for a renovated room which we were given.  We arrived before 4pm check in and room was ready so checked in a couple of hours early without a problem.  Good points - room was basic but ok and was clean.  Beds comfy.  Pool area was nice and never overcrowded at all.  Easy five minute walk to Knott's Berry Farm theme park.  We went to the park for opening time at 10am - came out mid afternoon and chilled around the pool for a couple of hours then went back to the park around 5pm until 9.30pm so location ideal for that.  Concierge was helpful in

We have stayed here for my Daughters Birthday every year in August. I believe this should be our 4th year. Although I have read of recent renovations, we have never had a bad experience. She loves her Birthday button and treat. We will be arriving this Saturday the 27th her actual Birthday, only sad part is the room will not be snoopy themed. Love that the kids get to see Snoopy walking around.. She is so excited we gave her a choice this year of other places since she in going to be the BIG 10!, she said " I want to go stay at the Knotts Hotel and go to Knotts Berry Farm again. They're doing something right!

Summary Heading: What ever you do, please do not go here. I repeat, DO NOT GO HERE.
Summary: Long story:  First of all, I arrived in L.A. too early, so I went to the hotel and asked them if our room was ready or if they had an extra room. The guy at the front desk was kind of rude and looked unpleased. The next day, I checked in and there was a line at the front desk and it took about an hour for me to get my turn even though there was just 3 people including me in line. The people at the front desk didn't seem to be focusing with my check in and they were just talking to each other about non-hotel related things. It took about another hour to check in when it should take 10 minutes. Then we went up to our room and as I was walking through the hallways, some of the wallpaper was tearing off. I reached my room and it look fine at first glance but the walls of my room was

Summary Heading: Agree with other review not great, not bad....
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights.  We had a room with 2 queens. Reserved for 4 people - kept only giving us 3 towels!  It was a big room which was nice. It had a larger mini fridge and a microwave.  Room and bath had dark wood and looked nice.  Our room sloped to the middle which was rather odd.  The first night there was a cheer leading camp going on and they were so loud!  The hotel was sold out so we could not move. We had a room next to the chaperone (there was a sign on the door) so we were hopeful it would not be too loud - unfortunately it was the party room and then late they started reviewing tapes that had loud yelling! The room above us decided to practice routines!  We called security and that stopped quickly.  Next night much quieter.  The ice machine never had ice - one

Summary Heading: Not so great, not so bad.
Summary: We were really excited about staying at the Knott's Berry Hotel, well ... because it IS the Knott's Berry Hotel.  The location to the parks was great.  We walked to Knott's Berry Farm and Soak City.  However, the beds sucked!  They were absolutely horrible.  We were even getting into the elevator and another guest stopped us and asked what we thought about the beds.  Come on, Knott's ... spend some money and get better beds.  The breakfast buffet was pretty good, although the eggs were a little bland.  Would I stay there again??  I don't really know.  Maybe knowing the beds suck but the trade off is being so close to the parks might make me go back.  My advice ... bring an air matress.

The hotel is great for the Anaheim area.  The hotel has plenty of restaurants, bars etc. within walking distance.  The hotel itself was clean and spacious and right next to the Knott's theme park and water park.  The hotels free shuttle bus to Disneyland was great way to get to Disney and not having to pay parking.  The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful.   Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others. Especially a family with young kids.

We stayed here for the convenience and thinking it was a decent place. Its old and run down. The ice makers on all floors were constantly out of ice. The staff was friendly. It is way over priced for the condition of the rooms. I also did not understand why there isnt a vent fan in the bathroom. The bathroom walls were falling apart because of the moisture.

Summary Heading: Sad room at Knotts Berry Resort
Summary: First off we enjoyed the park and it was very close to the resort...  However we came in on Monday night 7/25/11 to check in and it was late evening, a huge wedding reception was going on and we could not even hear the clerk manuel at the desk...He was not very friendly and we had kids asking questions about the park and he sent us up to room 827, it was NASTY DIRTY..Sand in one of the beds and it looked like the sheets had not been changed so I called front desk to get help they told me they were busy would need to call back around midnight...NEXT the bathroom had hair all over the floor and in tub NASTY..And I think the worst part were the PILLOWS are you kidding me a queen bed with two pillows AWFUL pillows..HORRIBLE STAY BAD NASTY ROOM NOT FRIENDLY PEOPLE AT ALL..So we

We had a very nice stay at Knott's Berrry Farm Resort Hotel.  Even though they gave us a very small room, it was comfortable.  My daughter and her friend stayed in another room. They enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi, and food which you can buy at the pool.  We were able to walk right next door for shopping and more restaurants.  Maid service was great, and reliable. The buffet breakfast was good with lots of variety. The hotel is very close to the 91 and 5 freeways so we were able to drive all over Orange County and get to places quickly. The only problem we had was that there are a lot of kids staying here because of Knott's Berry Farm. There were many nights when there were screaming children running down the halls, late at night, but it didn't keep us from sleeping.

My husband and I and our two girls stayed at the Knotts hotel in July of 2011.  We purchased the "Ultimate" package that included two nights at the hotel, a breakfast brunch for 4, a day at soak city and a day at Knotts Berry Farm.  I read previous reviews of the hotel, and taking their advise, I asked for a renovated room.    We arrived at the hotel saturday morning about 11 am and since check in wasn't until 4 pm, we were given our tickets to the parks.  At around 6 pm we returned to check in - there was no wait.  There is an extra charge they don't mention on the website - they charge a $30.00 fee per day (refundable after you check out) if you use a debit card to reserve the room - so be sure to budget for that.    The renovated room was spacious and had newer furnishings.

Purchased a package deal but drove together with an other family so needed only one parking pass which would have normal cost $14 and needed a extra child meal ticket at $7.99. They stated sorry but we can't do that. Also ask for joining rooms could not do that either and did not even point us in the direction of the elevator just for the price we paid just thought they could be slightly more accommodating. But because of it's closeness to the parks I think its a good place to stay just need to work on courtesy.
Manager Response: Thank for your review.  We take pride in providing great guest service and all your comments are appreciated to better our property.

Summary: This hotel is beautiful on the outside and the lobby is beautiful! The courtyard is very pretty but closed at 11 pm and did not open til 9 am which was a shame for me and my husband who love to get up early and sit outside and have coffee! No balconies very disappointing! Now to the rooms they were very dirty so dirty that when the kids went to sleep my husband and I drove down the street to the Courtyard by Marriot to see if they had any rooms available because we just could not stand the filth. Needless to say they had none so we were stuck at the resort! Please if you are a clean person do not waste your money on this resort! However the package plan was nice because it included breakfast buffet which was excellent and the park tickets and the parks are fantastic! Will return
Manager Response: Sorry to hear about your experience at our property with the room.  I would like to invite you to come again and ask for a renovated room the next time you are in town.  We do offer the best packages for the amusement park.  We have addressed your issues and really appreciate your comments.  Thank you

Summary: Check in is at 4pm so don't think you will get in at noon. Our room was ready at 4. Our kids went to Soak City and we wandered around waiting because we checked in at 11:30. I did think the wait was a bit much when others were checking in before noon. We were told it was because we requested the refurbished room. Funny thing is when the maids made up our room it was done by 1 pm. So why we had to wait so long was a mystery to me.  That was the only draw back. We got the over sized queen room. Beds were firm but not rock hard. Room was large. It had a wet bar and fridge. Also a flat screen TV.  The air conditions was not working up to par and after we reported it they installed a new unit that worked great. We were happy because we didn't have to move the car to go anywhere. We
Manager Response: Thamk you for your response and we are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Very disappointed with customer service! Purchased ultimate package with park tickets to take my kids to play why my husband works in another city. He mistakenly took tickets in car with him to work. Asked manager if they could help us get to parks. Offered to purchase tickets if they would refund when my husband returns with tickets this eve. They refused to do anything to help, so we are stuck in marginal hotel with not much to do and my kids will miss out on the waterpark, unless I decide to buy another set of tickets.  Check in also provided poor customer service. Arrived at 1pm and room was not ready. Understandable since check in is 4pm, however room still not ready at 4:15 and I had to fight to get it done.  We will not be back!

Can't beat the location and the value you get with the package deals... Parked the car and walked to both parks very convenient. Staff was great just an average hotel room but who cares really you sre never in your room they are remodeling now though

hotel personal was great,but when we get in our room ,mind u after a 9hrs driveall we want is a long shower,my complaint is the mold on the shower,i had to tell the front desk 3 times and not even that got them to clean it.what a shame we will no longer stay there.and our dresser one door wouldnt even stay closed.that is just not a good way to attract costumers.i hope it will get better before we return again.thanks

Summary Heading: awesome deal with park package!!!! awesome hotel!
Summary: this is an awesome hotel and got a very great hotel and park package! It is about 5 min. away from the park walking. The beds are very comfortable. Very kid friendly!

Summary Heading: Nots berry farm hotel but Motel 6
Summary: We visited the hotel 31 may to 2 jun. The lobby and resturanuts were fine but so as you get pass that the rooms hall ways elevators all remind me of motel 6.The elevaotrs we used had a temp license that was expired. Moldy rooms, and when snoopy visited the first night the female thats was woth him was impaitent. And the werid thing is my wife and i saw shadowy figures. This was the first time my wife and child were in cali and visiting Knott's and the lasting impression was bad.

We spent Memorial Day weekend at KBF and it was super fun.  The hotel staff was very friendly and made sure we had a newly renovated room (bed spread could be updated), the room was clean.  We bought the ultimate package a great deal we had tickets to Soak City, very short lines to the rides and a clean park.  The package also included tickets to KBF, which was a blast if you like thrill rides, the lines were very short in the AM about 15 minute wait times, the afternoon the lines were longer about 45 minutes for Ghostrider but hey it was Memorial day weekend and military appreciation day (which was a special promotion, military people were let in free).  The chicken at Mrs. Knotts' well worth the money, the cabbage is really good.  Pinks was everything I wanted in a hotdog

Summary Heading: Umm.. Not so great hotel!! but Amusement is great
Summary: My family stayed here for 1 night and We asked the Front desk if he can give us a renovated room, And yes he is kind enough to give us one. But unfortunately the room didn't impress me at all, the room is small, the bed was so called king but it looks a Queen bed, But in a bright side, the Pool is amazing.. best pool i seen.

I reserved 3 snoopy rooms for my sons birthday. They allmconnected which were nice and all were upgraded and newly refurnished. The rooms were in a dedicated hall with snoopy decor. On the second floor. Nice tv flat screen and had game controls for the kids. Free wifi for us.   We used the tennis courts which were great. Also the .game room was great as well. Fitness room well equipped with cardio and free weights.  The pool is HUGE and has an attached kids play area with water devices that spray and play. Kids loved it. Hugenspa as well.  Restaurant is good and has buffet. Buffet recommended as this isnfaster. You can alsomorder off menu.  Staff great very efficient.  We paid $144 nite

Summary Heading: Good value and good location if you're visiting Knotts Berry Theme Park
Summary: We were able to get a good package where we had the accomodation, dinner, buffet breaksfast and them park tickets (all for 4) was included - and also parking. This was an excellent value. Our kids had a good time in Knott's Berry Theme Park. There were not much queus so we were able to ride our favourite rides a few times. We had lunch at the Mrs Knotts Chicken Restaurant - big portions - very yummy and then went back to the park until close. The dinner was really nice as well - and Snoopy even greeted us. The room was average but the sheets were a bit rough and there were scraps trapped in the aircon. Breakfast was good. They also offer a shuttle to Disneyland but remember to book in early to avoid disappointment. There were only a few staff in reception the morning we checked

stayed at knotts berry farm over spring break for two weeks. read a number of reviews before going.was expecting a run down dirty hotel. it was the complete opposite we had a fantastic stay and are already planning on returning next year. we have been to many places in the u.s.a and this is one of the best.Would buy disney tickets on gate cheaper.Universal was better to buy before you go a bit dissapointing not many rides. Knotts berry farm very good for teenagers.Overall fantastic holl

Summary Heading: good value for knotts berry farm with package deal
Summary: I stayed b/c of a good deal this spring - 99$ for a night with 2 admin tix to park, which is connected to hotel, so i write the review in that context.  I also stayed an extra night at $59.  PROS:  with the deal - this was a great hotel option.  it was clean and right next door to the park.  It had a nice heated pool.  restaraunt right onsite was not bad and not outrageously priced for a hotel option and the knotts restaraunts right outside the park were walking distance;  a drug store right across teh street for drinks/snacks etc..;  very close to shopping/entertainment district in Buena Park.  easy access on/off highway;  free shuttle to disneyland - and with the extra night at $59 - it would be a good choice for a Knotts/disney combination trip  overall a great choice for a

Summary Heading: Will NOT stay here again until improvements are made
Summary: We have stayed here a few times over the years but on our most recent one night stay to visit the park I noticed this hotel is really beginning to show it's age. It has a great location right next to Knott's Berry Farm Park and has the potential to be a really great hotel. The rooms are in much need of a makeover with carpet, walls, bedding, bathroom, etc., either old, worn, or just plain dirty. A distinctive musty spell in the room. I was particularly disgusted by the bathroom that had mold and mildew throughout (please see pictures). Nociced some hair clippings around sink. The wallpaper is peeling and I noticed what seems to be mold and urine around the toilet. Please note that the drinking glasses provided in the rooms are only rinsed in the bathroom sink by housekeeping and
Manager Response: Sorry to hear about your experience at my property.  We are in the middle off renovating our hotel and have completed 50%.  By next year will will be mostly renovated. We have investigated the issues you had during your stay and have addressed them all.  Next time you are in town, I would like it if you can give us another chance to make a great impression.  We have new renovated rooms that I would like you to try at that time.  Thank you agian for your comments Don Prescott

Summary Heading: Don't come unless you want to spend the next week itching!
Summary: I stayed at this "resort" with my friends from band for our spring band trip to Disneyland and all I can say is BAD.  When we walked into our room we noticed old carpet and mold and mildew in the bathroom.  The shower also had low water pressure, but did seem to have soft water. Also the room walls are VERRY thin, we had a room on the first floor by the tennis/basketball court and there where people playing late night basketball and I could hear every dribble. 4 days after the hotel I developed bites from bed buys, I talked to my doctor and he confirmed that it was bed bug bites developed from 4-5 days ago.  My trip was April 1st so I hope its some joke, but I know its not.  Dont stay here!
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  Soorry to hear about your stay at our property.   We have addressed the issues with the housekeeping of the room and they were all taken care of.  Room was inspected and there was no activity in the room either.  We appreciate your comments so we can strive to provide great product and guest serivce.    Thank you

Summary Heading: Great place nice and very clean
Summary: After checking reviews of 3 star I was surprise with this place. Our rm looked like new. We are so picky when it comes to hotels. This place was better then the Marriott thats located on the main street of disneyland which we payed a higher rate.  So believe me the rate base on our room was excellent.

I've stayed in this hotel four years ago.  This time around, I notice how much they improved the rooms.  It's cleaner and much more comfortable.  Service (check in/out) is excellent and the location is perfect if you plan on going to the Knott's Berry Farm park.  For the money I spent on the hotel and tickets I am a happy camper.  The only thing I didn't like was that the bed was a bit lopsided (in Double Queen rooms).  I notice that people tend to sleep on one side more.  I would probably suggest bringing your own pillow as it was tough for me to lie flat even with their pillows.  Other than that, it was great!  I would suggest eating at Mrs. Knott's restaurant and order their chicken dinner.  Yummy!!!  Nothing but the best chicken, biscuits and rhubarb.  For breakfast, try
Manager Response: We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We appreciate your response and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you  Don Prescott

Summary: Just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel,it was a good sized room with the room and towels being cleaned daily. We did not go to the theme park but this hotel is ideally placed next door. It is situated in aproximately 40 miles from Hollywood and Universal with the beaches on Pacific highway being only several miles away, Seal and Huntington to name a few. we did not use the restaurant but they do serve meals in a buffett style. The room had a coffee pot and safe also it had an iron and a great shower which I think is an important part of the rom. The hotel allows you to order in food to eat in the rooms with lists of restaurants in the hotel guide book. The hotel staff were helpfull at all times.  The pool and jacuzzi were nice but a bit cold when we went, the gym is
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I hope the next time you visit that you will be able to go and enjoy our amusement park.  We appreciate all the comments from our guest so we can continue to improve our product.  Thanks Again Don Prescott

Summary Heading: most horrible place i have ever stayed!
Summary: we went to stay at knotts, even though we saw bad reviews. We thought we could deal with this because it was cheap. do not do the same as us.. from the moment we got there we realized what a bad choice we had made. we where ignored upon our arrival, for a full ten minutes, as the staff where to busy chatting to eachother. Once finally given our key to our room and getting upstairs, we find the room the dirtiest we have ever seen. the bed sheets were dirty, the pillows had hait still on them from the guests before, as did the shower. there was still rubbish in the bags from the guests before, including thimgs you would never want to see in your lifes time.  there shuttle bus was shocking, limited time and disneyland knew nothing about it. this is just some of the negative things

Summary Heading: Just O.K. - price is right but mediocre rooms and renovation in progress!
Summary: We stayed at Knott's Resort just one night - bracketed with visits to the Park before and after.  Great location, easy walking distance to the Park, shuttles to Disney, and food nearby.  Price was right too, got a great $140 package deal on room + tickets + parking + breakfast.  If you can get a great deal too and don't expect a plush resort, then it's fine - but if you want Disney quality stick to Disney properties!  I'm marking as recommended, but with BIG caveats about knowing what you get for the cheaper price!  Rooms were clean but a bit shabby - peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, holes in the bedskirt, stain on the blanket.  Bed stiff and a little uncomfortable.  Despite a newer flat-screen TV, they were really showing their age.  Biggest problem was the hammering we heard

I personally had an overall ok stay. The restaurant was nice. But our toilet was loud and obnoxious.  It needed maintenance.  Also the house keepers slammed every door possible. I swear in one room they slammed the door or the drawers about every minute. I woke up pissed! We were also given free internet but since we didn't bring computers I had to use theirs downstairs and it charged me 20 dollars for 15 minutes! This was also their slowest part of the year and they gave us the parkinglot view.  It would have been nice to see the rides. Only stay here if your going to knots Berry farm.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I do appoligize for the early noise due to housekeeping.  We strived to provide the best service and appreciate your response so we can continue to provide better guest service.  Thank you again

Summary: I've have stayed at this hotel on two occassions with each visit having a dirty/filthy wall mounted air conditioning unit.  The latest visit was in room 839.  A quick check of the beds yielded clean sheets, however the glasses in the room have been towel dried as evidenced by a quick breath on the glass to see the towel marks (dishwasher air drying does not do this).  After opening the air filter access panel on the front of the wall-mounted air conditioner I saw the filthiest HVAC I have ever seen in a hotel room (see pictures).  The bathroom sink drained slowly as well. You’ll find a bottle of Aquafina water on the sink which you’ll pay $4.00 for.  For that money you can easily walk across the street to the Walgreens at the corner of Beach and Crescent (3 minute walk each way)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our Hotel.  We always are looking for ways to improve your experience.  We will be offering complimentary Wireless internet starting in Feb. 2011 to enhance your stay.

Summary Heading: Lovely, clean hotel. Nice area and nice rooms
Summary: Visited Knotts Berry from UK. We did 9 nights here and 5 in LAs Vegas. Hotel was in a good location for touring round LA and surrounding areas.   We really liked this hotel - it was very clean and there is a little Snoopy village right next door that you can wonder round at night as well as a TGI Fridays.   We had one bad experience on our last night when we were woken up by a very rude woman from reception who told us we should have checked out the night before. Their error not ours and no apology! Although we complained the following morning and were offered a free breakfast.  Other than that the staff were ok.   Pool area is lovely - very big with plenty of space. We didnt eat in the restaurant as it was quite expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: I stayed here during Christmas break. The location of the park is ideal for most activities in the Orange County area. The hotel itself is old outdated and needs to be badly remodeled. The rooms are adequate but there are many hotels in the area that are nicer. If you are going to Knotts Berry Farm only you cant get much closer but it may be worth staying somewhere else nicer
Manager Response: We appreciate your review of our property.  We are currently in the renovation process and hope on your return you would enjoy on of our newly remodeled rooms.  Thank you again for your business.

Summary Heading: Bad service, should be motel not hotel...Not a place for tourist from overseas
Summary: Service was bad, staff didn"t care...We came from New Zealand and expected guidiance for shuttles to malls etc, and the staff were not helpful..Had a laundry (dry cleaning)to give the night before and the staff had no time to help out and in the end I had to bring my coffee stained blouse to NZ with me... My daughter had to google herself as how we were going to get to our destination...They are always short staffed and the bell desk  has no one behind to help out..A place maybe for locals with cars....Not a hotel for tourist from overseas
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments on our hotel.  We strive to alway provide the best service which from our guest comments is the way to keep the service up to standards.  Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Great Place! We love seeing Snoopy!
Summary: We go to Knott's Berry Farm every year in December. We stay at the hotel and go into the park 1 day & Disneyland the other. Hotel is nice. You can get a parking upgrade which includes breakfast for $5 more for 4 people. Snoopy comes into the restaurant at 9am. Kids loved that. He also comes out in the evening in his pj's. Love that you can walk into the park and shopping areas. Not sure of all the negative feedback. Weve never experienced any problems. The staff is wonderful.
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay at our property and look forward to seeing you in the future.  Thank you for your review!

Summary: I was quite worried when I read about the bad reviews. But, I was really surprise and had a wonderful stay at this hotel with very helpful and friendly front office staff. I really liked the shuttle service staff who made arrangement to fetch us to and fro from Buena park mall, help us to arrange the transport at wee hour for our "Black Friday Shopping" which most probably be my once in a life time experience in US as I won't be comming back since I need to fly at least 20 hrs to LA. Keep up the great effort for making visitor like me to find US an awesome place to have a great holiday!
Manager Response: I am glad that your stay with us was up to your expectations.  Thank you for your review.

Summary: If you choose another hotel option may be you can receive more benefits with the same price and quality level (3 stars). You need compare.  I used this hotel per one full week in Halloween 2010, it was acceptable but I won't repeat. Negative points: No free internet, No free parking, No free breakfast. No fridge/microwave. Always congested parking lot.They charge extra for everything (I need to ask for a small fridge to keep some beverages cold, and after 2 days waiting they got a rusty fridge per extra $20US). My room was in the 6th floor at the end of the hall, and the noise from the adjacent park was permanent until 1 am or more every day (some days I arrived at 11 pm trying to sleep but so much noise from the closest roller coaster). Coffee-maker was dirty...we clean up with
Easy parking and access to Knotts Berry Farm. Older rooms but clean. Would stay here again.

We stayed here for  our anniversary I wanted to go to the Haunted House at Knott's.  They didn't have anyone to help with suitcases or to park your car.  Check in wasn't much better I had Jeanette at check in she was pretty rude wouldn't let me check in without my husband the room was in both names and she would not let me do the check in and my husband was out trying to find a place to park,  she told me how we were "lucky" because she was letting us check in early I then didn't fell like talking to her anymore and asked the manager to help me he name is Andy and he was just as rude.  The rooms are very over priced.  We had a room on 2nd floor could here the people in the rooms on both sides of us.  On one side the people were fighting we could here everything and the other

We recently spent one night at the resort while attending the Haunt.  Check in was quick and easy.  No questions were asked when we checked in at 2:45 while posted check-in time is 4pm.  Our room  was very comfortable.  There were some minor details that management needs to look at to spruce up the place.  The bathroom lock was broken in our room.  Just a hole in the knob where it was supposed to be.  The temp control worked fine and we had a great night's sleep after having a good scare at the park!  I would not hesitate to stay again next year.

I have had the unfortunate opportunity to stay at this hotel a number of times. It is often unclean, frequently noisy, the restaurant is bad, the parking lot is shared with Knotts and is often a long walk, and is not in a convenient location unless you are going to Knotts. The remodeled rooms are only slightly better than the others. Fee for internet. Might be good for a family adventure to the park, but definately not for the business traveler.

This hotel is awful.  It was dirty, loud, and I made this reservations 3 months in advance and asked for a crib on my reservation, when I got there they said they were out of cribs, that is fine it happens sometimes, but the girl at the front desk was very rude about it.  Then I called housekeeping to get some extra blanket so I could try to make my 10 month old a bed on the floor and they never showed up. The tub looked discussing and in my sister's room every time the room above them would shower her sink would fill up with water.  The only advantage to this hotel is it's location to Knott's Berry Farm Theme park.

Summary Heading: This hotelhas al the ammenities you'll...
Summary: This hotelhas al the ammenities you'll ever need.  Great service food and you walk right over to knotts.  Tickets to knotts iand food ncluded with room.  Highly recommened

We got to see Snoopy three times here! He came by during dinner, was in the lobby, during breakfast! My two year old was over the moon! We stayed in Camp Snoopy which was great and the water soak area by the pool was a huge hit. It is decorated great for Halloween but word to the families not going to Halloween haunt, don't stay here during the haunt because it is packed with younger people going to it and not easy with small kids. Also about some poor ratings, this hotel is right next to the park and great for families so why people would expect the ritz is beyond me. The kids can even call a prerecorded line on the hotel phone wch reads them ten different stories, you pick, all included with camp snoopy. This hotel has such great low rates and packages that people should lay

Summary Heading: Probably would not stay here again
Summary: My wife and 4 year old son stayed at the Knotts Resort in mid September 2010. The major pro for this hotel is that it is next to the amusement park.  Then again, they charged $12 a day for hotel guests to park anyway so is that really a benefit? Not sure. Having Snoopy greet us was a nice touch for my son as well. The room was a regular room, no bells or whistles. We stayed in the room three nights. The first two nights the AC unit was not working properly, it would turn on and off..blow cold then nothing and we could smell something burning. We reported it to maintenance twice and they still could not get it fixed. We happened to find a maintenace guy in the lobby and mentioned it to him and he came up to the room and we had it working the last night. I agree with a previous

The greeting by Snoopy was cute.   The room we had was on the second floor. The room was outdated but it was clean.  The shower head grossed me out. It looked rusty.  The air conditioner only worked if you put the lever all the way down to 45 degrees.  The worst complaints we had was the paper thin walls. You could hear the families in the next room.  It was really annoying when on the second night there was a party on our floor.  . My husband didn't sleep well he called the front desk but it didnt help.  The pool was nice. Our kid enjoyed that a lot.  From the hotel it takes about five

I explained the situation, produced ID and my credit card, and the name of the clerk that my wife had spoken too. They made us wait 30 minutes until they could get her off the phone long enough to say yes, she had spoken to my wife. Not fun with three kids waiting in 102 degree heat. The room was spartan to say the least, with a loud air

When we arrived back around 4:00pm we had to re-check in as they had no record of our earlier check-in. An easy five minute, underneath GhostRider, to the main entrance of the park. A decent hotel, nothing great but also nothing bad. The pool area closes around 10pm they say due to a Buena Park city ordinance. The attendent was nice when he told me I had to leave but he went around and did the rest of his rounds before he told me I had to leave, giving me five minutes or so warning. Summary Heading: Good Location for exploring LA area
Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights and found the hotel pleasant enough. Pool area always clean and never crowded. Rooms clean,bright and large provided you don't get a ground floor room (we did at first and asked to be moved straight away). Breakfast staff were very good in Amber Waves but evening staff were very unplesant. Ideally placed for visitin Knotts, Disney, San Diego, beach resorts of Huntingdon etc, and LA itself.
Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your stay.  We strive to provide the best customer service and product.  We look forward to your future stays with us.

Summary Heading: Just spent three nights at the hotelm...
Summary: Just spent three nights at the hotelm, and things couldn't have been better. Stayed in an oversized room on 7th floor. The room was large enough to add a roll away, and still have plenty of space.  Room was clean, staff was friendly, and the kids loved the pool.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I am glad to hear that your stay was great.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: i often stay here because of thee pleasant  staff especially Samantha she is always here when i check in she is helpful not only to me but to everyone else that she helps. Most of the time she is here by herself, assisting those in the lobby checking in and walk-ins seeking rooms as well as answering the phone. All of this delivered with a smile. Samantha is an excellent example for customer service. My girlfriend and I look forward to seeing her each and every time we come here. I've stayed a lot of places and no one else anywhere has made me feel as welcome as Samantha! She always remembers my extra pillows...I don"t even have to ask .Thanks Sam!
Manager Response: We really appreciate when our employees stand out to our guest.  I am glad that she made your visit a pleasure and look forward to your future visits.

The front desk was pleasant and a young man by the name of Chris was very efficient .The theme park was a good time as usual. My reservation was made at the website so my first complaint is I made it on the 18th at 10pm at night and my Cancelation policy is the 18th at 6:00 PM that makes no sense. Great, don't have to wait for the elevators.  The room was horrible.  Lots of dirty spots on the carpet, wallpaper peeling, mildew in the tub!  Could not get another room because hotel was full to capacity.  We DID NOT BATHE IN THE TUB!!  This place is in dire need of renovation or destruction!!   Housekeeping services leave a lot to be desired...first night, no towels, second night, forgot to make beds, third night no washcloths.  Just

The server brok a glass while delivering the order adn left all the broken pieces on the floor. He said eh would send housekeeping in to clean it. He enver did. We spoke to the front desk and sent an email upon separture and recieved no response. Now my grand-daughter is nervous of anything glass. I am appalled that it did not warrant even an apology from the manager.

i was happy to get this hotel. cost for parking """""""""""""""$6"""""""""""""" not $12 if you book w priceline ($50). although, worst case scenario u get a queen bed room.  i tried checking in at 1pm, but the hotel was at full occupancy per the front desk clerk. i did go to the pool. the fitness center was there also. shower, locker and full changing facillities available. i was told best case 1 hr til room was ready. i decided to change and go to disney. i called them later in the afternoon, that i was going to be checking in LATE! Summary Heading: OUTSTANDING~ WORTH EVERY PENNY~ SNOOPY ROOM~ WOW
Summary: We took our Daughter who is 2 1/2~ We had a Snoopy Room..This is where Snoopy comes in to your room to tuck your child into bed. He stayed for pictures, hugs, video...and tuck in...This was a hit out of the park with our daughter. Park is right out the door...2 min walk...room was great~ With the Snoopy room your child gets a stuffed Snoopy.  This was one of the BEST stays we've ever had. I'm sure we will go back!

This hotel is great, the staff are friendly and the food is great. Snoppy is the best and both kids and adults will love him. This hotel is in a great location and knotts berry farm is great. We have stayed here often and we will be travelling from nz again to stay here. Handy to transport and only a short cab ride to a great shopping mall. This hotel is highly recommended.

This hotel is a in a great location from the two parks, you can find plenty of restaurants and shops by the hotel. The room was clean and acceptable.They had a great splash pad for the kids and the pool was nice and refreshing.   When I read the reviews I was really worried about the cleanliness of the rooms but I found out it was fine. Ask for the "recently refurbished" rooms. The only two things is that you can hear your neighbors @ times, because there are doors to extend the rooms and I think it does not create a great sound barrier and the pillows suck, they are deflated pieces of material. Bring your own!

Summary Heading: This hotel was very dirty and a big disappointment!

We left for the day and upon returning we discovered that the leak had not been fixed, thus more water on the floor. we read many  unhappy reviews that people had made,and coming from Ireland to visit for a few days on our fly-drive tour were a bit worried what to expect ,but we we have to say overall it is a nice place to stay and the price we paid was very reasonable.  you can't beat being able to walk back to your hotel after going to soak city and knotts theme park when you have young children with you.the hotel staff were very pleasant and the food was good ,also it was good to have a bar where you could sit and relax with the kids. The only thing i would say against it is the room was very small ,the bathroom was tiny but except for that it was a great place to stay don't be  put off by some of the reviews i wonder sometimes where they were born there's not many off us born in palaces!!!

It was our first time going to this "resort". We did eat in the Amber Waves this time which was very good and value for money, the reception staff were very helpfull as was the guy in the gift shop. My inlaws used the free hotel shuttle to Disneyland a few times and were very happy with it. Come on Knotts you need to do better as we wont stay here again.

Summary Heading: Our recent stay at Knott's resort hoyel
Summary: We travel with our girls all over the States for summer vacations. We try to go somewhere different each time. This stay at Knotts's resort was a nice surprise. The price was great, the location fantastic and the staff could not have been more nice. Our society seems to have too many of these pompous jerks, who just want to cause trouble.  After a whole day at the park or the water city, it was sooo nice to be able to just walk to the hotel. That alone, is worth the price of gold when everyone is tired. The food was

Don't get me started on the beds...I have never slept so badly my whole life. My back was completely stuffed by the time we left. Very hard and old, never felt so sore just from sleeping! Summary Heading: Stay elsewhere--there are better places in the area

The Courtyard by Marriott has nicer rooms, is less expensive and is nearly as close to Knott's Berry Farm.

Summary Heading: room service pizza was the best thing about the hotel april 18-21 2010

I am not a real picky person, all I want is a clean room with good upkeep.  I give every place a chance.  Well we took the kids to go to Knott's Berry farm and thought this was a good location.  Well the location was good in vicinity to the amusement park.  The rooms were outdated (think 1990) with stick floors and simple fixes not even attempted to be corrected (screws loose in doors everywhere) walls dirty, carpet sticky.  It really creeped me out thinking of all the grime.  The beds were lopsided and lumpy.  I can not believe Knott's Berry would ever endorse this as theirs.  I sure hope they process their jelly better than this - if not I'm not ever eating their goods again.

This hotel had very nice accomodations which were comfortable and clean. The rooms had great beds which were comfortable.The rooms were clean and nice. The shower and the air/heat system worked better than in any hotel/motel/resort I've been in lately. The housekeeping department was lax on replacing washcloths, drinking glasses, and other items when they cleaned the room and we had to call to have them delivered.  The Food and Beverage Department was quite good, which surprised me. Most hotels, even the best don't serve great food for banquets. This one did! The food and the service were GREAT!   But from the start it was apparent that the service was not what one would expect from a "Resort" OR a "Hotel." When I arrived, Snoopy greeted me with friendly waves while I sat

Summary Heading: Spend the money to stay elsewhere
Summary: although it was fairly clean & comfortable, nothing seemed to work(heat, A/C, remote, shower stall etc.) The service (with the exception of one shuttle driver) was horrible - no one seemed to know anything and had to difer questions such as "what time is the shuttle?" to others.  When the TV remote did not work, and needed new batteries I was told I had to wait until the next day because o9nly maintenance could change a battery?? Also when we ate in the restaraunt and order the 'happy hour' special, we did not get the discount and were told it didn't apply that night.  When we explained we would have ordered something else and specifiaclly asked for the special they just said oh well ( that was the one and only time we ate there).

Average hotel good for a short stay to do the theme park,otherwise isolated in the way of public transport,and things to do.Stay in down town LA to access trains to see the rest of LA ,we were stuck out here for a week local buses are ok but for example 3 buses and 2hours to get to long beach.Bus drivers unfriendly .Rooms clean and tidy quite good pool no fridge there are tea and coffee facilites. quite a few restaurants within 10 mins walk.

We had initially booked this hotel for 5 nights in early Jan. 2010; liked the hotel and our room so much we extended our stay for 2 more nights. We had asked for a room on one of the more recently updated and quieter higher floors with a king-size bed preference. Sound-proofing between rooms must be excellent as we did not even hear the families with several children staying in adjacent rooms. Staff is very friendly. Besides the restaurant in the hotel there are 2 others, including a TGI Friday, at the adjacent Knotts Berry Farm Park, a 3-minute walk from the hotel. Room had wireless computer access but at a nominal hourly or daily charge, even for the lobby computers. The hotel’s busiest times seem to be during school vacations.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at the Price if you want to be near Knott's or Buena Park
Summary: I have stayed in this hotel many times, and have always been happy.  This time, I was checking in for my wedding, which was being held at the Church of Reflections, which is located on the "Knott's Southern California Resort", which using the Theme/Amusement Park defination, is a location with multiple parks (seperate gated parks) a shopping area outside the parks, and at least one Hotel with convention facilities).  The Hotel's name meets those deifinations.  The Hotel property itself has a large pool, a good size Spa/Hot Tub (which was at 104 degress when I used it, much better than most places I stay at, where the Spa is a few degrees cooler), plus Tennis Courts, a workout room with quite a bit of equipement and a Sauna and Steam Room.  The room I stayed in and the other

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, really convenient for Knotts Berry Farm and Disney
Summary: I was a bit worried after reading some reviews but as soon as we drove up to the hotel i could see evrything would be fine. This is a large hotel with the usual amenities, i.e swimming pool, gym, sauna, steam room and restaurants. There is also a guest laundry and  internet use ( but this is expensive). Our room was large and well maintained with all the usual facilities, i.e TV, coffemaker etc We did not eat at the restaurant as it was expensive compared to other restaurants in the neighbourhood, also we like exploring and there were lots of restaurants within walking distance and even more just a short drive along the adjoining avenue ( Beach Boulevard). Finding the hotel from the airport was a breeze as it is located only a few hundred yards from the main highways ( 5 and

Summary Heading: Old, Uninspired Hotel Is No Resort
Summary: I stayed at Knott's Resort Hotel on a recent visit to Knott's Scary Farm and was unimpressed--the hotel is anything but a "resort" property. (The Halloween Haunt, on the other hand, is one of the best experiences I've had.) The hotel location is perfect for a Knott's visitor; I appreciated the convenience of retiring straight to my hotel room after a long night inside the park. However, the rest of my experience left something to be desired.  Hotel services - Staff was fine and check in was reasonable, but check out took a considerable amount of time...way more time than check out should ever take anywhere! Parking charge was $12, which is simply outrageous for Orange County.  Room condition - Old old old. Not remodeled since the 80's, it seems. Bland decor lacked any sort of

this hotel was the best we have ever stayed in in the USA. the staff were all freindly and could not do enough for us. food at amber waves was tasty well priced and well presented (try the crab leg and steak buffet).  the hotel was clean tidy and well maintained and the visit of snoopy was a huge bonus (he is not just for the kids) and just a short walk from a fantastic theme park with rides to suit every taste. We will definitely stay here again

Fast check in. Friendly staffs, clean rooms, and a great location. 2 blocks to Walgreens. One mile to Starbucks. A very convenient walk to Knotts berry farm theme park.  Saturday night buffet was very simple. The furnishing and the decor of the hotel need to be updated. Our stay was good but not great.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a decent price
Summary: First: I booked via Hotwire and get some discount on the room: However, I stayed here for 7 days in the end of November 2009 and find it comfortable. You do only need to pay for one night parking (=10 dollar), even if I stayed here for one week. Pool and restaurant is OK. Did not tired breakfast though. Good friendly staff.

We just returned from a trip to So Cal and stayed four nights here.  Room was pleasant and clean.  Only complaint about the room; the pillows.  They were very uncomfortable and made a good night's sleep a challenge.  Next time I bring my own!    We used the hotel's free shuttle to Disneyland on Friday.  That was very useful since my husband doesn't like to stay as late as the rest of us.  Only shuttle complaint; you have to set up what time you want to be picked up before you leave.  The pick up times are every two hours.  So if you want to stay for Fantasmic and fireworks, you're there until 11:20.  A 10:20 pick up time would have been perfect.

Summary Heading: Horrible hotel with bad service and a homophobe snoopy
Summary: Stayed at this hotel prior to our day at Knott's Berry Farm because the rate including park tickets seemed reasonable and the pictures on their website looked nice. How misleading they were! We paid extra to stay in a "Snoopy Room" which turned out to be the same rundown and filthy room like any other in this hotel, just with some Snoopy-pictures attached to the wall. This room type actually includes a bedtime visit from Snoopy which we weren't even aware of at time of booking so sure enough, right after 8pm Snoopy knocked at our door. He came together with a female employee and both were obviously quite irritated to find two fullgrown men sharing this room. The girl that came with Snoopy asked us whether we wanted him to come in and seemed quite surprised when we very clearly

The room was filthy—splats on the curtains, stained chairs, dirty carpet, mold in the bathroom, and so on.  You could find better sheet quality with Wal-Mart’s cheapest ones.  The TV remote control did not work and the maintenance man after 4 trips could not find one that worked.  He eventually brought our remote back, but to a different room!  (I actually found this entertaining, but it speaks volumes about hotel staff.)  The worst treatment we got, however, was from the reservation staff.  My niece came down with the flu and we thought we would have to cancel our reservation.  When I called to talk with a manager, my call got "disconnected" three times, thanks to Nancy.  I guess this is the hotel’s approach to resolving complaints.  Too bad Knott's and its “resort” hotel was

First off I have to say the Halloween Haunt at Knott's is really great. Totally worth going to. Unfortunately I can't say the same for the hotel. This was our second time staying here for the Haunt. Last year it didn't seem so bad. The room was okay, nothing special but fine. This year I don't know if we just got an older room or what but i was really grossed out at how dirty it was. The windows were filthy, an obvious kid smudge on one of them and just overall when the sun shone through them it looked like they hadn't been cleaned in months. The bedspread had two ink stains which wasn't so bad until I found the large yellow stain on the inside. I don't even want to know what that was. Yuck!  The bathtub was dirty on the outside and the fridge was all rusty on the inside.   The

Great hotel! If you love the Peanuts characters and being right by Knott's Berry Farm - this is your hotel! We enjoyed every moment!!!! We went here while I was on leave from Iraq and we had such a great time that we wanted to stay there our whole leave, but alas we had to visit other family :)

we stayed here the last night of our holiday before returning to lax and home to oz.. we booked a classic package for $199 usd.. which was room. x4 tickets breakfast  room was great clean tidy the standard we have expected for a hotel of its price and age. breakfast was buffet and great more than enough to gear us up for a day in the park.  the pool are was clean tidy and kids had a blast playing with the water area  fitness  centre great  the hotel allowed us to go to the park and gave us a key so we could use the fitness centre showers before we headed off for our 11:45pm flight home. which was very kind of them.  the park was empty..  it was post summer holiday- pre halloween specials... 29th sept. our kids stayed on rides as there were no one waiting for 5-6 rides  bliss..

I stayed here for 10 days in September and must say, after reading not-so-good reviews I was really impressed (and surprised at what I had previously read!) Got a very good deal with VirginHolidays.  Check in was fine and front desk staff were friendly. The giant snoopy is so friendly and cute too! Rooms are roomy and although bathrooms could do with updating they are totally fine. The only weird problem we had with room was the fact that there were weird stains on the bedsheets (which I then noticed on an employers uniform) perhaps it came from the iron??  The pool area is great at night - very quiet and the jacuzzi is lovely. Gym is free and quite good too.  Internet usage is available and quiet cheap. Be aware - if you stay at this hotel you WILL need a car, trips and

We had to go to LA for a family funeral on Saturday 9/19, but we decided to go a little early for some family fun at Knotts Berry Farm. We have Disneyland Annual Passes but decided to do something different. We got the Knotts package deal  through the hotel website. 4 park tickets, 4 breakfast buffet meals, free parking and the Snoopy Suite for $250. We decided to opt for the Snoopy suite because we thought it  would cheer up the boys because their grandma died, otherwise the same package in a regular room would be $199. Right off the bat I can say save the $50 because the Snoopy "wing" is exactly the same as the normal rooms but decorated with Peanuts. I agree with another poster THE BEDS STINK.  We stayed at a Motel 6 on I-5 the day earlier and the mattresses were exactly the

Summary Heading: Total waste of time and $$ / I've seen roach motels with better quality
Summary: Where to begin?  1) $12 for parking in an outside lot!!! 2) This is supposed to be a family hotel... but there are notrefridgerators or microwaves. How do you keep food and cold drinks for your children? 3) Internet service you have to pay for... $ 6 an hour / $10 for 24 hours / $50 a week. This includes paying for the business center as well.  4) A/C inop 5) Bathroom dingy!       a) tub was grimy        b) wall paper peeling        c) door hinges rusty       d) POOR housekeeping quality 6) Bed was like sleeping on a brick. Would have rather slept in my work truck at least the bench seat is coushioned 7) Not even a contental breakfast  I've stayed at numerous hotels/motels over the years and KNOTTS BERRY FARM RESORT rates as one of the worse I've ever stayed at.

I will let you in on a little secret...GO ON SUPER BOWL WEEKEND AND RIDE ALL THE RIDES WITHOUT WAITING IN LONG LINES!!  WOO HOO!!  I dragged my husband away from the TV and took my young children to Knott's.  We had the time of our lives!  Amazingly my husband even agreed to this date.  We did the Stay and Play for $99 a night (we did 2 nights) and got 4 tickets. He also paid $24.00 and got us a buffet breakfast for four!  I did notice that the ice machines did not work over the weekend and they magically worked on the week day which we stayed.  I guess alot of guests fill up their coolers before entering the park or before they go home.  There is a big sign that says to buy ice at the McDonald's next door.  Other than this we had a blast.

Summary Heading: i think the worst hotel i ever been
Summary: aircon doesnt work, staff are very unaccomodating. instead of transferring us to another room with a working aircon they let us stay in the same room while they fix it for 4 hours after midnight the kids went to bed in humid air because its already 2 am. and  then it happen again aircon keeps turning on and off literary not because it reached the desired setting, and so they had to fix it again and we are book for 4 days and 3 nights. we book this as a package with breakfast then they said we didnt. of course how can you fight that they said it am i stupid or what. well only breakfast so i let it go but i just had to add it.

Summary Heading: the very worse ! not worth the $
Summary: Harrased by an employee :after reproting the incident to the supervisor employee actually finds my room, knocks until she got tired had to be moved to another room with out escort and with out without an appology.
