We stayed at the hotel resort in the middle of August for 2 nights. We enjoyed our stay and only have positive things to say. The room was big enough for a family of 4 and quite modern. One night, at around 11pm, the toilet got stuck and within 15 mins. maintenace came and fixed it. The breakfast was included in the package - it was great. We also had included in the package tickets to Knotts Berry Farm and to Soak City. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the parks. The pool area is also great - it is quite big and with a bar and life-guard on duty.

Total lack of customer service.  You have to pay a $30 room fee (even if you have a credit card on file) for room incidentals.  Charge $20 for a fridge in room - ALL and I mean every single one of the ice machines (on all floors) were not working the weekend we were there.  No explanation as to what would cause them to work on all ice machines at one time.  I paid my $30 and then was told we couldn't rent a movie in the room --I called & asked for a manager and was told I couldn't speak to a manager and what did I want to talk to them about anyway.  I told them I wanted to rent a movie and they said you have to go down to the desk and pay with the cc.  I said I paid the $30 for incidentals - what is an incidental if not a movie?  They reluctantly gave me the movie after I told

We stayed at the Knotts Berry Farm Resort just this past weekend.  A co-worker suggested we stay at the Knotts Berry Resort.  I think for the price you should be able to park at least one vehicle in their hotel area for free, but instead I was charged $12.00 per day and they even overcharged my credit card for a couple of items I didn't even purchase.  Their rooms were very uncomfortable as well as their beds and pillows.  I have stayed at many other motels and I will never stay at this one again.  I won't even recommend it to my worst enemy.  I was charged for a buffet breakfast but yet they want to charge me again.  Their service was not nice!!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: I had read all the reviews on this hotel and was very hesitant to stay there. I also spoke to people that we knew that have stayed there and reviews were mixed as well.  We booked the Premier Package which gave us 4 flex passes for 4 days to both Soak City and Knotts Berry Farm plus breakfast and free parking. When you break it all down, the room comes out to less than $100 a night. You are getting what you pay for. The hotel has not been renovated since it opened other than new carpeting in the hallways.  The room was straight from the 70's or early 80's when the hotel was booked. Beds were old and slanted towards the floor. All bedding was original.  The rooms were clean BUT VERY OLD AND DATED.  Ripped carpeting throughout room.  Stains on curtains, etc. If you are looking for

Summary Heading: Great service - Over priced, bland food at their restaurant
Summary: The room was good for the price we paid (booked it through hotels.com or else it would have been very expensive). All the employees were very friendly and helpful. When we arrived we asked at the desk what we needed to do to get on the shuttle for Disneyland in morning.We were told just to show up by the front door in the morning. Morning comes around and we find out that we had to make a reservation and it had since filled up. I spoke with the manager and informed her that I was not given the proper information the night before or I would have made the reservation then. She apologized and let us know that when the shuttle returned they would take us then. (They only have timed reserved shuttles not constant shuttles coming and going) We appreciated the gestured but decided to

My family of 6 stayed here for two nights for a mini vacation, its right next to KNOTTS, and just a few minutes away from Disneyland where we spent most of our time. Staff was helpful freindly. Room was Clean, Nice, onsite resturant. The only thing was that there was a Parking fee per night I think it was about 10 bucks per day. But other than that it was great!!!!
I stayed here for football game in Long Beach, and I thought it was terrible. Dirty rooms and nasty food.

This was about our fifth time visiting the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel and it actually wasn't that great. As usual the rooms were comfortable and clean, and the staff was very friendly. However, one afternoon when we came up to our room after visiting the amusement park, the 6th floor(which we were staying on) smelled very badly of skunk! I'm not sure if it was just kids playing a prank or what, but it became a pretty big deal and police were called. It was a real hassle.  One night we decided to have dinner at the restaurant within the hotel. The waiter's there were a little bit weird. My family and I were sitting at the table talking, and we looked up and there was  this waiter standing there looking at us. It was just really weird. The food there is very expensive. One of

My son, aunt and I recently travelled to LA. Due to an unexpected change in plans we ended up staying at the Knotts Berry Farm Resort. The front desk staff was outstanding both when I made the reservation and checked in. We had two queen rooms adjoining. The rooms were standard size and clean. The beds were a little hard for my taste but the others in my party were quite comfortable. Neither room had a frig or microwave which was a bit of a hassle but still not a huge problem. All in all this is a good place to stay if your focus is on the park and waterpark. The only real complaint I had was with the restaurant. I went down one morning to have breakfast from the buffet. The waitress acted like it was a pain in her [--] to serve just one person and literally said "your here

Stayed in Room 615 on June 20, 2009.  Layed down to take a nap with my 1 year old son and awoke to a bed bug crawling across the sheet...disgusting!  Trapped the bug to show management who moved us to another room immediately.  Needless to say, I didn't get much sleep that night.
We love this hotel with great room service and we call it our home away from home! (Love as much as the Disneyland hotels!)  THE HOUSTON FAMILY  CALIFORNIA

The exterior of the resort wasn't too impressive so we were hoping it would look better inside.  The lobby was large and clean.  We were given a room on the bottom floor, room 103.  Looking back, we should have asked for another room.  It had a weird smell to it, so we had to air it out.  It was clean, a little small, had the regular amenities - hair dryer, ironing board, TV, table, chair, coffee maker and tea.  It was very noisy at night.  We could hear people entering/leaving the hotels at all hours of the night.  The bathroom door didn't lock.  The A/C unit didn't work very well.  The bedding needs to be replaced.  We didn't visit the pool/spa so I cannot comment on that.  I don't think I'll return to this resort unless they remodel it.    Parking is $12 a day.  We were there

Summary Heading: Special hotel with a lot of great memories!
Summary: I have always had beautiful memories of this hotel including where my husband proposed to me and appreciating a short walk after a long and fun night of numerous years of visits to the great  Knotts Halloween Haunt.  Of course, no place is perfect and there is always room for improvement, but to be honest I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, where I got married and both were equally wonderful and also had some areas that could be improved upon, like not disclosing parking fees till after you check in. I hope that someone reading this will take everyones reviews with a grain of salt and not be discouraged. Unfortunately, I think that most people are negative and always find the worst in everything. After researching hotel amenites on their websites or on travel websites decide

After we got married we stayed here on the 7th floor and it was amazing and gorgeous! I loved it here. I got  a ammazzing deal. !! i would recommend  this hotel to Anyone.  I see some people not agreeing but I would go back. It is right next to the theme park withing like 5 min of walking.   Service was amazing! right on time i requested more towels and i had them within 5 min!

Perhaps I should have known better that to expect so much for what was a relatively inexpensive room. My wife found a magazine inside the sheet covers on our first day. We complained and queried if the sheets had been changed by the maids. We were assured that it would be looked into & was offered a free breakfast by way of an apology. Not sure what happened as a result of the enquiry though! Had a complaint the 2nd day about a booking error for the room & later for another admin issue. The staff were helpful but these should have been non events that we shouldn't have been bothered with in the first place. Take my advice, get a booking confirmation in advance before travelling. The room was okay & very convenient for KBF. Onsite shop & convenience items are expensive. Buy some

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: i have stayed here many times over the last 10 years , and yes it is past its best in many ways , however for the price you pay  i think this hotel often gets a raw deal , the rooms some of them could do with a makeover , the rooms i have always had have been just fine not as new as courtyard , or as nice as a marriot , or new holiday inn but then you are not paying those prices .  we had two rooms  both not bad clean and adequate  beds were comfy looked like new ish carpets too good position for knotts and shops etc . must say i have noticed an improvement in the service and quality of staff this past year esp front desk . his is a decent budget room hotel trying hard to be upscale , i did find service in restaurant hit and miss esp as we ordered off menu and did not have

We had a good time at the park and for the money, the hotel was adequate only because of the proximity to the park.  However our entire trip was ruined due to at least one employee being nothing more than a thief and management did nothing to research it further to determine where our stolen item was even though they had cameras recording the area. BE VERY CAREFUL WHERE YOU LEAVE ANYTHING HERE!!!

My family and I (husband & kids) just returned from a trip to Knott's Berry Farm Resort and Theme Park.  We started with a package deal. For $245 we got an "over-sized" Camp Snoopy room.  My kids are small and I thought they'd enjoy the Snoopy-themed room which included a medium sized Snoopy plush doll, Peanuts Gang on the walls, Peanuts bedspreads and a Snoopy tuck-in service.  Snoopy actually comes to the room of the kids on this Camp Snoopy floor between 8:00pm-8:30pm.  They loved it.  We checked in early with no problem.  Because the package included 4 breakfast buffet tickets, parking and 4 tickets to the theme park, I did the math and figured the room probably should have been about $100 bucks a night, so I was not expecting the Ritz.  The hotel used to owned by Radisson.

For the price we paid the rooms were horrible!!  However, everything else was wonderful.  Every person on staff that we came in contact with was kind and courteous, the pool was really nice and clean and the childrens play area in the pool was great.  The location was amazing and we came back to the room mid-day from the park so the kids could take a quick break and have a snack.  The restaurant was really nice and the food was great and the prices very reasonable.    Again, the rooms were far less then desireable and I would never stay there again unless the rooms are renovated: the wallpaper was coming off the walls and taped down, the mold in and around the shower made me sick and I wouldn't let the kids take a bath (sit down) they had to stand and shower off.  I was truly

I attended a business conference over a four day period and DID NOT have to pay for the room.  With that said, I can honestly say that I found the presentation of room to be on par with any other hotel which would charge under $79 per night in a major tourist area.  On the exterior the room seems clean, neat and tidy.  But if you look closely, you'll see that this hotel is in need of major repairs and upgrades.  Upon entering my room all seemed to be okay except for the peculiar smell in the room. I opened the window and found that I could only open it about 3 inches.  I then turned on the air conditioner and found a foul smell coming from it.  After returning to the room a few hours later the smell was still present with the window open and discovered what appeared to be

The weather during my four-day stay was unusual -- two days of torrential rain and two days of record low Winter temperatures.  All this was over President's day weekend when kids were off from school.  So the hotel was full of kids whose activities were restricted by the rain.   Given everything that could have gone awry, the hotel did a great job of handling the situation -- even manning the pool and basketball courts in the evenings to give the kids something to do.  While I was here on business than a leisure traveler, I was drawn in by a rate special this hotel had advertised.   So perhaps I had lowered my expectations a bit, consonent with the bad economy.  I asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel--that's what I got.  I asked the desk to call me as incoming faxes

Booked thru Hotwire so we got what I thought was a pretty good deal, $51.00 per night.  This is in no way what I would consider a 'resort hotel'.  I was annoyed that we had to pay an additional $10 per night to park.  You also have to pay an additional fee if you want internet.  All of the higher class hotels I have stayed at usually provide at least free internet in the public areas, not so here.  We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, as we were here for a trade show - but we did stay 4 nights.  I have never stayed in a motel where you can hear so much noise coming from other rooms.  One night there was a high school formal dance being held on the premises, and after it was over we had to put up with about an hour of honking horns & cars racing thru the parking lot.  Then

Wow, this hotel was great! It is literaly right on the Knott's property, it took like 2 minutes to walk into the park. We got a great deal, they had a special for 1 night, parking, 2 tickets to Knotts, 2 breakfast buffets and 1 in room movie for $144 with tax. The deal wasn't available on the website, they offered it to me when I called the hotel to ask a question before booking. They upgraded our room to what they called an oversized 2 queen room and it was huge! The room was really nice and even had a bar area, which was great because we had 2 kids so the fridge and high bar came in handy to keep things high off the ground where they couldn't reach them. :)  The buffet was not great, but Snoopy comes to the restaurant in the morning at 9am (times may very??), so my daughter

Okay - this hotel I am giving 2 stars for several reasons.  First of all the pluses... the amenities there are wonderful!  The pool is great and clean and has a water feature for the kids.  The bathrooms by the pool are clean as well as the workout area.  The lobby is nice too.  Now the negatives.... the restaurant is dirty.  The food was okay but if it wasn't free, I would have requested money back.  Overpriced.  The room - now here is the kicker!!  From other reviews and other websites, it says that it was renovated recently and rooms were updated.  Well, if that is the case, don't get your room off priceline.  We paid only $50 for a room so we thought we were getting a deal - until we checked in!  The room had wallpaper peeling off, water stains on the walls in the bathroom

Summary Heading: A great place for meetings as well as families with kids
Summary: I ran a seminar here in Nov. and I have to say that the meeting space was lovely and the banquets and event staff was truly superb.  For example, my attendees  were free for lunch because we didn't provide it, so the staff set up a buffet in the resturaunt so that the attendees would have a very affordable option, we could keep our scheudle on time and they could keep the business in house...the is the only hotel where I have run a meeting where the staff has done something so proactive and creative like this.  Every employee in this hotel offered excellent service.    My family came also and my 1 and 3 year old had a total blast in the splash zone and pool area.  The pool area is not as beautiful as other big resorts but the whole waterworks splash area was really fun for my

This hotel is just okay. It is close, but don't expect service. After we checked out in the morning, we went back that afternoon when we realized we left our cell phone in the room.  The staff were completely inept if not downright liars.  We would get conflicting reports that housekeeping was bringing the phone down--no they didn't find anything.  I asked if we they could call the current guest to see if they were there and could they check?  They would not do this.  After about 30 minutes my husband just went up to the room and the nice guest allowed us to retrieve our phone (a 5 minutes solution).  Meanwhile, the front desk staff and manager were doing absolutely NOTHING.  I just don't get it--we cannot be the first guest to leave some item in the room--my only conclusion is

Good: Nice staff, nice, clean pool area, my kids loved seeing Snoopy, good breakfast buffet, not too far from Knott’s Berry Farm, close parking.   Bad: Uncomfortable/old beds, mildew in the shower, VERY noisy even after hours, outdated rooms, carpet stains, no towel rack over the sink, no in-room refrigerator, no towels in the pool area.     Warning: Do not visit Knott’s when they are doing the Toys-for-Tots get in free with a gift special… It was so busy we could hardly walk around without being trampled.

KBF Resort is only worth staying at if you intend to visit the theme park.  The park itself is great - the hotel is nothing special.  The rooms and decor scream 1987 - but it's all fine if you're simply looking for a place to sleep and rest while visiting the park.  I'm not sure anyone is paying attention to who parks in the hotel lot - it seemed anyone could drive in or out.

We spent a week at this hotel and have to say it was our best holiday experience.Every member of staff,from cleaners to reception staff did every thing to make our holiday enjoyable.They were all so friendly and helpful(especially Phillip)but not in an over-powering way.Having read through previous reviews,I can't believe  that anyone found this hotel dirty,and we were there during the busiest season(Hallowe'en Haunt was on) Free shuttle to Disney was great and there are plenty of good places to eat close to the hotel. On one occasion,the shuttle was late picking us up at Disney and we took a taxi back.The manager couldn't have been more apologetic and refunded our taxi fare,he also gave us free breakfast  vouchers . All in all this was a great place to stay........just wish I

First off, this is a very nice hotel with fair, competitive prices for the area.  The pool, play area, and fitness room were a wonderful treat.  Most of the staff were pleasant and helpful.  However, housekeeping left something to be desired.  There was blood on the bathroom wall, mold in the shower, and they forgot to leave soap in the room.   Besides these things, we really enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Believe the bad reviews, do not stay here
Summary: This maybe the noisest hotel I have styayed at with paper thin walls. After the first night of not being able to sleep becasue of noise from the room  next door, we were moved to a different room on the second night which was just as bad. The only way we could get to sleep was to open the window so the roller coaster noise drowned out the noise from guests next door. And the disturbance was a simple conversation between two people whom sounded like they were in our room, I'd hate to be next to someone having an argument. The workmanship is sloppy with crooked thermostats, slanting wallpaper border, bathroom tile and grout that was installed poorly, sheets that do not fit the beds etc. I didn't believe the poor reviews I had seen on this hotel, I wish I would have. If you are

The hotel is offering a package plan for the Knott's Berry Haunt and we thought it was a great deal so we went there last Sunday. I was a little concerned after reading some of these reviews, but I thought the hotel was good. The room was big and clean and there was a coffeemaker. The only problem we had was with the check in at 4pm. The hotel has been very busy with guests staying there for the Haunt package and check out is at noon, so our room wasn't ready at 4pm. What a fun night though once we got settled. They had a nice dinner buffet and breakfast buffet the next morning (Snoopy was there in the morning). We didn't have time to explore much of the hotel because we spent the evening at the theme park, but I have to say that we were pleased with what we saw. I would

I booked my stay with Hotels.com and when I got there they could only accomaodate us for one night. I was so mad! However, it turned out Ok because I didn't like the rooms anyway. They were small, not as clean as I expected them and they smelled! I would never go there again. We got another room later at The Holliday Inn... Much Better!!!
It was a good place to rest your head, but it definitely needs some upgrading. The lobby was nice, and the staff very friendly. The rooms were clean, but needed a face lift.

I stayed with my fiancee here for a 10 night holiday to see L.A and go to some theme parks.  Knotts Berry Farm was the best theme park I went to, and empty in the weekdays so really advise that.  You get cheap tickets too with a stay at this hotel.  The hotel was great, very clean, spacious rooms and good facilities with attentive, helpful staff.  There's even an ice machine on every floor!  The pool was great, clean and tidy, the toy is good fun and there is a really hot jacuzzi which is open with the pool till 11pm.  There were also guest laundry facilities quite handy, a mini arcade, a cash machine (ATM) and gift shop.  Contrary to Tripadvisor's status above these reviews, the wifi is not free, its $10 a day but cheaper if you buy longer plans.  Wifi is excellent though, rock

went here last year for halloween. its walking distance from knotts but i sugest if your going to go all out on this holiday go somewhere else. the rooms smelt like cigs, the rooms were small! not speciaous at all. but if your like what ever then i guess this is the hotel for you but i will not go here agian.

I booked the 2 rooms through Priceline. At $40.00 per night, I got what I paid for. When I won the bid I thought, wow - what a great deal! And then I checked out Trip Advisor, and saw the mixed reviews. So I thought well, it it wasn't going to be the best experience and certainly not the worst. It turned out to be "so-so, blah."  The 2 rooms were basically the same in condition and size. 	 It was not a resort hotel as named. It was more like an older Holiday Inn that was due for a remodel.  Staff was friendly and accommodating. Amber Waves restaurant was OK.  I knew that parking ($10/day) and internet access ($10/day) was an add-on, but at the end of a 3 night stay, a $60.00 charge was still a little hard to take. Several other “2 ½ - 3 star” properties we checked out during our

After 29 years in the U.S. Air Force (and a lot of amusement parks with 3 kids around the world), my wife and I took our 17 and 20 year old girls to Knotts in July for part  of a retirement vacation.  We stayed in the over sized room at the Knotts Hotel and it was superb.  First, the staff at the front desk were the friendliest I've ever met and helpful.  Second, the rooms were quite nice and well worth the few extra dollars in cost.  After spending all morning and early afternoon in the park, we picked up some of their good chicken and took it back to the room (3-5 minute walk) and also had a nice afternoon nap.  We then went back into the park until they closed and stayed in the hotel another night.  Perfect!  Also, they have a wide variety of rides and the lines were quite

Everything about the rooms were dirty from the minute you walk into the room; room stinks, stains on floor, hair still on the bathroom floor, bathtub dirty that didn't drain, stains on  furniture, etc. Only thing good was the service. Will never stay here again!

My boyfriend and I stayed, for the Knott's Scary Farm, and we had an overall great experience.  The rooms were spacious very clean, and comfy.  The only think I didn't really like was the $10 for parking.  Shouldn't that be included?  Overall I would definitely stay here again!!!

I stayed there 7/30-31/08 and I would rather stay at a motel 6. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE, nobody answers the phone in room service and my tailgate was stolen off of my truck in their parking lot.  The jacuzzi was cold and the hotel bathrooms were dirty.  Don't even waste your money.

Summary Heading: Knott's Berry Farm Resort-You Get What You Pay For!
Summary: Well....what can I say I had my doubts. After my bad experience at the Disney hotel I wondered if this theme park resort would have the same problems.  Of Course I was right!  We book a last minute vacation and paid about 350.00 for a one night stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Resort, 4 tickets to Knotts Berry Farm and parking fees included and breakfast for 4 included. I thought I paid that for the room at Disney alone so why not. On our way down is when I started to think about why it was all so cheap and then I started to worry about the condition of the room etc.  Anyway we get there at 12:30 p.m. check in is 4:00!!! A bit late I think well we decided to use out Knotts Berry Farm tickets and visit the park.  It really wasn't a big deal we had never been there before. We had a

We stayed one night the end of July. Lobby: Above average Front Desk Staff: Polite Pool: Clean Restaurant/staff: Nice Room: One of the worst I have ever stayed in. Proximity to Knott's: Great  The room # we stayed in was 321.....were do I start: The carpet was disgustingly dirty, torn and pulling away from the walls, the room smelled of something we never figured out what, there was no finish on any of the bathroom/shower fixtures, the window and small balcony was really dirty, we were unable to open the window due to the wasp nest outside of the window....and the worst part....a box of condoms and a used condom on top of the entertainment unit....GROSS. I understand from reading previous reviews the hotel is under renovation but this room should not be offered until it is

Summary Heading: Good stay, but rooms need improving
Summary: It was a great location for what we set out to do... go to Knotts Berry Farm and Knotts Soak City. The parking ($10) and internet access ($10) were a bit of a nuisance.  The standard room, however, was sub-par. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the carpet was dirty, the mattress was hard, the bathroom grout was blackish. It's difficult to believe that this is an 8 year old former Radisson Hotel. It seemed more like a 25 year old motel, judging from the rooms.  The front desk people were nice and efficient. The pool was also very nice (though the towels looked like they came from a high school locker room).  Housekeeping was something else in need of improvement, though. I don't think they even cleaned our room our 3rd day, just replaced towels (the Fruit Loop I left on

We are a Danish family of four (2 adults and 2 boys aged 9 and 11) who stayed four nights at Knotts Berry farm as part of our holiday touring California this summer and we were very happy with our stay. The kids loved the adjacent theme park - and the service and standard of the room and hotel was good - the pool area was also great though not very cosy - no trees and such - and then one thing - parking and internet access cost you 10$ each - should really be free - as it is in many other places - and this is a residential area with plenty of space for parking.

We had a 14 night stay at this hotel, 6 adults and 1 child age 11yrs. We had 3 rooms and all were fine, I found the bed hard but the others in my party found them fine.  Our stay was comfortable and I was concerned after reading other reviews. Clean rooms and we all stayed on different floors one newly refurbished and 2 were not, but all were clean and fine. 2 floors in the hotel were closed for refurbishment.  The only thing that we found difficult was that the bar closed at 10pm and 11pm at the weekend. A little early for us English, plus the restaurant was open until 11pm every day! Odd.  The staff was all very helpful and friendly, but slow. We did book lots of tours with the hotel and they were great value.

I had a business meeting at Knottsberry Farm, so I stayed at this resort the night before.  I had read all the bad reviews, but since it was only one night and convenient, I booked a room anyway.  The staff could not have been more accomodating.  "Lisa" at the front desk was friendly, quick and helpful.  The Hispanic gentleman (front desk/bells) was so helpful and went out of his way to make sure everything in the room was fine before he left.   The room was very clean and comfortable.  Although, the bed made my back sore the next day.  The carpet was clean, I had a great view of the patio and the clock tower at the Park.  The elevators are fast and the property very well kept.    The door entering the lobby from the courtyard are locked after a certain time and so I asked why.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a convention.  Let me preface this review by saying: I don't have children.  That being said, this hotel was inundated with families with small children, all on summer vacation.  If you don't have kids don't stay here.  Nothing to recommend this place for adults w/out kids.  Everyday the pool was so full of kids it looked like a public swimming pool!  The fitness room was adequate, but there was no water!  No water fountain or water dispenser.  The alternative was to purchase the $3 per bottle water from the vending machine.  The ice machines were out of ice by early afternoon every day.  The beds were incredibly hard.  The wallpaper is peeling in the bathroom and the waterflow is so restricted in the shower, that is is barely a trickle.  When

Summary Heading: Afterall good experience for the price
Summary: Our family (2 adults + 2 kids) was on a holiday in Los Angeles area in March. I was searching for a hotel somewhere close to Disneyland and found Knotts Berry. It seemed great, there is the amusement park next to hotel,  also water park if you stay in summer months and just 10 minutes drive to Disneyland. There is also experience dinner places close (medieval times, pirate dinner).  The hotel was nice, however some parts of it would need a bit refurbishment. Our standard room was not huge but fullfilled very well our needs. We get cot for our younger child immediately when asked from housekeeping.   Couple of days before we left happened then "accident". We were spending day out of the Hotel and asked housekeeping to change our linens. When we came back we noticed that out

Should be called Knott's Motel, not hotel.  And certainly not a resort.  Basically a Motel 6 experience at an elevated price.  Water stains in bathroom, sink area not wider then one arms width, fixtures worn and off color, ....  Nickel and dimed you to death- $10 for parking, $3 water in your room, .....  Did have Snoopy hanging around the lobby in the evening as well as a pool, tennis court and fitness center.  I would stay at a local motel next time or ensure i get a very cheap rate.

We stayed at Knotts in May of 2008.  After reading plenty of reviews on this site, I didn't know what to expect.  We arrived early around noon way before their 4 oclock check in, was told the room was not ready, not a problem as we jumped in the car and headed over to Po Folks for lunch!  Best bang for your buck here!  Can't beat their $5.99 lunch specials.  Anyways after lunch we received our rooms keys, had a room overlooking the courtyard and also part of the Ghostrider rollercoaster.  The room looked like it was somewhat renovated as the carpet was new, the chair looked pretty new, and the new 32" lcd tv was a very nice touch,   the only downside was the bathroom that could use a makeover, it was old and outdated.  other then that we had a wonderful 2 night stay at knotts

Summary Heading: I'm Knott Going To Knock it
Summary: This is my third time staying at  this hotel everytime I've stayed it has a different name which of course makes it hard when trying to book. We are from New Zealand  The firstime was in 1981 the front entrance to the hotel was in a different position to now and the pool was where the courtyard now is.  At that time the hotel staff in all areas were great we had a very noisy room which faced the front entrance at 3am a cleaner was cleaning the carpark with a noisy machine they promptly shifted us when I complained.  Four years ago we stayed again this time the hotel was owned by Radisson I found the front desk staff to be quite rude and not helpful plus a total uncaring attitude after all staff will only react the way the management treat them..  However this time with another

My wife and I just returned from a week's vacation in the LA area. I'm not sure what hotel all the negative review writers stayed at but it was definitely not the Knott's Berry Farm Resort we enjoyed. Of course I was a bit hesitant in staying here after reading the hit & miss reviews and that we got our room for $51 a night through Priceline, but all fears were laid aside upon our arrival.  The hotel and the park were easy to get to from the John Wayne Airport and it turned out to be a great central location for the things we had planned for Anaheim.  Check in went very smoothly but there was a bit of a wait behind other patrons as it was Friday afternoon and there was a women's conference and Fabulous Fords weekend taking place. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpfull

I read many reviews and was a little nervous to book this hotel.  I called the resort and asked some question about the negative reviews, they answered honestly that there were some stains on carpets and it was a older hotel but were in the process of up dating.  We stayed on the 4th floor rm 420 and it was beautiful. New carpet through out the halls still can smell the new.  The room was very spacious and clean. Amber Waves Restaurant was great. We loved being able to walk to Knotts! We will stay again for sure!

Back at the Knott's hotel for the Ford show, this time the spouse and the daughter were along for a trip to Knott's Berry Farm.  It's about the most convenient facility to KBF, the on-site restaurant isn't bad (the portions are monstrous) and there's a couple other alternatives nearby, the rooms are adequate but not really any more than that.     During big special events parking can be a bit of a hassle - there's always room but it may be a long walk.   The exercise facilities are adequate and the pool and water-splash play area are big (though the pool could be a bit warmer and something shallower for little kids, other than the hot tub, would be nice.)  Quality of service can be uneven, last year I had all kinds of problems, this year much better.   They nick you for $10 a

Stayed 3 nights at Knotts Berry and found the hotel to be ok but nothing more.  Our room was clean, the bathroom could have done with a bit of an update.  The rooms do have safes in but you have to get a key from reception (no charge).  There was quite a bit of noise at night from outside and also from the corridors.  Found it handy to be able to walk to the shops/restaurants at the Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park at night.

Summary Heading: started fine went way down hill
Summary: All started out okay, we were checked in and we needed a refrigerator and that was properly dealt with. Then the next night we had teenagers next door to us (we have 2 little kids we were not partying) they were partying. They shouldn't have put them by our family since they were very very noisy and we had to call security on them. Then friday morning @5:45 A.M. We were woken up by an alarm sounding in our rooms that the front desk has an emergency and all residents need to evacuate. When we asked about this we were told by a clerk that it was a false alarm, then the Manager came and said it was a real emergency. they didnt have an answer when we asked why the police or the fire dept didn't show up. Then we had a dead cockroach outside our room in the hallway. For 1 1/2 days our

My husband and I just came back from vacation, we stayed at the resort for 4 days. This is our second stay with them, we have always been very happy and all the staff is very friendly and very helpful. It is like any other hotel you stay at,  they have a pool, jacuzzi. They also have a fitness room and a steam room as well as a sauna. It is walking distance to Knotts Berry Farm as well as the little shops. We went to Knotts and DisneyLand every other day. Make sure you bring good walking shoes. They are famous for Mrs Knotts Chicken, but the chicken noodle soup is great. At different times of the day SNOOPY is wondering around the hotel to visit with everyone and the last day of our stay we saw snoopy in the lobby and the other familes that had their kids with them loved talking

We booked a stay at the KBF resort on March 28-29. Upon arrival we were greeted by Ellery at the front desk. He was very professional and helpful with our room arrangements.  We were given a room on the 8th floor.  It was less than average. We have traveled alot and stayed in all types of accomodations 1 star to 5 star. The room was very rundown, dirty carpets, cracks in both the sink and tub. stained wallpaper, chipping paint on trim boards.  The mattresses were the worst we have ever slept on in any hotel/motel we have stayed in. Hard as plywood. It was the old blue and white stripe mattresses I remember from the 60's or 70's. There was alot of hallway noise. You could hear anytime someone closed a door. No fridge, micro or safe in room. The resort is very close to the park,

Summary Heading: Wasn't impressed with the shuttle desk.
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Knott’s berry Farm hotel for a week at the beginning of June in 2007.  My major problem with the hotel was the shuttle services.  We were told they provided a free shuttle to any where within a five mile radius but when we arrived this was not the case.  After checking in we asked if we could have a shuttle drop us off at medieval times but the man at the shuttle desk said he could only do that if we bought the medieval times tickets from him.  We told him we’d already bought tickets before we’d arrived and he said he would talk to a driver and see what he could do.  He finally decided that a shuttle could drop us off but we would be expected to “take care of your driver” (leave him a generous tip).  I was not impressed with this but we had no

During our recent three-night visit to Southern California, my friends and I chose the Knott's Resort Hotel primarily for it's location. The hotel is located on Knott's Berry Farm property and the park entrance is just a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel itself. That, however, is one of only two positives this hotel has going for it. The other positive goes by the name of Erwin. He was the kind gentleman that checked us into the hotel and assisted us with switching rooms after the security alarm on one of the fire exits near our room could not be shut off.  The positives end there though.  Several years ago this property was part of the Radisson family of hotels. I can see why it no longer is. The rooms are drabby, dirty and very worn out. Carpeting in the hallways and common

Booked on Hotwire and paid more than I would have liked at $74 per night once fees were included.   It was spring break so that was the best rate I found for the weekend.  Staff was all very friendly and helpful.   All public areas and our room were very clean.   The maid always came in early and everything was spotless on our return.   A very nice crib was provided free for our baby.  The kids loved the pool and there were a lot of very happy kids out there during our stay.     There is  a nice laundry room that I appreciated.  Parking was $10 for our entire stay, not per night.   We paid $20 for a fridge for our entire stay but that was our option.  Never tried the resturant  or internet.  Overall  we had a very nice stay and have no complaints.   It is clean accomadations on

I unfortunately didn't read any reviews before booking.  We chose to stay here 1 nt. because there were 6 in our party (4 adults, 1 teenager, 1 child).  We were all going to Knott's Berry Farm Amusement Park and thought it would be convenient (which it is).   We got a package deal that included 4 tickets to the park.  The hotel staff was amazing and incredibly accommodating for us.  The only problem was we didn't get adjoining rooms however that wasn't a total necessity.    The rooms are old and as clean as they can get them.  The beds are like rocks!  The hallways were dirty and loud!  This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation!  There is a Courtyard about 2 blocks away...stay there!   If you choose to stay here, the buffet breakfast is mediocre....eggs, bacon, waffles,

Summary Heading: Front Desk Saved it from being a disaster.
Summary: After reading so many reviews about the staff being rude and apathetic, I was a little worried.  The front desk was absolutely wonderful. The restaurant staff, on the other hand, was a tragedy. First, I made the mistake of ordering the breakfast buffet. I don't know how you can make breakfast taste bad, but they succeeded in doing so. One waitress did little while the other ran around like a chicken with her head cut off. Then she grabbed me by my arm and pulled me towards the buffet.  One time, I walked into the restaurant waiting to be seated like it said on the sign and 2 staff members just stared wondering why I was there?  The Room: When I pulled the comforters off my bed, I discovered the nastiest sheets and mattress I have ever seen. I caught an eye infection my first

Postives  The front desk staff is absolutely wonderful.  They were the only bright spot during our stay.  They genuinely cared about our comfort and went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  Cost:  We bought these on priceline at the last minute.  Negatives  Beds:  I've never slept more horrible in my life.  The beds had no support.  The sheets were not made to stay on the bed during night sleep, and even my staff noted how horrible he imagined his sinuses were going to be because of snowstorm of allergens flying through the air as he laid down on the bed.  Bar maid:  (augh)  The rude, unapologetic, dishoveled, non-customer service oriented bar maid.  A man's voice announced 'last call'.  "Man...a Bloody Mary sounds great.  I'll get one before bedtime."  Leaving my hot cup

Summary Heading: Shoud NOT be called a Resort.
Summary: Having not read the reviews on tripadvisor we were not aware of the mistake we made when choosing to book here. They call the area the Knotts Berry Farm Resort. And the Hotel we stayed in which was called the Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel did not remind us of a Resort Hotel but of a motel in the middle of no where adding little posters on the wall calling it a snoppy room.   When you look at the resort on the outside it dose not look half bad but when you get in the building it is just an old Holiday Inn that was bought by Knotts and got a few snoppy touches. It wasnt that clean and the staff didnt seem like they wanted to be there. The location of the hotel was close to Knotts which was the only plus of the Hotel.  The pool was not very nice and didnt have enough seating. It

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights this past weekend and it was by far one of the worst hotel experiences we have had!   The room was terribly dirty, with stains on the mattress, cigarette burns on the chairs, discoloration (dirt?) on the upholstered chairs, the rollaway bed was practically a bunch of springs with a sheet on top ...the bathroom floor was obviously cleaned in haste, the toilet did not appear cleaned and overall, the room was GROSS!    Staff was rude and unhelpful. We (my hubby, I and 2 kids) forgot shampoo and conditioner and foun only one TINY complimentary bottle in the room. I stopped by the front desk to ask for more and  was told that they were not supposed to give "extras"...I insisted that 1 small bottle was not enough for 4 people (let alone one) when

Stayed here for 2 nights' coming from Las Vegas to visit a relative before going to San Francisco. We chose this hotel because it is near Cerritos area.     It is a basic hotel. The room is quite spacious. We got the deluxe, I think. The room is clean, has a cupboard area, ironing board and iron, coffee making facilities with Wolfgang Puck coffee provided with the sugar & cream. Staff is ok. Hotel is very near to Knott's Berry Farm amusement park but we did not go there. Maybe I will take my kids there someday.    Breakfast at Amber waves: there is buffet but we just ordered ala carte. The quality is better.  Plus point is that Snoopy shows up and table hops. This is fun especially when you have young kids with you.    Since Los Angeles is a car-necessity area. we rented a car

I always check TA first prior to making my selections. But I was an invited guest so I did not have a choice this time. Usually I try to ignore the reviews that say “the concierge was rude and unhelpful” or “our bell-boy was surly and ill-dressed”. I care about the facility being clean, safe and adequately heated or cooled.  	When we arrived there was no one in line, so we were checked in instantly. We received adjoining rooms that were fine for our needs. The room had the usual hotel décor, usual amount of room, plenty of cups and towels. First thing I do is peel back the sheets and look for bed-bug evidence. None found! There was plenty of hot and cold water, the air conditioner worked and the heater worked as well. The window did open to allow some fresh air in. Several times

Summary Heading: I remember it being nicer as a kid
Summary: I haven't stayed at the Knott's Resort since I was a kid. Unfortunately, I think the carpeting is still the same from my childhood. I am not going to rip this resort. I will just say that it is dated...and needs some updating. However, we were really only in the room to sleep, so I knew from previous reviews that this wasn't the Ritz and that was okay with me.   I liked the location and the package deal to get into the park. We prefer Knott's for the kid friendly rides and refreshingly short (if any) lines. Even the coasters had no lines all through the day and especially at opening.  The restaurant was a good value for large families, and the food was fine...nothing to get excited about. This is the one hotel where your kids can run around and not be out of place.  The room was

Well, we arived at the hotel at about 3:30 PM after a LONG day of flying and had are room in less than 5 minutes of waling into the door! (There where atleast 5 people infront of us and 3 people working on the line.) The Desk people where very nice. Well let me say this now, there are 4 people with us, Me my wife and 2 kids. We got into to the room and where excited just to rest, Later that right we visited the Pool, BTW This is one of the best pools I HAVE EVER seen it was huge!   The first day we went into the park for non-stop fun! The whole family enjoyed it! Another great thing is the hotel/park are located 5 minutes away from Disneyland witch was also nice ( we all liked knott's more :) We also visited Six Flags witch was about an hour and a half away and had fun there.

I got this hotel via Priceline. I am a single traveller who usually books a 2.5 * hotel, which on the most part are clean, national chain hotels. After failing to get a good rate in the Torrance area, I choose the Anaheim area and was upgraded to a 3* hotel, the Knotts Berry Farm. I then read the previous reviews on Tripadvisor and sensed some disappointment. First, I didn't like the $10.00 parking fee. Most of the hotels in the area supply free parking, the good part at least it was for the whole stay, not each day. I arrived at around 2:30 PM, and like previous reviews said I could not get my room until 4PM. It seems that do this automatically. I did take care of the check in. I then went to check some e-mail. Another charge of $5.00 for 15 minutes of internet useage. Most

Okay, after all the recent negative reviews, my wife and three kids and I were hesitant to stay at this hotel for two nights as part of a "post-Labor Day-crowds-die-down-Knotts Berry Farm-visit". As a family on a limited budget, however, the $49/night rate was just too good to pass up.  We were actually pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel is showing its age, the rooms are somewhat tired and the staff could use some brush-up skills in Customer Service. Nonetheless, our request for a room near an elevator was granted with no problem and the room was clean. When my wife requested some additional coffee cups, they were brought up right away AND the staff called afterwards to confirm that they were brought up. The room was about the same size as a standard Hilton room and the beds

Summary Heading: Labor Day weekend at Knotts Berry Farm Resort
Summary: Hello All,  My son and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Knotts Berry Farm Resort (my sister-in-law and her 3 kids stayed there as well).  We booked this hotel because we got a very good deal on the internet.  I read all the reviews on here prior to my visit (and yes I was worried but we paid a very little price for a holiday weekend).  Check in was at 4 pm but we actually got there at 11:30 am.  The front desk clerk I dealt with with very nice and accomodating to our needs.  I asked for non-smoking and a high floor and got it.  He said our room was ready and I could not believe it (someone stated on this site that it was almost impossible to get a early check-in but we did with no problems).  Our room was a good size for me and my 4 yr old son.  We had a nice size TV

we had a terrible experiance with this hotel,   the staff  were rude, and very unhelpful , We had to carry in our luggages which i should add we had 5 large luggages and two small infants, while the staff where there just looking at us. the rooms were very small and discusting our toilet and shower were blocked, there shuttle bus broke down and we were stranded for 2 hours ,  our room wasnt cleaned until 7pm at night and the  location was in the middle of know where. We do not reccommend this Hotel to anyone.

We booked a family trip through expedia. When we arrived, they said that the room that we booked and paid for was not available. They offered an upgrade to a larger room on the 3rd floor, and that we could check in 3:00. We took the kids to the park, and we came at 3:30 and was told our room was not ready. After waiting for some time, we FINALLY got our room. While it was spacious it was FILTHY. They said the dealy in getting our room was due to housekeeping cleaning the room;however later when it was time to settle in, I saw someone elses hair in the shower, and mold in the bathtub. Snoopy did come to the room, and the staff brough up 2 snoopy stuffed toys. That was the only good thing about this hotel. We also requested a non smoking room, and our room reaked of cigaretted

Emailed to say our long flight from New Zealand would be earlier than Check-in time. Happy to be able to leave bags and credit card number and told room would be ready about 4pm. Told them Younger ones going to the Theme Park,and myself  to shops. When I got back I was told the booking was under my sons name and I couldn't go to the room. Also the room booking they had was for 2 days later - not picked up at earlier chech-in. I pointed out the lady we had dealt with earlier and the fact the others could be at the park until 10pm and I was finally found a smoking room as there was no Non smoking available. This was horrible for me as I have never smoked and the smell was strong. Don't think I would stay there again mainly because of their attitude - It didn't matter that I was

Summary Heading: Not that bad, but not that good either
Summary: Me and my husband stayed here for two nights for a work confrence he was attending in the hotel. Check in was kind of slow when we arrived, there were about 10 people in line. Our room was nice, no problems that we could see. Everything seemed clean and the A/C worked great. The carpets were a little bit dingy, but not too bad. Some of the other couples who attended the confrence with us didn't have as good of luck with their rooms. There are signs in the bathrooms to hang up your towels if you do not need them replaced and to place them on the floor if you would like new ones. We hung our towels up, but they still replaced them. They say they are trying to conserve, but obviously not.  The next morning my husband attended the confrence in one of the hotel's confrence rooms and

Stay here if you like dirty rooms and hallways, bad service, horrible smells, and if you like to waste your money!! After standing in line for half an hour, we were told at check in that our double bed room that we reserved was not available. This must have been the running theme for the day, as other guests encountered the same problems. The roll away bed that was provided as a 'courtesy' looked more comfortable than the sagging matress!! Room are very out dated and in need of remodeling. There was no indication inside the room that an amusement park was a short walk away. Lamps did not work, there were nauseating odors, and we had a great view of palm tree branches against our window.  Hallway carpets do have multiple stains, and the ice machine never had ice during our two

I had read the reviews of this hotel, but I was still optimistic that I would have a good experience there.  I was wrong.  Check-in went smoothly, but as soon as we got up to the 7th floor, I saw the stained carpets.  And sure enough, although the room was basically nice, there was a ton of mold growing in the bath tub and the wallpaper was peeling off of the walls.  The air conditioning was so loud that I could not run it while I slept, even when wearing ear plugs!  The pillows were really soft as well.  When I called and asked for extra pillows, I was told that some would be delivered shortly.  After a half hour wait, I called to check about them.  At that point, they told me that there were extra pillows in the dresser, which they should have told me the first time.  I'm not

The hotel was in a great location but there was a $10 per stay parking charge which included in and out priviledges.  There was no ice or vending machine on the first floor (where my room was located) but they were on all the other floors- which meant an unnecessary elevator ride.  The carpet had a dirty sticky substance right next to the bed, which was nauseating to step in.  The face bowl backed up as soon as the water was turned on.  The onsite restaurant had a bar, which was a bonus.  The pool had a spray ground, but on the day we went to use it, the pool area was shut down (on a Sunday July afternoon).  I would rather stay in one of the motels along Beach Blvd rather than paying the cost for this "resort" hotel.

We arrived at the Hotel prior L.A.X Airport which wasn`t too far away, our first Impression was wow, It was huge, It looked liked something out of a Walt Disney Movie, It was a really nice Hotel, great location, near everything, all the theme parks, we was only staying for like 1 night so It didnt make a difference to us, we ate at the hotel and that was awesome, 24oz steak, yes try the food, very clean hotel, rooms clean, tes/coffee facilities In room, air con, they must of had a little trouble In the restaurent the next morning, we orderd and waited 15 minutes, still never turned up, our coach was leaving pressty much soon so we ate nothing, we had free coffee but we didn`t moan, overall It was beautiful, would go back again...

If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of Knott's Berry Farm, this is your hotel. if you're looking for a clean hotel, this is not where you want to stay.  Check-in is 4pm. If you arrive early (before 2pm or so), don't expect to have a room waiting for you. If you purchased a package deal through the hotel, you can arrive early, pick up your park tickets and hit Knott's Berry the whole day. Oherwise, there's the Buena Park Mall close by to bide your time at. The front desk was very friendly and check-in was painless.   There's only 3 elevators to cover 9 floors, but they're extremely fast. The hallway carpeting have decade-old stains all over them so don't walk barefoot. The rooms are standard size hotel rooms. We felt a bit scrunched (2 adults

I found a super rate on [--] for $45 per night feb 2007. The hotel was nice, quite, clean and big.  Only 10 minutes from disneyland off the santa ana 5. Resturants all along the main road. Would stay again.

We stayed at this hotel on a Hotwire purchase of $59 and $73 after taxes and fees.  The guest services account showed that total cost of the room was $54.88.   Anyways, parking is $10/day but because we only stayed from 9pm-7am to attend a conference, we were able to park on the street.  Be aware of street signs if you are trying to save money on parking because there is a portion of the streets are by special permit/resident parking only.    There is a Walgreens that is open 24 hours/day at the corner of Crescent and Beach Blvd.   We were expecting a dirty room as others have reported but we were very pleased with our room.  It was a non-smoking king room#818.   The room was clean with Clairol Herbal Essence toiletries.  The only negative was that there was a drainage problem

I had a great time here while visiting the knotts berry farm theme park. The hotel was literally right next door to the amusement park. The restaurant was pretty nice inside the hotel, a bit pricey.  The one thing they could improve upon was there internet service. It costs alot and you can only use it in the main area. It only worked some of the time.

After having read numerous reviews on this property I came to the following conclusion prior to our stay:  1)  Carpets would be dirty, and; 2)  Something would go wrong with check-in (i.e. it would be late due to rooms not being clean).  Wow - I was 100% right!  Too bad...  Sure, we arrived early, around 1 p.m.  I didn't expect anything and, lo and behold, there was a power outage so nobody could check in let alone properly check out.  Since I expected this anyway I just shrugged it off, checked our luggage and we walked to a restaurant for some lunch.  When all was said and done, after the power DID come on it took an hour to check in.  Yes, a huge line up and many screw ups (as expected).  My wife's folks checked in earlier and ended up having other guests walk in on them as

Summary Heading: Great room but don't eat at the restaurant!
Summary: We did the romance package that came with the king bed, chamapgne, park tickets, breakfast buffet and $30 for the restaurant in the hotel.  We loved our room.  It was as big as a suite.  Huge bathroom.  There was a bar area and a fridge.  Very clean and nice decor.  Comfortable bed.  We wished we had stayed a couple more nights there.  The Amber Waves restaurant in the hotel that served the buffet was awful!  Very unimpressive.  I picked up a danish and it had a hair on it!!  We then had the voucher for $30 for lunch or dinner.  We came back and had lunch.  There were only 2 other tables in there and I think we were in there an hour and a half!  Ridiculous.  The lunch was pathetic.  Very plain not much flavor.  So I would definitely stay at the hotel again but not eat at the
Good place to stay with a family on a budget.  Easy walking distance to Theme Park and good family restaurants.

Summary Heading: More like 2 or 2.5 stars rather than 3 stars
Summary: Don't think place is 3 stars.  Got an incredible deal thru airline but I would consider staying somewhere nicer next time.  Beds and linens are OK but carpet and bathroom could be cleaner, especially the carpet.  Service was so so.  Told them ahead of time I was arriving late (something like 9 pm) and was initially given a room in the middle of being cleaned.  If you mind 2 or 2.5 star accomodation and you can get a great deal, this place is definitely for you.  $10 parking for whole stay is a great price.  Also pretty cheap, relatively speaking, to get into amusement park, which has some serious rides.

Summary Heading: Lotsa good things but VERY FILTHY CARPETS
Summary: There are many good things to say about this hotel: - Amber Waves restaurant is way above par for a family hotel restaurant.  Breakfast buffet is good; although it would be nice to have the selection change from day to day.  Good kids' menu items and they can come with fresh vegetables. - Location next to Knotts is great if that is on your schedule.   - Guest services staff were helpful.  But it was clear they had preferred suppliers for cabs and shuttles and were not very helpful about making suggestions of other sources for tours or airport shuttles. - Pool area is great.  Pool and health club were kept clean and there were usually lots of towels.  It is nice that there is a hot tub because the pool was a little cool by the end of the afternoon or after supper. - Guest laundry

This was our 2nd stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  Our first stay was in August of last year.  At that time, I posted a good review of the property but after our latest stay, I would not recommend staying here.    We requested early check-in as we were moving from one hotel to another.  We were traveling with friends and they called us around 2 pm to let us know they were able to check-in.  When I got to the desk, I was told that our room would not be ready until 4.  I explained we had requested early check-in and the people we were traveling with had already checked in.  As if she didn't believe me, she asked me for the name of the other travelers and then told me that early check-in is not guaranteed so we would have to wait until 4.  Thirty minutes later I went

Summary Heading: Good Low Cost Deal for Families on a Budget - Not a "Resort" though
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights on business. Business facilites/meeting rooms were fine. Paid $99 per night - other people at the conference paid $119. Still cheap for the area. Right next to Knott's Berry Farm, which is a smaller, cheaper version of Disneyland. Room was large, Bed comfort a 6 out of 10. Wired ($11) internet connection worked fine. Fitness center was a universal machine, 1 treadmill, 1 stepper, 1 bike. Pool was busy & noisy pretty much all the time. Amber Waves restaurant's service, food and prices = all good. Mrs. Knott's Chicken Take-out nearby was a disappointment, lukewarm tasteless, gloppy food. Lots of young families having fun - nice to see. The negatives - coffee machine in didn't work and was filthy. Hotel decor- rugs, walls , furniture is beat to heck: multiple

Summary Heading: Don't stay at Knotts Berry Farm Resort Hotel
Summary: We (myself, boyfriend, and two 12 year olds) set out to enjoy a full day at Knotts Berry Farm and an overnight stay at the nearest hotel possible. Well, we were very disappointed in the park and the amount of rides that were not opened. This was not our first time at Knotts Berry Farm but most definitely our last! The park is so run down and most of the food stands and rides were closed. This was during spring break in April of 2007. We have attended better carnivals then this Park had to offer. All tables were dirty and the place was in need of major work to bring it back to the Knotts we loved in the past. We still managed to enjoy our day until we returned to our hotel to drop off some stuff animals we had won and use the restroom. When we arrived at our door the key wouldn't

Was very nervous after reading the negative reviews but decided to try it out anyway.  Booked through my Entertainment book.  Would definitely stay there again and again.  Check in was at 4pm but we didn't arrive until almost 9pm.  Called to make sure of late check in, front desk said no problem and when we got there, it was NO PROBLEM just like they said.  Staff very friendly at the desk and helpful.  Hotel short walk to entrance to amusement park.  Amber Waves is the restaurant located in the lobby.  Great breakfast buffet and it definitely holds you over until late lunch/early dinner, saving some money.  Adults $12.50, kids $6.95 but compared to the menu prices, definitely the way to go.  Skip the Friday/Saturday night Prime Rib/Crab Leg buffet for $20.95.  You can get a

In spite of all the bad reviews we decided to stay there. We were glad we did. It was very a very clean hotel and the staff was friendly. The one negative thing was that the internet coonection was not free.
Not much to say. Standard 3* property. The room was clean. The room was nicely decorated.  Hotel charges $10 to park. They have free coffee in the lobby.  Our first floor room was quiet.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, without the Disney upcharge
Summary: Stayed in a larger/upgraded room.  Was supposed to be $154 for a Sat nite…we paid $109.  I'm sure you could stay closer to Disney for this price, but not for such nice accomodations.  The room was HUGE.  The main room had 2 queen (or were they king?) beds, work table & swivel chair, easy chair & ottoman, dinette-style chair, 2 stool-height chairs at the “bar”, amoire with TV, and 1 night stand, wet bar & counter-high refrigerater (with small frozen food compartment).  The bar were the stools were had some cabinet shelves to store stuff.   Even with all the aforementioned furniture and our suitcases etc, there was still enough floor space for 2 people to do yoga floor work with room to spare on all sides…who knows if more could’ve fit…there were only  2 of us.  No microwave,

We booked on-line and as you know pictures are small and hard to tell exactly the condition of the hotel. But when we arrived, we were surprised to find the hotel was just fine for our 3 day stay. Clean, quiet with a lot of amenities. Parking cost is $10 for the entire stay and the hot tub was nice after a long day. There is always a coffee maker in the hotel rooms but I would like to see a small fridge in the rooms (for water, juices, fruit). The hotel is right by Knott's, various restaurants, and not far from Disneyland.

I arrived at the Hotel around 1:30 am and was checked in by an older gentleman, took all the bags towards the room and was ready to crash after a 9 hour drive. When we entered the room it had a terrible smell you could not miss, everyone was looking at each other like what is that smell. I started looking around the room and found the bathroom a filthy mess with food and grease on the walls, vanity and hairdryer, then my wife found the cause of the smell, it was Puke in the closet. I told everyone to calm down and that I would call the front desk to ask for a new room, I called and let the phone ring for 3 minutes the first time and 5 minutes the next time. Since no one was answering the phone I made the walk back to the desk, behind the desk was the older man (90) reading a

I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  We paid so little to stay here that I thought the hotel would be small and run down.  Was I surprised when we pulled up to the hotel.  It is a large beautiful hotel and only 8 miles from Disneyland.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly.  The restaurant was good but overpriced.  I would definitely recomend this hotel.  Also, skip the bellman for tour information.  They must work on commission because they kept trying to sell us the highest priced tours.  We decided to skip the tour and go on our own.  I am glad that we did becuse we got to see a lot more and for free!

Summary Heading: Nice value and close to Knotts.
Summary: We take a family trip (extended family also) every year to Knotts and Disneyland.  Over the years we have stayed at many pricey hotels.  This year we decided to look for more of a value.   All together we had 5 rooms.  4 doubles and 1 Snoopy room.  They all were very nice.  I wouldn't say it was like staying at the Ritz, but the rooms were clean, quiet and a good value for our money.   We took the shuttle to Disneyland and we walked through the parking lot to Knotts.  What more could you ask for?!?!    We have decided to stay here every year from now on.  We spend most of our time at the two parks anyway and the little time we stay at the hotel...it is very relaxing.  And the kids LOVED having Snoopy come tuck them in!

okay so like, the room service there is not very friendly.  me and my family were very very excited to visit knott's berry farm and we received a great deal from AAA.  so once we got to the resort, it looked very nice and classy.  but when we entered our hotel room, it wasn't even cleaned yet! nobody was in the room, and the bedsheets, pillows, bathroom, everything, was still messy and dirty.  the room hasn't been cleaned by the maids yet!  I mean, if you tell someone that their room is ready and they are ready to stay there, the room should at least be cleaned! when we called the front desk to confirm with them that the hotel room wasn't ready, they weren't very friendly.  all they did was say "come down here and we'll give you another room." they didnt apologize or anything!

We really look forward every year to taking our son here as Knotts is his favorite theme park.  We always stay at the Radisson Knotts Berry Farm and felt comfortable booking again as we liked it in the past.  This time however, we discovered they dropped the Radisson name and apparently dropped the quality right along with that.  Really disappointing!!!!!!!!    The room was dingy  apon arrival, and the bathroom had a lot of visible mold in the caulking.  The floor was showing a lot of wear and the caulk or seal around the base of the toilet was yellow and dirty(gross).  The beds were really worn and sloped when you laid on them.  I would imagine they have quite a lot of volume at this hotel, but since dropping the Radisson franchise, are not as required to maintain the chains

We stayed two nights in the hotel with my family.  The rooms were a great value and not bad.  They are not luxury but they did the job and we walked to Knotts Berry Farm.  The restaurant is a little overpriced but overall it was a good stay.  The rooms were clean and the service was fine.

My wedding reception was at a restaurant 2 blocks from the hotel so I booked 4 rooms for my wedding out-of-town guest last Sep and the fifth room is KING-bed for my groom & I to spend the night before we took off to Vegas. Had call & spoke to the manager about our rooms. All 5 rooms was confirmed. None of the guests like their room. The room was just ok, but all experienced water problems with the shower. One had no hot water. My groom & I checked in late around mid-night and our KING-bed room was not available. All the rooms were booked!!!! The only available room is in the corner with roll-away beds. They were very uncomfortable so we decided to sleep on the floor instead.  What a ripped off! We paid for KING-bed and got uncomfortable roll-away beds. This is after I had

We did not actually stay here but did a site inspection for work (I am a travel agent).  This hotel is located on Knott’s Berry Farm and is also within walking distance to other attractions such as Soak City and Medieval Times Dinner.   Rooms are of a good moderate size and offer a choice of a standard room or a Snoopy Themed room which is fantastic for Snoopy fans.   This property offers complimentary transfers to Disneyland and is great for families as it offers a children’s pool and also games room.

Summary Heading: We would have stayed elsewhere had we known...
Summary: I was thoroughly unimpressed with the front desk staff at this hotel. They checked us in late and we nearly missed the wedding at the chapel across the street that we'd flown in just to be at. I got the distinct feeling that policy (like, checking in at 4:00 and not a minute before) was far more important than accomodating guests' needs - or even acknowledging waiting guests in the first place! I would not recommend this hotel. It's nothing special to begin with and the staff really leave something to be desired. It was a very disappointing and frustrating experience.

This is not a bad place to stay if you are looking for value. We paid only $55.00 (off saeason) including tax and I must say at that price this hotel was quite a bargain. It is within walking distance of the Knott's theme park and offers a free shuttle to Disney. Although they do charge $10.00 to park, it included the length of stay so we did not have to move our car to park at Knott's Berry Farm the next day. Hotel service was incredible. Snoopy shows up in the lobby and in the restaurant  Amber Waves. It was a great photo op. The restaurant itself was wonderful. We ate there twice because it wasn't crowded and the food was exceptional offering rather large portions. We stayed in a regular room instead of a snoopy room which would have been an additional $150.00. I figured I

The Knotts hotel was OK.  Room was pretty large.  Check in was OK.  My only complaint would be that our room was dirty (found rubbish in the cabinets, hair on the bathroom basin, carpet was dirty).  Overall, it looks like the hotel is in need of a major makeover.  Short walk to Knotts Berry Farm.  Breakfast at Amber Waves was horrible.  However, all employees we encountered at the hotel and restaurant were friendly and courteous.

Summary Heading: Employee let a stranger in our room
Summary: I do not recommend this hotel. One of the employee's let someone into my room, just by knowing my first name and cell number. And i barely knew this person (that was let in), but my camera was missing when i returned from the park.   We made sure the manager knew my situation, she informed me, that i would be awarded a night stay in the future, of course i never heard from her again.   Nice going, i'll be sure to advise anyone that would want to stay at this hotel, to not even think about it.   Unless of course they want some strangers over.

I was part of a 30th High School Reunion over the last weekend of October. The staff is nice enough, but poorly trained. We had multiple issues with block rates not being honored and lies about the block being full. Each person who we spoke with had a different story than the next. I left my card for management to get a hold of me to explain. They didn't bother. I left a call for the GM and he has yet to call back.  The restaurant "Amber Waves" has decent food but poorly trained staff. The tables on the patio were crusted in dirt, the waitress repeatedly ignored our table until I got the bartender to come out. I had to make multiple trips to the bar for beverages, silverware, napkins etc. All in all...tragic service.  The rooms were clean and the staff is nice, but the

This was a very nice hotel for the price.  Hotel was very clean and nice.  Walls are a little thin.  Could hear kids running around on the floor above.  That was about the only negative I could find.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Very fast check-in and check-out.  We would stay here again.

I got a family of 4 package from this hotel's website. I think it's a good deal consider a room, ticket for 4 to Knott's berry farm and breakfast buffet for 4 and a parking pass.  Knott's berry farm theme park is right across from this hotel, within like a 5-8 mins walking distance. Along the way there are shops and restaurants (T.G.I Friday) There are a lot more other restaurants and entertainment within driving distance (like 2-3mins drive) it's unfortunate that I am not driving.     Walgreen (a pharama / supermarket store) is about 5 mins walk from the hotel.    Staffs are friendly and helpful.    The highlight of the day is when I get to take a pic with human-size snoopy, this is the main reason why I want to stay in this hotel!!!

2 Adults stayed for 4 nights. 10-15 Min drive to Disney. Altogether was a great choice.  Good bits: Rooms were lovely and clean with good facilities/extras. Hotel was spotless and well mainatined. Pool was lovely. Staff were very friendly and always said hello etc when passing.  Other bits: Last shuttle could have been later to allow time at Downtown Disney after park closing. First shuttle was full one day- book in advance with reception.  We would recommend this to anyone looking for a pleasant, clean and comfy place to stay whilst visiting the local attractions.  Cheers KBF!

Summary Heading: Good hotel for price, close to everything.
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for our two year anniversary. We booked our hotel at kind of late notice and decided to stay here mainly because of the free shuttle to Disneyland.  The font desk was very nice and we never had any problems with them. Check in time is 4:00, but we arrived after a long drive from Sacramento at about 3:00. They were okay with checking us in a little bit early. The room was nice. We were in one of the corner rooms, which was pretty small. The rooms are decorated pretty nicely, definitally not a cheap hotel feeling.  We were booked for a non smoking room, but after a while our room smelled like cigarettes. Maybe it was the vents or something, but we asked the front desk to move and they did so immediatley. Our first room had a bathtub, which

After reading some of the reviews I was worried about what I would find when we checked into this hotel.  We spent 6 nights here and I don't have any complaints about the hotel.  I would have liked to have a fridge and a microwave in the room but I knew when I booked the hotel they weren't included.  The front desk staff was courteous, our room was always clean, the staff and food at the Amber Waves restaurant were excellent (the waitress even remembered our drink orders a day later), the shuttle to Disneyland was great and it saved us $10 a day in parking and saved us from having to drive on those horrendous L.A. freeways and if you're going to both Knotts and Disneyland the location couldn't be better.   My kids loved the pool and would have spent our entire vacation in it if

Summary Heading: You're Just a 3 Dressed Up As A 9
Summary: Wow!!  We were so excited to be able to stay at the resort hotel!  Something we had never before been able to afford and let me tell you, the kids were SOOO excited!!  Nothing was included.  If we had stayed across the street, our accomodations would have cost less, included breakfast, and perhaps been more comfortable.  There was no towel bar by the vanity sink.  Weird eh?  So, after using the bathroom, you had to go back in there to hang your towel.   What is the purpose of having a vinity seperated from  the shower and toilet if you cannot wash up at the sink or dry your hands after brushing your teeth?  The walls are paper thin.  This is a family hotel and sometimes kids get loud~~they are excited!  The noise from inconsiderate neighbours speaking or hurrying up and down the

Summary Heading: Stay Here Only At A Bargain Price
