Summary: We (4 adults, 4 kids) stayed at the Knotts Berry Resort this August. I had read so many mixed reviews that I wasn't sure we wanted to stay at this hotel. We found a good deal on the internet for a double room for $89, so we decided to try it.      The best thing about this hotel is the location. You are indeed in walking distance of the amusement park. So if you plan on spending most of your time at the park and not at the hotel, then it's OK because you will not want to spend time in the hotel. We felt the rooms were dirty and the property needed a full makeover. Some reviewers raved about the pool but we did not like it at all! The pool is located in a concrete jungle with hardly any vegetetation. And the towels they offer at the pool are unbelievably tiny.      So my advice

Our family (4 adults and 7 children)  stayed at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel last summer.  We had 3 rooms, all very nice with very, very comfortable beds. We stayed 2 nights, and had a great time at Knott's Berry Farm. In March of this year a family member, who lives in Buena Park, became very ill and I found myself traveling to Buena Park 6 times, so far.  Each time I stayed at the Knott's Hotel.  Each stay was as expected.....clean room, safe environment, easy parking (although I think it's crazy to charge guests to park) and inexpensive room rates.  I like that it's a "hotel" and not a "motel" (corridors inside).  They have a great exercise room, with a TV (makes it easier to get on that treadmill!).  I  enjoy getting up early and walking to Mrs Knott's restaurant for

Summary Heading: What A Joke this place is
Summary: This hotel is one of most disgusting and dirtiest hotels I have every stayed at.  This would be as a 1 star motor lodge at best.   The carpets in the hallway were stained and had visible trash on them throughout our three day stay.  The white curtains had holes in them, which of course let in the light.  The plastic rods to move curtains were broke off and just laid on the floor.  There was trash under the table/desk area from the previous guests that was never cleaned up.  The carpets in the room turned my white socks black.  I am at a loss for words when I read the other reviews that gave this place a four or five star rating. The breakfast buffet at Amber Waves was also sub par.   The eggs were cold, the bacon undercooked and the fruit salad was stale.  Also one thing that is

We stayed here 2 nights and it was great! The location is awesome. Walking distance to Knott's, Soak City, dinner, shops, etc...... The room was average. We were only in the room to sleep. The pool was nice for the kids. The food was as expected. Everybody was very, very friendly! We even got to see Snoopy and take photo's in the lobby during dinner time :-)  For $119.00 per night we will be back again!

My family stayed two days at Knotts.   The front desk were very friendly and accomodating, we were able to check in a couple of hours early.  Although the rooms are average hotel quality w/ two queen beds and standard amenities, our room opened up to the courtyard filled with several tables and the gazebo.  I would definitly try to grab a room(our room is 123) in the 1st floor opening to the courtyard. It was great for our two girls to run around.  They also enjoyed the pool and play structure .

I am extremely disappointed with the so called Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel.  Resort it is not.  We arrived on a Thursday evening very excited for a birthday weekend.  We get into our room, and it's so very small.  I felt like a second class citizen.  We had a tiny double bed with two nightstands and a rocking chair all cramped into this room.  This was a corner room, so beware.  When we checked out on Sunday, we were able to see some of the other "standard" rooms and realized how small our room was.  Motel 6 rooms are larger then the room we had.  We took a walk and returned farily late that night, so we decided to order room service.  40 minutes later, they bring us my entree (which was okay), but the other entree ordered (a cheeseburger) was brought with no condiments at

My husband, myself, and our 13 year old son took in a two day trip to Knotts Berry Farm and their water park Soak City.  The hotel had a package for two nights, two days at each park, breakfast buffet, and parking.  While the package was great, the hotel was okay.  I tried checking in around 2pm, but no rooms were available.  Fine, check in is at 4pm, so we took our vouchers and went to Knotts Berry Farm.  When we returned at 6pm, still no rooms available.  Finally after a few phone calls, our room was ready.  The room was clean, but the bathroom was very old looking, and the room walls were paper thin.  Our last night there we could hear every word our neighbors said.  We enjoyed both breakfast and lunch at the hotel's Amber Waves Restaurant along with TGIF down toward to the

This hotel claims to be a resort.  It is no resort, but is still a great hotel.  My wife and I stayed while on a trip to Disneyland.  We arrived at about 2:30 PM and were able to check in even though we were an hour and a half before check in.  The front desk staff was excellent.  After checking in we dropped off our luggage and headed for Mrs. Knott’s restaurant.  There are a few shops and a T.G.I. Friday’s all within walking distance of the hotel.  We booked our room online and paid about as much as the roach motels across from Disneyland.  The pool, steam room and sauna were all great!  We also had dinner at Amber Waves and both the food and service were excellent.  This was definitely the way to go.

Summary Heading: Hotel is average, but location is great
Summary: Our family just stayed at the Knott's Resort Hotel for four days.  This was our first visit to the hotel and the theme park.  I would say the rooms themselves are average hotel quality.  The hotel looks like it gets a lot of business.  Our room had two queen beds.  The bathroom was an adequate size with the sink area separate from the shower/toliet area.  You will hear some room noise from the rooms next to yours, but it was not too terrible for us.  Our biggest complaint was quickly noticed when we got to our room for the first time.  There were several spots of dried ketchup and jelly on the carpet.  If you tried to walk on the carpet in your bare feet you would stick to these spots which was a very uncomfortable feeling.  We immediately called the front desk to ask that they
My family and I just spent a week here, and had a great time. Our room was clean,bed a little worn out. My children loved the pool area. Nice walk to knotts Berry Farm. Would stay here again.

Loved the Knotts resort.  Great parking, friendly staff, nice clean rooms, short walk to the park.  Discount tickets available for the parks but I chose to purchase the classic package.  Breakfast buffet is excellent also.  I would stay here again.

4 of us stayed at this hotel for 4 days.  We found the service to be fantastic.  There was always someone there to help with your luggage.  We found the restaurant to be great as well, the meals are hugh!!!.  Our room was nice but the only thing i didnt like was that the bathroom vanity and mirror was outside the actual bathroom so there wasnt much privacy in that respect, it should be in the bathroom!!!.  The cleaning staff were great and the hotel always looked clean and tidy to me.  I think the name resort is a bit stretched as i wouldnt call this a resort, resort you think very flash this was just like any hotel you can find anywhere but i would still recomend it to all.

I had a great stay at the Knott's Berry Farm Hotel. The staff members were very kind and knowledgable. The beds are huge, and even though they don't look comfortable, they are. Even the pool was great, as most hotels I have used have just average, boring pools, but this hotel sure didn't ! The breakfast buffet  @ Amber Waves was also good. Thanks to Knott's Berry Farm Hotel for such a great stay.

This is no resort.  The room we stayed in looked like it had never been dusted or vacuumed.  It was so disgusting there was even food under the beds.  The lobby staff is run by kids and if that isnt bad enough there was only one usually that knew anything.  Take the free shuttle to Disney with a grain of salt.  Sure its free but its by reservation only with specific times you have to go and come back.  So all the early times are booked well in advance.  You better get your name in the book as soon as you get there or you will be left with late afternoon times or nothing at all.  The only thing we liked about the place was their amusement park.  If anyone is familiar with Silver Dollar City it reminds me of that.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.  What I cant figure

My family of 4 stayed at this Hotel for 8 nights in April.  We travelled from Australia and it was our first visit to mainland USA.   My only real hiccup was when I checking my room account on the television and I noticed that I had been charged for dining in their Restaurant (At that time I had not eaten there), and charged a daily rate for the room (I had already pre paid my accommodation through a travel agent in Australia prior to arriving).  After a call to the front desk, reception wanted me to prove that I had not eaten in the restaurant and that I had paid for my accommodation.  Due to a comedy of problems I had been continually encountering since getting off the plane my patience was at an end.  After ranting and raving like a mad person at reception and refusing to

I’ve stayed at this hotel in the past when it was under the Radisson name, nothing much has changed since then. The service from every one was great and especially at the restaurant, the staff was outstanding and the food was very good.  The snoopy room we rented was small and the hallway carpet had major spots on it. One of the elevators was out of order for the entire stay and  the elevator doors were dirty and had calcium build up on them.  The front desk staff was friendly, but seemed to lack knowledge in many areas and their uniforms were dirty and very unkept.  Overall the location and having Snoopy around makes it a good place for kids, but don’t let the resort title fool you.

Summary Heading: good for the price, great shuttle for Disney
Summary: My cousin and I stayed for four days on a trip to Disneyland for her 21st birthday. Was a little nervous about it based on some of the reviews, but it was a last minute trip and all the hotels closer to the park were booked. But for our purposes it worked out great! Room was clean, staff was nice (even sent up a free room service dessert on her birthday) and being able to take the free Disney shuttle was such a plus.  It's only a 15minute shuttle ride to the park, was on time (mostly) and had helpful, friendly drivers. Just make sure you reserve times on the shuttle when you arrive for all the days you are there, our last day a cheerleading convention checked in and they basically filled up the whole shuttle for certain times so we had to take an earlier one back than we had

The hotel was nice.  Not too much I could complain about other than getting two queen beds instead of a king as I had reserved and the thin walls.  The first night we had a neighbor that snored like a dragon and a neighbor to the opposite side with children that never slept.  The walls - especially around the connecting doors - were extremely thin.  We were moved to a more quiet location the following night and had no futher issues.  Excellent location for Knotts, free shuttle to Disney.  The bell desk was the friendliest I'd ever dealt with.

Summary Heading: Read Title of Hotel Correctly and You Won't Expect a Resort
Summary: While reading through the reviews, I noticed one thing which was consistently complained about. The title of the hotel is Knott's Berry Farm Resort Hotel. This property is simply the hotel at Knott's Berry Farm Resort. The theme parks Anaheim/Buena Park refer to themselves as resorts instead of amusement parks. So if you interpret it that way, your expectations might not be as high.  Anyway........, I booked the hotel via Hotwire.com 2 days prior to the start of spring break and ended up with a $62.00 per room/per night rack rate for 2 King rooms for my daughters and my wife & I. I have to say I was very happy with the price considering all the amenities offered by this property. Other properties which had vacancies for the dates we stayed were much higher priced and most didn't

We used one of the banquet rooms for an annual Black-Tie Affair.  We specifically asked for a room where we could enjoy a quiet, non-muscial event, with slides and good food.  We were placed near an ajoining event for a high-school prom, the teenagers were being searched by security, and the music was so loud that the place settings in our area actually vibrated on the table.  The event coordinator never bothered to check to see if we were comfortable or appreared when she was summoned.  Our event was ruined and the rooms we blocked for our guests to stay were filthy and run downed!

Was not impressed by Knotts so called resort.  I am still perplexed why they call it a resort and not a hotel.  The rooms were run down and dirty. Definately not worthy of a resort title in my opinion.  My family and I expected the rooms to have a festive Knotts Berry Farm element to it.  Apparently that cost extra.  Boring resort and boring rooms.  Maybe we set our expectations a little high thinking it would be like Disneyland resort.  The only advantage to staying here is location.  It is within walking distance to the park. Recommend travelers not be fooled by the resort title and pay the extra and stay off site at a better hotel.  Wait a minute, come to mention it, Knotts Berry Farm resort was one of the cheapest places in the area.  I guess that should have been an

For a resort hotel at Knotts Berry Farm my family and I were expecting it to be in fairly good condition but were very disappointed after the 1st day.  We arrived very late our 1st night and although we had phoned ahead to have a crib set up in our room plus our friends room, they were not ready when we arrived.  Two people were setting up the cribs in the hallway in front of our rooms while our small children had woken up.  The next night we woke to a pipe bursting in our room, we called the front desk and a maintenance worker came by and shut off the water (he indicated that this had happened 3 times in the past week already).  Several of our bags and toiletries were soaking wet.  The front desk was able to find us a replacement room so at midnight we had to re-pack all of our

I have had the pleasure of staying at many resort hotels in my global travels.  However, none come close as Knott's Berry Farm to the complete opposite of what a guest might expect from a "resort".  1.  Room Readiness We were flying into the area for a wedding (reception at this hotel) and let the reservationist know that we'd be arriving early.  He made no mention of any problems with that.  On check-in, I was furious to find out that the rooms would not be ready until 4:00 PM - two hours AFTER the ceremony, and 30 minutes before the reception!  HOWEVER, the Front Desk manager made every effort to have a room ready at 12:00 noon so we could get ready to attend the ceremony (an hour away from the hotel), so kudos to him.  2.  Rooms Nothing special about the rooms.  Just the

Hotel is clean and comfortable and serves a great breakfast in the restaurant at a reasonable price.  This is such a convenient hotel for the Knotts Berry Resort being just a short walk away.  We visited the park at the end of September and it was really quiet, no problem with lines at all. We stayed two nights at this hotel and have no complaints at all.

Even though we only planned to visit Knott’s Berry Park for a day, we stayed 5 days in the hotel and used it as a base for visiting the other Anaheim theme parks.  The hotel has two main types of room, standard and Snoopy room.  The Snoopy Rooms have Snoopy themed furniture and more importantly, you get tucked in by Snoopy at night.  We booked a Snoopy Room for the 1st night, and then changed to a standard room for the rest of our stay, this did confuse our receptionist a bit but we got it sorted in the end.  And Snoopy came and saw us that night.  You get a 20% Discount voucher to use at the restaurant, Amber Waves and I can highly recommend it, food and service is excellent and if he’s around, Chef Snoopy will show you to your seat.  He also chased me around the lobby as well

If convenient access to the park is important to you than this is your place.  The hotel is clean; the staff was friendly and accommodating.  My family enjoyed our stay and my girls loved the salt water pool (doesn’t sting your eyes) and water play structure.  The hot tub is large enough to comfortably accommodate at least 12 adults with the occasional kid jumping in and out.  Since the pool stayed open until 11pm that left time for a nice swim or hot tub right before bed.  The walk into Knott’s is so easy that we went back to the Hotel and took naps midday.  One day we went to Knott’s in the morning, Soak City in the afternoon and back to Knott’s to close down the park.  There is a one time cost of $9 for parking at the hotel; however you can drive over to Soak City and not

Summary Heading: Walk to Knott's Berry Farm Park
Summary: My daughter and I stayed two nights at the Knotts Berry Farm Hotel.  It is just a short walk to the park and Soak City is across the street.  The room was bright, clean and comfortable and had a coffee maker.  The room was quite except in the morning.  The door to the room is very heavy.  When people leave their room in the morning the door slams shut very loudly.  We were tying to sleep in but did not accomplish it.  We ordered room service for breakfast one morning, it was delivered promptly and was delicious.  There is a restaurant on site but we did not eat there.  The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from Disneyland by reservation.  The driver was friendly and courteous.  Check in was quick and the staff was very nice.

Checked in on a sunday and had to wait for 1 1/2 hours for our room to be ready. The drain in the bathtub wouldn't work so they gave us a second room. That room had problems with the a/c so they upgraded us to a third room. One of their oversized rooms. We should have been happy but the same problems were in the third room also. No draining in the bathtub and the a/c leaked so much water that it soaked my kids suitcases that were sitting over two feet away from the a/c unit. Maintenance was in our room every day trying to fix the problems and on the third day we came back from a day out to find our room door ajar.  We called down to find that the maintenance guy had left it propped open for more than an hour. They said he left it open for the turn down service which we never get

This place was great for families! the room was spacious - but I think it needed the carpet cleaned. It had a weird smell in it.  We stayed at the end of the hallway so noise for us wasn't a problem.  The pool area was great - and they even have cocktails pool side.  It's great for a viist to the parks, and they even have a Disneyland shuttle. (We didn't take it, but I noticed it one day)  We bought the package deal, and the Breakfast buffet was small, but yummy.  There is a laundry room, but it's small. I had to wait for washers/dryers.  I liked the 12 noon checkout time, and I reccomend going and getting chicken from the store by the park to take back to the room.  YUMMY and a great price.  Place was clean, and staff was super nice. We'll definately stay again.

Summary Heading: Can't wait to come back here!
Summary: We stayed here from July 12th thru to July 19th, booked thru fun sun vacations.  The place was clean, airconditioner worked great as we hit south Cal during a heat wave!   We had only 3 problems, the bathroom door was off it's hinges (fixed right away) then the toilet plugged next day (fixed)  and the maid service on thursday didn't come until 5pm! We were tired, we left the hotel early (7:30am) came back at lunch and hit the pool (which is awsome) and by 5pm were getting ready to go eat and then go back to Disneyland, when they showed up, I told them not to bother. I got the feeling they weren't into cleaning.  but we did talk to the front desk and asked that the room be cleaned between 9am and 1pm.  The food was good, and thru fun sun we got a deal where the kids eat free with

No longer a Raddisson property. The room could have been in better shape, but the queen size beds helped.  Bathroom was abit mildewed. Humidity problem.  Stayed here for 2 nights, June 22 & 23. Very convenient for going to the park. But there was alot of noise going on around the outside of the hotel & in the rooms above & below & next to us. Made it difficult to sleep, especially when the noise was still going at 1am.  Our room faced the hotel courtyard & towards the park. They were testing Ghostrider early in the morning & that made for some more noise.  1 night, we got take out from Mrs. Knott's restaurant & ate back in the room.  That worked out well. The hotel restaurant was pretty good, & not too overpriced for that area, except for maybe the breakfast buffet.  They day we

Summary Heading: Best location for a visit to Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: We paid 122.00 per night for a two night stay. Did not get a package deal because we got a discount coupon on Ebay for a better deal. Parking is 9.00 per stay, free would be better.  Room definately needs remodelling. asked for a room by the pool, we got first floor with pool viewfrom window, although if it had been sliding doors we could have walked right out to the pool.  When I opened the window, I realized it had neither a screen or a lock. After a call they brought a little screw to lock the window, potentially dangerous as we were on the first floor.  Carpet was worn and looked very dirty, bedding was a bit threadbare also.  Pool was very nice, pretty big with a water play area for kids and a big jacuzzi nice and hot.  The workout room looked nice, but we didn't use it.

This really is the only hotel you'd want to stay at when going to Knotts Berry Farm.  The package they have is good and you're walking distance to Knotts and the water park.  The front desk staff was very nice and the lobby is welcoming.  The rooms however, are horrible, at least the one we stayed in.  We were put in one room on the 5th floor only to discover there was no bathtub for our kids, so they moved us immediately to another room on the 5th floor.  The rooms are very worn - floors with brown stains- the bath had mold around it - the bed sheets were so thin you could see the mattress underneath and well as the blanket was incredibly thin.  We ended up getting people next to us around 10pm and we heard their entire conversations.  I couldn't wait to get out of the room

We just returned from a weekend at the Knott's Resort and found the hotel's accommodations to be average.  The location is excellent if you are going to Knott's Berry Farm or Soak City, as both of these parks are a short walk from the hotel.  Parking was $9 for two nights.  We stayed at the hotel with our 16 and 13 year old sons, and our 18 month old toddler.  The older boys enjoyed the hotel's arcade and the pool, which is open from 9 a.m. to 11 p.m.  While the pool doesn't have a shallow area for young children (depth starts at 3 ft.), there is a fun water play area with shooting fountains that the younger kids loved, and a hot tub for adults.  Towels are available poolside, and there is also a beverage bar.  We were given a room on the 5th floor, but found it extremely noisy

Summary Heading: It's the most conveniant place to staty for local theme parks
Summary: We stayed here as our base while we went to area attractions such as Disneyland It is nice because it is not as hectic to stay here in Buena Park as it is on the streets surrounding Disneyland, but you are 5 minutes away from Disneyland, and right next door to all the other atttractions. Within a 1 block area there are many area attractions including Knotts Berry Farm, Medeival Times Dinner Show, Wild Bills Wester Dinner Show which is being transformed into a Pirate Dinner Show. They also have a Ripleys, Water Park, and a Wax Museum all on 1 block. There is a nice Claim Jumpers Resteraunt for dinner, and Po'Folks for breakfast. There is a Starbucks, Outback and other resteraunts, along with a Walgreens for picking up sunscreen and what not.   The hotel has a nice pool with an

We went to disneyland during spring break and stayed at the Radisson knotts Berry Farms Resort. It was very nice, better that What I expected. The room service is limited. Snoopy was in there and that was a plus with the kids. I would stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel last week for five nights.  We had got a price match deal under the Radisson Best Online Rate Guarantee that reduced our room bill from $500 to $300!!  Radisson had informed us that as from beginning of April the hotel would not longer be under their banner - they were going independent - and I think this showed.  The hotel appeared to be in a period of flux - staff seemed confused - especially the security man who told us there was no one that could book tours !.  I later found the charming Concierge did this job.  The Citrus Cafe was closed and the hotel appeared "cold".  Having said this our room was adequate - the smallest of this trip - wonder if this was because of our rate deal?  Hmm  All amenities were there - no towel holder in sink area and the

We just returned from a 3 day weekend at Radisson Knott's Berry Farm.  We had booked a last minute trip for the fun of it and went not expecting much.  Boy were we wrong!  From the moment we arrived to the minute we checked out the service at both the Resort and and the Park was first class.  Everyone we encountered went out of their way to make our visit perfect.  The room we stayed in was huge and included a breakfast bar and mini frig, it was extremely clean too.  We especially liked the dining at Amber Waves, the food was good, the service was great our daughter loved Chef Snoopy that came to visit our table.  We could not have asked for a more perfect weekend getaway.....we will be going back!

This hotel has everything.  Good location just outside  Knotts gate, shopping, restaurants on site, and fast food.  My room was spotless and the service was superb.  I arrived hours before check-in and was promptly checked in with no waiting.  The complimentary shuttle to Disneyland was always on time.  I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Radisson which is right outside the park gate to Knotts Berry Farm and would do it again. It was really convenient to go in and out of the park as needed.  The check in clerk wasn't too friendly but the room met my expectations.  The walls are thin so if you sleep light expect some problems but since we were there for a cheerleading competition, noise was expected.  Room service failed in the morning.  Apparently they had more than they could handle so we had to cancel our request. (There was no phone call to us letting us know they would be more than 20 minutes late)  We did go down to the restaurant to get a 'to-go' box so we wouldn't be late and the hostess was more than generous with the servings she provided and moved as quick as possible when we explained

Radison Resorts Knott’s Berry Farm 7675 Crescent Ave Buena Park, CA 90620  Date 14 - 16 Feb 05  Price - $58 # of nights stayed - 3 Unexpected fees - None # of beds – 2 - Queen Connecting room - No  Parking- Sufficent Access to room - Elevator Floors - 8 Interior corridors – Yes – nicely carpeted and muffle noise Apparent safety - Very good Neighborhood - Adjacent to entertainment park Hwy access – Freway is 5 minutes away Restaurants – Numerous with short drive – one in hotel Reception - Very Good, very efficient Newsstand – None – complimentary morning copy of local paper at reception desk. No Wall Street Journal Control of noisy guest and guest behavior – no problems – security officers on duty General outside cleanliness – Outstanding General inside cleanliness - Outstanding

Husband and I just returned from a nice two-night stay at Radisson-Knott's Berry Farm.  Being a non-busy time of year (mid-Feb) we arrived early and received our room at 12noon, luckily it was available.  The front desk staff person was very professional, courteous and helpful.  Our room was a king bed w/comfy overstuffed chair and ottoman, table lamp, desk/table with two chairs, large tv, coffee maker and supplies.  Bathroom was clean and modern and well-stocked.  Closet had iron and ironing board.  We did eat at Amber Waves, both lunch and dinner and also the breakfast buffet.  Food and service here is very good!  I would hesitate to purchase the breakfast buffet (we had complimentary coupons) although it was very good it was standard fare (for $16.95???).  The pool was fun

Location is great.  Easy walk to Knott's Berry Farm and Soak City.  The rooms were fairly good but the first one they gave us was close to the HVAC system on the roof which was noisy so we asked to move.  The onsite children's play area at the pool is a plus if you have kids.  The onsite restaurants are fair.  I do not recommend them unless you are deperate.  Check in was very slow, took us about 45 minutes wait.  Real problem happened when they "accidently" checked us out of our room and then gave our room to someone else.  Luckily, the poeple went to our room and complained that someone else's stuff was still in there.  Someone could have stollen our stuff.  The very bad thing was that the hotel kept stalling and then lied and said they had to move us because of a water leak

Stayed at this property for three nights in January.  We booked through Hotwire and paid $42 per night.  The room was great - comfortable bed, good thermostat control, clean bathroom, etc.  Sink, mirror, hair dryer, and vanity is a separate area from the toilet/bathtub/shower which is very convenient.  Free shuttle to Disney was very convenient and prompt.  Hotel is very well located if you are visiting Knott's Berry Farm (we did not) but still centrally located to all other Orange County attractions.  Close to highways.  We would stay here again.

I needed a 3 star or higher hotel in the Anaheim, Ca area for a family visit to So. Cal. & Disneyland.  Got a great rate on Priceline for 4 nights, including New Years Eve.  The front desk staff was VERY friendly and courteous.  The manager on duty everyday was great and very helpful.  Our room was nice, and the bed very comfortable.  I highly recommend this hotel if you are in the Anaheim & Buena Park area.

We arrived here on January 1st and had booked the same day through PLine. We had reservations at the Grand Californian for the next day but needed a place to stay since we decided to leave one day earlier. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accomodated our request for  2 Q beds and a non-smoking room.  The hotel is very impressive and is very close to Knotts Berry Farm.  We arrived very late so I didn't take much notice of the lobby, I remember it being very large and clean. Our room was a standard room and seemed to be a moderate size. It was very clean and I felt comfortable there.  After getting situated we went down to the 3rd floor for snacks at the vending machine and I was surprised to see dozens and dozens of teenagers hanging out all over the place. Some were

Summary Heading: Nice place for Knott's Berry Park
Summary: Just got back from a 3 night Knott's Berry Pakage stay at the Radisson.  The hotel was clean and comfortable.  It also had a great pool area for the kids. I would warn potential customers that the primary purpose of this Hotel is servicing the Knott's Berry theme parks.  If you don't have children, don't stay here because families comprise the majority of the hotel.  Snoopy made visits to the Restaurant during breakfast and dinner, so that was great for the Kids. I would also recommend buying the more expensive Knott's package because of the 4-day park hopper passes.  It makes it easier on the family when you can do the attractions in chunks over the entire stay. It was also nice to ride early in the am when it was cool, then go to Soak City in the heat of  the day, and then

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, very friendly staff, great restaurant
Summary: We stayed at the Radisson Knotts Berry Farm on a Monday and Tuesday night. My mother-in-law was with us, so we wanted a hotel close to the park. It was great that we could just walk over to the park in about 5 minutes.   The room was ok, bedspread a little worn, shower curtain a little mildewed, a ladies razor was under the sink on the floor. I guess the hotel cleaning staff would be at fault for these things.  There was a coffee maker and all the fixings in the room, which was nice. No refrigerator, but an ice machine was right down the hall. If you are driving here, you might want to bring a cooler for your room.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. If you arrive before 3 pm you have to come back after 3 to get into your room.  The pool area is very nice and they

I stayed in the Radisson Knott's Berry Farm based on good previous reviews on this site.  I expected a really nice room in a really nice location, per those reviews and my previous Radisson stays.  I sorta got that.  The location is absolutely beautiful (and convenient to most of Orange County), and the hotel itself is aesthetically fantastic.  However, if you are a business traveler (or someone who isn't just going for play), there are some drawbacks.  First, the AC in the room wasn't very strong.  This can be a problem on warm days in California.    Second, the location advertised high speed internet access.  They do have it, but only through their WebTV service.  If you want to actually use your laptop, you need to dial a local number for your ISP, which leads to...  Third,

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay if you are visiting Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Stayed 3 nights (9th to 12th July) as we couldn't get in to the Howard Johnson - picked this place from Trip Advisor comments. Good Hotel and facilities, and great if you have a car to get around or are wanting only to do Knotts - there isn't much else around here. Would prefer to stay in the Anaheim area again if visiting another time. I rate it 9/10.

The hotel is in an excellent location for all of the theme parks. Our room had two large double beds and plenty of room for the three of us. Our 5 year old daughter loved the swimming pool and the kids water area. The pool is very clean and there are lots of sun beds and tables around the pool. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was always very clean and in good state of repair.  The restaurant was very nice and a great location for breakfast. Snoopy can regularly be seen around the hotel and is always happy to stop for a photo. Mrs Knott’s Chicken dinners should not be missed they are great value and taste amazing especially after a day walking round one of the money theme parks.  Great hotel especially if you have kids!!

We stayed at the Radisson as part of a Disneyland Park Hopper package deal.  Hotel is extremely nice and within a short walking distance of the great Knott's Chicken Dinner restaurant!  They offer a shuttle to Disneyland that is extactly on time both leaving the hotel and picking you up at the Disney shuttle stop (Blue island).  Reservations are requested for leaving the hotel and mandatory, if you want them to pick you up.  Only a few people took advantage (I guess most were going to Knotts) and it was a VERY comfortable ride to and fro.  The only reason I didn't give an Excellent is because we ended up in a room with a wall for a view.  My fault for not asking for another room.  Be sure to ask for something above the 5th floor!  Room was clean and the bed was

Stayed at the Radisson Resort Knott's Berry Farm with my family on Thanks giving day. It was our first trip to Knott's Berry Farm and we had a great time at this Hotel. Room was clean and there was no noise.You don't pay for 'extras' at here there are freeparking, sauna, fitness club and huge pool. Hotel staff are pretty friendly and Knott's Berry Farm is right next door! It takes only minutes to get from the Knott's Berry Farm entrance to the room or from the car to the room.  This was definitely a great place to stay if you plan to stay this area.

Summary Heading: Radisson Resort Knott's Berry Farm - Disappointing
Summary: My family stayed at the Radisson at Knott's Berry on 7 September based on the good reviews I had read here. However, the experience was disappointing. We booked a snoopy room (through expedia) and a standard one (through the hotel). We should have saved the money we spent on the snoopy room as it was quite terrible. We got a room that was facing a wall. As such, it was really dark and the "lighting" in the room didn't help. There were 2 snoopy clocks in the room, neither of which was working. Both the wash basin and the room were small. The standard room we also got was just down the corridoor and much cheaper. We should have just gone for that. However, I must add that the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful!

From the start of our stay til the end all staff members were helpful, polite and most of all very willing to help in anyway possible to accomodate our large group. Our weekend could have been a disaster due to a rain issue, but due to the employees of the hotel, they turned our weekend around and made it great! Our stay was extremely nice, all the facilities were wonderful, clean and very well maintained. I did thank the hotel and staff and would recommend that anyone needing a room in a 10 mile radius of this hotel, take advantage and stay here. We have had a number of bad hotel experiences in the past at other hotels and our #1 fear is to always have a bad one. This was nothing like that, I can now formally start a list of Excellent Hotel Stays!! Kudos to the large group
We really enjoyed the hotel!  It was a great value, the room was really comfortable, clean and nicely decorated.  Very family friendly.
